n

na 1

ind. no; not; neither; nor ✓

Grammar ind, neg
Meaning no; not; neither; nor
Sanskrit na

na antalikkhe na samuddamajjhe,
na pabbatānaṃ vivaraṃ pavissa,
na vijjati so jagatippadeso,
yatthaṭṭhito mucceyya pāpakammā.

DHP 127 kodhavaggo

kassako paṭijānāsi,
na ca passāma te kasiṃ,
kasiṃ no pucchito brūhi,
yathā jānemu te kasiṃ.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4
na 2

ind. (adds a question mark) surely?; does one not? ✓

Grammar ind, interr, neg
Meaning (adds a question mark) surely?; does one not?
Sanskrit nu

yo so, sāriputta, ariyasāvako tathāgate ek'antagato abhippasanno, na so tathāgate vā tathāgatasāsane vā kaṅkheyya vā vicikiccheyya vā'ti?

SN 48.50 āpaṇasuttaṃ
na 3

prefix. not ✓

Grammar prefix, in comps, neg
Meaning not
Sanskrit na

idha, bhikkhave, assutavā puthujjano manasikaraṇīye dhamme nappajānāti, amanasikaraṇīye dhamme nappajānāti

MN 2.2 sabbāsavasuttaṃ

atha kho te bhikkhū tesaṃ aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ bhāsitaṃ n'eva abhinandiṃsu nappaṭikkosiṃsu.

SN 46.53 aggisuttaṃ
na 4

masc. (gram) negative prefix na ✓

Grammar masc, prefix, neg
Meaning (gram) negative prefix na
Sanskrit na

333, 344. attaṃ nassa tappurise.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 333

nassa padassa tappurise uttarapade attaṃ hoti. nabrāhmaṇo abrāhmaṇo, avasalo, abhikkhu, apañcavassaṃ, apañcagavaṃ.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 333
naattapaññatti

fem. non-definition of self ✗
naalamariya

Grammar adj, comp

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning rule about not nursing
Construction na + upaṭṭhāpana + sikkhāpada
naehibhadantika

adj. who doesn't come when asked; lit. not come sir [na + ehi + badanta + ika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, neg
Meaning who doesn't come when asked; lit. not come sir
Construction na + ehi + badanta + ika
naehibhadanta + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Antonym naehibhaddantika
Commentary (DNa) bhikkhāgahaṇatthaṃ, ehi bhaddante'ti vutto, na etī'ti naehibhaddantiko.
Sanskrit na + ehi + bhadanta

seyyath'idaṃ, nando vaccho, kiso saṃkicco, makkhali gosālo, etehi, bho gotama, acelakā mutt'ācārā hatth'āpalekhanā naehibhadantikā natiṭṭhabhaddantikā na abhihaṭaṃ na uddissakataṃ na nimantanaṃ sādiyanti

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ

nakka

masc. turtle ✗
nakkhatta 1

nt. constellation; zodiac; celestial object [√nakkh + a + tta] ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning constellation; zodiac; celestial object
Root Family √nakkh
Root √nakkh×1 a (attain, arrive)
Construction √nakkh + a + tta
nakkha + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Sanskrit nakṣatra
Sanskrit Root √nakṣ 1 (attain)

tasmā hi
dhīrañ'ca paññañ'ca bahussutañ'ca,
dhorayhasīlaṃ vatavantam'ariyaṃ,
taṃ t'ādisaṃ sappurisaṃ sumedhaṃ,
bhajetha nakkhattapathaṃ'va candimā.

DHP 208 sukhavaggo

no ce te evaṃ viharato taṃ middhaṃ pahīyetha tato tvaṃ, moggallāna, uṭṭhāy'āsanā udakena akkhīni anumajjitvā disā anuvilokeyyāsi nakkhattāni tārakarūpāni ullokeyyāsi

AN 7.61 pacalāyamānasuttaṃ
nakkhatta 2

nt. astrology; lit. constellation [√nakkh + a + tta] ✓

Meaning astrology; lit. constellation

Construction √nakkh + a + tta
nakkha + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Sanskrit nakṣatra
Sanskrit Root √nakṣ 1 (attain)

āthabbaṇaṃ supinaṃ lakkhaṇaṃ,
no vidahe atho'pi nakkhattaṃ,
virutañ'ca gabbhakaraṇaṃ,
tikicchaṃ māmako na seveyya.

SNP 52 tuvaṭakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 14

SN 28.10 sūcimukhīsuttaṃ
nakkhamati

pr. (+dat) is not acceptable (to); is not suitable (for) [na + √kham + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, from na khamati, neg, impers, intrans (+dat)
Meaning is not acceptable (to); is not suitable (for)
Root Family √kham
Root √kham･1 a (tolerate, endure)
√ In Comps kkham
Base √kham + a > khama
Construction na + khama + ti
na + khamati
Antonym khamati
Sanskrit kṣamate
Sanskrit Root √kṣam 1, 4 (endure)

yass'āyasmato khamati amhākaṃ imāsaṃ āpattīnaṃ saṅghamajjhe tiṇ'avatthārakena desanā, ṭhapetvā thullavajjaṃ, ṭhapetvā gihippaṭisaṃyuttaṃ, so tuṇh'assa. yassa nakkhamati, so bhāseyya.

VIN 5.4.7 tiṇavatthārakaṃ
nakha 1

masc. fingernail; toenail ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning fingernail; toenail
Sanskrit nakha

seyyathā'pi, māgaṇḍiya, kuṭṭhī puriso arugatto pakkagatto kimīhi khajjamāno nakhehi vaṇamukhāni vippatacchamāno aṅgārakāsuyā kāyaṃ paritāpeyya.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ

tena kho pana samayena satta ca jaṭilā satta ca nigaṇṭhā satta ca acelakā satta ca ekasāṭakā satta ca paribbājakā parūḷhakacchanakhalomā khārivividham'ādāya bhagavato avidūre atikkamanti.

fem. ?? psoriasis; (comm) disease in the place scratched by the nails ✓

Commentary (ANa) nakhasā'ti nakhehi vilekhitaṭṭhāne rogo.

iti imasmiṃ kāye vividhā ābādhā uppajjanti, seyyath'idaṃ ... pakkhandikā sūlā visūcikā kuṭṭhaṃ gaṇḍo kilāso soso apamāro daddu kaṇḍu kacchu nakhasā vitacchikā lohitaṃ pittaṃ madhumeho aṃsā piḷakā bhagandalā

naga

masc. mountain; lit. not going [na + √gam + a] ✓

Grammar masc, neg
Meaning mountain; lit. not going
Root Family √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction na + √gam + a
Derivative kita (a)
Compound kammadhāraya (na + ga)
Synonym giri
Sanskrit naga
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

nagā samuddā saritā vasun'dharā,
disā catasso vidisā adho divā,
sabbe aniccā tibhavā upaddutā,
kuhiṃ gato citta sukhaṃ ramissasi.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

vuṭṭhamhi deve caturaṅgule tiṇe,
saṃpupphite meghanibhamhi kānane,
naga-antare viṭapisamo sayissaṃ,
taṃ me mudū hehiti tūlasannibhaṃ.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
nagara 1

nt. town; city ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning town; city
Sanskrit nagara

kumbh'ūpamaṃ kāyam'imaṃ viditvā,
nagara-upamaṃ cittam'idaṃ ṭhapetvā.
yodhetha māraṃ paññ'āvudhena,
jitañ'ca rakkhe anivesano siyā.

DHP 40 cittavaggo

tam'anugacchanto passeyya purāṇaṃ nagaraṃ purāṇaṃ rājadhāniṃ pubbakehi manussehi ajjhāvuṭṭhaṃ ārāmasampannaṃ vanasampannaṃ pokkharaṇīsampannaṃ uddhāpavantaṃ ramaṇīyaṃ.

nagarapaṭisaṅkhārika

adj. for repairs to the city [nagara + paṭisaṅkhārika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning for repairs to the city
Construction nagara + paṭisaṅkhārika
Commentary (VINa) nagarapaṭisaṅkhārikānī'ti nagarassa paṭisaṅkhār'ūpakaraṇāni.
Sanskrit nagara + pratisaṃskāra

atha kho vassakāro brāhmaṇo magadhamahāmatto anattamano ahosi, kathañ'hi nāma devo devagahadārūni nagarapaṭisaṅkhārikāni āpad'atthāya nikkhittāni dhaniyassa kumbhakāraputtassa dassatī'ti!

VIN 1.1.2 dutiyapārājikaṃ
nagaraparikkhāra

masc. necessity for a town; requirement for a fort [nagara + parikkhāra] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning necessity for a town; requirement for a fort
Construction nagara + parikkhāra
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (nagarassa + parikkhāra)
Commentary (ANa) nagaraparikkhārehi suparikkhatan'ti nagarālaṅkārehi alaṅkataṃ. (VISMa) nagaraparikkhārehī'ti nagaraṃ parivāretvā rakkhaṇakehi. vivaṭaparikkhepo parikkhā uḍḍāpo pākāro esikā paligho pākārapatthaṇḍilan'ti satta nagaraparikkhārā'ti vadanti.
Sanskrit nagara + pariṣkāra

yato kho, bhikkhave, rañño paccantimaṃ nagaraṃ sattahi nagaraparikkhārehi suparikkhataṃ hoti, catunnañ'ca āhārānaṃ nikāmalābhī hoti akicchalābhī akasiralābhī. idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, rañño paccantimaṃ nagaraṃ akaraṇīyaṃ bāhirehi paccatthikehi paccāmittehi.

Construction nagara + pūjita

nagarasutta

nagarassāmī

masc. town chief; lord of the citadel; mayor; lit. master of the town [nagara + sāmī] ✓

Meaning town chief; lord of the citadel; mayor; lit. master of the town
Construction nagara + sāmī
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (nagarassa + sāmī)
Sanskrit nagarasvāmin

puratthimāya disāya āgantvā sīghaṃ dūtayugaṃ taṃ dovārikaṃ evaṃ vadeyya, kahaṃ, bho purisa, imassa nagarassa nagarassāmī'ti? so evaṃ vadeyya, eso, bhante, majjhe siṅghāṭake nisinno'ti.

SN 35.245 kiṃsukopamasuttaṃ
nagarūpakārikā

fem. (comm) a town protected with bastions ✗
nagarūpama

adj. like a town; similar to a city [nagara + upama] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning like a town; similar to a city
Construction nagara + upama
Compound kammadhāraya (nagara + upama)
Commentary (DHPa) nagar'ūpamaṃ cittam'idaṃ ṭhapetvā'ti nagaraṃ nāma bahiddhā thiraṃ hoti, gambhīraparikhaṃ pākāraparikkhittaṃ dvāraṭṭālakayuttaṃ, antosuvibhattavīthicatukkasiṅghāṭakasampannaṃ antar'āpaṇaṃ, taṃ vilumpissāmā'ti bahiddhā corā āgantvā pavisituṃ asakkontā pabbataṃ āsajja paṭihatā viya gacchanti, evam'eva paṇḍito kulaputto attano vipassanācittaṃ thiraṃ nagarasadisaṃ katvā ṭhapetvā nagare ṭhito ekatodhārādinānappakārāvudhena coragaṇaṃ viya vipassanāmayena ca ariyamaggamayena ca paññ'āvudhena taṃtaṃmaggavajjhaṃ kilesamāraṃ paṭibāhanto taṃ taṃ kilesamāraṃ yodhetha, pahareyyāthā'ti attho.
Sanskrit nagara + upamā

kumbh'ūpamaṃ kāyam'imaṃ viditvā,
nagar'ūpamaṃ cittam'idaṃ ṭhapetvā,
yodhetha māraṃ paññ'āvudhena,
jitañ'ca rakkhe anivesano siyā.

DHP 40 cittavaggo
nagaropamasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 7.67 (AN7.67) ✗
nagga

adj. naked; nude ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning naked; nude
Notes √lagg (be ashamed)?
English Cognate naked
Sanskrit nagna

sah'ācaritena chavo sigālo,
na kotthuko sīhasamo kadāci,
naggo musāvādī gaṇassa satthā,
saṅkassar'ācāro na sataṃ sarikkho'ti.

SN 2.30 nānātitthiyasāvakasuttaṃ

acelako nāma yo koci paribbājakasamāpanno naggo.

VIN 2.5.5.1 acelakasikkhāpadaṃ
naggacariyā

fem. nudity; lit. going around naked [nagga + cariyā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning nudity; lit. going around naked
Construction nagga + cariyā
Compound kammadhāraya (nagga + cariyā)
Sanskrit nagnacaryā

na naggacariyā na jaṭā na paṅkā,
n'ānāsakā thaṇḍilasāyikā vā,
rajojallaṃ ukkuṭikappadhānaṃ,
sodhenti maccaṃ avitiṇṇakaṅkhaṃ.

SN 41.9 acelakassapasuttaṃ
naṅgala

nt. plough ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning plough
Sanskrit lāṅgala

na kho mayaṃ passāma bhoto gotamassa yugaṃ vā naṅgalaṃ vā phālaṃ vā pācanaṃ vā balībadde vā, atha ca pana bhavaṃ gotamo evam'āha

SN 7.11 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ

saddhā bījaṃ tapo vuṭṭhi,
paññā me yuganaṅgalaṃ,
hirī īsā mano yottaṃ,
sati me phālapācanaṃ.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ

Grammar nt, comp

Construction naṅgala + mukha

Commentary (ANa) naṅgalamukhānī'ti mātikāmukhāni. tāni hi naṅgalasarikkhakattā naṅgalehi ca khatattā naṅgalamukhānī'ti vuccanti.
Sanskrit lāṅgala + mukha

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, nadī pabbateyyā dūraṅ'gamā sīghasotā hārahārinī. tassā puriso ubhato naṅgalamukhāni vivareyya.

naṅguṭṭha

nt. tail ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning tail
Synonym laṅgula
English Cognate langur
Sanskrit lāṅgūla

seyyathā'pi, rāhula, rañño nāgo īsādanto urūḷhavā abhijāto saṅgām'āvacaro saṅgāmagato … dantehi'pi kammaṃ karoti, naṅguṭṭhena'pi kammaṃ karoti, rakkhat'eva soṇḍaṃ.

MN 61 ambalaṭṭhika rāhulovādasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso alagaddatthiko alagaddagavesī alagaddapariyesanaṃ caramāno. so passeyya mahantaṃ alagaddaṃ. tam'enaṃ bhoge vā naṅguṭṭhe vā gaṇheyya.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
nacittavipallāsa

masc. correct thinking; undeluded thought; not a mental hallucination; lit. not an inversion of mind [na + citta + vipallāsa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp, neg
Meaning correct thinking; undeluded thought; not a mental hallucination; lit. not an inversion of mind

Compound kammadhāraya (na + cittavipallāsa)
Antonym cittavipallāsa
Sanskrit na + citta + viparyāsa

nacirasseva

sandhi. after only a short time; lit. not after a long time [na + cirassa + eva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + adv + ind, neg
Meaning after only a short time; lit. not after a long time
Construction na + cirassa + eva
Antonym cirasseva
Sanskrit na + cirasya + eva

tumhe'pi, bhikkhave, nacirass'eva, yass'atthāya kulaputtā samma'd'eva agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajanti tadanuttaraṃ brahmacariyapariyosānaṃ diṭṭh'eva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharissatha.

AN 2.5 upaññātasuttaṃ

evaṃ vutte, aggivessana, āḷāro kālāmo maṃ etadavoca, viharat'āyasmā, t'ādiso ayaṃ dhammo yattha viññū puriso nacirass'eva sakaṃ ācariyakaṃ sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihareyyā'ti.

ruṇṇam'idaṃ, bhikkhave, ariyassa vinaye yadidaṃ gītaṃ. ummattakam'idaṃ, bhikkhave, ariyassa vinaye yadidaṃ naccaṃ. komārakam'idaṃ, bhikkhave, ariyassa vinaye yadidaṃ ativelaṃ dantavidaṃsakahasitaṃ.

JA 545 tittha jātakaṃ
naccagītavāditavisukadassana

nt. dancing, singing, instrumental music and watching shows ✗
naccagītavāditavisūkadassana

nt. dancing, singing, instrumental music and watching shows [nacca + gīta + vādita + visūka + dassana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, comp
Meaning dancing, singing, instrumental music and watching shows
Construction nacca + gīta + vādita + visūka + dassana
Compound dvanda (nacca ca gīta ca vādita ca visūkadassana ca)
Commentary (MNa) attanā naccananaccāpan'ādivasena naccā ca gītā ca vāditā ca, antamaso mayūranaccan'ādivasenā'pi pavattānaṃ naccādīnaṃ visūkabhūtā dassanā cā'ti naccagītavāditavisūkadassanā. nacc'ādīni hi attanā payojetuṃ vā parehi payojāpetuṃ vā payuttāni passituṃ vā n'eva bhikkhūnaṃ na bhikkhunīnaṃ vaṭṭanti.
Sanskrit nṛtyagīta + vādita + vāsuki + darśana

naccagītavāditavisūkadassanā paṭivirato ahosiṃ. mālāgandhavilepanadhāraṇamaṇḍanavibhūsanaṭṭhānā paṭivirato ahosiṃ.

MN 54 potaliyasuttaṃ
nacchādeti

pr. (+dat) (food) does not agree (with); does not please; does not give pleasure (to) [na + ā + √chand + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, from na chādeti, neg, impers, intrans (+dat)
Meaning (food) does not agree (with); does not please; does not give pleasure (to)
Root Family ā √chand
Root √chand･8 *e (desire, please)
√ In Comps cchand
Base √chand + *e > chande > chāde (irreg)
Construction na + ā + chāde + ti
na + acchādeti
Phonetic Change a > ā
Antonym acchādeti
Commentary (MNa) nacchādeyyā'ti adhimattabyādhiparetatāya na rucceyya. (MNa) nacchādessatī'ti na ruccissati na tuṭṭhiṃ karissati.
Sanskrit na + ācchadayati
Sanskrit Root √chad √chand 1, 2 (seem, please)

pañc'ime, bhikkhave, ādīnavā dantakaṭṭhassa akhādane. katame pañca? acakkhussaṃ, mukhaṃ duggandhaṃ hoti, rasaharaṇiyo na visujjhanti, pittaṃ semhaṃ bhattaṃ pariyonandhati, bhattam'assa nacchādeti.

AN 5.208 dantakaṭṭhasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso ābādhiko assa dukkhito bāḷhagilāno, bhattañ'c'assa nacchādeyya, na c'assa kāye balamattā

pajjoto araṇena cā'ti.

VIN 4.1.1 bodhikathā

bahubheravaṃ ratanagaṇānam'ālayaṃ,
najjo yathā naragaṇasaṅghasevitā,
puthū savantī upayanti sāgaraṃ.

VIN 2.7.6 surusuruvaggo
naṭṭakī

fem. dancer; actress [√naṭ + *aka + ī] ✓

Grammar fem, from naṭṭaka
Meaning dancer; actress
Root Family √naṭ
Root √naṭ×1 a (bend, dance)
Construction √naṭ > nāṭ + *aka + ī
naṭṭaka + ī
Derivative taddhita (ī)
Phonetic Change āṭ > aṭṭ
Sanskrit nartakī
Sanskrit Root √naṭ 1 (dance, play)

alaṅ'katā suvasanā,
mālinī candan'ussadā,
majjhe mahāpathe nārī,
turiye naccati naṭṭakī.

TH 186 nāgasamālattheragāthā
naṭṭha

pp. lost; perished; destroyed [√nas + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of nassati
Meaning lost; perished; destroyed
Root Family √nas
Root √nas･3 ya (be lost, disappear)
Construction √nas + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change st > ṭṭh
Commentary (VIN 1.4.1.6) naṭṭhacīvaro nāma bhikkhussa cīvaraṃ agginā vā daḍḍhaṃ hoti, udakena vā vuḷhaṃ hoti, undūrehi vā upacikāhi vā khāyitaṃ hoti, paribhogajiṇṇaṃ vā hoti. (VINa) naṭṭhan'ti cor'ādīhi haṭaṃ, etam'pi hi karaṇapalibodhassa niṭṭhitattā niṭṭhitan'ti vuccati.
Sanskrit naṣṭa
Sanskrit Root √naś 4 (be lost)

yo pana bhikkhu aññātakaṃ gahapatiṃ vā gahapatāniṃ vā cīvaraṃ viññāpeyya aññatra samayā, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ. tatth'āyaṃ samayo, acchinnacīvaro vā hoti bhikkhu, naṭṭhacīvaro vā, ayaṃ tattha samayo.

VIN PAT NP 6 aññātakaviññattisikkhāpadaṃ

niṭṭhitacīvarasmin'ti bhikkhuno cīvaraṃ kataṃ vā hoti naṭṭhaṃ vā vinaṭṭhaṃ vā daḍḍhaṃ vā cīvar'āsā vā upacchinnā.

VIN 1.4.1.1 paṭhamakathinasikkhāpadaṃ
naṭṭhakāraṇā

ind. because of being destroyed [naṭṭha + kāraṇa + ā] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning because of being destroyed
Construction naṭṭha + kāraṇa + ā
naṭṭhakāraṇa + ā
naṭṭhacīvara

adj. whose robe has perished; who robe has been destroyed [naṭṭha + cīvara] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning whose robe has perished; who robe has been destroyed
Construction naṭṭha + cīvara
Compound kammadhāraya (naṭṭha + cīvara)
Commentary (VIN 1.4.1.6) naṭṭhacīvaro nāma bhikkhussa cīvaraṃ agginā vā daḍḍhaṃ hoti, udakena vā vuḷhaṃ hoti, undūrehi vā upacikāhi vā khāyitaṃ hoti, paribhogajiṇṇaṃ vā hoti.
Sanskrit naṣṭa + cīvara

yo pana bhikkhu aññātakaṃ gahapatiṃ vā gahapatāniṃ vā cīvaraṃ viññāpeyya aññatra samayā, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ. tatth'āyaṃ samayo, acchinnacīvaro vā hoti bhikkhu, naṭṭhacīvaro vā, ayaṃ tattha samayo.

adj. (+loc) perceiving (something) as destroyed [naṭṭha + saññī] ~

Grammar adj, comp (+loc)
Meaning perceiving (something) as destroyed
Construction naṭṭha + saññī
Commentary (VINa) anaṭṭhe naṭṭhasaññī'ti attano cīvarena saddhiṃ bahūni aññesaṃ cīvarāni ekato ṭhapitāni corā haranti. tatr'esa attano cīvare anaṭṭhe naṭṭhasaññī hoti. esa nayo avinaṭṭh'ādīsu'pi.
nata 1

pp. bent, stooped, inclined [√nam] ✗
nata 2

pp. bent, bowed down [√nam] ✗
natatuttari

ind. not more than that [na + tato + uttari] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp, neg
Meaning not more than that
Construction na + tato + uttari
Antonym tatuttari
Commentary (VVt) tato catumāsato uttari atirekaṃ tatuttari, tatuttari na hotī'ti natatuttari, natatuttarī'ti saññā assa atthī'ti natatuttarisaññī
Sanskrit na + tatas + uttarin
natatuttarisaññī

adj. (+loc) perceiving (something) as not more than that [natatuttari + saññī] ~

Grammar adj, comp (+loc)
Meaning perceiving (something) as not more than that
Construction natatuttari + saññī
Commentary (VVt) tato catumāsato uttari atirekaṃ tatuttari, tatuttari na hotī'ti natatuttari, natatuttarī'ti saññā assa atthī'ti natatuttarisaññī
nati

fem. inclination; tendency; bent; bias; lit. bend [√nam + ti] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from namati
Meaning inclination; tendency; bent; bias; lit. bend
Root Family √nam
Root √nam･1 a (bend)
Construction √nam + ti
Derivative kita (ti)
Phonetic Change mt > t
Sanskrit nati
Sanskrit Root √nam 1 (bend, bow)

nissitassa calitaṃ, anissitassa calitaṃ n'atthi. calite asati passaddhi, passaddhiyā sati nati na hoti. natiyā asati āgatigati na hoti. āgatigatiyā asati cut'ūpapāto na hoti. cut'ūpapāte asati n'ev'idha na huraṃ na ubhayam'antarena. es'ev'anto dukkhassā'ti.

UD 74 catutthanibbānapaṭisaṃyuttasuttaṃ

yaññad'eva, bhikkhave, bhikkhu bahulam'anuvitakketi anuvicāreti, tathā tathā nati hoti cetaso.

MN 19 dvedhāvitakkasuttaṃ
natiṭṭhabhadantika

adj. who doesn't stay when asked; lit. not stand sir [na + tiṭṭha + bhadanta + ika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, neg
Meaning who doesn't stay when asked; lit. not stand sir
Construction na + tiṭṭha + bhadanta + ika
natiṭṭhabhadanta + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Antonym tiṭṭhabhaddantika
Variant natiṭṭhabhaddantika
Commentary (DNa) tena hi, tiṭṭha bhaddante'ti vutto'pi na tiṭṭhatī'ti natiṭṭhabhaddantiko.
Sanskrit na + tiṣṭha + bhadanta

seyyath'idaṃ, nando vaccho, kiso saṃkicco, makkhali gosālo, etehi, bho gotama, acelakā mutt'ācārā hatth'āpalekhanā naehibhaddantikā natiṭṭhabhadantikā na abhihaṭaṃ na uddissakataṃ na nimantanaṃ sādiyanti

natumhasutta

masc. Chapter 4 of the Khandasaṃyuttaṃ, Book 3 of the Saṃyutta Nikāya ✗

natumhākaṃvagga

natumhākaṃsutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 22.33 (SN22.33) ✗
natta 1.1

nt. dance, play [√nat] ✗
natta 2.1

nt. night ~

Grammar nt
Meaning night
Variant ratta
Commentary (NIDD2) nattaṃ vuccati ratti. aho'ti divaso. rattiñ'ca divā ca taṇhakkhayaṃ
Notes see SCPN §2
Sanskrit nakta
nattamatta

adj. old enough to be one’s grandson; lit. grandson measure [nattu + matta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning old enough to be one’s grandson; lit. grandson measure
Construction nattu + matta
Compound kammadhāraya (natta + matta)
Sanskrit naptṛ + mātra

tassa evaṃ hoti, mayaṃ kho pubbe agāriyabhūtā samānā aññe ovadāma'pi anusāsāma'pi. ime pan'amhākaṃ puttamattā maññe nattamattā maññe ovaditabbaṃ anusāsitabbaṃ maññantī'ti.

AN 4.122 ūmibhayasuttaṃ
nattamaha

nt. night and day [natta + aha] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning night and day
Construction natta + aha
Compound dvanda (natta ca aha ca)
Variant rattamaha
Commentary (NIDD2) nattaṃ vuccati ratti. aho'ti divaso. rattiñ'ca divā ca taṇhakkhayaṃ
Sanskrit nakta + ahar, naktaṃdina

ākiñcaññaṃ pekkhamāno satimā,
n'atthī'ti nissāya tarassu oghaṃ,
kāme pahāya virato kathāhi,
taṇhakkhayaṃ nattamaha-abhipassa.

SNP 61 upasīva māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 6
nattamāla

masc. tree Pongamia Glabrā ✗
nattar

masc. grandson; grandchild ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning grandson; grandchild
Sanskrit naptṛ, napāt

tassa evaṃ hoti, mayaṃ kho pubbe agāriyabhūtā samānā aññe ovadāma'pi anusāsāma'pi. ime pan'amhākaṃ puttamattā maññe nattamattā maññe ovaditabbaṃ anusāsitabbaṃ maññantī'ti.

AN 4.122 ūmibhayasuttaṃ

atha kho sāḷho ca migāranattā sāṇo ca sekhuniyanattā yen'āyasmā nandako ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ nandakaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdiṃsu.

AN 3.67 sāḷhasuttaṃ
natthaññaṃ

sandhi. there is not another; is there not (something) else? [na + atthi + aññaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pr + nt, neg
Meaning there is not another; is there not (something) else?
Construction na + atthi + aññaṃ
Antonym atthaññaṃ
Sanskrit na + asti + anyam

channaṃ, āvuso, phass'āyatanānaṃ asesavirāganirodhā n'atth'aññaṃ kiñcī'ti. mā h'evaṃ, āvuso.

AN 4.173 mahākoṭṭhikasuttaṃ

yattha ca pana jāyati jīyati mīyati cavati upapajjati tañ'ca vakkhati, idañ'hi na jāyati na jīyati na mīyati na cavati na upapajjatī'ti, santañ'ca pan'aññaṃ uttari nissaraṇaṃ n'atth'aññaṃ uttari nissaraṇan'ti vakkhatī'ti.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
natthañño

sandhi. there is no other person; there is no-one else; there is nothing else [na + atthi + añño] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pr + pron, neg
Meaning there is no other person; there is no-one else; there is nothing else
Construction na + atthi + añño
Antonym atthañño
Sanskrit nāsti + anyaḥ

n'atthi kho me, mahārāja, koc'añño attanā piyataro. tuyhaṃ pana, mahārāja, atth'añño koci attanā piyataro'ti? mayham'pi kho, mallike, n'atth'añño koci attanā piyataro'ti.

SN 3.8 mallikāsuttaṃ

yoniso manasikāro,
dhammo sekhassa bhikkhuno,
n'atth'añño evaṃ bahukāro,
uttam'atthassa pattiyā,
yoniso padahaṃ bhikkhu,
khayaṃ dukkhassa pāpuṇe'ti.

ITI 16 paṭhamasekhasuttaṃ
natthāvaha

adj. useless; futile; conferring no benefit [na + attha + āvaha] ~

Meaning useless; futile; conferring no benefit
Construction na + attha + āvaha
Antonym atthāvaha
Commentary (SNa) sabbānatth'āvahaṃ hotī'ti, sabbaṃ tapaṃ mayhaṃ atth'āvahaṃ na bhavatī'ti ñatvā.
natthi 1

pr. (+nom) is not; it is not; there is not; there is no; there is nothing [na + √as + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, from na atthi, neg, intrans (+nom)
Meaning is not; it is not; there is not; there is no; there is nothing
Root Family √as
Root √as･1 a (be)
Construction na + √as + ti
na + atthi
Phonetic Change st > tth
Antonym atthi
Sanskrit nāsti
Sanskrit Root √as 2 (be)

n'atthi jhānaṃ apaññassa,
paññā n'atthi ajhāyato,
yamhi jhānañ'ca paññā ca,
sa ve nibbānasantike.

DHP 372 bhikkhuvaggo

atthi, bhikkhave, dakkhiṇesu janapadesu dhovanaṃ nāma. tattha hoti annam'pi pānam'pi khajjam'pi bhojjam'pi leyyam'pi peyyam'pi naccam'pi gītam'pi vāditam'pi. atth'etaṃ, bhikkhave, dhovanaṃ, n'etaṃ n'atthī'ti vadāmi.

AN 10.107 dhovanasuttaṃ
natthi 2

pr. (+nom) does not exist; no longer exists [na + √as + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, from na atthi, neg, intrans (+nom)
Meaning does not exist; no longer exists
Root Family √as
Root √as･1 a (be)
Construction na + √as + ti
na + atthi
Phonetic Change st > tth
Antonym atthi
Sanskrit nāsti
Sanskrit Root √as 2 (be)

sabbaṃ atthī'ti kho, kaccāna, ayam'eko anto. sabbaṃ n'atthī'ti ayaṃ dutiyo anto. ete te, kaccāna, ubho ante anupagamma majjhena tathāgato dhammaṃ deseti

SN 12.15 kaccānagottasuttaṃ

atthaṅ'gato so uda vā so n'atthi,
udāhu ve sassatiyā arogo,
taṃ me munī sādhu viyākarohi,
tathā hi te vidito esa dhammo?

SNP 61 upasīva māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 6
natthika

adj. nihilistic; not believing; atheistic; not believing in the efficacy of action or existence of the afterlife; lit. there is nothing [na + √as + ti + ka] ✓

Meaning nihilistic; not believing; atheistic; not believing in the efficacy of action or existence of the afterlife; lit. there is nothing

Root √as･1 a (be)
Construction na + √as + ti + ka
natthi + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Antonym atthika
Sanskrit nāstika
Sanskrit Root √as 2 (be)

ye'pi te, bhikkhave, ahesuṃ ukkalā vassabhaññā ahetukavādā akiriyavādā natthikavādā, te'p'ime tayo niruttipathe adhivacanapathe paññattipathe na garahitabbaṃ nappaṭikkositabbaṃ amaññiṃsu.

SN 22.62 niruttipathasuttaṃ

atha ca pan'āyaṃ bhavaṃ purisapuggalo diṭṭh'eva dhamme viññūnaṃ gārayho, dussīlo purisapuggalo micchādiṭṭhi natthikavādo'ti

natthikadiṭṭhi

ye'pi te, bhikkhave, ahesuṃ ukkalā vassabhaññā ahetukavādā akiriyavādā natthikavādā, te'p'ime tayo niruttipathe adhivacanapathe paññattipathe na garahitabbaṃ nappaṭikkositabbaṃ amaññiṃsu.

SN 22.62 niruttipathasuttaṃ

atha ca pan'āyaṃ bhavaṃ purisapuggalo diṭṭh'eva dhamme viññūnaṃ gārayho, dussīlo purisapuggalo micchādiṭṭhi natthikavādo'ti

MN 60 apaṇṇakasuttaṃ
natthitā

fem. non-existence; idea of non-existence; absence; lit. there is not state [na + √as + ti + tā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from na atthi, neg
Meaning non-existence; idea of non-existence; absence; lit. there is not state
Root Family √as
Root √as･1 a (be)
Construction na + √as + ti + tā
natthi + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Phonetic Change st > tth
Antonym atthitā
Sanskrit nāstitā
Sanskrit Root √as 2 (be)

dvayanissito khv'āyaṃ, kaccāna, loko yebhuyyena, atthitañ'c'eva natthitañ'ca. lokasamudayaṃ kho, kaccāna, yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya passato yā loke natthitā sā na hoti. lokanirodhaṃ kho, kaccāna, yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya passato yā loke atthitā sā na hoti.

SN 12.15 kaccānagottasuttaṃ

ovādo: bhikkhuṇīnaṃ ovādo dātabbo dinno kiṃ? idāni pana tāsaṃ natthitāya, so ca ovādo idha n'atthi.

VIN PAT PK saṅghuposatha pubbakaraṇādi vidhi
natthidāni

sandhi. now there is not [natthi + dāni] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pr + ind
Meaning now there is not
Construction natthi + dāni
Commentary (PMa) n'atth'idāni punabbhavo'ti idāni puna uppatti n'atthi.

ñāṇañ'ca pana me dassanaṃ udapādi, akuppā me vimutti, ayam'antimā jāti, n'atth'idāni punabbhavo'ti.

SN 56.11 dhammacakkappavattanasuttaṃ
natthidinnasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 24.5 (SN24.5) ✗
natthiputtasamasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 1.13 (SN1.13) ✗
natthisammata

adj. (+dat) agreed to be nonexistent (by); considered to not exist (by) [natthi + sammata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, neg (+dat)
Meaning agreed to be nonexistent (by); considered to not exist (by)
Construction natthi + sammata
Compound kammadhāraya (natthi + sammata)
Antonym atthisammata
Sanskrit nāsti + sammata

kiñca, bhikkhave, n'atthisammataṃ loke paṇḍitānaṃ, yam'ahaṃ n'atthī'ti vadāmi? viññāṇaṃ niccaṃ dhuvaṃ sassataṃ avipariṇāmadhammaṃ n'atthisammataṃ loke paṇḍitānaṃ, aham'pi taṃ n'atthī'ti vadāmi.

SN 22.94 pupphasuttaṃ
natthī

pr. (+nom) is not; it is not; there is not; there is no [na + √as + ti] ✓

Grammar pr 3rd sg of natthi, irreg form of natthi, neg, intrans (+nom)
Meaning is not; it is not; there is not; there is no
Root Family √as
Root √as･1 a (be)
Construction na + √as + ti
na + atthi > nathhī
Phonetic Change st > tth
with metrically lengthened ī
Antonym atthi
Sanskrit nāsti
Sanskrit Root √as 2 (be)

visenikatvā pana ye caranti,
diṭṭhīhi diṭṭhiṃ avirujjhamānā,
tesu tvaṃ kiṃ labhetho pasūra,
yes'īdha n'atthī param'uggahītaṃ.

SNP 46 pasūrasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 8
natthu

fem. nose ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning nose
Synonym ghānadhātu, nāsikā
Sanskrit nasta

tassa so bhisakko sallakatto bhesajjaṃ kareyya, uddhaṃvirecanaṃ adhovirecanaṃ añjanaṃ paccañjanaṃ natthukammaṃ. so taṃ bhesajjaṃ āgamma cakkhūni uppādeyya, cakkhūni visodheyya.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
natthukamma

nt. nasal treatment; medical snuff; (comm) treatment employing oil [natthu + kamma] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning nasal treatment; medical snuff; (comm) treatment employing oil
Construction natthu + kamma
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (natthuṃ + kamma)
Commentary (DNa) natthukamman'ti telena yojetvā natthukaraṇaṃ.
Sanskrit nastaḥkarman

tassa so bhisakko sallakatto bhesajjaṃ kareyya, uddhaṃvirecanaṃ adhovirecanaṃ añjanaṃ paccañjanaṃ natthukammaṃ. so taṃ bhesajjaṃ āgamma cakkhūni uppādeyya, cakkhūni visodheyya.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
natthukaraṇī

fem. nasal-dropper ✗
nadati 1

pr. (+acc) roars; bellows; thunders [√nad + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning roars; bellows; thunders
Root Family √nad
Root √nad･1 a (roar)
Base √nad + a > nada
Construction nada + ti
Sanskrit nadati
Sanskrit Root √nad 1 (sound)

sīho, bhikkhave, migarājā sāyanhasamayaṃ āsayā nikkhamati. āsayā nikkhamitvā vijambhati. vijambhitvā samantā catuddisaṃ anuviloketi. samantā catuddisaṃ anuviloketvā tikkhattuṃ sīhanādaṃ nadati. tikkhattuṃ sīhanādaṃ naditvā gocarāya pakkamati.

AN 10.21 sīhanādasuttaṃ
nadati 2

pr. (+acc) makes a bold assertion; lit. roars [√nad + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning makes a bold assertion; lit. roars
Root Family √nad
Root √nad･1 a (roar)
Base √nad + a > nada
Construction nada + ti
Sanskrit nadati
Sanskrit Root √nad 1 (sound)

dasabalasamannāgato, bhikkhave, tathāgato catūhi ca vesārajjehi samannāgato āsabhaṃ ṭhānaṃ paṭijānāti, parisāsu sīhanādaṃ nadati, brahmacakkaṃ pavatteti

SN 12.21 dasabalasuttaṃ

tena kho pana samayena āyasmā ca mahāmoggallāno āyasmā ca ānando avāpuraṇaṃ ādāya vihāre āhiṇḍanti, abhikkamath'āyasmanto, abhikkamath'āyasmanto! idān'āyasmā sāriputto bhagavato sammukhā sīhanādaṃ nadissatī'ti.

AN 9.11 sīhanādasuttaṃ
nadanta

Grammar prp of nadati, intrans
Meaning roaring; shouting
Root Family √nad
Root √nad･1 a (roar)
Base √nad + a > nada
Construction nada + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Sanskrit nadat
Sanskrit Root √nad 1 (sound)

nadato parisāyaṃ te,
vādīdappāpahārino,
ye te dakkhanti vadanaṃ,
dhaññā te narapuṅgava.

API 17 mahāpajāpatigotamītherīapadānaṃ
nadi

aor. (+acc) roared, made a noise [√nad] ✗

nadi + ikā

Sanskrit Root √nad 1 (sound)
nadiṭṭhivipallāsa

masc. correct seeing; undeluded view; undistorted outlook; lit. not an inversion of view [na + diṭṭhi + vipallāsa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp, neg
Meaning correct seeing; undeluded view; undistorted outlook; lit. not an inversion of view
Construction na + diṭṭhi + vipallāsa
Compound kammadhāraya (na + diṭṭhivipallāsa)
Antonym diṭṭhivipallāsa
Sanskrit na + dṛṣṭi + viparyāsa

cattāro'me, bhikkhave, nasaññāvipallāsā nacittavipallāsā nadiṭṭhivipallāsā. katame cattāro? anicce, bhikkhave, aniccan'ti nasaññāvipallāso nacittavipallāso nadiṭṭhivipallāso.

AN 4.49 vipallāsasuttaṃ
nadita

pp. roared, made a noise [√nad] ✗

Construction √nad + itabba

Sanskrit naditavya
Sanskrit Root √nad 1 (sound)
naditvā 1

abs. having roared [√nad + itvā] ✓

Grammar abs of nadati, intrans
Meaning having roared
Root Family √nad
Root √nad･1 a (roar)
Construction √nad + itvā
Sanskrit naditvā
Sanskrit Root √nad 1 (sound)

sīho, bhikkhave, migarājā sāyanhasamayaṃ āsayā nikkhamati. āsayā nikkhamitvā vijambhati. vijambhitvā samantā catuddisaṃ anuviloketi. samantā catuddisaṃ anuviloketvā tikkhattuṃ sīhanādaṃ nadati. tikkhattuṃ sīhanādaṃ naditvā gocarāya pakkamati.

AN 10.21 sīhanādasuttaṃ
naditvā 2

abs. having asserted boldly [√nad + itvā] ✓

Grammar abs of nadati, intrans
Meaning having asserted boldly
Root Family √nad
Root √nad･1 a (roar)
Construction √nad + itvā
Commentary (SNa) sīhanādaṃ naditvā'ti ye dubbalā pāṇā, te palāyantū'ti attano sūrabhāvasannissitena kāruññena naditvā.
Sanskrit naditvā
Sanskrit Root √nad 1 (sound)

atha kho bhagavā udumbarikāya paribbājak'ārāme sīhanādaṃ naditvā vehāsaṃ abbhuggantvā gijjhakūṭe pabbate paccupaṭṭhāsi. sandhāno pana gahapati tāva'd'eva rājagahaṃ pāvisī'ti.

taṃ nadīhi vijānātha,
sobbhesu padaresu ca,
saṇantā yanti kusobbhā,
tuṇhīyanti mah'odadhī.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso loṇaphalakaṃ gaṅgāya nadiyā pakkhipeyya. taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave, api nu sā gaṅgā nadī amunā loṇaphalena loṇaṃ assa apeyyā'ti?

MN 50 māratajjanīyasuttaṃ
nadīpabbateyyūpama

Meaning like a river (flowing) from the mountains; mountain stream

Sanskrit nadī + parvatīya + upamā

seyyathā'pi, brāhmaṇa, nadī pabbateyyā dūraṅ'gamā sīghasotā hārahārinī, n'atthi so khaṇo vā layo vā muhutto vā yaṃ sā āvattati, atha kho sā gacchat'eva vattat'eva sandat'eva, evam'evaṃ kho, brāhmaṇa, nadīpabbateyy'ūpamaṃ jīvitaṃ manussānaṃ parittaṃ lahukaṃ .. n'atthi jātassa amaraṇaṃ.

AN 7.74 arakasuttaṃ
nadīpāra

nt. far side of the river [nadī + pāra] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning far side of the river
Construction nadī + pāra
Commentary (VINa) nadīpāran'ti ettha pārayatī'ti pārā. kiṃ pārayati? nadiṃ. nadiyā pārā nadīpārā, taṃ nadīpāraṃ, nadiṃ ajjhottharamānan'ti attho. ettha ca nadiyā lakkhaṇaṃ nadīnimitte vuttanayam'eva.
nadīmukha

nt. mouth of a river ✗
nadīvidugga 1

nt. river that is hard to cross; inaccessible river [nadī + vidugga] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning river that is hard to cross; inaccessible river
Construction nadī + vidugga

Sanskrit nadī + vi + durga

kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, mahācoro visamanissito hoti? idha, bhikkhave, mahācoro nadīviduggaṃ vā nissito hoti pabbatavisamaṃ vā.

AN 3.51 mahācorasuttaṃ

Sanskrit nadī + vi + durga

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso jar'udapānaṃ vā olokeyya pabbatavisamaṃ vā nadīviduggaṃ vā, apakass'eva kāyaṃ, apakassa cittaṃ

chetvā naddhiṃ varattañ'ca,
sandānaṃ sah'anukkamaṃ,
ukkhittapalighaṃ buddhaṃ,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

DHP 398 brāhmaṇavaggo
nanāyaṃ

sandhi. surely this?; isn’t this? [nanu + ayaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron
Meaning surely this?; isn’t this?
Construction nanu + ayaṃ
Sanskrit nanu + ayam

attani ca, bhikkhave, attaniye ca saccato thetato anupalabbhamāne, yam'pi taṃ diṭṭhiṭṭhānaṃ, so loko so attā, so pecca bhavissāmi nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo, sassatisamaṃ tath'eva ṭhassāmī'ti, nan'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, kevalo paripūro bāladhammo'ti?

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
nanu

ind. surely?; but wouldn’t?; is it true?; wasn’t? [na + nu] ✓

Grammar ind, interr, from na nu, neg
Meaning surely?; but wouldn’t?; is it true?; wasn’t?
Construction na + nu
Variant nūna
Notes expressing an objection
Sanskrit nanu

nanu te, sāriputta, channena bhikkhunā sammukhā'y'eva anupavajjatā byākatā'ti?

SN 35.87 channasuttaṃ

alaṃ, ānanda, mā soci mā paridevi nanu etaṃ, ānanda, mayā paṭikacc'eva akkhātaṃ sabbeh'eva piyehi manāpehi nānābhāvo vinābhāvo aññathābhāvo

DN 16.32 mahāparinibbānasuttaṃ
nantaka

Meaning rag; strip of cloth; (comm) frayed old cloth
Commentary (ANa) nantakavāsī'ti antacchinnapilotikavasano.
Sanskrit naktaka

seyyathā'pi, āvuso, bhikkhu paṃsukūliko rathiyāya nantakaṃ disvā vāmena pādena niggaṇhitvā dakkhiṇena pādena pattharitvā, yo tattha sāro taṃ paripātetvā ādāya pakkameyya.

AN 5.162 dutiyaāghātapaṭivinayasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhante, caṇḍālakumārako vā caṇḍālakumārikā vā kaḷopihattho nantakavāsī gāmaṃ vā nigamaṃ vā pavisanto nīcacittaṃyeva upaṭṭhapetvā pavisati.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ

tatr'idaṃ, bhante, pūraṇena kassapena paramasukk'ābhijāti paññattā, nando vaccho kiso saṃkicco makkhali gosālo. pūraṇena, bhante, kassapena imā chaḷabhijātiyo paññattā'ti.

SN 1.12 nandatisuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, sapatto sapattassa evaṃ icchati, aho vat'āyaṃ dubbaṇṇo assā'ti! taṃ kissa hetu? na, bhikkhave, sapatto sapattassa vaṇṇavatāya nandati.

SN 2.14 nandanasuttaṃ
nandana 2

nt. name of a heavenly wood; lit. delighting; enjoying [√nand + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, from nandati
Meaning name of a heavenly wood; lit. delighting; enjoying
Root Family √nand
Root √nand･1 a (delight, enjoy)
Construction √nand + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Commentary (SNa) nandane vane'ti ettha taṃ vanaṃ paviṭṭhe paviṭṭhe nandayati tosetī'ti nandanaṃ.
Sanskrit nandana
Sanskrit Root √nand 1 (rejoice)

bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, aññatarā tāvatiṃsakāyikā devatā nandane vane accharāsaṅghaparivutā dibbehi pañcahi kāmaguṇehi samappitā samaṅgībhūtā paricāriyamānā tāyaṃ velāyaṃ imaṃ gāthaṃ abhāsi

SN 1.11 nandanasuttaṃ

so tattha nandane vane accharāsaṅghaparivuto dibbehi pañcahi kāmaguṇehi samappito samaṅgībhūto paricāreyya. so passeyya gahapatiṃ vā gahapatiputtaṃ vā pañcahi kāmaguṇehi samappitaṃ samaṅgībhūtaṃ paricārayamānaṃ.

Sanskrit Root √nand 1 (rejoice)

nandati puttehi puttimā,

atha kho nandamātā upāsikā āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ bhuttāviṃ onītapattapāṇiṃ ekam'antaṃ nisīdi. ekam'antaṃ nisinnaṃ kho nandamātaraṃ upāsikaṃ āyasmā sāriputto etadavoca, ko pana te, nandamāte, bhikkhusaṅghassa abbhāgamanaṃ ārocesī'ti?

Root Family √nand
Root √nand･1 a (delight, enjoy)
Construction √nand + a + vant + ī
nandavant + ī

Sanskrit nanda +
Sanskrit Root √nand 1 (rejoice)

nt. Udāna 22 (UD 22) ✗
nandā

fem. name of a nun [√nand] ✗
nandi 1

fem. pleasure; enjoyment; relish; delight [√nand + i] ✓

Grammar fem, from nandati
Meaning pleasure; enjoyment; relish; delight
Root Family √nand
Root √nand･1 a (delight, enjoy)
Construction √nand + i
Derivative kita (i)
Variant nandī
Sanskrit nandi
Sanskrit Root √nand 1 (rejoice)

no ce āsavānaṃ khayaṃ pāpuṇāti ten'eva dhammarāgena tāya dhammanandiyā pañcannaṃ oram'bhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā opapātiko hoti tattha parinibbāyī anāvattidhammo tasmā lokā

MN 64 mahāmālukyasuttaṃ

yaṃ kiñci sampajānāsi,
uddhaṃ adho tiriyañ'c'āpi majjhe,
etesu nandiñ'ca nivesanañ'ca,
panujja viññāṇaṃ bhave na tiṭṭhe.

masc. consummation of craving ✗
nandikkhayavagga

nandikkhayasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 22.51 (SN22.51) ✗
nandinirodha

masc. end of enjoyment; cessation of delight [nandī + nirodha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning end of enjoyment; cessation of delight
Construction nandī + nirodha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (nandiyā + nirodha)
Antonym nandisamudaya
Sanskrit nandī + nirodha

tañ'ce bhikkhu n'ābhinandati n'ābhivadati n'ājjhosāya tiṭṭhati, tassa taṃ anabhinandato anabhivadato anajjhosāya tiṭṭhato nirujjhati nandī. nandinirodhā dukkhanirodho, puṇṇā'ti vadāmi

SN 35.88 puṇṇasuttaṃ

nandimukhī

adj. happy faced; bright faced; with a cheerful expression [nandi + mukhī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning happy faced; bright faced; with a cheerful expression
Construction nandi + mukhī
Compound kammadhāraya (nandi + mukhī)
Sanskrit nāndīmukha, nandīmukhā "sound of a drum" (bsk)

tatiyam'pi kho āyasmā ānando abhikkantāya rattiyā, nikkhante pacchime yāme, uddhaste aruṇe, nandimukhiyā rattiyā uṭṭhāy'āsanā ek'aṃsaṃ uttar'āsaṅgaṃ karitvā yena bhagavā ten'añjaliṃ paṇāmetvā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca

nandiya

nanda + iya

Sanskrit nandika
Sanskrit Root √nand 1 (rejoice)

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā nātike viharati giñjak'āvasathe. tena kho pana samayena āyasmā ca anuruddho āyasmā ca nandiyo āyasmā ca kimilo gosiṅgasālavanadāye viharanti.

nandirāga

masc. (+loc) delight and desire (in); pleasure and passion (for) [nandi + rāga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp (+loc)
Meaning delight and desire (in); pleasure and passion (for)
Construction nandi + rāga
Compound dvanda (nandi ca rāga ca)
Commentary (SNa) nandirāgo sinehan'aṭṭhena āpodhātusadiso.
Sanskrit nandi + rāga

luddo'ti kho, bhikkhave, mārassetaṃ pāpimato adhivacanaṃ. papatā'ti kho, bhikkhave, lābhasakkārasilokassetaṃ adhivacanaṃ. suttakan'ti kho, bhikkhave, nandirāgass'etaṃ adhivacanaṃ.

SN 17.3 kummasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, pathavīdhātu, evaṃ catasso viññāṇaṭṭhitiyo daṭṭhabbā. seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, āpodhātu, evaṃ nandirāgo daṭṭhabbo. seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, pañca bījajātāni, evaṃ viññāṇaṃ s'āhāraṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ.

SN 22.54 bījasuttaṃ

SN 2.28 nandivisālasuttaṃ

nt. Jātaka 28 (JA 28) ✗
nandivisālasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 2.28 (SN2.28) ✗
nandisamudaya

masc. source of enjoyment; arising of delight [nandī + samudaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning source of enjoyment; arising of delight
Construction nandī + samudaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (nandiyā + samudaya)
Antonym nandinirodha
Commentary (SNa) nandisamudayā dukkhasamudayo'ti taṇhāya samodhānena pañcakkhandhadukkhassa samodhānaṃ hoti. iti chasu dvāresu, nandisamudayā dukkhasamudayo'ti iminā dvinnaṃ saccānaṃ vasena vaṭṭaṃ matthakaṃ pāpetvā dassesi.
Sanskrit nandī + samudaya

tassa taṃ abhinandato abhivadato ajjhosāya tiṭṭhato uppajjati nandī. nandisamudayā dukkhasamudayo, puṇṇā'ti vadāmi

SN 35.88 puṇṇasuttaṃ
nandisaṃyojana 1

adj. with delight as bond; having enjoyment as the fetter; lit. delight fetter [nandi + saṃyojana] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with delight as bond; having enjoyment as the fetter; lit. delight fetter
Construction nandi + saṃyojana
Compound kammadhāraya (nandi eva saṃyojana)
Variant nandīsaṃyojana
Sanskrit nandi + saṃyojana

nandisaṃyojano loko,
vitakkassa vicāraṇaṃ,
taṇhāya vippahānena,
nibbānaṃ iti vuccati.

pārāyanavaggo 13

nandī 1

adj. who takes pleasure in; who enjoys [√nand + ī] ✓

Grammar adj, from nandati
Meaning who takes pleasure in; who enjoys
Root Family √nand
Root √nand･1 a (delight, enjoy)
Construction √nand + ī
Derivative kita (ī)
Antonym anandī
Sanskrit nandin
Sanskrit Root √nand 1 (rejoice)

iti bhinnānaṃ vā sandhātā sahitānaṃ vā anuppadātā samagg'ārāmo samaggarato samagganandī samaggakaraṇiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā hoti

AN 10.176 cundasuttaṃ

ākiñcaññasambhavaṃ ñatvā,
nandī saṃyojanaṃ iti,
evam'etaṃ abhiññāya,
tato tattha vipassati,
etaṃ ñāṇaṃ tathaṃ tassa,
brāhmaṇassa vusīmato'ti.

SNP 69 posāla māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 14
nandī 2

fem. (+loc) pleasure (in); enjoyment (in); delight (in) [√nand + ī] ✓

Grammar fem, from nandati (+loc)
Meaning pleasure (in); enjoyment (in); delight (in)
Root Family √nand
Root √nand･1 a (delight, enjoy)
Construction √nand + ī
Derivative kita (ī)
Antonym anandī
Variant nandi
Commentary (SNa) rāgo'tiādīni lobhass'eva nāmāni. so hi rañjanavasena rāgo, nandanavasena nandī, taṇhāyanavasena taṇhā'ti vuccati.
Sanskrit nandī
Sanskrit Root √nand 1 (rejoice)

cakkhusmiṃ, āvuso, rūpe cakkhuviññāṇe cakkhuviññāṇaviññātabbesu dhammesu yo chando yo rāgo yā nandī yā taṇhā ye ca upāy'ūpādānā cetaso adhiṭṭhān'ābhinives'ānusayā tesaṃ khayā virāgā nirodhā cāgā paṭinissaggā vimuttaṃ me cittan'ti pajānāmi.

MN 112 chabbisodhanasuttaṃ

kacci tvaṃ anagho bhikkhu,
kacci nandī na vijjati,
kacci taṃ ekam'āsīnaṃ,
aratī n'ābhikīratī'ti.

SN 2.18 kakudhasuttaṃ
nandījāta

adj. who is happy; who is enjoying; who is delighting; lit. delight arisen [nandī + jāta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who is happy; who is enjoying; who is delighting; lit. delight arisen
Construction nandī + jāta
Compound sattamī tappurisa (nandīyaṃ + jāta)
Commentary (SNa) nandījātassā'ti jātataṇhassa.
Sanskrit nandin + jāta

aghajātassa ve nandī,
nandījātassa ve aghaṃ,
anandī anagho bhikkhu,
evaṃ jānāhi āvuso'ti.

SN 2.18 kakudhasuttaṃ
nandīnirodha

masc. cessation of delight; ending of enjoyment [nandī + nirodha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning cessation of delight; ending of enjoyment
Construction nandī + nirodha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (nandiyā + nirodha)
Sanskrit nandī + nirodha

tassa nandīnirodhā upādānanirodho, upādānanirodhā bhavanirodho, bhavanirodhā jātinirodho, jātinirodhā jarāmaraṇaṃ sokaparidevadukkhadomanassupāyāsā nirujjhanti. evametassa kevalassa dukkhakkhandhassa nirodho hoti.

MN 38 mahātaṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ
nandībhavaparikkhaya

masc. extinction of enjoyment in existence; destruction of delight in being; (comm) (or) destruction of delight and existence [nandī + bhava + parikkhaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning extinction of enjoyment in existence; destruction of delight in being; (comm) (or) destruction of delight and existence
Construction nandī + bhava + parikkhaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (nandībhavassa + parikkhaya)
Variant nandibhavaparikkhaya
Commentary (SNa) nandībhavaparikkhayā'ti nandīmūlakassa kammabhavassa parikkhayena. nandiyā ca bhavassa cā'ti'pi vaṭṭati.
Sanskrit nandin + bhava + parikṣaya

nandībhavaparikkhayā,
saññāviññāṇasaṅkhayā,
vedanānaṃ nirodhā upasamā,
evaṃ khv'āhaṃ āvuso jānāmi
sattānaṃ nimokkhaṃ pamokkhaṃ vivekan'ti.

SN 1.2 nimokkhasuttaṃ
nandībhavaparikkhīṇa

adj. eradicated enjoyment in existence [nandī + bhava + parikkhīṇa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning eradicated enjoyment in existence
Construction nandī + bhava + parikkhīṇa
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (nandībhavaṃ + parikkhīṇa)
Sanskrit nandin + bhava + parikṣīṇa

candaṃ'va vimalaṃ suddhaṃ,
vippasannam'anāvilaṃ,
nandībhavaparikkhīṇaṃ,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

DHP 413 brāhmaṇavaggo
nandīrāga

masc. delight and desire; (or) delighting in desire; (comm) three karmic intentions [nandī + rāga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning delight and desire; (or) delighting in desire; (comm) three karmic intentions
Construction nandī + rāga
Compound dvanda (nandī ca rāga ca)
Variant nandībhava
Commentary (SNa) nandīrāgo nāma tayo kamm'ābhisaṅkhārā.
Sanskrit nandin + rāga

virato kāmasaññāya,
rūpasaṃyojan'ātigo,
nandīrāgaparikkhīṇo,
so gambhīre na sīdatī'ti.

SN 2.15 candanasuttaṃ

chaṭṭho antaracaro vadhako ukkhittāsiko'ti kho, bhikkhave, nandīrāgass'etaṃ adhivacanaṃ.

SN 35.238 āsīvisopamasuttaṃ
nandīrāgaparikkhīṇa

Grammar adj, comp

SN 2.15 candanasuttaṃ
nandīrāgasahagata

adj. accompanied by delight and desire [nandī + rāga + sahagata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning accompanied by delight and desire
Construction nandī + rāga + sahagata
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (nandīrāgena + sahagata)

Commentary (DNa) nandīrāgena saha gatā'ti nandīrāgasahagatā. nandīrāgena saddhiṃ atthato ekattam'eva gatā'ti vuttaṃ hoti.
Sanskrit nandī + rāga + sahagata

katamo c'āvuso, dukkhasamudayo? y'āyaṃ taṇhā ponobbhavikā nandīrāgasahagatā tatratatr'ābhinandinī, seyyath'idaṃ, kāmataṇhā bhavataṇhā vibhavataṇhā, ayaṃ vuccat'āvuso, dukkhasamudayo.

Sanskrit nandi + upasecana

upayo, bhikkhave, avimutto, anupayo vimutto. rūp'upayaṃ vā, bhikkhave, viññāṇaṃ tiṭṭhamānaṃ tiṭṭheyya, rūp'ārammaṇaṃ rūpappatiṭṭhaṃ nand'ūpasecanaṃ vuddhiṃ virūḷhiṃ vepullaṃ āpajjeyya.

SN 22.53 upayasuttaṃ
nandhi 1

fem. strap; thong; tie [√nadh + ṃa + i] ✓

Grammar fem, from nandhati
Meaning strap; thong; tie
Root Family √nadh
Root √nadh･2 ṃa (wrap, twist)
Base √nadh + ṃa > nandha
Construction nandha + i
Derivative kita (i)
Variant naddhi, nandi
Sanskrit naddhi, naddhrī
Sanskrit Root √nah 4 (tie)

chetvā nandhiṃ varattañ'ca,
sandānaṃ sah'anukkamaṃ,
ukkhittapalighaṃ buddhaṃ,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

DHP 398 brāhmaṇavaggo
nandhi 2

aor. wrapped, twisted with, tied [√nadh] ✗
napaṭikkositabba

ptp. should not be rejected; should not be disdained; lit. not to be blamed [na + pati + √kus + *a + itabba] ~

Grammar ptp of na paṭikkosati, neg
Meaning should not be rejected; should not be disdained; lit. not to be blamed
Root Family pati √kus
Root √kus･1 *a (call, insult)
√ In Comps kkus
Base √kus + *a > kosa
Construction na + pati + kosa + itabba
na + paṭikkositabba
Derivative kicca (itabba)
Phonetic Change u > o
Antonym paṭikkositabba
Notes nappaṭikkositabba is the preferred spelling
Sanskrit na + pratyākroṣṭavya
Sanskrit Root √kruś 1 (cry out)
napaṭijānāti

pr. (+acc) does not admit; does not acknowledge [na + pati + √ñā + nā + ti] ~

Grammar pr, from na paṭijānāti, neg, trans (+acc)
Meaning does not admit; does not acknowledge
Root Family pati √ñā
Root √ñā･5 nā (know)
√ In Comps ññā
Base √ñā + nā > jānā
Construction na + pati + jānā + ti
na + paṭijānāti
Phonetic Change ñ > j
Antonym paṭijānāti
Sanskrit na + pratijānāti
Sanskrit Root √jñā 9 (know)
naparamarūpa

naparamparabhojanasaññī

adj. (+loc) perceiving (oneself) as not eating one meal after the other [na + paramparabhojana + saññī] ~

Grammar adj, comp, neg (+loc)
Meaning perceiving (oneself) as not eating one meal after the other
Construction na + paramparabhojana + saññī
napi

sandhi. not even; nor just [na + api] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + ind, neg
Meaning not even; nor just
Construction na + api
Antonym api
Sanskrit na + api

na brāhmaṇo kappam'upeti saṅkhā,
na diṭṭhisārī na'pi ñāṇabandhu,
ñatvā ca so sammutiyo puthujjā,
upekkhatī uggahaṇanti m'aññe.

SNP 51 mahābyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 13

ekaccā devatā evam'āhaṃsu, na kālaṅ'kato samaṇo gotamo, na'pi kālaṅ'karoti, arahaṃ samaṇo gotamo, vihārotv'eva so arahato evarūpo hotī'ti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
napitābhūtapubba

adj. not one's father before; not previously one's father [na + pitābhūta + pubba] ~

Grammar adj, comp, neg
Meaning not one's father before; not previously one's father
Construction na + pitābhūta + pubba
Antonym pitābhūtapubba
napiyakamya

adj. not wishing to be loved; not wanting to be dear; not wishing to endear oneself [na + piya + kamya] ~

Grammar adj, comp, neg
Meaning not wishing to be loved; not wanting to be dear; not wishing to endear oneself
Construction na + piya + kamya
Compound kammadhāraya (na + piyakamya)
Antonym piyakamya
Commentary (VINa) piyakamyassa vā'ti evaṃ ahaṃ etassa piyo bhavissāmī'ti attano piyabhāvaṃ patthayamānassa vā.
Sanskrit na + priyakāmya
naputtabhūtapubba

adj. not one's son before; not previously one's son [na + puttabhūta + pubba] ~

Grammar adj, comp, neg
Meaning not one's son before; not previously one's son
Construction na + puttabhūta + pubba
nappakāsati

pr. does not shine; does not manifest; does not appear [na + pa + √kās + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, from na pakāsati, neg, intrans
Meaning does not shine; does not manifest; does not appear
Root Family pa √kās
Root √kās･1 a (shine, be visible)
Base √kās + a > kāsa
Construction na + pa + kāsa + ti
na + pakāsati
Antonym pakāsati
Commentary (SNa) nappakāsatī'ti na jotati, na pātubhavatī'ti attho.
Sanskrit na + prakāśate
Sanskrit Root √kāś 1 (appear, make a show)

yattha āpo ca pathavī,
tejo vāyo na gādhati,
na tattha sukkā jotanti,
ādicco nappakāsati,
na tattha candimā bhāti,
tamo tattha na vijjati.

UD 10 bāhiyasuttaṃ

avijjāya nivuto loko,
vevicchā pamādā nappakāsati,
japp'ābhilepanaṃ brūmi,
dukkham'assa mahabbhayaṃ.

SNP 56 ajita māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 1
nappajappati

pr. (+acc) does not desire; does not yearn (for); does not pray (for); lit. does not mutter [na + pa + √japp + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, from na pajappati, neg, trans (+acc)
Meaning does not desire; does not yearn (for); does not pray (for); lit. does not mutter
Root Family pa √japp
Root √japp･1 a (mutter, pray)
Base √japp + a > jappa
Construction na + pa + jappa + ti
na + pajappati
Antonym pajappati
Commentary (SNa) nappajappanti n'āgatan'ti ... anāgataṃ na patthenti.
Sanskrit na + prajapati
Sanskrit Root √jap 1 (whisper)

atītaṃ n'ānusocanti,
nappajappanti n'āgataṃ,
paccuppannena yāpenti,
tena vaṇṇo pasīdati.

SN 1.10 araññasuttaṃ
nappajahati

pr. (+acc) does not give up; does not abandon; does not let go (of) [na + pa + √hā + a + ti] ✓

Root √hā･1 a (abandon)

Construction na + pa + jaha + ti
na + pajahati
Phonetic Change h > j
Sanskrit na + prajahāti
Sanskrit Root √hā 3 (leave)

kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na āsāṭikaṃ hāretā hoti? idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu uppannaṃ kāmavitakkaṃ adhivāseti nappajahati na vinodeti na byantīkaroti na anabhāvaṃ gameti

ayaṃ vuccat'āvuso, bhikkhu sakkāy'ābhirato nappajahāsi sakkāyaṃ sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāya.

na + pajānāti

Sanskrit Root √jñā 9 (know)

idha, bhikkhave, assutavā puthujjano manasikaraṇīye dhamme nappajānāti, amanasikaraṇīye dhamme nappajānāti

MN 2.2 sabbāsavasuttaṃ

duppañño duppañño'ti, āvuso, vuccati. kittāvatā nu kho, āvuso, duppañño'ti vuccatī'ti? nappajānāti nappajānātī'ti kho, āvuso, tasmā duppañño'ti vuccati.

SN 56.35 sattisatasuttaṃ

nappaṭikaṅkhe anāgataṃ,
yadatītaṃ pahīnaṃ taṃ,
appattañ'ca anāgataṃ.

AN 3.4 accayasuttaṃ
nappaṭikūla

Root √kūl×1 a (obstruct, embank)
√ In Comps kūl or kkūl

Compound kammadhāraya (na + paṭikūla)

Sanskrit na + pratikūla
Sanskrit Root √kūl 1 (cover, hide)

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, yassa kassaci bhikkhuno kāyagatāsati bhāvitā bahulīkatā, taṃ cakkhu n'āviñchati manāpiyesu rūpesu, amanāpiyā rūpā nappaṭikūlā honti.

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ
nappaṭikkosi

Root √kus･1 *a (call, insult)
√ In Comps kkus
Base √kus + *a > kosa
Construction na + pati + kosa + i
na + paṭikkosi
Phonetic Change u > o
Antonym paṭikkosi
Synonym anumodi, abhinandi
Commentary (ANa) nappaṭikkosiṃsū'ti na idaṃ evan'ti nappaṭisedhesuṃ.
Sanskrit na + pratyākruś
Sanskrit Root √kruś 1 (cry out)

atha kho te bhikkhū tesaṃ aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ bhāsitaṃ n'eva abhinandiṃsu nappaṭikkosiṃsu.

SN 46.53 aggisuttaṃ

√ In Comps kkus

Construction na + pati + kosa + itabba

Phonetic Change u > o
Antonym paṭikkositabba
Sanskrit na + pratyākroṣṭavya
Sanskrit Root √kruś 1 (cry out)

tassa, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno bhāsitaṃ n'eva abhinanditabbaṃ nappaṭikkositabbaṃ. anabhinanditvā appaṭikkositvā tāni padabyañjanāni sādhukaṃ uggahetvā sutte otāretabbāni, vinaye sandassetabbāni.

AN 4.180 mahāpadesasuttaṃ

te'p'ime tayo niruttipathe adhivacanapathe paññattipathe na garahitabbaṃ nappaṭikkositabbaṃ amaññiṃsu. taṃ kissa hetu? nindā-ghaṭṭana-byārosa-upārambha-bhayā'ti.

so taṃ appaṭisaṅkhāya piveyya, nappaṭinissajjeyya. tassa taṃ pivato c'eva nacchādeyya vaṇṇena'pi gandhena'pi rasena'pi, pivitvā ca pana maraṇaṃ vā nigaccheyya maraṇamattaṃ vā dukkhaṃ.

SNP 7 vasalasuttaṃ

puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu codito codakena codakaṃ nappaṭippharati. yam'p'āvuso, bhikkhu codito codakena codakaṃ nappaṭippharati, ayam'pi dhammo sovacassakaraṇo.

MN 15 anumānasuttaṃ
nappaṭibala

adj. (+inf) not competent (to); not qualified (to); not able (to) [na + pati + √bal + a] ✓

Root √bal･1 a (be strong, live)
Construction na > a + pati + √bal + a
Derivative kita (a)
Compound kammadhāraya (na + paṭibala)
Antonym paṭibala
Commentary (ANa) nappaṭibalo'ti kāyabalena ca ñāṇabalena ca asamannāgato.
Sanskrit apratibala
Sanskrit Root √bal 2 (be strong)

yañ'ca ayam'āyasmā dhammaṃ bhāsati tassa ca nappaṭibalo saṃkhittena vā vitthārena vā atthaṃ ācikkhituṃ desetuṃ paññāpetuṃ paṭṭhapetuṃ vivarituṃ vibhajituṃ uttānīkātuṃ. duppañño ayam'āyasmā, n'āyam'āyasmā paññavā'ti.

AN 4.192 ṭhānasuttaṃ
nappaṭibhāti 1

pr. does not come to mind; does not occur to one [na + pati + √bhā + a + ti] ✓

Meaning does not come to mind; does not occur to one

Construction na + pati + bhā + ti
na + paṭibhāti
Antonym paṭibhāti
Sanskrit na + pratibhāti
Sanskrit Root √bhā 2 (shine)

ko nu kho, bho gotama, hetu, ko paccayo yen'ekadā dīgharattaṃ sajjhāyakatā'pi mantā nappaṭibhanti, pag'eva asajjhāyakatā?

SN 46.55 saṅgāravasuttaṃ

ekam'antaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā puṇṇiyo bhagavantaṃ etadavoca, ko nu kho, bhante, hetu ko paccayo yena app'ekadā tathāgataṃ dhammadesanā paṭibhāti app'ekadā nappaṭibhātī'ti?

AN 10.83 puṇṇiyasuttaṃ
nappaṭibhāti 2

pr. (+acc) is not evident [pati + √bhā] ✗
nappaṭibhāyati

pr. does not come to mind; does not occur to one [na + pati + √bhā + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass of na paṭibhāti, neg, intrans
Meaning does not come to mind; does not occur to one
Root Family pati √bhā
Root √bhā･1 ya (shine, speak)
Base √bhā + ya > bhāya (pass)
Construction na + pati + bhāya + ti
na + paṭibhāyati
Antonym paṭibhāyati
Variant nappaṭibhāsati
Sanskrit na + pratibhāti
Sanskrit Root √bhā 2 (shine)

mah'ācariyena vata kira, bho, saddhiṃ mantayamānā na jānimha, āyasmā ānando'ti. sace hi mayaṃ jāneyyāma, ayaṃ āyasmā ānando'ti, ettakam'pi no nappaṭibhāyeyya. khamatu ca me āyasmā ānando'ti.

AN 10.96 kokanudasuttaṃ
nappaṭibhāsati

pr. (+dat) does not occur (to); does not come to mind (of); (comm) does not speak in return [na + pati + √bhā + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, from na paṭibhāsati, neg, impers, intrans (+dat)
Meaning does not occur (to); does not come to mind (of); (comm) does not speak in return
Root Family pati √bhā
Root √bhā･1 a (shine, speak)
Base √bhā + a > bhā > bhāsa (irreg)
Construction na + pati + bhāsa + ti
na + paṭibhāsati
Antonym paṭibhāsati
Variant nappaṭibhāti
Commentary (MNa) ettakam'pi no nappaṭibhāseyyā'ti paṭisambhidāpattassa appaṭibhānaṃ nāma n'atthi. yā pan'āyaṃ upamā āhaṭā, taṃ na āhareyyāma, attham'eva katheyyāma. upamā hi ajānantānaṃ āharīyatī'ti ayam'ettha adhippāyo
Sanskrit na + pratibhāti
Sanskrit Root √bhā 2 (shine)

sace hi mayaṃ jāneyyāma āyasmā sāriputto'ti, ettakam'pi no nappaṭibhāseyya.

Sanskrit na + prativirudhyate
Sanskrit Root √rudh 2, 7 (obstruct)

so uppannaṃ lābhaṃ n'ānurujjhati, alābhe nappaṭivirujjhati, uppannaṃ yasaṃ n'ānurujjhati, ayase nappaṭivirujjhati, uppannaṃ pasaṃsaṃ n'ānurujjhati, nindāya nappaṭivirujjhati, uppannaṃ sukhaṃ n'ānurujjhati, dukkhe nappaṭivirujjhati.

AN 8.6 dutiyalokadhammasuttaṃ
nappaṭivirūḷha

pp. not regrown; not regenerated [pati + vi + √ruh] ✗
nappaṭisaṃvedeti

pr. does not experience [pati + saṃ + √vid] ✗
nappaṭisevati

pr. (+acc) does not practice; does not indulge (in); does not engage (in) [na + pati + √sev + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, from na paṭisevati, neg, trans (+acc)
Meaning does not practice; does not indulge (in); does not engage (in)
Root Family pati √sev
Root √sev･1 a (serve, associate)
Base √sev + a > seva
Construction na + pati + seva + ti
na + paṭisevati
Antonym paṭisevati
Sanskrit na + pratisevate
Sanskrit Root √sev 1 (attend upon)

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo kāme ca nappaṭisevati, pāpañ'ca kammaṃ na karoti, sahā'pi dukkhena sahā'pi domanassena assumukho'pi rudamāno paripuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ carati.

AN 4.5 anusotasuttaṃ

Root √sev･1 a (serve, associate)

Derivative kita (itar)
Sanskrit pratisev
Sanskrit Root √sev 1 (attend upon)
nappaṭihaññati

pr. (+instr) is unafflicted (by); (comm) is unobstructed through contentment; lit. is not hit back [na + pati + √han + ya + ti] ~

Grammar pr, pass of na paṭihanati, neg, intrans (+instr)
Meaning is unafflicted (by); (comm) is unobstructed through contentment; lit. is not hit back
Root Family pati √han
Root √han･1 ya (strike, kill)
Base √han + ya > hañña (pass)
Construction na + pati + hañña + ti
na + paṭihaññati
Phonetic Change ny > ññ
Commentary (ANa) disā nappaṭihaññatī'ti yassa hi asukaṭṭhānaṃ nāma gato cīvar'ādīni labhissāmī'ti cittaṃ uppajjati, tassa disā paṭihaññati nāma. yassa evaṃ na uppajjati, tassa nappaṭihaññati nāma. (ANt) disā nappaṭihaññatī'ti santuṭṭhiyā cātuddisabhāvena disā na paṭihanati. vuttañ'h'etaṃ cātuddiso appaṭigho ca hoti, santussamāno itarītarenā'ti (su. ni. 42).
Sanskrit na + pratihanyate
Sanskrit Root √han 1, 2 (smite)
nappaṇidahati

pr. (+acc) does not make an aspiration; does not wish (for); does not pray (for) [na + pa + ni + √dhā + a + ti] ~

Grammar pr, from na paṇidahati, neg, trans (+acc)
Meaning does not make an aspiration; does not wish (for); does not pray (for)
Root Family pa ni √dhā
Root √dhā･1 a (place, support)
Base √dhā + a > dhā > daha (irreg)
Construction na > a + pa + ni + daha + ti
na + paṇidahati
Antonym paṇidahati
Sanskrit na + praṇidadhāti
Sanskrit Root √dhā 1, 2, 3 (put)
nappatiṭṭhāti

pr. (+loc) does not get established (in); does not find a firm footing (in); lit. does not stand back [na + pati + √ṭhā + a + ti] ~

Grammar pr, from na patiṭṭhāti, neg, intrans (+loc)

Root Family pati √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + a > ṭhā
Construction na + pati + ṭhā + ti
na + patiṭṭhāti
Antonym patiṭṭhāti
Commentary (ANa) cavati nappatiṭṭhātī'ti imasmiṃ sāsane guṇehi cavati, patiṭṭhātuṃ na sakkoti.
Sanskrit na + pratitiṣṭhati
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)
nappatirūpa

adj. unsuitable; improper; inappropriate [na + pati + √rūp + a] ✓

Grammar adj, from na rūpa, neg
Meaning unsuitable; improper; inappropriate
Root Family pati √rūp
Root √rūp･8 *e (form, produce)
Construction na + pati + √rūp + a
Derivative kita (a)
Compound kammadhāraya (na + patirūpa)
Antonym patirūpa
Synonym asāruppa
Variant appatirūpa
Commentary (MNa) nappatirūpan'ti na sāruppaṃ
Sanskrit apratirūpa
Sanskrit Root √rūp 10 (form)

evaṃ vutte, potaliyo gahapati gahapativādena maṃ samaṇo gotamo samudācaratī'ti kupito anattamano bhagavantaṃ etadavoca, ta'y'idaṃ, bho gotama, nacchannaṃ, ta'y'idaṃ nappatirūpaṃ, yaṃ maṃ tvaṃ gahapativādena samudācarasī'ti.

suttā te nappabujjhanti,
kālo tesaṃ pabujjhitun'ti.

Antonym pamajjati
Sanskrit na + pramadati
Sanskrit Root √mad 1, 2, 3, 4 (be exhilarated)

yo ca pubbe pamajjitvā,
pacchā so nappamajjati,
so'maṃ lokaṃ pabhāseti,
abbhā mutto'va candimā.

DHP 172 lokavaggo

jhāyī na pādalol'assa,
virame kukkuccā nappamajjeyya,
ath'āsanesu sayanesu,
appasaddesu bhikkhu vihareyya.

na uṇṇameyya pasaṃsito bhikkhu,
lobhaṃ saha macchariyena,
kodhaṃ pesuṇiyañ'ca panudeyya.

SNP 52 tuvaṭakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 14

Sanskrit Root √vyath √vedh 1 (waver)

selo yathā ekagghano,
vātena na samīrati,
evaṃ rūpā rasā saddā,
gandhā phassā ca kevalā,
iṭṭhā dhammā aniṭṭhā ca,
nappavedhenti tādino.

Construction na + pa + saha + ti

Sanskrit na + prasahate
Sanskrit Root √sah 1, 2, 4 (prevail)

asubh'ānupassiṃ viharantaṃ,
indriyesu susaṃvutaṃ,
bhojanamhi ca mattaññuṃ,
saddhaṃ āraddhavīriyaṃ,
taṃ ve nappasahati māro,
vāto selaṃ'va pabbataṃ.

DHP 8 yamakavaggo

na antalikkhe na samuddamajjhe,
na pabbatānaṃ vivaraṃ pavissa,
na vijjatī so jagatippadeso,
yatthaṭṭhitaṃ nappasaheyya maccu.

dhīro ca dānaṃ anumodamāno,
ten'eva so hoti sukhī parattha.

ko sutvā nappasīdeyya,
api kaṇh'ābhijātiyo,
tasmā hi attakāmena,

saddhammo garukātabbo,
saraṃ buddhāna'sāsanan'ti.

dasa'pi, bhante, purisā, vīsam'pi, bhante, purisā, tiṃsam'pi, bhante, purisā, cattārīsam'pi, bhante, purisā, paññāsam'pi, bhante, purisā nappahonti yāvatikā imissā nāḷandāya pāṇā te ekena khaṇena ekena muhuttena ekaṃ maṃsakhalaṃ ekaṃ maṃsapuñjaṃ kātuṃ.

VIN 1.4.1.3 tatiyakathinasikkhāpadaṃ
nappiyasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.87 (AN10.87) ✗
nabāhulika

Grammar adj, from na bahula, neg
Meaning not excessive; not living luxuriously
Root Family √bah
Root √bah×1 a (increase)
Construction na + √bah > bāh + u + la + *ika
nabahula + *ika
Derivative taddhita (*ika)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Compound kammadhāraya (na + bāhulika)
Antonym bāhulika
Variant nabāhullika
Sanskrit na + bāhulya + ika
Sanskrit Root √bṛh √baṃh 6 (make big or strong)

ye pana te kulaputtā ... sāmaññe apekkhavanto sikkhāya tibbagāravā nabāhulikā nasāthalikā okkamane nikkhittadhurā paviveke pubbaṅ'gamā ... tehi bhavaṃ gotamo saddhiṃ saṃvasati.

MN 107 gaṇakamoggallānasuttaṃ
nabhaginibhūtapubba

Construction na + bhaginibhūta + pubba
Antonym bhaginibhūtapubba
nabhas

masc. sky ✓

Grammar masc, mano group
Meaning sky
Synonym ādiccapatha, deva
Variant nata
Commentary (SNa) nabhaṃ abbhussakkamāno'ti ākāsaṃ abhilaṅghanto.
Notes nabho in comps
Sanskrit nabhas

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, saradasamaye viddhe vigatavalāhake deve ādicco nabhaṃ abbhussakkamāno sabbaṃ ākāsagataṃ tamagataṃ abhivihacca bhāsate ca tapate ca virocati ca

Grammar adj, comp, neg
Meaning not intending to cause discord; with no desire for dissension; not wishing to break apart
Construction na + bheda + adhippāya
Compound kammadhāraya (na + bhedādhippāya)
Antonym bhedādhippāya
Commentary (VINa) bhed'ādhippāyassa vā'ti evam'ayaṃ etena saddhiṃ bhijjissatī'ti parassa parena bhedaṃ icchantassa vā.
Sanskrit na + bheda + abhiprāya
namataka

nt. felt covering for a knife ✗
namati 1

Grammar pr, intrans (+dat)
Meaning bends (towards); inclines (to); veers (towards)
Root Family √nam
Root √nam･1 a (bend)
Base √nam + a > nama
Construction nama + ti
Sanskrit namati
Sanskrit Root √nam 1 (bend, bow)

kāmavitakkaṃ ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhu bahulam'anuvitakketi anuvicāreti, pahāsi nekkhammavitakkaṃ, kāmavitakkaṃ bahulam'akāsi, tassa taṃ kāmavitakkāya cittaṃ namati.

MN 19 dvedhāvitakkasuttaṃ

maraṇena'pi taṃ pahīyati,
yaṃ puriso mam'idan'ti maññati,
etam'pi viditvā paṇḍito,
na mamattāya nametha māmako.

DN 21.8 sakkapañhasuttaṃ
namassati

Root √namass･1 a (bow, worship)

Construction namassa + ti
Commentary (ANa) namassantī'ti kāyena namassanti, vācāya namassanti, manasā namassanti, dhamm'ānudhammapaṭipattiyā namassanti, sakkaronti garuṃ karonti.
Sanskrit namasyati
Sanskrit Root namasya - (pay homage)

tasmā hi ne namasseyya,
sakkareyya ca paṇḍito,
annena atha pānena,
vatthena sayanena ca.

AN 4.63 brahmasuttaṃ

no ce haritāni tiṇāni āmaseyyāsi, aggiṃ paricareyyāsi. no ce aggiṃ paricareyyāsi, pañjaliko ādiccaṃ namasseyyāsi

gāthā'c'imā atthavatī abhāsi.

namassamāno aṭṭhāsiṃ,

vuṭṭhahitvā samādhimhā,
satthā loke anuttaro,
mama kammaṃ pakittento,
idaṃ vacanam'abravi.

Phonetic Change +y
Antonym ito
Sanskrit na + itaḥ

tassa mayhaṃ, aggivessana, etadahosi, ye kho keci atītam'addhānaṃ samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā opakkamikā dukkhā tibbā kharā kaṭukā vedanā vedayiṃsu, etāvaparamaṃ, na'y'ito bhiyyo.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
nayidaṃ

sandhi. not this; this (is) not; it (is) not [na + idaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron, neg
Meaning not this; this (is) not; it (is) not
Construction na + [y] + idaṃ
Phonetic Change +y
Antonym idaṃ
Sanskrit na + idam

ettako ce'pi, bhikkhu, attabhāvapaṭilābho abhavissa nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo, na'y'idaṃ brahmacariyavāso paññāyetha sammā dukkhakkhayāya.

SN 22.96 gomayapiṇḍasuttaṃ

na'y'idaṃ, bhikkhave, brahmacariyaṃ vussati janakuhan'atthaṃ, na janalapan'atthaṃ, na lābhasakkārasilok'ānisaṃs'atthaṃ, na itivāda-ppamokkha-ānisaṃs'atthaṃ, na iti maṃ jano jānātū'ti

AN 4.25 brahmacariyasuttaṃ
nayidha

sandhi. not here; there isn’t; wouldn’t be here [na + idha] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + adv, neg
Meaning not here; there isn’t; wouldn’t be here
Construction na + [y] + idha
Phonetic Change +y
Antonym idha
Sanskrit na + iha

kiṃ nu satto'ti paccesi,
māra diṭṭhigataṃ nu te,
suddhasaṅkhārapuñjo'yaṃ,
na'y'idha satt'upalabbhati.

SN 5.10 vajirāsuttaṃ

na brāhmaṇo aññato suddhim'āha,
diṭṭhe sute sīlavate mute vā,
puññe ca pāpe ca anūpalitto,
attañjaho na'y'idha pakubbamāno.

SNP 42 suddhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 4
nayimaṃ

sandhi. not this; this is not [na + imaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron, neg
Meaning not this; this is not
Construction na + [y] + imaṃ
Phonetic Change +y
Sanskrit na + imam

satta vassāni mettaṃ cittaṃ bhāvesiṃ. satta vassāni mettaṃ cittaṃ bhāvetvā satta saṃvaṭṭavivaṭṭakappe na'y'imaṃ lokaṃ punāgamāsiṃ. saṃvaṭṭamāne sud'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, loke ābhassar'ūpago homi, vivaṭṭamāne loke suññaṃ brahmavimānaṃ upapajjāmi.

AN 7.62 mettasuttaṃ

na kho pana so, sāriputta, saṃsāro sulabharūpo yo mayā asaṃsaritapubbo iminā dīghena addhunā, aññatra suddh'āvāsehi devehi. suddh'āvāse c'āhaṃ, sāriputta, deve saṃsareyyaṃ, na'y'imaṃ lokaṃ punarāgaccheyyaṃ.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
nayime

sandhi. they (do) not [na + ime] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron, neg
Meaning they (do) not
Construction na + [y] + ime
Phonetic Change +y
Sanskrit na + ime

bhaddakā vat'ime sunāparantakā manussā, subhaddakā vat'ime sunāparantakā manussā, yaṃ me na'y'ime pāṇinā pahāraṃ dentī'ti. evam'ettha, bhagavā, bhavissati, evam'ettha, sugata, bhavissatī'ti.

SN 35.88 puṇṇasuttaṃ
nara

masc. man; person ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning man; person
Commentary (NIDD1) naro'ti satto naro mānavo poso puggalo jīvo jāgu jantu indagu manujo.
Sanskrit nara

mātari pitari c'āpi,
yo micchā paṭipajjati,
tathāgate vā sambuddhe,
atha vā tassa sāvake,
bahuñ'ca so pasavati,
apuññaṃ t'ādiso naro.

AN 4.4 dutiyakhatasuttaṃ

taṃ puttapasusammattaṃ,
byāsattamanasaṃ naraṃ,
suttaṃ gāmaṃ mah'ogho'va,
maccu ādāya gacchati.

DHP 287 maggavaggo
naraka 1

masc. pit; chasm ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning pit; chasm
Sanskrit naraka

sace kho tvaṃ, bhikkhu, brahmuno vacanaṃ upātivattissasi ... seyyathā'pi vā pana, bhikkhu, puriso narakappapāte papatanto hatthehi ca pādehi ca pathaviṃ virādheyya, evaṃ sampadam'idaṃ, bhikkhu, tuyhaṃ bhavissati.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ

maraṇāya vā samādapeyyā'ti satthaṃ vā āhara, visaṃ vā khāda, rajjuyā vā ubbandhitvā kālaṅ'karohi, sobbhe vā narake vā papāte vā papatā'ti.

VIN 1.1.3 tatiyapārājikaṃ
naraka 2

masc. hell; place of torment ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning hell; place of torment
Commentary (VINa) narako nāma tattha tattha phalantiyā bhūmiyā sayam'eva nibbattā mahādarī, yattha hatthī'pi patanti, corā'pi nilīnā tiṭṭhanti.
Sanskrit naraka

hitvā icchañ'ca lobhañ'ca,
yattha satto puthujjano,
cakkhumā paṭipajjeyya,
tareyya narakaṃ imaṃ.

najjo yathā naragaṇasaṅghasevitā,
puthū savantī upayanti sāgaraṃ.

ye taṃ namassanti pasaṃsiyā te'ti.

SN 1.34 nasantisuttaṃ
nalāṭa

masc. forehead ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning forehead
Sanskrit lalāṭa, rarāṭa

MN 35 cūḷasaccakasuttaṃ

caṅkamassa anto vā majjhe vā koṭiyaṃ vā rukkhe sati pamādam'āgamma caṅkamantassa nalāṭaṃ vā sīsaṃ vā paṭihaññatī'ti antorukkhatā dutiyo doso.

muṭṭhīhi'pi yujjhanti, raṅgamajjhe'pi saṅghāṭiṃ pattharitvā naccakiṃ evaṃ vadanti, idha, bhagini, naccassū'ti, nalāṭikam'pi denti, vividham'pi anācāraṃ ācaranti.

na chandagū no'pi nivissavādī,
sa vippamutto diṭṭhigatehi dhīro,
na lippati loke anattagarahī.

aṭṭhakavaggo 13

dhi'r'atthu pūraṃ nava sotasandaniṃ.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, gaṇḍo anekavassagaṇiko. tass'assu gaṇḍassa nava vaṇamukhāni nava abhedanamukhāni. tato yaṃ kiñci pagghareyya, asuci'y'eva pagghareyya, duggandhaṃ'y'eva pagghareyya, jegucchiyaṃ'y'eva pagghareyya.

AN 9.15 gaṇḍasuttaṃ
nava 3

masc. (vinaya) newcomer; newbie; new monk; monk of less than five years standing ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning (vinaya) newcomer; newbie; new monk; monk of less than five years standing
Commentary (VINa) thero vā'ti ādīsu vayovuḍḍh'ādīsu yo vā so vā hotu, paripuṇṇadasavassatāya thero vā ūnapañcavassatāya navo vā atirekapañcavassatāya majjhimo vā'ti attho. (SNa) navo'ti aparipuṇṇapañcavasso hi bhikkhu navo nāma hoti, pañcavassato paṭṭhāya majjhimo, dasavassato paṭṭhāya thero.
Sanskrit nava

na ca bāhulikā, na sāthalikā okkamane nikkhittadhurā paviveke pubbaṅ'gamā'ti, iminā tatiyena ṭhānena navā bhikkhū pāsaṃsā bhavanti

MN 3 dhammadāyādasuttaṃ

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme. tena kho pana samayena aññataro navo bhikkhu ativelaṃ kulāni upasaṅkamati.

Commentary (ANa) navasassānī'ti aggasassāni.
Sanskrit navasasya

āgantukassa dānaṃ deti, gamikassa dānaṃ deti, gilānassa dānaṃ deti, dubbhikkhe dānaṃ deti, yāni tāni navasassāni navaphalāni tāni paṭhamaṃ sīlavantesu patiṭṭhāpeti.

Construction √nhā > nahā + ta + ka
nahāta + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Phonetic Change nhā > nahā (expansion)
Notes (MW) m. one who has bathed or performed ablutions (i.e. a Brahman who, after performing the ceremonial lustrations required on his finishing his studentship as a brahma-cārin under a religious teacher, returns home and begins the second period of his life as a gṛha-stha
Sanskrit snātaka
Sanskrit Root √snā 2, 4 (bathe)

ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu samaṇo iti'pi brāhmaṇo iti'pi nahātako iti'pi vedagū iti'pi sottiyo iti'pi ariyo iti'pi arahaṃ iti'pi

Sanskrit naḷa + setu

yo mānam'udabbadhī asesaṃ,
naḷasetuṃ'va sudubbalaṃ mah'ogho,
so bhikkhu jahāti orapāraṃ,
urago jiṇṇam'iva tacaṃ purāṇaṃ.

SNP 1 uragasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 1
naḷāgāra

nt. reed hut; grass house [naḷa + agāra] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning reed hut; grass house
Construction naḷa + agāra
Compound kammadhāraya (naḷa + agāra)
Sanskrit naḷa + agāra

ārabbhatha nikkhamatha,
yuñjatha buddhasāsane,
dhunātha maccuno senaṃ,
naḷ'āgāraṃ'va kuñjaro.

SN 6.14 aruṇavatīsuttaṃ
naḷerupucimandamūla

Meaning foot of Naḷeru's neem tree
Construction naḷeru + pucimanda + mūla
Commentary (VINa) naḷerupucimandamūle'ti ettha naḷeru nāma yakkho, pucimando'ti nimbarukkho, mūlan'ti samīpaṃ.
naḷorāja

masc. name of a demigod; lit. king Naḷa [naḷo + rāja] ~

Grammar masc, comp, atta group
Meaning name of a demigod; lit. king Naḷa
Construction naḷo + rāja
naṃ

pron. him; her; it; one; that [ta + aṃ] ✓

Grammar pron, masc fem and nt acc sg of ta
Meaning him; her; it; one; that
Construction ta > na + aṃ
Variant taṃ
Sanskrit tam

manopubbaṅ'gamā dhammā,
manoseṭṭhā manomayā,
manasā ce paduṭṭhena,
bhāsati vā karoti vā,
tato naṃ dukkham'anveti,
cakkaṃva vahato padaṃ.

DHP 1 yamakavaggo

akiñcanaṃ anādānaṃ,
etaṃ dīpaṃ anāparaṃ,
nibbānaṃ iti naṃ brūmi,
jarāmaccuparikkhayaṃ.

SNP 65 kappa māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 10
nā

cs. (gram) nā; conjugational sign of group 5 kiyādigaṇa verbs ✓

Grammar cs, masc
Meaning (gram) nā; conjugational sign of group 5 kiyādigaṇa verbs
Sanskrit ṇā

449, 513. kiyādito nā.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 449
nāka

masc. heaven ✗
nākaṅkhati

pr. (+acc) does not wish (for); does not want; does not desire; does not aspire (for) [na + ā + √kaṅkh + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, from na ākaṅkhati, neg, trans (+acc)
Meaning does not wish (for); does not want; does not desire; does not aspire (for)
Root Family ā √kaṅkh
Root √kaṅkh･1 a (wish for)
Base √kaṅkh + a > kaṅkha
Construction na + ā + kaṅkha + ti
na + ākaṅkhati
Sanskrit na + ākāṅkṣati
Sanskrit Root √kāṅkṣ 1 (desire)

ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu vasī vitakkapariyāyapathesu. yaṃ vitakkaṃ ākaṅkhissati taṃ vitakkaṃ vitakkessati, yaṃ vitakkaṃ n'ākaṅkhissati na taṃ vitakkaṃ vitakkessati.

MN 20 vitakkasaṇṭhānasuttaṃ
nākaramha

aor. (+acc) we did not do; we did not make [na + a + √kar + amha] ✓

Grammar aor 1st pl of na akari, irreg, neg, trans (+acc)
Meaning we did not do; we did not make
Root Family √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Construction na + a + √kar + amha
na + akaramha
Notes standard form is nākarimha
Sanskrit na + akṛma
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

kiṃ pana tumhe, āvuso nigaṇṭhā, jānātha, akaramh'eva mayaṃ pubbe pāpakammaṃ na n'ākaramhā'ti? no h'idaṃ, āvuso.

MN 14 cūḷadukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ
nākāsi

aor. (+acc) did not do; did not perform [na + a + √kar + si] ~

Grammar aor of na karoti, neg, trans (+acc)
Meaning did not do; did not perform
Root Family √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Construction na + a + √kar > kā + si
na + akāsi
Phonetic Change kar > kā (Kacc 491, 523)
Antonym akāsi
Sanskrit na + akārṣīt
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)
nākusala

nt. not unbeneficial actions; not unskilful deeds [na + na + kusala] ✓

Grammar nt, from na kusala, neg x2
Meaning not unbeneficial actions; not unskilful deeds
Construction na + na + kusala
Compound kammadhāraya (na + akusala)
Antonym akusala
Sanskrit na + akuśala

vāc'ānurakkhī manasā susaṃvuto,
kāyena ca n'ākusalaṃ kayirā,
ete tayo kammapathe visodhaye,
ārādhaye maggam'isippaveditaṃ.

DHP 281 maggavaggo
nāga 1

masc. noble person; great man; epithet of an arahant; epithet of the Buddha ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning noble person; great man; epithet of an arahant; epithet of the Buddha
Commentary (ANa) ayañ'hi na āguṃ karotī'ti iminā atthena nāgo. (NIDD1) nāgo'ti āguṃ na karotī'ti nāgo, na gacchatī'ti nāgo, n'āgacchatī'ti nāgo.
Sanskrit nāga

api ca, udāyi, yo sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya āguṃ na karoti kāyena vācāya manasā, tam'ahaṃ nāgo'ti brūmī'ti.

AN 6.43 nāgasuttaṃ

okañ'jahaṃ taṇhacchidaṃ anejaṃ,
nandiñ'jahaṃ oghatiṇṇaṃ vimuttaṃ,
kappañ'jahaṃ abhiyāce sumedhaṃ,
sutvāna nāgassa apanamissanti ito.

pārāyanavaggo 12

nāgo pasārayī pādaṃ,
puriso nāgam'āruhi.

THI 32 dantikātherīgāthā

seyyathā'pi, rāhula, rañño nāgo īsādanto urūḷhavā abhijāto saṅgām'āvacaro saṅgāmagato purimehi'pi pādehi kammaṃ karoti, pacchimehi'pi pādehi kammaṃ karoti

MN 61 ambalaṭṭhika rāhulovādasuttaṃ
nāga 3

masc. snake; serpent; cobra ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning snake; serpent; cobra
Commentary (MNa) nāgan'ti sumanapupphakalāpasadisaṃ mahāphaṇaṃ tividhasovatthikaparikkhittaṃ ahināgaṃ addasa.
Sanskrit nāga

brāhmaṇo evam'āha, ukkhipa maṃsapesiṃ, abhikkhaṇa, sumedha, satthaṃ ādāyā'ti. abhikkhaṇanto sumedho satthaṃ ādāya addasa nāgaṃ. nāgo, bhadante'ti.

MN 23 vammikasuttaṃ

uragam'pi kho, udāyi, mahantaṃ brahantaṃ kāy'upapannaṃ jano disvā evam'āha, nāgo vata, bho, nāgo'ti!

citrā supaṇṇā iti tesa nāmaṃ.

AN 6.43 nāgasuttaṃ
nāgacchati

pr. (+acc) does not arrive (at); does not return (to) [na + ā + √gam + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, from na āgacchati, neg, trans (+acc)
Meaning does not arrive (at); does not return (to)
Root Family ā √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Base √gam + a > gama > gaccha (irreg)
Construction na + ā + gaccha + ti
na + āgacchati
Antonym āgacchati
Variant na gacchati
Sanskrit na + āgacchati
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

sa ve bhūtapariñño,
so vītataṇho bhav'ābhave,
bhūtassa vibhavā bhikkhu,
n'āgacchati punabbhavan'ti.

ITI 49 diṭṭhigatasuttaṃ

avijjā h'āyaṃ mahāmoho,
yen'idaṃ saṃsitaṃ ciraṃ,
vijjāgatā ca ye sattā,
n'āgacchanti punabbhavan'ti.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ
nāgata

masc. future; lit. not come [na + ā + √gam + ta] ✓

Grammar masc, pp of na āgacchati, neg
Meaning future; lit. not come
Root Family ā √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction na + ā + √gam + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change mt > t
Compound kammadhāraya (na + āgata)
Antonym atīta, āgata
Synonym anāgataṃsa, aparanta
Variant anāgata
Commentary (SNa) nappajappanti n'āgatan'ti ... anāgataṃ na patthenti.
Sanskrit anāgata
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

atītaṃ n'ānusocanti,
nappajappanti n'āgataṃ,
paccuppannena yāpenti,
tena vaṇṇo pasīdati.

esaṃ kho pana, bhikkhu, caturāsītiyā nāgasahassānaṃ eko'y'eva so nāgo hoti yam'ahaṃ tena samayena abhiruhāmi, uposatho nāgarājā.

DHP 324 nāgavaggo

seyyathā'pi, bho, kusalo nāgavaniko nāgavanaṃ paviseyya. so passeyya nāgavane mahantaṃ hatthipadaṃ, dīghato ca āyataṃ, tiriyañ'ca vitthataṃ.

Meaning name of a monk
Commentary (MNa) nāgasamālo'ti tassa therassa nāmaṃ. paṭhamabodhiyañ'hi vīsativass'abbhantare upavānanāgitameghiyattherā viya ayam'pi bhagavato upaṭṭhāko ahosi.

tena kho pana samayena āyasmā nāgasamālo bhagavato piṭṭhito ṭhito hoti bhagavantaṃ bījayamāno.

nāgahata

nāgāpalokita

nt. looking around like an elephant; turning the whole body not just the head; lit. elephant turned around [nāga + apalokita] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning looking around like an elephant; turning the whole body not just the head; lit. elephant turned around
Construction nāga + apalokita
Commentary (DNt) nāg'āpalokitan'ti nāgassa viya apalokitaṃ, hatthināgassa apalokanasadisaṃ apalokanan'ti attho.
nāgāpalokitaṃ

ind. looking around like an elephant; turning the whole body not just the head; lit. elephant looked away [nāga + apalokita + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, acc sg of nāgāpalokita
Meaning looking around like an elephant; turning the whole body not just the head; lit. elephant looked away
Construction nāga + apalokita + aṃ
nāgāpalokita + aṃ
Compound abyayībhāva (nāga + apalokitaṃ)
Commentary (MNa) nāg'āpalokitaṃ apalokesī'ti pahārasaddaṃ sutvā yathā nāma hatthināgo ito vā etto vā apaloketu'kāmo gīvaṃ aparivattetvā sakalasarīren'eva nivattitvā apaloketi. evaṃ sakalasarīren'eva nivattitvā apalokesi.
Sanskrit nāga + avalokita

atha kho, pāpima, kakusandho bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho nāg'āpalokitaṃ apalokesi, na v'āyaṃ dūsī māro mattam'aññāsī'ti. sah'āpalokanāya ca pana, pāpima, dūsī māro tamhā ca ṭhānā cavi mahānirayañ'ca upapajji.
