Commentary (MNa) nāg'āvāsasate'ti nāgamaṇḍalasatāni.
Notes see SCPN §10 (Eastern Forms)
Sanskrit nāga + āvāsa + satam

ek'ūnapaññāsa ājīvakasate, ek'ūnapaññāsa paribbājakasate, ek'ūnapaññāsa nāg'āvāsasate, vīse indriyasate, tiṃse nirayasate, chattiṃsa rajodhātuyo, satta saññīgabbhā, satta asaññīgabbhā, satta nigaṇṭhigabbhā, satta devā

MN 76 sandakasuttaṃ
nāgita

masc. name of the Buddha's attendant for some time ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning name of the Buddha's attendant for some time

tena kho pana samayena āyasmā nāgito bhagavato upaṭṭhāko hoti. atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ nāgitaṃ āmantesi, ke pana kho, nāgita, uccāsaddamahāsaddā, kevaṭṭā maññe macchavilope'ti?

AN 5.30 nāgitasuttaṃ
nāgitattheragāthā

fem. Theragāthā 86 (TH86) ✗
nāgitasutta 1

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.30 (AN5.30) ✗
nāgitasutta 2

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 6.42 (AN6.42) ✗
nāgī

fem. female snake; female nāga-snake ✗
nāgghati

pr. (+acc) is not worth [na + √aggh + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, from na agghati, neg, trans (+acc)
Meaning is not worth
Root Family √aggh
Root √aggh･1 a (be worth)
Base √aggh + a > aggha
Construction na + aggha + ti
na + agghati
Antonym agghati
Sanskrit na + arghati
Sanskrit Root √argh √arh 1 (be worth)

vipassamāno jānāti,
ubho bhoge sumedhaso,
anavajjasukhass'etaṃ,
kalaṃ n'āgghati soḷasin'ti.

AN 4.62 ānaṇyasuttaṃ

ārāmacetyā vanacetyā,
pokkharañño sunimmitā,
manussarāmaṇeyyassa,
kalaṃ n'āgghanti soḷasiṃ.

SN 11.15 rāmaṇeyyakasuttaṃ
nāccayati

pr. (+acc) (of time) does not pass quickly; does not fly past [na + ati + √i + a + ti] ~

Grammar pr, from na accayati, neg, trans (+acc)
Meaning (of time) does not pass quickly; does not fly past
Root Family ati √i
Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Base √i + a > aya
Construction na + ati + aya + ti
na + accayati
Antonym accayati
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)
nāccasārī

adj. not gone over the limit; who does not overshoot; not overreached [na + ati + a + √sar + *ī] ✓

Grammar adj, from na atisarati, neg
Meaning not gone over the limit; who does not overshoot; not overreached
Root Family ati √sar
Root √sar･1 a (go, flow)
Construction na + ati + a + √sar > sār + *ī
Derivative kita (*ī)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Compound kammadhāraya (na + accasārī)
Antonym accasārī
Commentary (SNPa) yo nāccasārī'ti yo nātidhāvi.
Sanskrit na + atisārin
Sanskrit Root √sṛ 1, 3 (flow)

yo n'āccasārī na paccasārī,
sabbaṃ accagamā imaṃ papañcaṃ,
so bhikkhu jahāti orapāraṃ,
urago jiṇṇam'iva tacaṃ purāṇaṃ.

SNP 1 uragasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 1
nāccāsanna

adj. not to close; not too nearby [na + ati + ā + √sad + na] ✓

Grammar adj, from na āsanna, neg
Meaning not to close; not too nearby
Root Family ati ā √sad
Root √sad･1 a (sink, sit, settle)
Construction na + ati > aty > acc + ā + √sad + na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change ti > ty > cc
Antonym accāsanna
Sanskrit na + atyāsanna
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)

idha, bhikkhave, sen'āsanaṃ n'ātidūraṃ hoti n'āccāsannaṃ gaman'āgamanasampannaṃ divā appākiṇṇaṃ rattiṃ appasaddaṃ appanigghosaṃ appa-ḍaṃsa-makasa-vāt'ātapa-sarīsapa-samphassaṃ

AN 10.11 senāsanasuttaṃ
nāccāsanne

ind. not too near; not too close-by [na + ati + ā + √sad + na + e] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, loc sg of na accāsanna, neg
Meaning not too near; not too close-by
Root Family ati ā √sad
Root √sad･1 a (sink, sit, settle)
Construction na + ati + ā + √sad + na + e
na + accāsanna + e
Phonetic Change ti > ty > cc
d > n
Antonym nātidūre
Sanskrit na + atyāsanna
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)

gacchanto kho pana so bhavaṃ gotamo dakkhiṇen'eva pādena paṭhamaṃ pakkamati. so n'ātidūre pādaṃ uddharati, n'āccāsanne pādaṃ nikkhipati, so n'ātisīghaṃ gacchati, n'ātisaṇikaṃ gacchati

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

so n'ātidūre n'āccāsanne āsanassa parivattati, na ca pāṇinā ālambitvā āsane nisīdati, na ca āsanasmiṃ kāyaṃ pakkhipati.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
nāccuṇha

adj. not too hot [na + ati + √us + ṇhā + a] ✓

Grammar adj, neg
Meaning not too hot
Root Family ati √us
Root √us×6 ṇhā (be hot)
Base √us + ṇhā > uṇhā
Construction na + ati + uṇhā + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change ti > ty > cc
Compound kammadhāraya (na + accuṇha)
Antonym accuṇha
Sanskrit na + atyuṣṇa
Sanskrit Root √uṣ 1, 9 (burn)

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu app'ābādho hoti app'ātaṅko, samavepākiniyā gahaṇiyā samannāgato n'ātisītāya n'āccuṇhāya majjhimāya padhānakkhamāya. ayaṃ, bhikkhave, dutiyo samayo padhānāya.

AN 5.54 samayasuttaṃ
nāccogāḷhaṃ

ind. not too much; not too extravagantly; lit. not too deep [na + ati + ava + √gāh + ta + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, acc sg of na accogāḷha, neg
Meaning not too much; not too extravagantly; lit. not too deep
Root Family ati ava √gāh
Root √gāh･1 a (dive, plunge)
√ In Comps gāh or ggāh
Construction na + ati + ava + √gāh + ta > gāḍha > gāḷha + aṃ
nāccogāḷha + aṃ
Phonetic Change t > ḍ > ḷ
Antonym nātihīnaṃ
Commentary (ANa) n'āccogāḷhan'ti n'ātimahantaṃ.
Sanskrit na + ati + avagāḍha
Sanskrit Root √gāh 1 (plunge)

idha, byagghapajja, kulaputto āyañ'ca bhogānaṃ viditvā, vayañ'ca bhogānaṃ viditvā, samaṃ jīvikaṃ kappeti n'āccogāḷhaṃ n'ātihīnaṃ, evaṃ me āyo vayaṃ pariyādāya ṭhassati, na ca me vayo āyaṃ pariyādāya ṭhassatī'ti.

AN 8.54 dīghajāṇusuttaṃ
nāccodāta

adj. not too light; not too fair-skinned [na + ati + ava + √dā + ta] ✓

Meaning not too light; not too fair-skinned

Root √dā･3 ya (be pure, clean)
Construction na + ati > aty > acc + ava + √dā + ta

ava > o
Compound kammadhāraya (na + accodāta)
Sanskrit na + ati + avadāta
Sanskrit Root √dai √dā 4 (clear)

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, khattiyakaññā vā brāhmaṇakaññā vā gahapatikaññā vā pannarasavass'uddesikā vā soḷasavass'uddesikā vā, n'ātidīghā n'ātirassā n'ātikisā n'ātithūlā n'ātikāḷī n'āccodātā paramā sā, bhikkhave, tasmiṃ samaye subhā vaṇṇanibhā'ti?

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ
nājīvikāpakata

adj. not having difficulty earning a living ✗
nājjhagamā 1

imperf. (+acc) did not discover; did not find; lit. did not arrived at [na + adhi + a + √gam + ā] ✓

Grammar imperf of na adhigacchati, neg, trans (+acc)
Meaning did not discover; did not find; lit. did not arrived at
Root Family adhi √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction na + adhi > adhy > ajjh + a + √gam + ā
Antonym ajjhagamā
Commentary (SNa) n'ājjhagamun'ti na adhigacchanti na vindanti na passanti. vattamān'atthe atītavacanaṃ.
Sanskrit na + adhigam
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

yo n'ājjhagamā bhavesu sāraṃ,
vicinaṃ puppham'iva udumbaresu,
so bhikkhu jahāti orapāraṃ,
urago jiṇṇam'iva tacaṃ purāṇaṃ.

SNP 1 uragasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 1

pahāsi saṅkhaṃ na vimānam'ajjhagā,
acchecchi taṇhaṃ idha nāmarūpe,
taṃ chinnaganthaṃ anighaṃ nirāsaṃ,
pariyesamānā n'ājjhagamuṃ,
devā manussā idha vā huraṃ vā,
saggesu vā sabbanivesanesu.

SN 1.20 samiddhisuttaṃ
nājjhagamā 2

imperf. (+acc) did not attain; did not obtain; lit. did not arrived at [na + adhi + a + √gam + ā] ✓

Grammar imperf of na adhigacchati, neg, trans (+acc)
Meaning did not attain; did not obtain; lit. did not arrived at
Root Family adhi √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction na + adhi > adhy > ajjh + a + √gam + ā
Antonym ajjhagamā
Commentary (MNa) n'ājjhagaman'ti ... na paṭilabhiṃ.
Sanskrit na + adhigam
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

evam'etaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya sudiṭṭhaṃ hoti, so ca aññatr'eva kāmehi aññatra akusalehi dhammehi pītisukhaṃ n'ājjhagamaṃ, aññaṃ vā tato santataraṃ, atha khv'āhaṃ n'eva tāva anāvaṭṭī kāmesu paccaññāsiṃ.

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ

tāya'pi kho tvaṃ, āvuso gotama, iriyāya tāya paṭipadāya tāya dukkarakārikāya n'ājjhagamā uttarimanussadhammā alam'ariyañāṇadassanavisesaṃ, kiṃ pana tvaṃ etarahi bāhulliko padhānavibbhanto āvatto bāhullāya adhigamissasi uttarimanussadhammā alam'ariyañāṇadassanavisesan'ti?

nājjhagā

imperf. (+acc) did not get; did not obtain [adhi + √gam] ✗

Meaning does not fret; does not worry; is not anxious

Root √jhā･3 ya (think, meditate)
√ In Comps jjhā

Construction na + ā + jhe + ti
na + ajjheti
Antonym ajjheti

Sanskrit Root √dhyai √dhyā 2, 4 (think)

yo'dha kāme accatari,
saṅgaṃ loke duraccayaṃ,
na so socati n'ājjheti,
chinnasoto abandhano.

SNP 53 attadaṇḍasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 15
nājjhosa

ger. (+acc) not clinging; not fixating; not holding tightly [na + adhi + ava + √sā + ya] ✓

Grammar ger of na ajjhosati, neg, trans (+acc)
Meaning not clinging; not fixating; not holding tightly
Root Family adhi ava √sā
Root √sā･1 a (complete, accomplish)
Construction na + adhi + ava + √sā + ya
na + ajjhosaya > nājjhosa
Phonetic Change ava > o
Antonym ajjhosa
Variant nājjhosāya
Sanskrit na + adhyavasāya
Sanskrit Root √so 4 (destroy, kill, finish)

na so rajjati rūpesu,
rūpaṃ disvā paṭissato,
virattacitto vedeti,
tañ'ca n'ājjhosa tiṭṭhati.

SN 35.95 mālukyaputtasuttaṃ
nājjhosāya

ger. (+acc) not clinging; not fixating; not holding tightly [na + adhi + ava + √sā + ya] ✓

Grammar ger of na ajjhosati, neg, trans (+acc)
Meaning not clinging; not fixating; not holding tightly
Root Family adhi ava √sā
Root √sā･1 a (complete, accomplish)
Construction na + adhi + ava + √sā + ya
na + ajjhosāya
Phonetic Change ava > o
Antonym ajjhosāya
Variant nājjhosa, anajjhosāya
Sanskrit na + adhyavasāya
Sanskrit Root √so 4 (destroy, kill, finish)

rasañ'ca bhotvāna asāditañ'ca sāduṃ,
atho'pi bhotvāna asādum'ekadā,
sāduṃ rasaṃ n'ājjhosāya bhuñje,
virodham'āsādusu n'opadaṃsaye.

SN 35.94 adantāguttasuttaṃ

tañ'ce bhikkhu n'ābhinandati n'ābhivadati n'ājjhosāya tiṭṭhati, tassa taṃ anabhinandato anabhivadato anajjhosāya tiṭṭhato nirujjhati nandī. nandinirodhā dukkhanirodho, puṇṇā'ti vadāmi

SN 35.88 puṇṇasuttaṃ
nāñña 1

pron. not another; not different; not someone else; not somewhere else [na + añña] ✓

Grammar pron, from na añña, neg
Meaning not another; not different; not someone else; not somewhere else
Construction na + añña
Compound kammadhāraya (na + añña)
Antonym añña
Sanskrit na + anya

attanā hi kataṃ pāpaṃ,
attanā saṃkilissati,
attanā akataṃ pāpaṃ,
attanā'va visujjhati,
suddhī asuddhi paccattaṃ,
n'āñño aññaṃ visodhaye.

DHP 165 attavaggo

idh'eva suddhi iti vādayanti,
n'āññesu dhammesu visuddhim'āhu,
yaṃ nissitā tattha subhaṃ vadānā,
paccekasaccesu puthū niviṭṭhā.

SNP 46 pasūrasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 8
nāñña 2

dukkham'eva hi sambhoti,
dukkhaṃ tiṭṭhati veti ca,
n'āññatra dukkhā sambhoti,
n'āññaṃ dukkhā nirujjhatī'ti.

sabbhi'r'eva samāsetha,
sabbhi kubbetha santhavaṃ,
sataṃ saddhammam'aññāya,
paññā labbhati n'āññato'ti.

SN 1.31 sabbhisuttaṃ
nāññatra

dukkham'eva hi sambhoti,

n'āññatra dukkhā sambhoti,
n'āññaṃ dukkhā nirujjhatī'ti.

SN 5.10 vajirāsuttaṃ

na aññatra bhagavatā,
n'āññatra tava sāsanā,
yassa te dhammam'aññāya,
acchiduṃ bhavabandhanaṃ.

ayam'pi kho nigaṇṭho nāṭaputto saṅghī c'eva gaṇī ca gaṇ'ācariyo ca ñāto yasassī titthakaro sādhusammato bahujanassa.

nt. drama [√naṭ] ✗
nāṭikā

fem. dancing girl [√naṭ] ✗

AN 3.101 loṇakapallasuttaṃ
nātaputta

masc. family names of Mahavira; leader of the Jains; lit. son of the dance [nāta + putta] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning family names of Mahavira; leader of the Jains; lit. son of the dance
Construction nāta + putta
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (nātassa + putta)
Variant nāthaputta, nāṭaputta
Sanskrit nāṭa + putra

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā nāḷandāyaṃ viharati pāvārikambavane. tena kho pana samayena nigaṇṭho nātaputto nāḷandāyaṃ paṭivasati mahatiyā nigaṇṭhaparisāya saddhiṃ.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
nātika

masc. name of a village ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning name of a village
Variant nādika
Commentary (MNa) nātike viharatī'ti nātikā nāma ekaṃ taḷākaṃ nissāya dvinnaṃ cūḷapitimahāpitiputtānaṃ dve gāmā, tesu ekasmiṃ gāme. (ANa) nātike'ti evaṃnāmake gāme.

ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā nātike viharati giñjak'āvasathe. atha kho āyasmā saddho yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdi.

AN 11.9 saddhasuttaṃ

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā nātike viharati giñjak'āvasathe. tena kho pana samayena āyasmā ca anuruddho āyasmā ca nandiyo āyasmā ca kimilo gosiṅgasālavanadāye viharanti.

MN 31 cūḷagosiṅgasuttaṃ
nātikaḍḍhati

pr. does not over-react; does not get angry; lit. does not drag too far [na + ati + √kaḍḍh + a + ti] ~

Grammar pr, from na atikaḍḍhati, neg, intrans
Meaning does not over-react; does not get angry; lit. does not drag too far
Root Family ati √kaḍḍh
Root √kaḍḍh･1 a (drag, plough)
Base √kaḍḍh + a > kaḍḍha
Construction na + ati + kaḍḍha + ti
na + atikaḍḍhati
Antonym atikaḍḍhati
Commentary (VINa) n'ātikaḍḍheyyāsī'ti yaṃ te mayi pemaṃ patiṭṭhitaṃ, taṃ kodhavasena na atikaḍḍheyyāsi, sace na kujjheyyāsī'ti vuttaṃ hoti.
Sanskrit Root √kṛṣ 1, 6 (drag, plough)
nātikaṇha

adj. not too dark; not too black [na + ati + kaṇha] ~

Grammar adj, from na kaṇha, neg
Meaning not too dark; not too black
Construction na + ati + kaṇha
Compound kammadhāraya (na + atikaṇha)
Antonym atikaṇha
Sanskrit na + atikṛṣṇa
nātikālena

ind. not too early; not very early in the morning [na + ati + √kal + *a + ena] ~

Grammar ind, adv, instr sg of na ati kāla, neg
Meaning not too early; not very early in the morning
Root Family ati √kal
Root √kal×8 *e (spend time)
Construction na + ati + √kal > kāl + *a + ena
nātikāla + ena
Sanskrit na + atikalyam
Sanskrit Root √kal 10 (drive, produce)
nātikāḷika

adj. not too black; not too dark-skinned [kāḷa] ✗
nātikāḷī

adj. not too black; not too dark-skinned [na + ati + kāḷī] ✓

Grammar adj, from na kāḷī, neg
Meaning not too black; not too dark-skinned
Construction na + ati + kāḷī
Compound kammadhāraya (na + atikāḷī)
Sanskrit na + ati + kālī

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, khattiyakaññā vā brāhmaṇakaññā vā gahapatikaññā vā pannarasavass'uddesikā vā soḷasavass'uddesikā vā, n'ātidīghā n'ātirassā n'ātikisā n'ātithūlā n'ātikāḷī n'āccodātā paramā sā, bhikkhave, tasmiṃ samaye subhā vaṇṇanibhā'ti?

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ
nātikiya

adj. living in Nātika; from Nātika [nātika] ✗
nātikisa

adj. not too thin; not too skinny [na + ati + √kis + a] ✓

Grammar adj, from na kisa, neg
Meaning not too thin; not too skinny
Root Family ati √kis
Root √kis×1 a (be thin)
Construction na + ati + √kis + a
Derivative kita (a)
Compound kammadhāraya (na + atikisa)
Sanskrit na + atikṛśa
Sanskrit Root √kṛś 4 (be lean)

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, khattiyakaññā vā brāhmaṇakaññā vā gahapatikaññā vā pannarasavass'uddesikā vā soḷasavass'uddesikā vā, n'ātidīghā n'ātirassā n'ātikisā n'ātithūlā n'ātikāḷī n'āccodātā paramā sā, bhikkhave, tasmiṃ samaye subhā vaṇṇanibhā'ti?

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ
nātikkamati 1

pr. (+acc) (of a boundary) does not overstep; does not cross [na + ati + √kam + a + ti] ~

Grammar pr, from na atikkamati, neg, trans (+acc)
Meaning (of a boundary) does not overstep; does not cross
Root Family ati √kam
Root √kam･1 a (go)
√ In Comps kkam
Base √kam + a > kama
Construction na + ati + kama + ti
na + atikkamati
Antonym atikkamati
Sanskrit na + atikramate
Sanskrit Root √kram 1, 4 (stride)
nātikkamati 2

pr. (+acc) (of a rule) does not transgress [na + ati + √kam + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, from na atikkamati, neg, trans (+acc)
Meaning (of a rule) does not transgress
Root Family ati √kam
Root √kam･1 a (go)
√ In Comps kkam
Base √kam + a > kama
Construction na + ati + kama + ti
na + atikkamati
Antonym atikkamati
Sanskrit na + atikramate
Sanskrit Root √kram 1, 4 (stride)

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, yaṃ mayā sāvakānaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ taṃ mama sāvakā jīvitahetu'pi n'ātikkamanti

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ
nātithoka

adj. not too little [na + ati + thoka] ✓

Grammar adj, from na thoka, neg
Meaning not too little
Construction na + ati + thoka
Compound kammadhāraya (na + atithoka)
Antonym nātibahu
Sanskrit na + ati + stoka

so patt'odakaṃ paṭiggaṇhanto na pattaṃ unnāmeti, na pattaṃ onāmeti, na pattaṃ sannāmeti, na pattaṃ vināmeti. so patt'odakaṃ paṭiggaṇhāti n'ātithokaṃ n'ātibahuṃ.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

so odanaṃ paṭiggaṇhanto na pattaṃ unnāmeti, na pattaṃ onāmeti, na pattaṃ sannāmeti, na pattaṃ vināmeti. so odanaṃ paṭiggaṇhāti n'ātithokaṃ n'ātibahuṃ.

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, khattiyakaññā vā brāhmaṇakaññā vā gahapatikaññā vā pannarasavass'uddesikā vā soḷasavass'uddesikā vā, n'ātidīghā n'ātirassā n'ātikisā n'ātithūlā n'ātikāḷī n'āccodātā paramā sā, bhikkhave, tasmiṃ samaye subhā vaṇṇanibhā'ti?

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ
nātidūra

adj. not too far away; not too distant [na + ati + √dū + ra] ✓

Grammar adj, from na dūra, neg
Meaning not too far away; not too distant
Root Family ati √dū
Root √dū×1 a (go, run)
Construction na + ati + √dū + ra
Derivative kita (ra)
Compound kammadhāraya (na + atidūra)
Antonym atidūra
Sanskrit na + atidūra
Sanskrit Root √du 1 (go)

idha, bhikkhave, sen'āsanaṃ n'ātidūraṃ hoti n'āccāsannaṃ gaman'āgamanasampannaṃ divā appākiṇṇaṃ rattiṃ appasaddaṃ appanigghosaṃ appa-ḍaṃsa-makasa-vāt'ātapa-sarīsapa-samphassaṃ

AN 10.11 senāsanasuttaṃ
nātidūre

ind. not too far [na + ati + √dū + ra + e] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, loc sg of na atidūra, neg
Meaning not too far
Root Family ati √dū
Root √dū×1 a (go, run)
Construction na + ati + √dū + ra + e
nātidūra + e
Antonym nāccāsanne
Sanskrit nātidūra
Sanskrit Root √du 1 (go)

gacchanto kho pana so bhavaṃ gotamo dakkhiṇen'eva pādena paṭhamaṃ pakkamati. so n'ātidūre pādaṃ uddharati, n'āccāsanne pādaṃ nikkhipati, so n'ātisīghaṃ gacchati, n'ātisaṇikaṃ gacchati

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

so n'ātidūre n'āccāsanne āsanassa parivattati, na ca pāṇinā ālambitvā āsane nisīdati, na ca āsanasmiṃ kāyaṃ pakkhipati.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
nātidhāvati

pr. (+acc) does not override; does not overturn; does not overstep; lit. does not run past [na + ati + √dhāv + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, from na atidhāvati, neg, trans (+acc)
Meaning does not override; does not overturn; does not overstep; lit. does not run past
Root Family ati √dhāv
Root √dhāv･1 a (run, flow)
Base √dhāv + a > dhāva
Construction na + ati + dhāva + ti
na + atidhāvati
Antonym atidhāvati
Sanskrit na + atidhāvati
Sanskrit Root √dhāv 1 (run)

janapadaniruttiṃ n'ābhiniveseyya, samaññaṃ n'ātidhāveyyā'ti, iti kho pan'etaṃ vuttaṃ. kiñ'c'etaṃ paṭicca vuttaṃ? kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, janapadaniruttiyā ca abhiniveso hoti samaññāya ca atisāro?

MN 139 araṇavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
nātipāteti

na + atipāteti

Sanskrit na + atipātayati
Sanskrit Root √pat 1 (fly, fall)
nātibahu

adj. not too much [na + ati + √bah + u] ✓

Grammar adj, from na bahu, neg
Meaning not too much
Root Family ati √bah
Root √bah×1 a (increase)
Construction na + ati + √bah + u
Derivative kita (u)
Compound kammadhāraya (na + atibahu)
Antonym nātithoka
Sanskrit na + atibahu
Sanskrit Root √bṛh √baṃh 6 (make big or strong)

so patt'odakaṃ paṭiggaṇhanto na pattaṃ unnāmeti, na pattaṃ onāmeti, na pattaṃ sannāmeti, na pattaṃ vināmeti. so patt'odakaṃ paṭiggaṇhāti n'ātithokaṃ n'ātibahuṃ.

so odanaṃ paṭiggaṇhanto na pattaṃ unnāmeti, na pattaṃ onāmeti, na pattaṃ sannāmeti, na pattaṃ vināmeti. so odanaṃ paṭiggaṇhāti n'ātithokaṃ n'ātibahuṃ.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
nātimaññati

pr. (+acc) does not despise; does not scorn; does not look down (on); does not have contempt (for); is not condescending (about); lit. does not think in excess [na + ati + √man + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, from na atimaññati, neg, trans (+acc)
Meaning does not despise; does not scorn; does not look down (on); does not have contempt (for); is not condescending (about); lit. does not think in excess
Root Family ati √man
Root √man･3 ya (think)
Base √man + ya > mañña
Construction na + ati + mañña + ti
na + atimaññati
Phonetic Change ny > ññ
Antonym atimaññati
Sanskrit na + atimanyate
Sanskrit Root √man 3, 4, 8 (think)

na paro paraṃ nikubbetha,
n'ātimaññetha katthaci naṃ kañci,
byārosanā paṭighasaññā,
n'āññam'aññassa dukkham'iccheyya.

KHP 9 karaṇīya mettasuttaṃ

appalābho'pi ce bhikkhu,
salābhaṃ n'ātimaññati,
taṃ ve devā pasaṃsanti,
suddhājīviṃ atanditaṃ.

DHP 366 bhikkhuvaggo
nātimaññitabba

ptp. should not be underestimated; should not be undervalued; lit. not to be thought in excess [na + ati + √man + ya + itabba] ~

Meaning should not be underestimated; should not be undervalued; lit. not to be thought in excess
Root Family ati √man
Root √man･3 ya (think)
Base √man + ya > mañña
Construction na + ati + mañña + itabba
na + atimaññitabba

Phonetic Change ny > ññ
Sanskrit Root √man 3, 4, 8 (think)
nātimahanta

adj. not too big; not overly large; not over-size [na + ati + √mah + a + nta] ✓

Grammar adj, from na mahanta, neg
Meaning not too big; not overly large; not over-size
Root Family ati √mah
Root √mah×1 a (increase)
Base √mah + a > maha
Construction na > a + ati + maha + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Compound kammadhāraya (na + atimahanta)
Antonym atimahanta
Commentary (VINa) n'ātimahanto kabaḷo'ti mayūr'aṇḍaṃ atimahantaṃ, kukkuṭ'aṇḍaṃ atikhuddakaṃ, tesaṃ vemajjhappamāṇo.
Sanskrit na + ati + mahat
Sanskrit Root √mah √maṅh 1, 10 (be great)

n'ātimahantaṃ kabaḷaṃ karissāmī'ti sikkhā karaṇīyā.

VIN PAT SE 39 kabaḷasikkhāpadaṃ

n'ātimahanto kabaḷo kātabbo. yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca mahantaṃ kabaḷaṃ karoti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.

VIN 2.7.4 sakkaccavaggo
nātirassa

Meaning not too short
Construction na + ati + rassa

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, khattiyakaññā vā brāhmaṇakaññā vā gahapatikaññā vā pannarasavass'uddesikā vā soḷasavass'uddesikā vā, n'ātidīghā n'ātirassā n'ātikisā n'ātithūlā n'ātikāḷī n'āccodātā paramā sā, bhikkhave, tasmiṃ samaye subhā vaṇṇanibhā'ti?

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ
nātivattati 1

Antonym ativattati
Sanskrit na + ativartate
Sanskrit Root √vṛt 1 (turn)

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, mahāsamuddo ṭhitadhammo velaṃ n'ātivattati

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ
nātivattati 2

pr. (+acc) does not go beyond; does not escape; does not transcend; does not overcome [na + ati + √vatt + a + ti] ✓

Sanskrit Root √vṛt 1 (turn)

yā evarūpā upekkhā, dhammaṃ sā n'ātivattati. tasmā sā upekkhā gehasitā'ti vuccati. imā cha gehasitā upekkhā.

MN 137 saḷāyatanavibhaṅgasuttaṃ

anissito na calati,
nissito ca upādiyaṃ,
itthabhāv'aññathābhāvaṃ,
saṃsāraṃ n'ātivattati.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ
nātivelaṃ

ind. (of time) concisely; not excessively; not too long; lit. not over the limit [na + ati + velā + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, acc sg of na ativela, neg
Meaning (of time) concisely; not excessively; not too long; lit. not over the limit
Construction na + ati + velā + aṃ
nātivelā + aṃ
Compound abyayībhāva (na + ativelaṃ)
Antonym ativelaṃ
Sanskrit na + ativelam

cudito vacībhi satim'ābhinande,
sabrahmacārīsu khilaṃ pabhinde,
vācaṃ pamuñce kusalaṃ n'ātivelaṃ,
janavādadhammāya na cetayeyya.

SNP 54 sāriputtasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 16
nātisaṇikaṃ

ind. not too slowly [na + ati + saṇika + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, from na saṇikaṃ, neg
Meaning not too slowly
Construction na + ati + saṇika + aṃ
nātisaṇika + aṃ
Antonym nātisīghaṃ
Commentary (MNa) n'ātisaṇikan'ti yathā pacchato āgacchanto okāsaṃ na labhati, evaṃ na atisaṇikaṃ gacchati.
Sanskrit na + ati + śanais

so n'ātidūre pādaṃ uddharati, n'āccāsanne pādaṃ nikkhipati, so n'ātisīghaṃ gacchati, n'ātisaṇikaṃ gacchati, na ca adduvena adduvaṃ saṅghaṭṭento gacchati, na ca gopphakena gopphakaṃ saṅghaṭṭento gacchati.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

so taṃ parisaṃ dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṃsetvā uṭṭhāy'āsanā pakkamati. so n'ātisīghaṃ gacchati, n'ātisaṇikaṃ gacchati, na ca muccitu'kāmo gacchati.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
nātisithila

adj. not too loose; not too slack; not too flat [na + ati + sithila] ✓

Grammar adj, from na sithila, neg
Meaning not too loose; not too slack; not too flat
Construction na + ati + sithila
Compound kammadhāraya (na + atisithila)
Antonym atisithila
Sanskrit na + ati + śithila

yadā pana te, soṇa, vīṇāya tantiyo na accāyatā honti n'ātisithilā same guṇe patiṭṭhitā, api nu te vīṇā tasmiṃ samaye saravatī vā hoti kammaññā vā'ti? evaṃ, bhante.

AN 6.55 soṇasuttaṃ
nātisīghaṃ

ind. not too fast; not too quickly [na + ati + sīgha + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, acc sg of na atisīgha, neg
Meaning not too fast; not too quickly
Construction na + ati + sīgha + aṃ
nātisīgha + aṃ
Antonym nātisaṇikaṃ
Commentary (MNa) n'ātisīghan'ti divā vihārabhattatthāya gacchanto bhikkhu viya na atisīghaṃ gacchati.
Sanskrit na + ati + śīghram

so n'ātidūre pādaṃ uddharati, n'āccāsanne pādaṃ nikkhipati, so n'ātisīghaṃ gacchati, n'ātisaṇikaṃ gacchati, na ca adduvena adduvaṃ saṅghaṭṭento gacchati, na ca gopphakena gopphakaṃ saṅghaṭṭento gacchati.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

so taṃ parisaṃ dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṃsetvā uṭṭhāy'āsanā pakkamati. so n'ātisīghaṃ gacchati, n'ātisaṇikaṃ gacchati, na ca muccitu'kāmo gacchati.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
nātisīta

adj. not too cold [na + ati + √sid + *a] ✓

Grammar adj, neg
Meaning not too cold
Root Family ati √sid
Root √sid×1 a (be cool)
Construction na + ati + √sid > sit > sīt + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > ī
Compound kammadhāraya (na + atisīta)
Antonym nāccuṇha, atisīta
Sanskrit nātiśīta
Sanskrit Root √śyai √śyā 1 (congeal, freeze)

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu app'ābādho hoti app'ātaṅko, samavepākiniyā gahaṇiyā samannāgato n'ātisītāya n'āccuṇhāya majjhimāya padhānakkhamāya. ayaṃ, bhikkhave, dutiyo samayo padhānāya.

AN 5.54 samayasuttaṃ
nātihīnaṃ

ind. not too little; not too frugal; lit. not too low [na + ati + √hā + na + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, acc sg of na atihīna, neg
Meaning not too little; not too frugal; lit. not too low
Root Family ati √hā
Root √hā･3 ya (decrease)
Construction na + ati + √hā > hī + na + aṃ
nātihīna + aṃ
Phonetic Change ā > ī (Kacc 502, 493)
Antonym nāccogāḷhaṃ
Commentary (ANa) nātihīnan'ti n'ātikasiraṃ.
Sanskrit na + ati + hīna
Sanskrit Root √hā 1, 3 (leave)

idha, byagghapajja, kulaputto āyañ'ca bhogānaṃ viditvā, vayañ'ca bhogānaṃ viditvā, samaṃ jīvikaṃ kappeti n'āccogāḷhaṃ n'ātihīnaṃ, evaṃ me āyo vayaṃ pariyādāya ṭhassati, na ca me vayo āyaṃ pariyādāya ṭhassatī'ti.

AN 8.54 dīghajāṇusuttaṃ
nāttaparitāpanānuyogamanuyutta

adj. not devoted to the practice of harming oneself [na + atta + paritāpana + anuyogaṃ + anuyutta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, neg
Meaning not devoted to the practice of harming oneself
Construction na + atta + paritāpana + anuyogaṃ + anuyutta
Compound kammadhāraya (na + attaparitāpanānuyogamanuyutta)
Antonym attaparitāpanānuyogamanuyutta
Sanskrit na + ātaman + paritāpana (bsk) + anuyoga + anuyukta

kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, puggalo n'ev'attan'tapo hoti n'āttaparitāpan'ānuyogam'anuyutto na paran'tapo na paraparitāpan'ānuyogam'anuyutto?

AN 4.198 attantapasuttaṃ

yo ca kho ayaṃ, bhante, puggalo n'ev'attan'tapo n'āttaparitāpan'ānuyogam'anuyutto na parantapo na paraparitāpan'ānuyogam'anuyutto ... ayam'eva me puggalo cittaṃ ārādhetī'ti.

MN 51 kandarakasuttaṃ
nātha

masc. protector; lord; refuge [√nāth + a] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from nāthati
Meaning protector; lord; refuge
Root Family √nāth
Root √nāth×1 a (have power, protect)
Construction √nāth + a
Derivative kita (a)
Antonym anātha
Sanskrit nātha
Sanskrit Root √nāth 1 (seek aid)

attā hi attano nātho,
ko hi nātho paro siyā,
attanā hi sudantena,
nāthaṃ labhati dullabhaṃ.

DHP 160 attavaggo

vandanaṃ dāni vajjāsi,
lokanāthaṃ anuttaraṃ,
padakkhiṇañ'ca katvāna,
ādiseyyāsi dakkhiṇaṃ.

THI 68 ekudāniyattheragāthā
nāthakaraṇa

adj. producing a support, making for protection ✗
nāthakaraṇādhammā

Meaning things which serve as protectors; matters which provide refuge
Construction nāthakaraṇā + dhamma + ā
nāthakaraṇādhamma + ā
nāthaputta

Meaning family name of Mahavira; leader of the Jains; lit. son of the lord
Construction nātha + putta

Variant nāṭaputta, nātaputta
Sanskrit nātha + putra

tena kho pana samayena nigaṇṭho nāthaputto nāḷandāyaṃ paṭivasati mahatiyā nigaṇṭhaparisāya saddhiṃ.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
nāthavagga

masc. Chapter 2 of Dasakanipāta, Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.11-20 ✗

dasabalasamannāgato, bhikkhave, tathāgato catūhi ca vesārajjehi samannāgato āsabhaṃ ṭhānaṃ paṭijānāti, parisāsu sīhanādaṃ nadati, brahmacakkaṃ pavatteti

nādika

masc. name of a village ✓

Meaning name of a village

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā nādike viharati giñjak'āvasathe. tena kho pana samayena āyasmā ca anuruddho āyasmā ca nandiyo āyasmā ca kimilo gosiṅgasālavanadāye viharanti.

MN 31 cūḷagosiṅgasuttaṃ
nādinna 1

Phonetic Change ā > ī (Kacc 502, 493)
īn > inn
Compound kammadhāraya (na + adinna)
Antonym adinna
Sanskrit na + adatta
Sanskrit Root √dā 3 (give)

adinn'ādānaṃ pahāya adinn'ādānā paṭivirato hoti. yaṃ taṃ parassa paravittūpakaraṇaṃ, gāmagataṃ vā araññagataṃ vā, taṃ n'ādinnaṃ theyyasaṅkhātaṃ ādātā hoti.

MN 41 sāleyyakasuttaṃ
nādinna 2

Root Family √dā
Root √dā･1 a (give)

Sanskrit Root √dā 3 (give)

dinnaṃ sukhaphalaṃ hoti,
n'ādinnaṃ hoti taṃ tathā,
corā haranti rājāno,
aggi ḍahati nassati.

SN 1.41 ādittasuttaṃ
nādibrahmacariyaka

adj. not fundamental to the holy life; not essential to the spiritual path [na + ādi + brahma + cariya + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, from ādibrahmacariya, neg
Meaning not fundamental to the holy life; not essential to the spiritual path

nādibrahmacariya + ka

Compound kammadhāraya (na + ādibrahmacariyaka)
Antonym ādibrahmacariyaka
Variant nādibrahmacariyika
Sanskrit na + ādi + brahmacarya + ka

kasmā pan'etaṃ, bhante, bhagavatā abyākatan'ti? na h'etaṃ, poṭṭhapāda, atthasaṃhitaṃ na dhammasaṃhitaṃ n'ādibrahmacariyakaṃ

DN 9.4 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, saññāattakathā

taṃ kissa hetu? n'esā, bhikkhave, kathā atthasaṃhitā n'ādibrahmacariyakā na nibbidāya na virāgāya na nirodhāya na upasamāya na abhiññāya na sambodhāya na nibbānāya saṃvattati.

SN 56.9 viggāhikakathāsuttaṃ
nādiyati

pr. (+acc) does not take; does not steal [na + √ādā + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, from na ādiyati, neg, trans (+acc)
Meaning does not take; does not steal
Root Family √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Base √ādā + ya > ādāya > ādiya (irreg)
Construction na + ādiya + ti
na + ādiyati
Phonetic Change ā > i (Kacc 502, 493)
Antonym ādiyati
Variant nādeti
Sanskrit na + ādatte
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

yo'dha dīghaṃ va rassaṃ vā,
aṇuṃ thūlaṃ subh'āsubhaṃ,
loke adinnaṃ n'ādiyati,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

DHP 409 brāhmaṇavaggo

sace musā na bhaṇasi,
sace pāṇaṃ na hiṃsasi,
sace adinnaṃ n'ādiyasi,
saddahāno amaccharī,
kiṃ kāhasi gayaṃ gantvā,
udapāno'pi te gayā'ti.

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ
nādiyi

na samesu na omesu,
na ussesu vadate muni,
santo so vītamaccharo,
n'ādeti na nirassatī'ti.

SNP 53 attadaṇḍasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 15

samuggahītesu pamoham'āgā,
ito ca n'āddakkhi aṇum'pi saññaṃ,
tasmā tuvaṃ momuhato dahāsi.

SNP 47 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 9

taṃ ce hi n'āddakkhuṃ tathāvimuttaṃ, (icc'āyasmā mogharājā)
devā manussā idha vā huraṃ vā,
nar'uttamaṃ atthacaraṃ narānaṃ,
ye taṃ namassanti pasaṃsiyā te'ti.

SNP 53 attadaṇḍasuttaṃ

nādhigacchati

te sāraṃ n'ādhigacchanti,
micchāsaṅkappagocarā.

DHP 11 yamakavaggo

so attānaṃ ātāpeti paritāpeti, kusalañ'ca dhammaṃ n'ādhigacchati, uttari ca manussadhammā alamariyañāṇadassanavisesaṃ na sacchikaroti.

satta vassāni bhagavantaṃ,

sambuddhassa satīmato.

SNP 28 padhānasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 2
nādhiṭṭhāti

pr. (+acc) does not stand firmly; does not take a stand; does not make up one’s mind; does not fixate [na + adhi + √ṭhā + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, from na adhiṭṭhāti, neg, trans (+acc)
Meaning does not stand firmly; does not take a stand; does not make up one’s mind; does not fixate

√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + a > ṭhā
Construction na + adhi + ṭhā + ti
na + adhiṭṭhāti
Sanskrit na + adhitiṣṭhati
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

so viññāṇaṃ na upeti, na upādiyati, n'ādhiṭṭhāti, attā me'ti. tass'ime pañc'upādānakkhandhā anupetā anupādinnā dīgharattaṃ hitāya sukhāya saṃvattantī'ti.

SN 22.85 yamakasuttaṃ

upay'upādān'ābhinivesavinibandho khv'āyaṃ, kaccāna, loko yebhuyyena. tañ'c'āyaṃ upay'upādānaṃ cetaso adhiṭṭhānaṃ abhinives'ānusayaṃ na upeti na upādiyati n'ādhiṭṭhāti, attā me'ti.

SN 12.15 kaccānagottasuttaṃ

na + adhibhoti

Sanskrit na + adhibhavati
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

agāravo hoti … sagāravo hoti ... appatisso hoti … sappatisso hoti ... na ārādhako hoti … ārādhako hoti ... na visujjhati … visujjhati ... mānaṃ n'ādhibhoti … mānaṃ adhibhoti … paññāya na vaḍḍhati … paññāya vaḍḍhati

AN 10.156-166 2-bhajitabbādisuttāni
nādhimuccati 1

pr. (+loc) is not drawn (to); is not attracted (to); does not incline (towards) [na + adhi + √muc + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass of na adhimuñcati, neg, intrans (+loc)
Meaning is not drawn (to); is not attracted (to); does not incline (towards)
Root Family adhi √muc
Root √muc･2 ya (release, free)
Base √muc + ya > mucca (pass)
Construction na + adhi + mucca + ti
na + adhimuccati
Phonetic Change y > c
Antonym adhimuccati
Sanskrit na + adhimucyate
Sanskrit Root √muc 6 (release)

kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, olīyanti eke? bhav'ārāmā, bhikkhave, devamanussā bhavaratā bhavasammuditā tesaṃ bhavanirodhāya dhamme desiyamāne cittaṃ na pakkhandati na pasīdati na santiṭṭhati n'ādhimuccati.

ITI 49 diṭṭhigatasuttaṃ

kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, saṃvaro hoti? idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā piyarūpe rūpe n'ādhimuccati, appiyarūpe rūpe na byāpajjati, upaṭṭhitakāyassati ca viharati appamāṇacetaso

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ
nādhimuccati 2

pr. (+loc) does not draw a definite conclusion (about); is not resolved (about) [na + adhi + √muc + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass of na adhimuñcati, neg, intrans (+loc)
Meaning does not draw a definite conclusion (about); is not resolved (about)
Root Family adhi √muc
Root √muc･2 ya (release, free)
Base √muc + ya > mucca (pass)
Construction na + adhi + mucca + ti
na + adhimuccati
Phonetic Change y > c
Antonym adhimuccati
Commentary (MNa) n'ādhimuccatī'ti tāya vicikicchāya sanniṭṭhānaṃ na gacchati.
Sanskrit na + adhimucyate
Sanskrit Root √muc 6 (release)

dvīsu mahāpurisalakkhaṇesu kaṅkhati vicikicchati n'ādhimuccati na sampasīdati, kos'ohite ca vatthaguyhe, pahūtajivhatāya ca.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

yo so, bhikkhave, bhikkhu satthari kaṅkhati vicikicchati n'ādhimuccati na sampasīdati tassa cittaṃ na namati ātappāya anuyogāya sātaccāya padhānāya.

MN 16 cetokhilasuttaṃ
nādhimucchita

pp. not infatuated; not greedy; not strongly fixated on [na + adhi + √mucch + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of na adhimucchati, neg
Meaning not infatuated; not greedy; not strongly fixated on
Root Family adhi √mucch
Root √mucch･1 a (thicken, fixate)
Construction na + adhi + √mucch + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Commentary (THa) n'ādhimucchitā na ajjhositā akkhabbhañjanaṃ viya sākaṭikā, vaṇalepanaṃ viya vaṇino abhuñjiṃsu.
Sanskrit Root √mūrch √murch 1 (thicken)

paṇītaṃ yadi vā lūkhaṃ,
appaṃ vā yadi vā bahuṃ,
yāpan'atthaṃ abhuñjiṃsu,
agiddhā n'ādhimucchitā.

TH 257 pārāpariyattheragāthā
nādhivāseti

Grammar pr, caus of na adhivasati, neg, trans (+acc)

Root Family adhi √vas
Root √vas･1 *e (live)
Base √vas + *e > vāse (caus)

na + adhivāseti
Phonetic Change a > ā
Antonym adhivāseti
Sanskrit na + adhivāsayati
Sanskrit Root √vas 1 (dwell)

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu paṭisaṅkhā yoniso uppannaṃ kāmavitakkaṃ n'ādhivāseti pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti anabhāvaṃ gameti

MN 2.7 sabbāsavasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu uppannaṃ kāmavitakkaṃ ... byāpādavitakkaṃ ... vihiṃsāvitakkaṃ ... uppann'uppanne pāpake akusale dhamme n'ādhivāseti, pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti anabhāvaṃ gameti. evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu hantā hoti.

AN 5.140 sotasuttaṃ
nādhīyati

na + adhīyati
Antonym adhīyati
Commentary (SNa) n'ādhīyasī'ti na sajjhāyasi. n'ādiyasī'ti vā pāṭho, na gaṇhāsī'ti attho.
Sanskrit na + adhyeti, adhīyati
Sanskrit Root adhi√i 1, 2 (learn)
nānaccaya

Sanskrit nānā + caya

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, bālo abyatto akusalo sūdo rājānaṃ vā rājamahāmattaṃ vā nānaccayehi sūpehi paccupaṭṭhito assa.

SN 47.8 sūdasuttaṃ
nānatta 1

nt. diversity; variety; multiplicity [nānā + tta] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from nānā
Meaning diversity; variety; multiplicity
Construction nānā + tta

Antonym ekatta
Sanskrit nānatva

kim'ārammaṇā, samiddhi, purisassa saṅkappavitakkā uppajjantī'ti? nāmarūp'ārammaṇā, bhante'ti. te pana, samiddhi, kva nānattaṃ gacchantī'ti? dhātūsu, bhante'ti.

AN 9.14 samiddhisuttaṃ
nānatta 2

adj. diverse; varied; manifold [nānā + tta + a] ✓

Grammar adj, from nānā
Meaning diverse; varied; manifold
Construction nānā + tta + a
nānatta + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Antonym ekatta
Commentary (MNa) nānattā'ti nānā bahū anekappakārā.
Sanskrit nānatva

atthi, bhikkhave, upekkhā nānattā nānattasitā, atthi upekkhā ekattā ekattasitā. katamā ca, bhikkhave, upekkhā nānattā nānattasitā?

MN 137 saḷāyatanavibhaṅgasuttaṃ

evam'etaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya disvā y'āyaṃ upekkhā nānattā nānattasitā taṃ abhinivajjetvā, y'āyaṃ upekkhā ekattā ekattasitā yattha sabbaso lok'āmis'ūpādānā aparisesā nirujjhanti tam'ev'ūpekkhaṃ bhāveti.

MN 54.2 potaliyasuttaṃ
nānattakathā

fem. chatting about this and that; talk about various topics [nānatta + kathā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning chatting about this and that; talk about various topics
Construction nānatta + kathā
Compound kammadhāraya (nānatta + kathā)
Sanskrit nānatva + kathā

nigamakathaṃ nagarakathaṃ janapadakathaṃ itthikathaṃ sūrakathaṃ visikhākathaṃ kumbhaṭṭhānakathaṃ pubbapetakathaṃ nānattakathaṃ lok'akkhāyikaṃ samudd'akkhāyikaṃ itibhav'ābhavakathaṃ iti vāti

Sanskrit nānatva + varṇa

majjhe sarassa tiṭṭhanti,
vimānā kappaṭṭhāyino,
veḷuriyavaṇṇā rucirā,
accimanto pabhassarā,
accharā tattha naccanti,
puthu nānattavaṇṇiyo.

MN 31 cūḷagosiṅgasuttaṃ

adj. various; many different kinds of; manifold [nānā + pakāra] ✓

Sanskrit nānāprakāra

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu imam'eva kāyaṃ uddhaṃ pādatalā adho kesamatthakā tacapariyantaṃ pūraṃ nānappakārassa asucino paccavekkhati

DN 22.5 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

tvaṃ attano vīriyaṃ daḷhaṃ katvā paggaṇhā'ti bodhisattaṃ nānappakārāhi thutīhi abhitthuniṃsu.

JAa 1.N.1 sumedha kathā
nānappakāraka

adj. various; many different kinds of; manifold [nānā + pakāra + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, from nānappakāra
Meaning various; many different kinds of; manifold
Construction nānā + pakāra + ka
nānappakāra + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Commentary (VIN 1.4.2.9) nānappakārakaṃ nāma katam'pi akatam'pi kat'ākatam'pi. kataṃ nāma sīs'ūpagaṃ gīv'ūpagaṃ hatth'ūpagaṃ pād'ūpagaṃ kaṭ'ūpagaṃ. akataṃ nāma ghanakataṃ vuccati. kat'ākataṃ nāma tadubhayaṃ.
Sanskrit nānāprakāra

yo pana bhikkhu nānappakārakaṃ rūpiyasaṃvohāraṃ samāpajjeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT NP 19 rūpiyasaṃvohārasikkhāpadaṃ

yo pana bhikkhu nānappakārakaṃ kayavikkayaṃ samāpajjeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

viggayha nānā kusalā vadanti,
yo evaṃ jānāti sa vedi dhammaṃ,
idaṃ paṭikkosamakevalī so.

atha kho sambahulā nānātitthiyasāvakā devaputtā asamo ca sahali ca nīko ca ākoṭako ca vegabbhari ca māṇavagāmiyo ca abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇā kevalakappaṃ veḷuvanaṃ obhāsetvā yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu

yā c'āyaṃ, āvuso, appamāṇā cetovimutti, yā ca ākiñcaññā cetovimutti, yā ca suññatā cetovimutti, yā ca animittā cetovimutti, ime dhammā nān'ātthā c'eva nānābyañjanā ca udāhu ek'atthā byañjanam'eva nānan'ti?

MN 43 mahāvedallasuttaṃ

atthi kho, āvuso, pariyāyo yaṃ pariyāyaṃ āgamma ime dhammā nān'ātthā c'eva nānābyañjanā ca, atthi ca kho, āvuso, pariyāyo yaṃ pariyāyaṃ āgamma ime dhammā ek'atthā, byañjanam'eva nānaṃ.

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhu, dvinnaṃ kaṭṭhānaṃ saṅghaṭṭā samodhānā usmā jāyati, tejo abhinibbattati, tesaṃ'y'eva dvinnaṃ kaṭṭhānaṃ nānābhāvā vikkhepā yā tajjā usmā sā nirujjhati, sā vūpasammati.

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ

alaṃ, ānanda, mā soci mā paridevi nanu etaṃ, ānanda, mayā paṭikacc'eva akkhātaṃ sabbeh'eva piyehi manāpehi nānābhāvo vinābhāvo aññathābhāvo

Commentary (MNa) nānābhesajjehī'ti harītakāmalak'ādīhi nān'osadhehi.
Sanskrit nānā + bheṣaja

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, pūtimuttaṃ nānābhesajjehi saṃsaṭṭhaṃ. atha puriso āgaccheyya paṇḍukarogī.

MN 46 mahādhammasamādānasuttaṃ
nānāmagga

masc. different road; diverse paths ✗
nānāmaggāni

nt. various roads ✗
nānārajja

nt. surgical probe (?) ✗
nānāratta

adj. variously coloured; multi-coloured; lit. variously dyed [nānā + ratta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning variously coloured; multi-coloured; lit. variously dyed
Construction nānā + ratta

Commentary (ANa) nānārattānan'ti nilapītalohitodātavaṇṇehi nānārajanehi rattānaṃ.
Sanskrit nānā + rakta

seyyathā'pi nāma gahapatissa vā gahapatiputtassa vā nānārattānaṃ dussānaṃ dussakaraṇḍako pūro

AN 8.30 anuruddha mahāvitakkasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, āvuso moggallāna, rañño vā rājamahāmattassa vā nānārattānaṃ dussānaṃ dussakaraṇḍako pūro assa.

att'ūpamāā hi te sattā,
attā hi paramo piyo,
hanti kuddho puthuttānaṃ,
nānārūpesu mucchito.

pañc'imāni, bho gotama, indriyāni nānāvisayāni nānāgocarāni, na aññam'aññassa gocaravisayaṃ paccanubhonti.

nānāsakā

Meaning not (by) fasting; lit. not not eating
Root Family √as
Root √as･1 a (eat)
Construction na + na + √as > ās + *akā

Compound kammadhāraya (na + anāsakā)
Antonym anāsakā
Sanskrit na + anāśaka
Sanskrit Root √aś 1, 9 (eat)

na naggacariyā na jaṭā na paṅkā,
n'ānāsakā thaṇḍilasāyikā vā,
rajojallaṃ ukkuṭikappadhānaṃ,
sodhenti maccaṃ avitiṇṇakaṅkhaṃ.

nānāsaṃvāsaka

asanto n'ānukubbanti,
sataṃ dhammo duranvayo.

Antonym anugijjhati
Sanskrit na + anugṛdhyati
Sanskrit Root √gṛdh 4 (be greedy)

lābhakamyā na sikkhati,
alābhe ca na kuppati,
aviruddho ca taṇhāya,
rasesu n'ānugijjhati.

SNP 48 purābhedasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 10

cakkhūhi n'eva lol'assa,
gāmakathāya āvaraye sotaṃ,
rase ca n'ānugijjheyya,
na ca mamāyetha kiñci lokasmiṃ.

SNP 52 tuvaṭakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 14
nānujaññā

opt. (+acc) should not allow; should not permit; should not grant permission [na + anu + √ñā + nā + eyya] ✓

Grammar opt of na anujānāti, irreg, neg, trans (+acc)
Meaning should not allow; should not permit; should not grant permission
Root Family anu √ñā
Root √ñā･5 nā (know)
√ In Comps ññā
Base √ñā + nā > jānā
Construction na + anu + jānā + eyya
na + anujānayya > nānujaññā
Phonetic Change eyya > ā (Kacc 508, 515)
nā > ya (Kacc 509, 516)
ñ > j
Antonym anujaññā
Sanskrit na + anujñā
Sanskrit Root √jñā 9 (know)

tato adinnaṃ parivajjayeyya,
kiñci kvaci sāvako bujjhamāno,
na hāraye harataṃ n'ānujaññā,
sabbaṃ adinnaṃ parivajjayeyya.

Sanskrit na + anujñānāti
Sanskrit Root √jñā 9 (know)

MN 59 bahuvedanīyasuttaṃ
nānutapati

na + anutapati

Sanskrit Root √tap 1 (heat)

tañ'ca kammaṃ kataṃ sādhu,
yaṃ katvā n'ānutappati,
yassa patīto sumano,
vipākaṃ paṭisevati.

DHP 68 bālavaggo

akataṃ dukkaṭaṃ seyyo,
pacchā tappati dukkaṭaṃ,
katañ'ca sukataṃ seyyo,
yaṃ katvā n'ānutappati.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ

tass'etaṃ pāṭikaṅkhaṃ, subhanimittaṃ na manasi karissati, tassa subhanimittassa amanasikārā rāgo cittaṃ n'ānuddhaṃsessati, so arāgo adoso amoho anaṅgaṇo asaṃkiliṭṭhacitto kālaṃ karissati.

akiñcanaṃ n'ānupatanti dukkhā.

so rūpaṃ ... n'ānuparidhāvati n'ānuparivattati. so rūpaṃ ... ananuparidhāvaṃ ananuparivattaṃ, parimuccati rūpamhā ... parimuccati jātiyā jarāmaraṇena sokehi paridevehi dukkhehi domanassehi upāyāsehi.

SN 22.99 gaddulabaddhasuttaṃ

na + anupādāya
Antonym upādāya
Variant anupādāya
Notes very weird construction
Sanskrit na + upādā
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

idha, sāriputta, bhikkhu pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto nisīdati pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya parimukhaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhapetvā, na tāv'āhaṃ imaṃ pallaṅkaṃ bhindissāmi yāva me nānupādāya āsavehi cittaṃ vimuccissatī'ti.

MN 32 mahāgosiṅgasuttaṃ

na + anupāpuṇāti
Antonym anupāpuṇāti
Sanskrit na + anuprāpnoti
Sanskrit Root √āp 5 (obtain)

tassa taṃ vanapatthaṃ upanissāya viharato anupaṭṭhitā c'eva sati na upaṭṭhāti, asamāhitañ'ca cittaṃ na samādhiyati, aparikkhīṇā ca āsavā na parikkhayaṃ gacchanti, ananuppattañ'ca anuttaraṃ yogakkhemaṃ n'ānupāpuṇāti.

y > v
Antonym anuppavecchati
Variant nānupavecchati

Sanskrit na + anuprayacchati
Sanskrit Root √yam 1, 2 (reach)

tassa n'ev'assa puratthimāya disāya udakassa āyamukhaṃ, na pacchimāya disāya udakassa āyamukhaṃ, na uttarāya disāya udakassa āyamukhaṃ, na dakkhiṇāya disāya udakassa āyamukhaṃ, devo ca kālena kālaṃ sammā dhāraṃ n'ānuppaveccheyya.

tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā rattibhāgaṃ vā divasabhāgaṃ vā so puggalo anāpucchā pakkamitabbaṃ, n'ānubandhitabbo.

MN 17 vanapatthasuttaṃ
nānubyañjanaggāhī

Variant nānuvyañjanaggāhī, mānubyañjanaggāhī
Sanskrit na + anuvyañjana + gṛhāya

kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu indriyesu guttadvāro hoti? idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā na nimittaggāhī hoti n'ānubyañjanaggāhī.

AN 4.37 aparihāniyasuttaṃ

cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā na nimittaggāhī n'ānubyañjanaggāhī

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
nānubhavati

Meaning does not achieve; does not accomplish; does not fulfil

Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)

Construction na + anu + bhava + ti
na + anubhavati
Phonetic Change ū > av
Sanskrit na + anubhavati
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

yañ'c'assa sārena sārakaraṇīyaṃ tañ'c'assa atthaṃ n'ānubhavissatī'ti.

MN 29 mahāsāropamasuttaṃ
nānubhoti 1

pr. (+acc) does not achieve; does not realise [na + anu + √bhū + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, from na anubhoti, neg, trans (+acc)
Meaning does not achieve; does not realise
Root Family anu √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Base √bhū + a > bho
Construction na + anu + bho + ti
na + anubhoti
Phonetic Change ū > o
Antonym anubhoti
Sanskrit na + anubhū
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

te upārambh'ānisaṃsā c'eva dhammaṃ pariyāpuṇanti itivādappamokkh'ānisaṃsā ca. yassa c'atthāya dhammaṃ pariyāpuṇanti tañ'c'assa atthaṃ n'ānubhonti.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
nānubhoti 2

pr. (+acc) does not experience; does not partake (of) [anu + √bhū] ✗
nānumīyati

pr. is not measured; is not quantified [na + anu + √mā + īya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass of na anumināti, neg, intrans
Meaning is not measured; is not quantified
Root Family anu √mā
Root √mā･5 īya (measure)
Base √mā + īya > mīya (pass)
Construction na + anu + mīya + ti
na + anumīyati
Phonetic Change ā > i (Kacc 502, 493)
Antonym anumīyati
Commentary (SNa) taṃ anumīyatī'ti taṃ anusayitaṃ rūpaṃ marantena anusayena anumarati. na hi ārammaṇe bhijjamāne tadārammaṇā dhammā tiṭṭhanti. yaṃ anumīyatī'ti yaṃ rūpaṃ yena anusayena anumarati.
Sanskrit na + anumīyate
Sanskrit Root √mā 2, 3, 4 (measure)

yaṃ kho, bhikkhu, anuseti taṃ anumīyati, yaṃ anumīyati tena saṅkhaṃ gacchati. yaṃ n'ānuseti na taṃ anumīyati, yaṃ n'ānumīyati na tena saṅkhaṃ gacchatī'ti. aññātaṃ, bhagavā, aññātaṃ, sugatā'ti.

SN 22.36 dutiyāññatarabhikkhusuttaṃ
nānuyuñjati

pr. (+acc) does not practice; does not engage (in); does not commit (to); does not do; lit. does not yoke near [na + anu + √yuj + ṃa + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, from na anuyuñjati, neg, trans (+acc)
Meaning does not practice; does not engage (in); does not commit (to); does not do; lit. does not yoke near
Root Family anu √yuj
Root √yuj･2 ṃa (yoke, join)
Base √yuj + ṃa > yuñja
Construction na + anu + yuñja + ti
na + anuyuñjati
Antonym anuyuñjati
Sanskrit na + anuyuñjati
Sanskrit Root √yuj 2, 7 (join)

so tāya dhammapariyattiyā divasaṃ atināmeti, riñcati paṭisallānaṃ, n'ānuyuñjati ajjhattaṃ cetosamathaṃ. ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhu, bhikkhu pariyattibahulo, no dhammavihārī.

AN 5.73 paṭhamadhammavihārīsuttaṃ

sammā nibbān'ādhimuttass'eva sato so yāni sammā nibbān'ādhimuttassa asappāyāni tāni n'ānuyuñjeyya, asappāyaṃ cakkhunā rūpadassanaṃ n'ānuyuñjeyya

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ
nānuyutta

pp. not practising; not engaging in; not doing; lit. not yoked near [na + anu + √yuj + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of na anuyuñjati, neg
Meaning not practising; not engaging in; not doing; lit. not yoked near
Root Family anu √yuj
Root √yuj･2 ṃa (yoke, join)
Construction na + anu + √yuj + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change j > t
Compound kammadhāraya (na + anuyutta)
Antonym anuyutta
Synonym anācārī
Variant ananuyutta
Sanskrit na + anu + yukta
Sanskrit Root √yuj 2, 7 (join)

asappāyaṃ kāyena phoṭṭhabbaṃ n'ānuyuttassa, asappāyaṃ manasā dhammaṃ n'ānuyuttassa rāgo cittaṃ n'ānuddhaṃseyya.

Antonym nappaṭivirujjhati
Sanskrit na + anurudhyati
Sanskrit Root √rudh 2, 7 (obstruct)

so uppannaṃ lābhaṃ n'ānurujjhati, alābhe nappaṭivirujjhati, uppannaṃ yasaṃ n'ānurujjhati, ayase nappaṭivirujjhati, uppannaṃ pasaṃsaṃ n'ānurujjhati, nindāya nappaṭivirujjhati, uppannaṃ sukhaṃ n'ānurujjhati, dukkhe nappaṭivirujjhati.

nānusikkhati 2

pr. (+acc) does not imitate; does not follow one's example [anu + √sikkh] ✗

yathā ca pana kāmehi visaṃyuttaṃ viharantaṃ taṃ brāhmaṇaṃ akathaṃkathiṃ chinnakukkuccaṃ bhav'ābhave vītataṇhaṃ saññā n'ānusenti, evaṃvādī kho ahaṃ, āvuso, evam'akkhāyī'ti

nirāsatti anāgate,
atītaṃ n'ānusocati,
vivekadassī phassesu,
diṭṭhīsu ca na nīyati.

SNP 48 purābhedasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 10

AN 10.197 anussaritabbasuttaṃ

Sanskrit na + anu + sravati
Sanskrit Root √sru 1 (flow)
nānūpacāra

adj. having multiple defined areas; lit. many approaches [nānā + upacāra] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having multiple defined areas; lit. many approaches
Construction nānā + upacāra
Commentary (VINa) yaṃ pana ekaṃ gharaṃ dvinnaṃ bhariyānaṃ sukhavihār'atthāya majjhe bhittiṃ uṭṭhāpetvā nānādvāravaḷañjaṃ kataṃ, tatth'uppanno uddesalābho bhittiantarikassa na pāpuṇāti, tasmiṃ tasmiṃ ṭhāne nisinnass'eva pāpuṇāti, etaṃ ekaṃ gharaṃ nān'ūpacāraṃ nāma.
nānvāgameti

pr. (+acc) does not follow around; does not return (to); does not revive; does not relive; lit. does not cause to follow back [na + anu + ā + √gam + *e + ti] ✓

Sanskrit na + anvāgamayati

nappaṭikaṅkhe anāgataṃ,
yadatītaṃ pahīnaṃ taṃ,
appattañ'ca anāgataṃ.

yasmiṃ kāmā na vasanti,
taṇhā yassa na vijjati,
kathaṃkathā ca yo tiṇṇo,
vimokkho tassa n'āparo.

Sanskrit na + api

na santi puttā tāṇāya,
na pitā n'āpi bandhavā,
antaken'ādhipannassa,
n'atthi ñātīsu tāṇatā.

DHP 288 maggavaggo

so tāya dhammapariyattiyā na divasaṃ atināmeti, n'āpi riñcati paṭisallānaṃ, anuyuñjati ajjhattaṃ cetosamathaṃ. evaṃ kho, bhikkhu, bhikkhu dhammavihārī hoti.

AN 5.73 paṭhamadhammavihārīsuttaṃ

n'āphusantaṃ phusati ca,
phusantañ'ca tato phuse,
tasmā phusantaṃ phusati,
appaduṭṭhapadosinan'ti.

SN 1.22 phusatisuttaṃ
nābbhaññāsi

Antonym abbhaññāsi
Variant nābhaññāsi
Sanskrit na + abhijñā
Sanskrit Root √jñā 9 (know)

yāvakīvañ'c'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, imesaṃ pañcannaṃ upādānakkhandhānaṃ evaṃ assādañ'ca assādato ādīnavañ'ca ādīnavato nissaraṇañ'ca nissaraṇato yathābhūtaṃ n'ābbhaññāsiṃ

SN 22.26 assādasuttaṃ

ye'me, bho gotama, samaṇabrāhmaṇā saṅghino gaṇino gaṇācariyā ñātā yasassino titthakarā sādhusammatā, bahujanassa ... sabb'ete sakāya paṭiññāya abbhaññaṃsu sabb'eva n'ābbhaññaṃsu, udāhu ekacce abbhaññaṃsu ekacce n'ābbhaññaṃsū'ti?

MN 30 cūḷasāropamasuttaṃ
nābbhanumodati

pr. (+acc) does not appreciate enormously; does not vigorously applaud; does not express approval [na + abhi + anu + √mud + *a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, from na abbhanumodati, neg, trans (+acc)
Meaning does not appreciate enormously; does not vigorously applaud; does not express approval
Root Family abhi anu √mud
Root √mud･1 *a (be soft, happy)
Base √mud + *a > moda
Construction na + abhi + anu + moda + ti
na + abbhanumodati
Phonetic Change u > o
Antonym abbhanumodati
Sanskrit abhyanumud
Sanskrit Root √mud 1 (be merry)

bhūtaṃ kho pana tacchaṃ tathaṃ paṭipadaṃ paññapentassa dhammaṭṭhitataṃ dhammaniyāmataṃ, kathañ'hi nāma mādiso viññū samaṇassa gotamassa subhāsitaṃ subhāsitato n'ābbhanumodeyyā'ti?

DN 9.4 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, saññāattakathā
nābbhanumodi

aor. (+acc) did not appreciate enormously; did not vigorously applaud; did not express approval [na + abhi + anu + √mud + *a + i] ✓

Grammar aor of na abbhanumodati, neg, trans (+acc)
Meaning did not appreciate enormously; did not vigorously applaud; did not express approval
Root Family abhi anu √mud
Root √mud･1 *a (be soft, happy)
Base √mud + *a > moda
Construction na + abhi > abhy > abbh + anu + moda + i
na + abbhanumodi
Phonetic Change bhi > bhy > bbh
u > o
Sanskrit na + abhyanumud
Sanskrit Root √mud 1 (be merry)

evaṃ vutte, bhagavā āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ etadavoca, santaññ'eva kho, ānanda, pariyāyaṃ pañcak'aṅgo thapati udāyissa n'ābbhanumodi, santaññ'eva ca pana pariyāyaṃ udāyī pañcak'aṅgassa thapatissa n'ābbhanumodi.

MN 59 bahuvedanīyasuttaṃ
nābbhanumoditar

masc. disapprover; who disagrees; non-acceptor [na + abhi + anu + √mud + *itar] ~

Grammar masc, agent, from na abbhanumodati, neg
Meaning disapprover; who disagrees; non-acceptor
Root Family abhi anu √mud
Root √mud･1 *a (be soft, happy)
Construction na + abhi > abhy > abbh + anu + √mud > mod + *itar
Derivative kita (*itar)
Phonetic Change bhi > bhy > bbh
u > o
Antonym abbhanumoditar
Commentary (ANa) n'ābbhanumoditā'ti evaṃ yoniso sabbaṃ kāraṇasampannaṃ katvā'pi vissajjitaṃ parassa pañhaṃ n'ābhinumodati n'ābhinandati sāriputtattherassa pañhaṃ lāḷ'udāyitthero viya.
Sanskrit na + abhi + anumoditṛ
Sanskrit Root √mud 1 (be merry)
nābbhācikkhati

pr. (+acc) does not misrepresent; does not slander; does not falsely accuse; (comm) does not speak untruthfully (about) [na + abhi + ā + √cikkh + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, from na abbhācikkhati, neg, trans (+acc)
Meaning does not misrepresent; does not slander; does not falsely accuse; (comm) does not speak untruthfully (about)
Root Family abhi ā √cikkh
Root √cikkh･1 a (show, tell)
Base √cikkh + a > cikkha
Construction na + abhi > abhy > abbh + ā + cikkha + ti
na + abbhācikkhati
Phonetic Change bhi > bhy > bbh
Antonym abbhācikkhati
Commentary (ANa) abbhācikkhantī'ti abhibhavitvā ācikkhanti, abhūtena vadanti.
Sanskrit na + abhyākhyāti
Sanskrit Root √khyā √cakṣ 2 (see)

dve'me, bhikkhave, tathāgataṃ n'ābbhācikkhanti. katame dve? yo ca abhāsitaṃ alapitaṃ tathāgatena abhāsitaṃ alapitaṃ tathāgatenā'ti dīpeti, yo ca bhāsitaṃ lapitaṃ tathāgatena bhāsitaṃ lapitaṃ tathāgatenā'ti dīpet

AN 2.24 bālavaggo
nābrāhmaṇa

masc. no Brahman is not [na + na + brāhmaṇa] ~

Meaning no Brahman is not
Construction na + na > a + brāhmaṇa
Antonym abrāhmaṇa
nābhavissa

cond. (+nom) would not have been; would not exist [na + √bhū + a + issa] ✓

Construction na + a + bhava + issa

Antonym abhavissa

Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

kāmadhātuvepakkañ'ca, ānanda, kammaṃ n'ābhavissa, api nu kho kāmabhavo paññāyethā'ti? no h'etaṃ bhante

AN 3.67 paṭhamabhavasuttaṃ
nābhāsamāna

prp. (+acc) not (when) not speaking; not (when) not talking [na + √bhās + a + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of na na bhāsati, neg x2, trans (+acc)
Meaning not (when) not speaking; not (when) not talking
Root Family √bhās
Root √bhās･1 a (speak)
Base √bhās + a > bhāsa
Construction na + na > a + bhāsa + māna
na + abhāsamāna
Derivative kita (māna)
Antonym abhāsamāna
Notes "they do not know when he is not speaking"
Sanskrit na + na + bhāṣamāṇa
Sanskrit Root √bhāṣ 1 (speak)

n'ābhāsamānaṃ jānanti,
missaṃ bālehi paṇḍitaṃ,
bhāsamānañ'ca jānanti,
desentaṃ amataṃ padaṃ.

AN 4.48 visākhasuttaṃ
nābhi 1

fem. hub of a cart wheel; centre-point of a wheel [√nabh + *i] ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning hub of a cart wheel; centre-point of a wheel
Root Family √nabh
Root √nabh×1 a (burst, split)
Construction √nabh > nābh + *i
Derivative kita (*i)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Notes circle in the centre of a wheel to which spokes are attached
Sanskrit nābhi
Sanskrit Root √nabh 1, 4, 9 (burst)

rājā te sabbe gāhāpetvā rāj'aṅgaṇe nābhippamāṇe āvāṭe khaṇāpetvā te tattha nisīdāpetvā paṃsūhi pūretvā upari palāle vikirāpetvā aggiṃ dāpesi.

DHPa 1.2.1 sāmāvatīvatthu
nābhi 2

fem. navel [√nabh + *i] ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning navel
Root Family √nabh
Root √nabh×1 a (burst, split)
Construction √nabh > nābh + *i
Derivative kita (*i)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit nābhi
Sanskrit Root √nabh 1, 4, 9 (burst)

kaṇḍuppaṭicchādi nāma yassa adhonābhi ubbhajāṇumaṇḍalaṃ kaṇḍu vā pīḷakā vā assāvo vā thullakacchu vā ābādho, tassa paṭicchādan'atthāya.

VIN 2.5.9.8 kaṇḍuppaṭicchādisikkhāpadaṃ
nābhikīrati

pr. (+acc) does not drown; does not submerge; (comm) does not overwhelm; lit. does not sprinkle over [na + abhi + √kir + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, from na abhikirati, neg, trans (+acc)
Meaning does not drown; does not submerge; (comm) does not overwhelm; lit. does not sprinkle over
Root Family abhi √kir
Root √kir･1 a (scatter, sprinkle)
Base √kir + a > kira
Construction na + abhi + kira + ti
na + abhikirati
Phonetic Change n'ābhikīrati with metrically lengthened ī
Antonym abhikirati
Variant nābhikirati
Commentary (SNa) aratī n'ābhikīratī'ti ukkaṇṭhitā n'ābhibhavati.
Sanskrit na + abhikirati
Sanskrit Root √kṝ √kṛ 6 (scatter)

uṭṭhānen'appamādena,
saṃyamena damena ca,
dīpaṃ kayirātha medhāvī,
yaṃ ogho n'ābhikīrati.

DHP 25 appamādavaggo

anagho ve ahaṃ yakkha,
atho nandī na vijjati,
atho maṃ ekam'āsīnaṃ,
aratī n'ābhikīratī'ti.

SN 2.18 kakudhasuttaṃ
nābhikkhaṇaṃ

Construction na + abhi + √ikkh + aṇa + aṃ
nābhikkhaṇa + aṃ
Antonym abhikkhaṇaṃ
Commentary (JAa) tasmā'ti yasmā accābhikkhaṇasaṃsaggena asamosaraṇena ca mittā jīranti, tasmā.
Sanskrit na + abhīkṣṇam
Sanskrit Root √īkṣ 1 (see)

tasmā n'ābhikkhaṇaṃ gacche,
na ca gacche cirāciraṃ,
kālena yācaṃ yāceyya,
evaṃ mittā na jīyare.

JA 528 mahābodhi jātakaṃ

manas'ānāvilo siyā,
kusalo sabbadhammānaṃ,
sato bhikkhu paribbaje'ti.

bhavañ'ca n'ābhijappeyya,
bheravesu ca na sampavedheyya.

SNP 52 tuvaṭakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 14

√ In Comps ññā

Antonym abhijānāti
Sanskrit na + abhijānāti
Sanskrit Root √jñā 9 (know)

ye ca rūpe pamāṇiṃsu,
ye ca ghosena anvagū,
chandarāgavas'ūpetā,
n'ābhijānanti te janā.

AN 4.65 rūpasuttaṃ

ayaṃ loko paro loko,
brahmaloko sadevako,
diṭṭhiṃ te n'ābhijānāti,
gotamassa yasassino.

n'ābhinandāmi maraṇaṃ,
n'ābhinandāmi jīvitaṃ,
nikkhipissaṃ imaṃ kāyaṃ,
sampajāno patissato.

TH 259 sāriputtattheragāthā

purāṇaṃ n'ābhinandeyya,
nave khantiṃ na kubbaye,
hiyyamāne na soceyya,
ākāsaṃ na sito siyā.

SNP 68 udaya māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 13
nābhinipphajjati

pr. is not accomplished; is not successfully attained; does not materialize; is not produced [na + abhi + nī + √pad + ya + ti] ✓

Meaning is not accomplished; is not successfully attained; does not materialize; is not produced

Root √pad･3 ya (go, step)
Base √pad + ya > pajja > phajja (irreg)
Construction na + abhi + nī + phajja + ti
na + abhinipphajjati
Phonetic Change īp > ipp
p > ph (Kacc 20, 27)
dy > jj
Commentary (MNa) n'ābhinipphajjantī'ti na nipphajjanti, hatthaṃ n'ābhiruhanti.
Sanskrit na + abhiniṣpadyate
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

tassa ce, bhikkhave, kulaputtassa evaṃ uṭṭhahato ghaṭato vāyamato te bhogā n'ābhinipphajjanti. so socati kilamati paridevati urattāḷiṃ kandati, sammohaṃ āpajjati, moghaṃ vata me uṭṭhānaṃ, aphalo vata me vāyāmo'ti.

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ

Phonetic Change i > e
Antonym abhiniveseti
Sanskrit na + abhiniveśayati
Sanskrit Root √viś 6 (enter)

janapadaniruttiṃ n'ābhiniveseyya, samaññaṃ n'ātidhāveyyā'ti, iti kho pan'etaṃ vuttaṃ. kiñ'c'etaṃ paṭicca vuttaṃ? kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, janapadaniruttiyā ca abhiniveso hoti samaññāya ca atisāro?

MN 139 araṇavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
nābhibhuyya

Antonym abhibhuyya
Sanskrit na + abhibhū
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

ñāṇavādañ'ca, āvuso, bhikkhu vadamāno bhāvanāvādañ'ca, jānām'imaṃ dhammaṃ, passām'imaṃ dhammaṃ, bhāvitakāyo'mhi bhāvitasīlo bhāvitacitto bhāvitapañño'ti. tañ'ce, āvuso, bhikkhuṃ lobho n'ābhibhuyya tiṭṭhati

AN 10.24 mahācundasuttaṃ
nābhimaṇḍala

nt. area around the navel; lit. navel circle [nābhi + maṇḍala] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning area around the navel; lit. navel circle
Construction nābhi + maṇḍala
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (nābhiyā + maṇḍala)
Commentary (VINa) nābhimaṇḍalaṃ jāṇumaṇḍalan'ti uddhaṃ nābhimaṇḍalaṃ adho jāṇumaṇḍalaṃ paṭicchādentena jāṇumaṇḍalassa heṭṭhā jaṅghaṭṭhikato paṭṭhāya aṭṭh'aṅgulamattaṃ nivāsanaṃ otāretvā nivāsetabbaṃ
Sanskrit nābhi + maṇḍala

parimaṇḍalaṃ nivāsetabbaṃ nābhimaṇḍalaṃ jāṇumaṇḍalaṃ paṭicchādentena. yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca purato vā pacchato vā olambento nivāseti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.

VIN 2.7.1 parimaṇḍalavaggo
nābhimaddati

pr. (+acc) does not completely crush; does not devastate; does not destroy [na + abhi + √madd + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, from na abhimaddati, neg, trans (+acc)
Meaning does not completely crush; does not devastate; does not destroy
Root Family abhi √madd
Root √madd･1 a (crush, grind)
Base √madd + a > madda
Construction na + abhi + madda + ti
na + abhimaddati
Antonym abhimaddati
Commentary (ANa) n'ābhimadde'ti ekaṃ kāraṇaṃ āharitvā na maddeyya.
Sanskrit na + abhimardati, abhimṛdnāti
Sanskrit Root √mṛd √mrad 1, 9 (rub, crush)

upārambhaṃ na sikkheyya,
khalitañ'ca na gāhaye,
n'ābhihare n'ābhimadde,
na vācaṃ payutaṃ bhaṇe.

AN 3.68 kathāvatthusuttaṃ

sace pan'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo pañhaṃ puṭṭho samāno n'ābhiharati n'ābhimaddati na anupajagghati na khalitaṃ gaṇhāti, evaṃ sant'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo kaccho hoti.

AN 3.68 kathāvatthusuttaṃ
nābhiramati

pr. (+loc) does not enjoy; does not delight (in); does not take pleasure (in) [na + abhi + √ram + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, from na abhiramati, neg, intrans (+loc)
Meaning does not enjoy; does not delight (in); does not take pleasure (in)
Root Family abhi √ram
Root √ram･1 a (delight, please)
Base √ram + a > rama
Construction na + abhi + rama + ti
na + abhiramati
Antonym abhiramati
Sanskrit na + abhiramate
Sanskrit Root √ram 1 (be or make content)

ye ca kho keci, bhikkhave, samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā, idaṃ dukkhan'ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānanti ... jātisaṃvattanikesu saṅkhāresu n'ābhiramanti, jarāsaṃvattanikesu saṅkhāresu n'ābhiramanti

SN 56.42 papātasuttaṃ

sabbasaṅkhārā ca me anavatthitā khāyissanti, sabbaloke ca me mano n'ābhiramissati, sabbalokā ca me mano vuṭṭhahissati

AN 6.102 anavatthitasuttaṃ
nābhivadati

pr. (+acc) does not welcome [na + abhi + √vad + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, from na abhivadati, neg, trans (+acc)
Meaning does not welcome
Root Family abhi √vad
Root √vad･1 a (say, speak)
Base √vad + a > vada
Construction na + abhi + vada + ti
na + abhivadati
Antonym abhivadati
Sanskrit na + abhivadati
Sanskrit Root √vad 1 (speak)

tañ'ce bhikkhu n'ābhinandati n'ābhivadati n'ājjhosāya tiṭṭhati, tassa taṃ anabhinandato anabhivadato anajjhosāya tiṭṭhato nirujjhati nandī. nandinirodhā dukkhanirodho, puṇṇā'ti vadāmi

SN 35.88 puṇṇasuttaṃ
nābhivadanta

prp. (+acc) not welcoming; not being hospitable [na + abhi + √vad + a + nta] ~

Grammar prp of na abhivadati, neg, trans (+acc)
Meaning not welcoming; not being hospitable
Root Family abhi √vad
Root √vad･1 a (say, speak)
Base √vad + a > vada
Construction na + abhi + vada + nta
na + abhivadanta
Derivative kita (nta)
Antonym abhivadanta
Variant anabhivadanta
Sanskrit na + abhivadat
Sanskrit Root √vad 1 (speak)
nābhivadi

aor. (+acc) did not welcome; did not affirm [na + abhi + √vad + i] ✓

Grammar aor of na abhivadati, neg, trans (+acc)
Meaning did not welcome; did not affirm
Root Family abhi √vad
Root √vad･1 a (say, speak)
Construction na + abhi + √vad + i
na + abhivadi
Antonym abhivadi
Sanskrit abhivad
Sanskrit Root √vad 1 (speak)

pathaviṃ kho ahaṃ, brahme, pathavito abhiññāya yāvatā pathaviyā pathavattena ananubhūtaṃ tadabhiññāya pathaviṃ n'āp'ahosiṃ, pathaviyā n'āp'ahosiṃ, pathavito n'āp'ahosiṃ, pathaviṃ me'ti n'āp'ahosiṃ, pathaviṃ n'ābhivadiṃ.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ

bhav'ev'āhaṃ bhayaṃ disvā,
bhavañ'ca vibhav'esinaṃ,
bhavaṃ n'ābhivadiṃ kiñci,
nandiñ'ca na upādiyin'ti.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
nābhivassati

pr. (+loc) does not rain (on); does not pour (onto) [na + abhi + √vass + a + ti] ✓

na + abhivassati
Antonym abhivassati
Sanskrit na + abhivarṣati
Sanskrit Root √vṛṣ 1, 6 (rain)

pallaṅkena nisinnassa,
jaṇṇuke n'ābhivassati,
alaṃ phāsuvihārāya,
pahit'attassa bhikkhuno.

TH 259 sāriputtattheragāthā
nābhisaṅkharoti

pr. (+acc) does not create; does not construct; does not generate; does not fabricate [na + abhi + saṃ + √kar + o + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, from na abhisaṅkharoti, neg, trans (+acc)
Meaning does not create; does not construct; does not generate; does not fabricate
Root Family abhi saṃ √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Base √kar + o > karo > kharo (irreg)
Construction na + abhi + saṃ + kharo + ti
na + abhisaṅkharoti
Phonetic Change ṃ > ṅ
k > kh (Kacc 20, 27)
Antonym abhisaṅkharoti
Sanskrit na + abhisaṃskaroti
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

te jātisaṃvattanikesu saṅkhāresu anabhiratā, jarāsaṃvattanikesu saṅkhāresu anabhiratā, maraṇasaṃvattanikesu saṅkhāresu anabhiratā ... jātisaṃvattanike'pi saṅkhāre n'ābhisaṅkharonti

nābhisajati

√ In Comps ssaj
Base √saj + a > saja
Construction na + abhi + saja + ti
na + abhisajati
Phonetic Change jj > j
Antonym abhisajati
Sanskrit na + abhisṛjati
Sanskrit Root √sṛj 1, 6 (send forth)

akakkasaṃ viññāpaniṃ,
giraṃ saccam'udīraye,
yāya n'ābhisaje kañci,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

DHP 408 brāhmaṇavaggo
nābhisajjati

Meaning is not overly attached (to); is not overly fond (of)

Root √saj･3 ya (stick, cling)
Base √saj + ya > sajja (pass)
Construction na + abhi + sajja + ti
na + abhisajjati
Phonetic Change y > j
Antonym abhisajjati
Sanskrit na + abhiṣajyate
Sanskrit Root √sañj 1 (hang)

kayavikkaye na tiṭṭheyya,
upavādaṃ bhikkhu na kareyya kuhiñci,
gāme ca n'ābhisajjeyya,
lābhakamyā janaṃ na lapayeyya.

Sanskrit Root √hṛ 1 (take)

kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, puggalo attan'tapo hoti attaparitāpan'ānuyogam'anuyutto? idha, bhikkhave, ekacco acelako hoti muttācāro hatth'āpalekhano naehibhaddantiko natiṭṭhabhaddantiko n'ābhihaṭaṃ na uddissakataṃ na nimantanaṃ sādiyati.

AN 3.68 kathāvatthusuttaṃ

sace pan'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo pañhaṃ puṭṭho samāno n'ābhiharati n'ābhimaddati na anupajagghati na khalitaṃ gaṇhāti, evaṃ sant'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo kaccho hoti.

Sanskrit Root √hṛṣ 1, 4 (be excited)
nāma 1

ind. certainly; truly; for sure ✓

Grammar ind, emph
Meaning certainly; truly; for sure
Sanskrit nāma

seyyathā'pi nāma balavā puriso samiñjitaṃ vā bāhaṃ pasāreyya

sīlagandhasamo gandho,
kuto nāma bhavissati,
yo samaṃ anuvāte ca,
paṭivāte ca vāyati.

VISM 1.1.2 sīlānisaṃsa kathā
nāma 2

Meaning called; means; by the name of; namely; lit. name

English Cognate name, nominal, nominative
Sanskrit nāma

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā aṅgesu viharati assapuraṃ nāma aṅgānaṃ nigamo.

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ

bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, dasārahānaṃ ānako nāma mudiṅgo ahosi. tassa dasārahā ānake ghaṭite aññaṃ āṇiṃ odahiṃsu.

nāma 4

nt. name ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning name

app'ekacce maṃ paccuggantvā pattacīvaraṃ paṭiggahesuṃ, app'ekacce āsanaṃ paññapesuṃ, app'ekacce pād'odakaṃ upaṭṭhapesuṃ. api ca kho maṃ nāmena ca āvusovādena ca samudācaranti.

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ

tath'ev'ime catubbaṇṇā,
pabbajitvā tav'antike,
jahanti purimaṃ nāmaṃ,
buddhaputtā'ti ñāyare.

APA 3 sāriputta therāpadānaṃ
nāma 5

nt. mental objects of consciousness; mentality; mental factors of feeling, perception, intention, contact and attention; lit. name ✓

Grammar nt, abstr
Meaning mental objects of consciousness; mentality; mental factors of feeling, perception, intention, contact and attention; lit. name
Commentary (MN 9) vedanā, saññā, cetanā, phasso, manasikāro, idaṃ vuccat'āvuso, nāmaṃ
Sanskrit nāman

kattha āpo ca pathavī,
tejo vāyo na gādhati,
kattha dīghañ'ca rassañ'ca,
aṇuṃ thūlaṃ subh'āsubhaṃ,
kattha nāmañ'ca rūpañca,
asesaṃ uparujjhatī'ti?

DN 16.11 mahāparinibbānasuttaṃ

evaṃ vutte aññataro bhikkhu there bhikkhū etadavoca, nāmaṃ kho, āvuso, eko anto, rūpaṃ dutiyo anto, viññāṇaṃ majjhe, taṇhā sibbinī.

ajito'ti tassa brāhmaṇassa nāmaṃ saṅkhā samaññā paññatti vohāro nāmaṃ nāmakammaṃ nāmadheyyaṃ nirutti byañjanaṃ abhilāpo'ti, icc'āyasmā ajito.

NIDD2 2.1 ajita māṇava pucchā niddesa
nāmakāya

Meaning name group; mind group; mental body; immaterial constituents (excluding consciousness); lit. name body

Sanskrit nāman + kāya

yehi, ānanda, ākārehi yehi liṅgehi yehi nimittehi yehi uddesehi nāmakāyassa paññatti hoti, tesu ākāresu tesu liṅgesu tesu nimittesu tesu uddesesu asati api nu kho rūpakāye adhivacanasamphasso paññāyethā'ti? no h'etaṃ, bhante.

DN 15.1 mahānidānasuttaṃ, paṭiccasamuppādo

accī yathā vātavegena khittā,
atthaṃ paleti na upeti saṅkhaṃ,
evaṃ munī nāmakāyā vimutto,
atthaṃ paleti na upeti saṅkhaṃ.

rūpaṃ jīrati maccānaṃ,
nāmagottaṃ na jīrati,
rāgo uppatho'ti vuccati,
lobho dhammānaṃ paripantho,
vayo rattin'divakkhayo.

TH 259 sāriputtattheragāthā

anattani attamāniṃ,
passa lokaṃ sadevakaṃ,
niviṭṭhaṃ nāmarūpasmiṃ,
idaṃ saccan'ti maññati.

Antonym nāmarūpasamudaya
Sanskrit nāmarūpa + nirodha

tāsaṃ ce, āvuso, naḷakalāpīnaṃ ekaṃ ākaḍḍheyya, ekā papateyya, aparaṃ ce ākaḍḍheyya, aparā papateyya. evam'eva kho, āvuso, nāmarūpanirodhā viññāṇanirodho, viññāṇanirodhā nāmarūpanirodho

SN 12.67 naḷakalāpīsuttaṃ

nāmarūpasamudayā viññāṇasamudayo, nāmarūpanirodhā viññāṇanirodho.

SN 22.57 sattaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
nāmarūpanirodhagāmī

adj. leading to the ending of names and forms; leading to the cessation of mental and physical phenomena [nāmarūpanirodha + gāmī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning leading to the ending of names and forms; leading to the cessation of mental and physical phenomena
Construction nāmarūpanirodha + gāmī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (nāmarūpanirodhaṃ + gāmī)
Sanskrit nāmarūpa + nirodha + gāmin

yato kho, āvuso, ariyasāvako nāmarūpañ'ca pajānāti, nāmarūpasamudayañ'ca pajānāti, nāmarūpanirodhañ'ca pajānāti, nāmarūpanirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadañ'ca pajānāti, ettāvatā'pi kho, āvuso, ariyasāvako sammādiṭṭhi hoti

MN 9 sammādiṭṭhisuttaṃ
nāmarūpapaccayā

ind. dependent on mind and body; due to mental and physical phenomena; lit. from condition of name and form [nāmarūpa + paccaya + ā] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, abl sg of nāmarūpapaccaya
Meaning dependent on mind and body; due to mental and physical phenomena; lit. from condition of name and form
Construction nāmarūpa + paccaya + ā
nāmarūpapaccaya + ā
Sanskrit nāmarūpa + pratyayāt

nāmarūpapaccayā phasso'ti iti kho pan'etaṃ vuttaṃ, tadānanda, iminā'p'etaṃ pariyāyena veditabbaṃ, yathā nāmarūpapaccayā

DN 15.1 mahānidānasuttaṃ, paṭiccasamuppādo

avijjāpaccayā, bhikkhave, saṅkhārā, saṅkhārapaccayā viññāṇaṃ, viññāṇapaccayā nāmarūpaṃ, nāmarūpapaccayā saḷ'āyatanaṃ, saḷ'āyatanapaccayā phasso, phassapaccayā vedanā

SN 12.2 vibhaṅgasuttaṃ
nāmarūpapabhava

adj. produced by name and form; generated by materiality and mentality [nāmarūpa + pabhava] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning produced by name and form; generated by materiality and mentality
Construction nāmarūpa + pabhava
Compound kammadhāraya (nāmarūpa + pabhava)
Sanskrit nāmarūpa + prabhava

saḷāyatanañ'c'idaṃ, bhikkhave, kiṃnidānaṃ kiṃsamudayaṃ kiṃjātikaṃ kiṃpabhavaṃ? saḷāyatanaṃ nāmarūpanidānaṃ nāmarūpasamudayaṃ nāmarūpajātikaṃ nāmarūpapabhavaṃ.

MN 11 cūḷasīhanādasuttaṃ
nāmarūpasamudaya 1

masc. source of name and form; arising of mental and physical phenomena [nāmarūpa + samudaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning source of name and form; arising of mental and physical phenomena
Construction nāmarūpa + samudaya

Antonym nāmarūpanirodha
Sanskrit nāmarūpa + samudaya

nāmarūpasamudayā viññāṇasamudayo, nāmarūpanirodhā viññāṇanirodho.

SN 22.57 sattaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

nāmarūpasamudayā cittassa samudayo, nāmarūpanirodhā cittassa atthaṅ'gamo. manasikārasamudayā dhammānaṃ samudayo, manasikāranirodhā dhammānaṃ atthaṅ'gamo'ti.

SN 47.42 samudayasuttaṃ

Meaning having name and form as source; arising from the six sense fields
Construction nāmarūpa + samudaya

Sanskrit nāmarūpa + samudaya

saḷāyatanañ'c'idaṃ, bhikkhave, kiṃnidānaṃ kiṃsamudayaṃ kiṃjātikaṃ kiṃpabhavaṃ? saḷāyatanaṃ nāmarūpanidānaṃ nāmarūpasamudayaṃ nāmarūpajātikaṃ nāmarūpapabhavaṃ.

MN 11 cūḷasīhanādasuttaṃ
nāmarūpasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 12.58 (SN12.58) ✗
nāmarūpārammaṇa

adj. based on name and form; founded on mental and physical phenomena; lit. name form supporting [nāmarūpa + ārammaṇa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning based on name and form; founded on mental and physical phenomena; lit. name form supporting
Construction nāmarūpa + ārammaṇa
Compound kammadhāraya (nāmarūpa + ārammaṇa)
Sanskrit nāmarūpa + ālambana

kim'ārammaṇā, samiddhi, purisassa saṅkappavitakkā uppajjantī'ti, iti puṭṭho samāno nāmarūp'ārammaṇā, bhante'ti vadesi. te pana, samiddhi, kva nānattaṃ gacchantī'ti, iti puṭṭho samāno dhātūsu, bhante'ti vadesi.

AN 9.14 samiddhisuttaṃ
nāmarūpūpanisa

adj. with name and form as pre-condition [nāmarūpa + upanisa] ~

Meaning with name and form as pre-condition
Construction nāmarūpa + upanisa
nāmalesa

masc. name as a pretext [nāma + lesa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name as a pretext
Construction nāma + lesa
Compound kammadhāraya (nāma + lesa)
Commentary (VINa) nāmaleso nāma saṅgharakkhito diṭṭho hoti pārājikaṃ dhammaṃ ajjhāpajjanto. aññaṃ saṅgharakkhitaṃ passitvā codeti, saṅgharakkhito mayā diṭṭho.
Sanskrit nāma + leśa

kiñci desaṃ lesamattaṃ upādāyā'ti leso nāma dasa lesā, jātileso, nāmaleso, gottaleso, liṅgaleso, āpattileso, pattaleso, cīvaraleso, upajjhāyaleso, ācariyaleso, sen'āsanaleso.

VIN 1.2.9 dutiyaduṭṭhadosasikkhāpadaṃ
nāmasannissita

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning based on names; dependent on words
Construction nāma + sannissita
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (nāme + sannissita)
Commentary (SNa) nāmasannissitā'ti samudd'ādipaṇṇattinissitā. gāthā ārabhanto hi samuddaṃ vā pathaviṃ vā yaṃ kiñci nāmaṃ nissayitvā'va ārabhati.
Sanskrit nāma + saṃniśrita

chando nidānaṃ gāthānaṃ,
akkharā tāsaṃ viyañjanaṃ,
nāmasannissitā gāthā,
kavi gāthānam'āsayo'ti.

MN 137 saḷāyatanavibhaṅgasuttaṃ

desetu me, bhante, bhagavā saṃkhittena dhammaṃ, desetu sugato saṃkhittena dhammaṃ, app'eva nām'āhaṃ bhagavato bhāsitassa atthaṃ ājāneyyaṃ. app'eva nām'āhaṃ bhagavato bhāsitassa dāy'ādo assan'ti.

ñ > n
Sanskrit jñāpyate

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 470

ñā'icc'etāya dhātuyā parassa nāpaccayassa lopo hoti vā, yakārattañ'ca. jaññā, nāyati. vā'ti kim'atthaṃ? jānāti.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 509
nāyamāyasmā

sandhi. this venerable (is) not [na + ayaṃ + āyasmā] ✓

Meaning this venerable (is) not
Construction na + ayaṃ + āyasmā
Antonym ayamāyasmā
Sanskrit na + ayam + āyuṣmān

idha, bhikkhave, puggalo puggalena saddhiṃ saṃvasamāno evaṃ jānāti, dīgharattaṃ kho ayam'āyasmā khaṇḍakārī chiddakārī sabalakārī kammāsakārī, na santatakārī na santatavutti, sīlesu dussīlo ayam'āyasmā, n'āyam'āyasmā sīlavā'ti.

AN 4.192 ṭhānasuttaṃ

tam'enaṃ samannesamāno evaṃ jānāti, dīgharattaṃ samāpanno ayam'āyasmā imaṃ kusalaṃ dhammaṃ, n'āyam'āyasmā ittarasamāpanno'ti.

Antonym ārādheti
Sanskrit na + ārādhayati
Sanskrit Root √rādh 4, 5 (succeed)

kiṃ nu kho bhoto gotamassa sāvakā bhotā gotamena evaṃ ovadīyamānā evaṃ anusāsīyamānā sabbe accantaṃ niṭṭhaṃ nibbānaṃ ārādhenti udāhu ekacce n'ārādhentī'ti?

MN 107 gaṇakamoggallānasuttaṃ

app'ekacce kho, brāhmaṇa, mama sāvakā mayā evaṃ ovadīyamānā evaṃ anusāsīyamānā accantaṃ niṭṭhaṃ nibbānaṃ ārādhenti, ekacce n'ārādhentī'ti.

na + ārādheti
Antonym ārādheti
Sanskrit na + ārādhayati
Sanskrit Root √rādh 4, 5 (succeed)

yv'āyaṃ, bhante, puggalo attantapo attaparitāpan'ānuyogam'anuyutto, ayaṃ me puggalo cittaṃ n'ārādheti. yo'p'āyaṃ, bhante, puggalo parantapo paraparitāpan'ānuyogam'anuyutto, ayam'pi me puggalo cittaṃ n'ārādheti.

MN 51 kandarakasuttaṃ
nārī

fem. woman [nara + *ī] ✓

Meaning woman

Sanskrit nārī

yāva hi vanatho na chijjati,
aṇumatto'pi narassa nārisu,
paṭibaddhamano'va tāva so,
vaccho khīrapako'va mātari.

DHP 284 maggavaggo

et'ādisaṃ ce ratanaṃ na icchasi,
nāriṃ nar'indehi bahūhi patthitaṃ,
diṭṭhigataṃ sīlavataṃ nu jīvitaṃ,
bhav'ūpapattiñ'ca vadesi kīdisaṃ.

Sanskrit na + ārocayati
Sanskrit Root √ruc 1 (shine)

paṭicchādeyyā'ti, imaṃ jānitvā codessanti, sāressanti khuṃsessanti, vambhessanti, maṅkuṃ karissanti n'ārocessāmī'ti dhuraṃ nikkhittamatte, āpatti pācittiyassa.

VIN 2.5.7.4 duṭṭhullasikkhāpadaṃ
nālaka

masc. name of an ascetic ~

Grammar masc
Meaning name of an ascetic
Sanskrit nālaka
nālakagāmaka

masc. small village of Nālaka [nālaka + gāmaka] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning small village of Nālaka
Construction nālaka + gāmaka
Commentary (SNa) nālakagāmake'ti rājagahassa avidūre attano kulasantake evaṃnāmake gāme.
nālakasutta

nt. Sutta Nipāta 3.11 (SNP 37) ✗
nālaṅkammaniya

adj. not suitable for the purpose (of sexual intercourse) [na + alaṃ + kammaniya] ~

Grammar adj, comp, neg
Meaning not suitable for the purpose (of sexual intercourse)
Construction na + alaṃ + kammaniya
Compound kammadhāraya (na + alaṅkammaniya)
Antonym alaṅkammaniya
Variant nālaṃkammaniya
Commentary (VIN 1.3.1) nālaṃ kammaniyan'ti na sakkā hoti methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevituṃ.
Sanskrit na + aram + karmaṇya
nālattha

aor. (+acc) did not get; did not obtain; did not receive [na + √labh + a + a] ✓

Grammar aor of na labhati, neg, trans (+acc)
Meaning did not get; did not obtain; did not receive
Root Family √labh
Root √labh･1 a (get)
Base √labh + a > labha > lattha (irreg)
Construction na + a + lattha + a
na + alattha
Phonetic Change labh > latth (Kacc 497, 477)
Antonym alattha
Sanskrit na + alāpsīt
Sanskrit Root √labh 1 (take)

alatthaṃ yadidaṃ sādhu,
n'ālatthaṃ kusalaṃ iti.
ubhayen'eva so tādī,
rukkhaṃ'v'upanivattati.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11

cirarattaṃ vat'ātāpī,
dhammaṃ anuvicintayaṃ,
samaṃ cittassa n'ālatthaṃ,
pucchaṃ samaṇabrāhmaṇe.

n'ālatthaṃ kusalaṃ iti.

rukkhaṃ'v'upanivattati.

AN 8.51 gotamīsuttaṃ
nālamariya

adj. not suitable for a noble person; not proper for an awakened one [na + alaṃ + ariya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, neg
Meaning not suitable for a noble person; not proper for an awakened one
Construction na + alaṃ + ariya
Compound kammadhāraya (na + alamariya)
Antonym alamariya
Commentary (DNa) na alamariyā'ti ariyabhāve asamatthā.
Sanskrit na + aram + ārya

ye dhammā kusalā kusalasaṅkhātā ye dhammā akusalā akusalasaṅkhātā ... ye dhammā n'ālamariyā n'ālamariyasaṅkhātā ye dhammā alamariyā alamariyasaṅkhātā, ty'āssa dhammā paññāya vodiṭṭhā honti vocaritā. idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, paññābalaṃ.

nālamariyasaṅkhāta

AN 9.5 balasuttaṃ
nālaṃ 1

ind. (+inf or +dat) not suitable (for); not worth [na + alaṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, comp, neg (+inf or +dat)
Meaning not suitable (for); not worth
Construction na + alaṃ
Antonym alaṃ
Sanskrit na + alam, aram

sabbe dhammā n'ālaṃ abhinivesāyā'ti

AN 7.61 pacalāyamānasuttaṃ

āhāranettippabhavaṃ,
n'ālaṃ tadabhinandituṃ,
tassa nissaraṇaṃ santaṃ,
atakk'āvacaraṃ dhuvaṃ.

ITI 43 ajātasuttaṃ
nālaṃ 2

tatr'āssutavā puthujjano n'ālaṃ nibbindituṃ n'ālaṃ virajjituṃ n'ālaṃ vimuccituṃ

SN 12.61 assutavāsuttaṃ

satt'ime kāyā akaṭā akaṭavidhā animmitā animmātā vañjhā kūṭaṭṭhā esikaṭṭhāyiṭṭhitā, te na iñjanti na vipariṇamanti na aññam'aññaṃ byābādhenti n'ālaṃ aññam'aññassa sukhāya vā dukkhāya vā sukhadukkhāya vā.

VIN PAT PC 68 ariṭṭhasikkhāpadaṃ
nālaṃvacanīya

adj. not separated; not estranged; not divorced [na + alaṃ + vacanīya] ~

Grammar adj, comp, neg
Meaning not separated; not estranged; not divorced
Construction na + alaṃ + vacanīya
Commentary (VMVt) alaṃvacanīyā hontī'ti itthī vā puriso vā ubho'pi vā jāyābhāve, sāmikabhāve ca nikkhittachandatāya accantaviyuttattā puna aññam'aññaṃ samāgam'atthaṃ, mā evaṃ akaritthā'tiādinā vacanīyatāya vattabbatāya alaṃ arahā'ti alaṃvacanīyā, alaṃ vā kattuṃ arahaṃ sandhānavacanam'etesu itthipurisesū'ti alaṃvacanīyā, sandhānakārassa vacanaṃ vinā asaṅgacchanakā pariccattāyevā'ti adhippāyo.
Sanskrit na + aram + vacanīya

Grammar nt, from na alika, neg
Meaning not untruth; not falsehood; not lies
Construction na + alika

masc. vegetable stalk [nāliya + sāka] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning vegetable stalk
Construction nāliya + sāka
Commentary (ANa) nibbattatelakan'ti vinivattitatelaṃ. nāliyasākan'ti sālipiṭṭhena saddhiṃ madditvā jīrak'ādisaṃyutte sappimhi pacitvā catumadhurena yojetvā vāsaṃ gāhāpetvā ṭhapitaṃ nāliyasākaṃ.
nāvakaṅkhati

pr. (+acc) does not desire; does not wish (for) [na + ava + √kaṅkh + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, from na avakaṅkhati, neg, trans (+acc)
Meaning does not desire; does not wish (for)
Root Family ava √kaṅkh
Root √kaṅkh･1 a (wish for)
Base √kaṅkh + a > kaṅkha
Construction na + ava + kaṅkha + ti
na + avakaṅkhati
Antonym avakaṅkhati
Variant nāpi kaṅkhati
Notes (MW) an-avakāṅkṣamāṇa, not wishing impatiently (said of ascetics who, having renounced all food, expect death without impatience), Jain.
Sanskrit avakāṅkṣati
Sanskrit Root √kāṅkṣ 1 (desire)

satthaṃ, āvuso sāriputta, āharissāmi, n'āvakaṅkhāmi jīvitan'ti.

Sanskrit avajānāti

yassa papañcā ṭhiti ca n'atthi,
sandānaṃ palighañ'ca vītivatto,
taṃ nittaṇhaṃ muniṃ carantaṃ,
n'āvajānāti sadevako'pi loko'ti.

sa pattapāṇi vicaranto,
amūgo mūgasammato,
appaṃ dānaṃ na hīḷeyya,
dātāraṃ n'āvajāniyā.

apadaṃ kena padena nessatha.

taṃ jano n'āvabujjhati.

SNP 39 kāmasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 1

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, sāmuddikāya nāvāya vettabandhanabaddhāya vassamāsāni udake pariyādāya hem'antikena thalaṃ ukkhittāya vāt'ātapaparetāni vettabandhanāni.

nāvākata

Meaning made into a boat; constructed into a raft

Sanskrit nāva + kata

asu hi, bhante, sālalaṭṭhi bahiddhā suparikammakatā, anto suvisuddhā nāvākatā phiy'ārittabaddhā. tass'etaṃ pāṭikaṅkhaṃ, nāvā na saṃsīdissati, puriso sotthinā pāraṃ gamissatī'ti.

tatth'āyaṃ samayo, gilānasamayo, cīvaradānasamayo, cīvarakārasamayo, addhānagamanasamayo, nāv'ābhiruhanasamayo, mahāsamayo, samaṇabhattasamayo, ayaṃ tattha samayo.

Meaning not entered the home (of)
