Sanskrit na + āvāsa + gata

ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu mutto cakkhuviññeyyehi rūpehi, n'āvāsagato mārassa, na mārassa vasaṃ gato, ummukk'assa mārapāso. mutto so mārabandhanena na yathākāmakaraṇīyo pāpimato.

VIN PAT NID nidānuddeso
nāviñchati

Grammar pr, from na āviñchati, neg, trans (+acc or +loc)
Meaning does not pull (towards); does not tug (to); does not incline (towards)

Construction na + ā + vi + añcha + ti

Antonym āviñchati
Variant nāviñjati
Notes possibly corruption of na āvañchati "does not wander towards"
Sanskrit na + āvañcati
Sanskrit Root √āñch 1 (tear)

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, yassa kassaci bhikkhuno kāyagatāsati bhāvitā bahulīkatā, taṃ cakkhu n'āviñchati manāpiyesu rūpesu, amanāpiyā rūpā nappaṭikūlā honti.

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ
nāvindakī

Meaning name of a minister
nāvutika

adj. ninety years old [navuti + *ika] ✓

Grammar adj, from navuti
Meaning ninety years old
Construction navuti > nāvuti + *ika
Derivative taddhita (*ika)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit navatikā

yato ca kho ayaṃ bhavaṃ puriso jiṇṇo hoti vuddho mahallako addhagato vayoanuppatto, āsītiko vā nāvutiko vā vassasatiko vā jātiyā, atha tamhā paññāveyyattiyā, parihāyatī'ti.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, tam'eva bhaginiṃ passeyya aparena samayena āsītikaṃ vā nāvutikaṃ vā vassasatikaṃ vā jātiyā, jiṇṇaṃ gopānasivaṅkaṃ bhoggaṃ daṇḍaparāyanaṃ pavedhamānaṃ gacchantiṃ āturaṃ gatayobbanaṃ khaṇḍadantaṃ palitakesaṃ, vilūnaṃ khalitasiraṃ valinaṃ tilak'āhatagattaṃ.

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ
nāvuso

sandhi. no friend; no brother ✗
nāsa

masc. ruin, destruction, death ✗
nāsakkhi

aor. (+inf) was unable (to); was incapable (of); was not possible (to) [na + √sak + ṇo + i] ✓

Grammar aor of na sakkoti, neg, intrans (+inf)
Meaning was unable (to); was incapable (of); was not possible (to)
Root Family √sak
Root √sak･4 ṇo (be able, powerful)
Base √sak + ṇo > sakṇo > sakkho (irreg)
Construction na + a + sakkho + i
na + asakkhi
Antonym asakkhi
Sanskrit na + aśakat
Sanskrit Root √śak 5 (be able)

accayāsi, brāhmaṇa, pañhaṃ, n'āsakkhi pañhassa pariyantaṃ gahetuṃ. nibbān'ogadhañ'hi, brāhmaṇa, brahmacariyaṃ vussati nibbānaparāyaṇaṃ nibbānapariyosānan'ti.

SN 48.42 uṇṇābhabrāhmaṇasuttaṃ

yato kho te bhikkhū n'āsakkhiṃsu ariṭṭhaṃ bhikkhuṃ gaddhabādhipubbaṃ etasmā pāpakā diṭṭhigatā vivecetuṃ, atha kho te bhikkhū yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
nāsacchidda

nt. nostril; lit. nose hole [nāsā + chidda] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning nostril; lit. nose hole
Construction nāsā + chidda
Compound sattamī tappurisa (nāsāyaṃ + chidda)
Commentary (MNa) kaṇṇacchiddan'ti maṃsalohit'ādīhi asamphuṭṭhakaṇṇavivaraṃ. nāsacchidd'ādīsu'pi es'eva nayo.
Sanskrit nāsāchidra

yaṃ ajjhattaṃ paccattaṃ ākāsaṃ ākāsagataṃ upādinnaṃ, seyyath'idaṃ, kaṇṇacchiddaṃ nāsacchiddaṃ mukhadvāraṃ, yena ca asitapītakhāyitasāyitaṃ ajjhoharati … ayaṃ vuccati, rāhula, ajjhattikā ākāsadhātu.

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ
nāsacchinna

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning whose nose is cut off; with amputated nose
Construction nāsā + chinna
Compound kammadhāraya > chaṭṭhī bahubbīhi (nāsā + chinna)
Sanskrit nāsā + chinna

dujjīvitaṃ nāma hatthacchinnassa pādacchinnassa hatthapādacchinnassa kaṇṇacchinnassa nāsacchinnassa kaṇṇanāsacchinnassa, iminā ca pāpakena iminā ca dujjīvitena mataṃ te jīvitā seyyo'ti.

VIN 1.1.3 tatiyapārājikaṃ
nāsato

fem. from the nose; through the nostrils [nāsā + ato] ✓

Grammar fem, abl sg of nāsā
Meaning from the nose; through the nostrils
Construction nāsā + ato
Sanskrit nāsāyāḥ

tassa mayhaṃ, aggivessana, etadahosi, yaṃnūn'āhaṃ appāṇakaṃ'y'eva jhānaṃ jhāyeyyan'ti. so kho ahaṃ, aggivessana, mukhato ca nāsato ca assāsapassāse uparundhiṃ.

yaṃ kho, āvuso visākha, kāyikaṃ vā cetasikaṃ vā n'eva sātaṃ n'āsātaṃ vedayitaṃ, ayaṃ adukkhamasukhā vedanā'ti.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
nāsikā

fem. nose [nāsā + ikā] ✓

Grammar fem, from nāsā
Meaning nose
Construction nāsā + ikā

Synonym ghānadhātu, natthu
Sanskrit nāsikya

brāhmaṇassa asiṃ ākaḍḍhitvā upasiṅghantassa maricacuṇṇāni nāsaṃ pavisitvā khipitu'kāmataṃ uppādesuṃ. tassa khipantassa nāsikā asidhārāya paṭihatā dvidhā chijji.

JAa 126 asilakkhaṇa jātakavaṇṇanā

taṃ yathā? cakkhu ca sotañ'ca cakkhusotaṃ, mukhañ'ca nāsikā ca mukhanāsikaṃ, chavi ca maṃsañ'ca lohitañ'ca chavimaṃsalohitaṃ. evaṃ pāṇy'aṅg'atthe.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 322
nāsikāloma

nt. nostril hair ✗
nāsikāsota

nt. nostril ✗
nāsita 1

Root √nas･3 *e (be lost, disappear)

Construction nāse + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit nāśita
Sanskrit Root √naś 4 (be lost)

yo pana bhikkhu jānaṃ tathānāsitaṃ samaṇ'uddesaṃ upalāpeyya vā, upaṭṭhāpeyya vā, sambhuñjeyya vā, saha vā seyyaṃ kappeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 70 kaṇṭakasikkhāpadaṃ

tathānāsitan'ti evaṃ nāsitaṃ.

VIN 2.5.7.10 kaṇṭakasikkhāpadaṃ

iti kho, bhikkhave, vivaṭo mayā khemo maggo sovatthiko pītigamanīyo, pihito kummaggo, ūhato okacaro, nāsitā okacārikā. yaṃ, bhikkhave, satthārā karaṇīyaṃ sāvakānaṃ hitesinā anukampakena anukampaṃ upādāya, kataṃ vo taṃ mayā.

AN 7.37 dutiyamittasuttaṃ
nāsiṃsatī

pr. (+acc) does not wish (for); does not hope (for); does not aspire (for) [na + ā + √siṃs + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr 3rd sg of na āsiṃsati, irreg form of nāsiṃsati, neg, trans (+acc)
Meaning does not wish (for); does not hope (for); does not aspire (for)
Root Family ā √siṃs
Root √siṃs･1 a (hope, wish)
Base √siṃs + a > siṃsa
Construction na + ā + siṃsa + ti
na + āsiṃsati > nāsiṃsatī
Phonetic Change with metrically lengthened ī
Antonym āsiṃsati
Variant nāsīsatī
Sanskrit na + āśaṃsati
Sanskrit Root √śaṃs 1 (praise)

tasmā have lokavidū sumedho,
lok'antagū vusitabrahmacariyo,
lokassa antaṃ samitāvi ñatvā,
n'āsiṃsatī lokam'imaṃ parañ'cā'ti.

AN 4.45 rohitassasuttaṃ

saññaṃ pariññā vitareyya oghaṃ,
pariggahesu muni n'opalitto,
abbūḷhasallo caram'appamatto,
n'āsiṃsatī lokam'imaṃ parañ'cā'ti.

SNP 40 guhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 2

tasmā have lokavidū sumedho,

n'āsīsatī lokam'imaṃ parañ'cā'ti.

Base √nas + *e > nāse (caus)
Construction nāse + ti
Sanskrit nāśayati
Sanskrit Root √naś 4 (be lost)

tass'eva kho pana, bhikkhave, mahato migasaṅghassa koci'd'eva puriso uppajjeyya atthakāmo hitakāmo yogakkhemakāmo. so yv'āssa maggo khemo sovatthiko pītigamanīyo taṃ maggaṃ vivareyya, pidaheyya kummaggaṃ, ūhaneyya okacaraṃ, nāseyya okacārikaṃ.

āsevitabbañ'ca vo, bhikkhave, dhammaṃ desessāmi n'āsevitabbañ'ca ... katamo ca, bhikkhave, n'āsevitabbo dhammo? micchādiṭṭhi, ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, n'āsevitabbo dhammo.

AN 10.194 āsevitabbadhammasuttaṃ
nāsesi

aor. killed, ruined, destroyed, expelled [√nas] ✗

Root Family √as
Root √as･1 a (be)
Construction na + √as + a
na + assa
Antonym assa
Sanskrit na + syāt
Sanskrit Root √as 2 (be)

pāṇimhi ce vaṇo n'āssa,
hareyya pāṇinā visaṃ,
n'ābbaṇaṃ visam'anveti,
n'atthi pāpaṃ akubbato.

DHP 124 pāpavaggo

pacchimāyaṃ, bhante, bhittiyan'ti. pacchimā ce, bhikkhave, bhitti n'āssa kv'āssa patiṭṭhitā'ti? pathaviyaṃ, bhante'ti. pathavī ce, bhikkhave, n'āssa kv'āssa patiṭṭhitā'ti? āpasmiṃ, bhante'ti. āpo ce, bhikkhave, n'āssa kv'āssa patiṭṭhitā'ti? appatiṭṭhitā, bhante'ti.

SN 12.64 atthirāgasuttaṃ
nāssa 2

sandhi. not to him; nor for him [na + assa] ✓

Meaning not to him; nor for him
Construction na + assa
Sanskrit na + asmai

na brāhmaṇassa pahareyya,
n'āssa muñcetha brāhmaṇo,
dhī brāhmaṇassa hantāraṃ,
tato dhī y'assa muñcati.

DHP 389 brāhmaṇavaggo

tam'enaṃ samannesamāno evaṃ jānāti, ñatt'ajjhāpanno ayam'āyasmā bhikkhu yasappatto, n'āssa idh'ekacce ādīnavā saṃvijjantī'ti.

MN 47 vīmaṃsakasuttaṃ
nāssa 3

sandhi. nor his [na + assa] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron, neg
Meaning nor his
Construction na + assa
Sanskrit na + asya

disvāna aññam'aññaṃ saṇṭhapesuṃ, ayaṃ kho, āvuso, samaṇo gotamo āgacchati bāhulliko padhānavibbhanto āvatto bāhullāya. so n'eva abhivādetabbo, na paccuṭṭhātabbo, n'āssa pattacīvaraṃ paṭiggahetabbaṃ.

AN 3.32 ānandasuttaṃ
nāssudha

sandhi. certainly did not in this case [na + ssu + idha] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + ind, neg
Meaning certainly did not in this case
Construction na + ssu + idha
Commentary (SNa) n'āssudhā'ti ettha assudhā'ti padapūraṇamatte avadhāraṇatthe vā nipāto, n'eva koci bhagavantaṃ upasaṅkamī'ti attho.
Sanskrit na + svid + iha

evaṃ, bhante'ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paṭissutvā n'āssudha koci bhagavantaṃ upasaṅkamati, aññatra ekena piṇḍapātanīhārakena.

Antonym ahamasmi
Sanskrit na + aham + asmi

sammukhā kho pana m'etaṃ bhagavato sutaṃ sammukhā paṭiggahitaṃ, abhay'ūparato'ham'asmi, n'āham'asmi bhay'ūparato, vītarāgattā kāme na sevāmi khayā rāgassā'ti.

MN 47 vīmaṃsakasuttaṃ
nāhaṃ

sandhi. I (am) not; I (do) not [na + ahaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron, neg
Meaning I (am) not; I (do) not
Construction na + ahaṃ
Antonym ahaṃ
Sanskrit na + ahaṃ

n'āhaṃ bhabbo etarahi,
kāmāni paṭisevituṃ,
anivatti bhavissāmi,
brahmacariyaparāyaṇo'ti.

AN 5.57 abhiṇhapaccavekkhitabbaṭhānasuttaṃ

n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammam'pi samanupassāmi yaṃ evaṃ lahuparivattaṃ yatha'y'idaṃ cittaṃ. yāvañ'c'idaṃ, bhikkhave, upamā'pi na sukarā yāva lahuparivattaṃ cittan'ti.

SN 1.48 paṇihitācchavaggo
nāhosi

aor. (+nom) was not; did not exist; did not become [na + √hū + a + si] ✓

Grammar aor of na hoti, neg, intrans (+nom)
Meaning was not; did not exist; did not become
Root Family √hū
Root √hū･1 a (be)
Base √hū + a > ho
Construction na + a + ho + si
na + ahosi
Phonetic Change ū > o
Antonym ahosi
Sanskrit bhū
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

disvāna taṇhaṃ aratiṃ ragañ'ca,
n'āhosi chando api methunasmiṃ,
kim'ev'idaṃ muttakarīsapuṇṇaṃ,
pādā'pi naṃ samphusituṃ na icche.

SNP 47 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 9

purimā, bhikkhave, koṭi na paññāyati avijjāya, ito pubbe avijjā n'āhosi, atha pacchā samabhavī'ti. evañ'c'etaṃ, bhikkhave, vuccati, atha ca pana paññāyati, idappaccayā avijjā'ti

AN 10.61 avijjāsuttaṃ

Meaning (of a flower) stalk; stem

Sanskrit nāla

bālā kumudanāḷehi,
pabbataṃ abhimatthatha,
giriṃ nakhena khanatha,
ayo dantehi khādatha.

VIN 1.4.3.1 pattasikkhāpadaṃ

atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo anupubbena nāḷik'odanaparamatāya saṇṭhāsi. atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo aparena samayena susallikhitagatto pāṇinā gattāni anumajjanto tāyaṃ velāyaṃ imaṃ udānaṃ udānesi

SN 3.13 doṇapākasuttaṃ
nāḷikodanaparama

nt. one bamboo measure of boiled rice at the very most [nāḷikā + odana + parama] ✓

Meaning one bamboo measure of boiled rice at the very most
Construction nāḷikā + odana + parama
Compound kammadhāraya (nāḷikodana + parama)
Sanskrit nāḍikā, nālikā + odana + parama

tesaṃ kho pana, bhikkhu, caturāsītiyā thālipākasahassānaṃ eko'y'eva so thālipāko hoti yato nāḷik'odanaparamaṃ bhuñjāmi tadupiyañ'ca sūpeyyaṃ.

SN 22.96 gomayapiṇḍasuttaṃ
nāḷikodanaparamatā

fem. one bamboo measure of boiled rice at the very most [nāḷikā + odana + paramatā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning one bamboo measure of boiled rice at the very most
Construction nāḷikā + odana + paramatā
Compound kammadhāraya (nāḷikodana + paramatā)
Variant nāḷikodanamattā
Commentary (SNa) nāḷik'odanaparamatāya saṇṭhāsī'ti so kira māṇavo divase divase tathāgatassa santikaṃ gacchati, dasabalassa vissāsiko ahosi. atha naṃ ekadivasaṃ pucchi rājā kittakaṃ bhuñjatī'ti? so nāḷik'odanan'ti āha. vaṭṭissati ettāvatā purisabhāgo esa, ito paṭṭhāya gāthaṃ mā vadī'ti. iti rājā tatth'eva saṇṭhāsi.
Sanskrit nāḍikā, nālikā + odana + paramatā

atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo anupubbena nāḷik'odanaparamatāya saṇṭhāsi. atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo aparena samayena susallikhitagatto pāṇinā gattāni anumajjanto tāyaṃ velāyaṃ imaṃ udānaṃ udānesi

AN 8.30 anuruddha mahāvitakkasuttaṃ

yato ca kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu … catunnañ'ca jhānānaṃ ābhicetasikānaṃ diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārānaṃ nikāmalābhī hoti akicchalābhī akasiralābhī … evaṃ so ten'aṅgena paripūro hoti.

AN 10.8 jhānasuttaṃ

Meaning desiring; craving; longing (for)

Root √kam･8 *aya (desire)

Construction ni + kāmaya + māna

Phonetic Change a > ā
Commentary (MNa) nikāmayamānā'ti patthayamānā.
Sanskrit nikāmayamāna
Sanskrit Root √kam 3, 5 (love)

siyā kho pana, bhante, idh'ekaccassa āyasmato evam'assa, lābhasakkārasilokaṃ nūna ayam'āyasmā nikāmayamāno pavivek'ādhimutto'ti. na kho pan'etaṃ, bhante, evaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ.

AN 6.55 soṇasuttaṃ

ye kho keci samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā lābhasakkārasilokaṃ nikāmayamānā araññavanapatthāni pantāni sen'āsanāni paṭisevanti, lābhasakkārasilokanikāmanasandosahetu have te bhonto samaṇabrāhmaṇā akusalaṃ bhayabheravaṃ avhāyanti.

MN 4 bhayabheravasuttaṃ
nikāmalābhī

adj. who easily gets; who gains at will; lit. gaining one's desire [nikāma + lābhī] ✓

Meaning who easily gets; who gains at will; lit. gaining one's desire

AN 8.30 anuruddha mahāvitakkasuttaṃ

yato ca kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu … catunnañ'ca jhānānaṃ ābhicetasikānaṃ diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārānaṃ nikāmalābhī hoti akicchalābhī akasiralābhī … evaṃ so ten'aṅgena paripūro hoti.

Meaning pleasant sleep; comfortable rest

Commentary (DHPa) na nikāmaseyyan'ti yathā icchati, evaṃ seyyaṃ alabhitvā anicchitaṃ parittakam'eva kālaṃ seyyaṃ labhati.

cattāri ṭhānāni naro pamatto,
āpajjati paradār'ūpasevī,
apuññalābhaṃ na nikāmaseyyaṃ,
nindaṃ tatīyaṃ nirayaṃ catutthaṃ.

DHP22 nirayavaggo
nikāmeti

pr. (+acc) desires; craves; longs (for) [ni + √kam + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning desires; craves; longs (for)
Root Family ni √kam
Root √kam･8 *e (desire)
Base √kam + *e > kāme
Construction ni + kāme + ti
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit nikāmayate
Sanskrit Root √kam 3, 5 (love)

yo hi koci, bhikkhave, bhikkhu uppannaṃ lābhasakkārasilokaṃ assādeti nikāmeti, ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu giddho papatāya anayaṃ āpanno byasanaṃ āpanno yathākāmakaraṇīyo pāpimato.

SN 17.3 kummasuttaṃ

so tadassādeti, taṃ nikāmeti, tena ca vittiṃ āpajjati. tattha ṭhito tadadhimutto tabbahulavihārī aparihīno kālaṃ kurumāno brahmakāyikānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjati.

AN 4.123 paṭhamanānākaraṇasuttaṃ
nikāya 1

Meaning group; type; class; order
Root Family ni √ci
Root √ci･5 nā (gather, accumulate)
Construction ni + √ci > ki > kay + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change c > k
i > ay
Sanskrit nikāya
Sanskrit Root √ci 1, 2, 5 (gather)

n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekanikāyam'pi samanupassāmi evaṃ cittaṃ yatha'y'idaṃ, bhikkhave, tiracchānagatā pāṇā, te'pi kho, bhikkhave, tiracchānagatā pāṇā citten'eva cittitā, tehi'pi kho, bhikkhave, tiracchānagatehi pāṇehi cittaññ'eva cittataraṃ.

SN 22.100 dutiyagaddulabaddhasuttaṃ

katamā ca, bhikkhave, jāti? yā tesaṃ tesaṃ sattānaṃ tamhi tamhi sattanikāye jāti sañjāti okkanti abhinibbatti khandhānaṃ pātubhāvo āyatanānaṃ paṭilābho, ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, jāti.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
nikkaḍḍhati

Construction nī + kaḍḍha + ti
Phonetic Change īk > ikk
Sanskrit niṣkarṣati
Sanskrit Root √kṛṣ 1, 6 (drag, plough)

yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhuṃ kupito anattamano saṅghikā vihārā nikkaḍḍheyya vā nikkaḍḍhāpeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 17 nikkaḍḍhanasikkhāpadaṃ

nikkaḍḍheyyā'ti gabbhe gahetvā pamukhaṃ nikkaḍḍhati, āpatti pācittiyassa. pamukhe gahetvā bahi nikkaḍḍhati, āpatti pācittiyassa. ekena payogena bahuke'pi dvāre atikkāmeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.

atthaddhā susamāhitā,

sammāsambuddhadesite'ti.

Antonym anikkhanta
Sanskrit niṣkrānta
Sanskrit Root √kram 1, 4 (stride)

atha kho āyasmā ānando abhikkantāya rattiyā, nikkhante paṭhame yāme, uṭṭhāy'āsanā ek'aṃsaṃ uttar'āsaṅgaṃ karitvā yena bhagavā ten'añjaliṃ paṇāmetvā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ
nikkhanta 3

pp. (+abl) got away; escaped; lit. gone out [nī + √kam + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of nikkhamati (+abl)
Meaning got away; escaped; lit. gone out
Root Family nī √kam
Root √kam･1 a (go)
√ In Comps kkam
Construction nī + √kam > kham + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change īk > ikk
k > kh (Kacc 20, 27)
m > n
Antonym anikkhanta
Sanskrit niṣkrānta
Sanskrit Root √kram 1, 4 (stride)

manussānaṃ vārentānaṃ vārentānam'eva saṭṭhisahassā balavagāvo ca saṭṭhisahassā dhenuyo ca nikkhantā

DHPa 1.4.8 visākhā vatthu
nikkhantasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 8.1 (SN8.1) ✗
nikkhanti

fem. getting out; coming out; emergence [nī + √kam] ✗
nikkhama

masc. going out, departure ✗

Phonetic Change īk > ikkh
k > kh (Kacc 20, 27)
Antonym pavisati

SN 8.2 aratisuttaṃ

yaṃ ajjhattaṃ paccattaṃ ākāsaṃ ākāsagataṃ upādinnaṃ, seyyath'idaṃ … yena ca asitapītakhāyitasāyitaṃ adhobhāgaṃ nikkhamati … ayaṃ vuccati, rāhula, ajjhattikā ākāsadhātu.

UD 10 bāhiyasuttaṃ

atha kho, āvuso, rājā pasenadi kosalo sāvatthiyā nikkhamitvā antepuradvārā paṭhamaṃ rathavinītaṃ abhiruheyya, paṭhamena rathavinītena dutiyaṃ rathavinītaṃ pāpuṇeyya, paṭhamaṃ rathavinītaṃ vissajjeyya dutiyaṃ rathavinītaṃ abhiruheyya.

Sanskrit nikṣipta
Sanskrit Root √kṣip 6 (throw)

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, yavakalāpī cātumahāpathe nikkhittā assa. atha cha purisā āgaccheyyuṃ byābhaṅgihatthā. te yavakalāpiṃ chahi byābhaṅgīhi haneyyuṃ. evañ'hi sā, bhikkhave, yavakalāpī suhatā assa chahi byābhaṅgīhi haññamānā.

SN 35.248 yavakalāpisuttaṃ

nikkhittamaṇisuvaṇṇā samaṇā sakyaputtiyā apetajātarūparajatā'ti.

√ In Comps kkhip

Commentary (SNa) paṇḍukambale nikkhitto'ti rattakambale ṭhapito.
Sanskrit nikṣipta
Sanskrit Root √kṣip 6 (throw)

seyyathā'pi, brāhmaṇa, udapatto āvilo luḷito kalalībhūto andhakāre nikkhitto. tattha cakkhumā puriso sakaṃ mukhanimittaṃ paccavekkhamāno yathābhūtaṃ na jāneyya na passeyya.

SN 46.55 saṅgāravasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi nāma maṇi veḷuriyo subho jātimā aṭṭh'aṃso suparikammakato paṇḍukambale nikkhitto bhāsate ca tapate ca virocati ca

Meaning abandoned duty (towards); shirking responsibility (towards); not taking responsibility (for); lit. put down the yoke-pole

Antonym anikkhittadhura
Sanskrit nikṣipta + dhura

ye'me, bho gotama, puggalā ... sāmaññe anapekkhavanto sikkhāya na tibbagāravā bāhulikā sāthalikā okkamane pubbaṅ'gamā paviveke nikkhittadhurā ... na tehi bhavaṃ gotamo saddhiṃ saṃvasati.

MN 107 gaṇakamoggallānasuttaṃ

idh'āvuso satthu pavivittassa viharato sāvakā vivekaṃ n'ānusikkhanti, yesañ'ca dhammānaṃ satthā pahānam'āha, te ca dhamme nappajahanti, bāhulikā ca honti, sāthalikā, okkamane pubbaṅ'gamā, paviveke nikkhittadhurā

Grammar masc, comp (+acc)

Construction nikkhitta + matta

Commentary (VINa) dhuraṃ nikkhittamatte'ti dhure nikkhittamatte. sace'pi dhuraṃ nikkhipitvā pacchā āroceti, na rakkhati, dhuraṃ nikkhittamatte'y'eva pācittiyan'ti vuttaṃ hoti.
Sanskrit nikṣipta + mātra

paṭicchādeyyā'ti, imaṃ jānitvā codessanti, sāressanti khuṃsessanti, vambhessanti, maṅkuṃ karissanti n'ārocessāmī'ti dhuraṃ nikkhittamatte, āpatti pācittiyassa.

Antonym upādiyati

na kho pan'āhaṃ, sāriputta, ettāvatā saupavajjo'ti vadāmi. yo kho, sāriputta, tañ'ca kāyaṃ nikkhipati, aññañ'ca kāyaṃ upādiyati, tam'ahaṃ saupavajjo'ti vadāmi.

SN 35.87 channasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, rāhula, pathaviyā sucim'pi nikkhipanti, asucim'pi nikkhipanti, gūthagatam'pi nikkhipanti, muttagatam'pi nikkhipanti, kheḷagatam'pi nikkhipanti, pubbagatam'pi nikkhipanti, lohitagatam'pi nikkhipanti, na ca tena pathavī aṭṭīyati vā harāyati vā jigucchati vā.

n'ābhinandāmi jīvitaṃ,

sampajāno patissato.

TH 259 sāriputtattheragāthā

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso yaṃ imasmiṃ jambudīpe tiṇakaṭṭhasākhāpalāsaṃ taṃ chetvā ekajjhaṃ saṃharitvā caturaṅgulaṃ caturaṅgulaṃ ghaṭikaṃ katvā nikkhipeyya

Sanskrit Root √kṣip 6 (throw)

tam'enaṃ sāmikā gandhaparibhāvite karaṇḍake nikkhipanti. yo'pi'ssa hoti anusahagato ūsagandho vā khāragandho vā gomayagandho vā asamūhato, so'pi samugghātaṃ gacchati.

SN 22.89 khemakasuttaṃ

accekaṃ maññamānena bhikkhunā paṭiggahetabbaṃ, paṭiggahetvā yāva cīvarakālasamayaṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ. tato ce uttari nikkhipeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT NP 28 accekacīvarasikkhāpadaṃ
nikkhipana

nikkhipanta

Sanskrit Root √kṣip 6 (throw)

VIN PAT NP 3 akālacīvarasikkhāpadaṃ

accekaṃ maññamānena bhikkhunā paṭiggahetabbaṃ, paṭiggahetvā yāva cīvarakālasamayaṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ. tato ce uttari nikkhipeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

nikkhipitabba 2

Sanskrit nikṣepitum
Sanskrit Root √kṣip 6 (throw)
nikkhipitvā 1

abs. (+acc) having placed down; having dropped; having deposited; lit. having thrown down [ni + √khip + itvā] ✓

Grammar abs of nikkhipati, trans (+acc)
Meaning having placed down; having dropped; having deposited; lit. having thrown down
Root Family ni √khip
Root √khip･1 a (throw)
√ In Comps kkhip
Construction ni + √khip + itvā
Sanskrit nikṣiptvā
Sanskrit Root √kṣip 6 (throw)

nikkhipitvā garuṃ bhāraṃ,
aññaṃ bhāraṃ anādiya,
samūlaṃ taṇham'abbuyha,
nicchāto parinibbuto'ti.

SN 22.22 bhārasuttaṃ

so na khulukhulukārakaṃ pattaṃ dhovati, na samparivattakaṃ pattaṃ dhovati, na pattaṃ bhūmiyaṃ nikkhipitvā hatthe dhovati, hatthesu dhotesu patto dhoto hoti, patte dhote hatthā dhotā honti.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
nikkhipitvā 2

abs. (+acc) having kept aside; having left aside; having disregarded; lit. having thrown down [ni + √khip + itvā] ✓

Grammar abs of nikkhipati, trans (+acc)
Meaning having kept aside; having left aside; having disregarded; lit. having thrown down
Root Family ni √khip
Root √khip･1 a (throw)
√ In Comps kkhip
Construction ni + √khip + itvā
Sanskrit nikṣiptvā
Sanskrit Root √kṣip 6 (throw)

so kho ahaṃ, bhante, sakaṃ cittaṃ nikkhipitvā imesaṃ'y'eva āyasmantānaṃ cittassa vasena vattāmi. nānā hi kho no, bhante, kāyā ekañ'ca pana maññe cittan'ti.

MN 31 cūḷagosiṅgasuttaṃ
nikkhipitvā 3

abs. (+acc) having given up [ni + √khip] ✗
nikkhipitvāna

abs. (+acc) having placed down; having dropped; having deposited; having set aside; lit. having thrown down [ni + √khip + itvāna] ✓

Grammar abs of nikkhipati, trans (+acc)
Meaning having placed down; having dropped; having deposited; having set aside; lit. having thrown down
Root Family ni √khip
Root √khip･1 a (throw)
√ In Comps kkhip
Construction ni + √khip + itvāna
Sanskrit nikṣiptvā
Sanskrit Root √kṣip 6 (throw)

tassa taṃ vacanaṃ sutvā,
abbhutaṃ lomahaṃsanaṃ,
satthāni nikkhipitvāna,
māṇavā etadabravuṃ.

TH 248 adhimuttattheragāthā
nikkhippa

ger. (+acc) dropping; discarding; setting aside; lit. throwing down [ni + √khip + ya] ✓

Grammar ger of nikkhipati, trans (+acc)
Meaning dropping; discarding; setting aside; lit. throwing down
Root Family ni √khip
Root √khip･1 a (throw)
√ In Comps kkhip
Construction ni + √khip + ya
Phonetic Change y > p
Sanskrit nikṣipya
Sanskrit Root √kṣip 6 (throw)

sutvāna corā isino subhāsitaṃ,
nikkhippa satthāni ca āvudhāni ca,
tamhā ca kammā viramiṃsu eke,
eke ca pabbajjam'arocayiṃsu.

TH 248 adhimuttattheragāthā
nikkhippagāmī

adj. laid down when one goes ✗
nikkhepa 1

Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit nikṣepa
Sanskrit Root √kṣip 6 (throw)

katamañ'ca, bhikkhave, maraṇaṃ? yaṃ tesaṃ tesaṃ sattānaṃ tamhā tamhā sattanikāyā cuti cavanatā bhedo antaradhānaṃ maccu maraṇaṃ kālakiriyā khandhānaṃ bhedo kaḷevarassa nikkhepo jīvitindriyassupacchedo, idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, maraṇaṃ

Sanskrit nikṣepaṇa
Sanskrit Root √kṣip 6 (throw)

SN 35.236 paṭhamahatthapādopamasuttaṃ

bhārañ'ca vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi bhārahārañ'ca bhār'ādānañ'ca bhāranikkhepanañ'ca. taṃ suṇātha. katamo ca, bhikkhave, bhāro?

SN 12.61 assutavāsuttaṃ
nikkhepanadhamma

Compound kammadhāraya (nikkhepana + dhamma)
Commentary (SNa) nikkhepanadhammo'ti nikkhipitabbasabhāvo.
Sanskrit nikṣepaṇa + dharma

ye'pi te, mahārāja, bhikkhū arahanto khīṇ'āsavā vusitavanto katakaraṇīyā ohitabhārā anuppattasadatthā parikkhīṇabhavasaṃyojanā samma'd'aññāvimuttā, tesaṃ'p'āyaṃ kāyo bhedanadhammo nikkhepanadhammo'ti.

VIN 1.2.6 kuṭikārasikkhāpadaṃ

vāsīhi tacchetvā nikhādanaṃ ādāya anto suvisodhitaṃ visodheyya, anto suvisodhitaṃ visodhetvā lekhaṇiyā likheyya, lekhaṇiyā likhitvā pāsāṇaguḷena dhoveyya, pāsāṇaguḷena dhovetvā nāvaṃ kareyya, nāvaṃ katvā phiy'ārittaṃ bandheyya, phiy'ārittaṃ bandhitvā nadiṃ patāreyya.

madhuvā maññati bālo,
yāva pāpaṃ na paccati,
yadā ca paccati pāpaṃ,
bālo dukkhaṃ nigacchati.

DHP 69 bālavaggo

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco aḍḍhakahāpaṇena'pi bandhanaṃ nigacchati, kahāpaṇena'pi bandhanaṃ nigacchati, kahāpaṇasatena'pi bandhanaṃ nigacchati.

AN 3.101 loṇakapallasuttaṃ
nigacchi

aor. underwent, came to [ni + √gam] ✗
nigaṇṭha 1

masc. Jain; naked ascetic; lit. free from ties [ni + √ganth + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from gaṇṭha

Root Family ni √ganth
Root √ganth･8 *e (tie, bind)

Phonetic Change nth > ṇṭh
Variant nigantha
Commentary (MNa) amhākaṃ gaṇṭhanakileso palibujjhanakileso n'atthi, kilesagaṇṭharahitā mayan'ti evaṃ vāditāya laddhanāmavasena nigaṇṭho.
Notes sk nir √grantha "free from knots" pāḷi ni √gaṇṭha "tied down"
Sanskrit nirgrantha
Sanskrit Root √granth √grath 1, 7, 9 (tie)

tena kho pana samayena satta ca jaṭilā satta ca nigaṇṭhā satta ca acelakā satta ca ekasāṭakā satta ca paribbājakā parūḷhakacchanakhalomā khārivividham'ādāya bhagavato avidūre atikkamanti.

SN 3.11 sattajaṭilasuttaṃ

tena kho pana samayena sambahulā nigaṇṭhā isigilipasse kāḷasilāyaṃ ubbhaṭṭhakā honti āsanapaṭikkhittā, opakkamikā dukkhā tibbā kharā kaṭukā vedanā vedayanti.

ye c'āp'ime makkhalipūraṇāse,
gaṇassa satthāro sāmaññappattā,
na hi nūna te sappurisehi dūre'ti.

SN 2.30 nānātitthiyasāvakasuttaṃ

atha kho nīko devaputto nigaṇṭhaṃ nāṭaputtaṃ ārabbha bhagavato santike imaṃ gāthaṃ abhāsi

Sanskrit nirgrantha + śrāvaka

ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sakkesu viharati kapilavatthusmiṃ nigrodh'ārāme. atha kho vappo sakko nigaṇṭhasāvako yen'āyasmā mahāmoggallāno ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ mahāmoggallānaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdi.

DN 9.1 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, poṭṭhapādaparibbājakavatthu
nigamaghāta 1

masc. plundering of a town, marauding ✗
nigamaghāta 2

masc. town raider; market town looter ✗
nigamana 1

nt. explaining; quoting [ni + √gam + ana] ~

Grammar nt, act, from nigacchati
Meaning explaining; quoting
Root Family ni √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction ni + √gam + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Sanskrit nigamana
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

Commentary (VINa) gāmena pūjitaṃ gāmassa vā pūjitan'ti gāmapūjitaṃ. es'eva nayo sesapadesu'pi.
nigamabandhana

Construction nigama + bandhana

Sanskrit nigama + bandhana

bandheyyuṃ vā'ti rajjubandhanena vā andubandhanena vā saṅkhalikabandhanena vā gharabandhanena vā nagarabandhanena vā gāmabandhanena vā nigamabandhanena vā bandheyyuṃ, purisaguttiṃ vā kareyyuṃ.

prp. rebuking, censuring, restraining [ni + √gah] ✗

√ In Comps ggah
Base √gah + ṇhā > gaṇhā
Construction ni + gaṇhā + ti
Sanskrit nigṛhṇāti
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)

nāsāyaṃ suggahitaṃ gahetvā uparighaṭāyaṃ suniggahitaṃ niggaṇheyya. uparighaṭāyaṃ suniggahitaṃ niggahetvā daṇḍena sutāḷitaṃ tāḷeyya. daṇḍena sutāḷitaṃ tāḷetvā osajjeyya.

SN 35.246 vīṇopamasuttaṃ

so passeyya mahantaṃ alagaddaṃ. tam'enaṃ ajapadena daṇḍena suniggahitaṃ niggaṇheyya. ajapadena daṇḍena suniggahitaṃ niggahitvā, gīvāya suggahitaṃ gaṇheyya.

niggatā janā asmā gāmā so'yaṃ niggatajano, gāmo.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 328
niggama

yogena niggayha pathe nivesiya,
disvā samudayaṃ vibhavañ'ca sambhavaṃ,
dāy'ādako hehisi aggavādino.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

tasmiṃ pahīne tasmiṃ byantīkate ath'āparaṃ dhammavitakk'āvasissati. so hoti samādhi na c'eva santo na ca paṇīto nappaṭippassaddhaladdho na ekodibhāv'ādhigato sasaṅkhāraniggayhavāritagato hoti.

niggayhavādiṃ medhāviṃ,
t'ādisaṃ paṇḍitaṃ bhaje,
t'ādisaṃ bhajamānassa,
seyyo hoti na pāpiyo.

abbhāsassa ante niggahita-āgamo hoti vā. caṅkamati, cañcalati, jaṅgamati. vā'ti kim'atthaṃ? pivāsati, daddallati.

kīvanto tattha bheravā,

nigghose sayan'āsane.

SN 35.245 kiṃsukopamasuttaṃ

khandhabījaṃ nāma, assattho, nigrodho, pilakkho, udumbaro, kacchako, kapitthano, yāni vā pan'aññāni'pi atthi khandhe jāyanti, khandhe sañjāyanti, etaṃ khandhabījaṃ nāma.

Sanskrit nyagrodha
Sanskrit Root √ruh 1 (ascend)

siyā kho pana te, nigrodha, evam'assa, antevāsikamyatā no samaṇo gotamo evam'āhā'ti. na kho pan'etaṃ, nigrodha, evaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ. yo eva vo ācariyo, so eva vo ācariyo hotu.

DN 25 udumbarikasuttaṃ
nigrodhakappa

masc. name of a monk; preceptor of Vaṅgīsa [nigrodha + kappa] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of a monk; preceptor of Vaṅgīsa
Construction nigrodha + kappa
Commentary (SNa) nigrodhakappenā'ti nigrodharukkhamūlavāsinā kappattherena.
nigrodhakappasutta

nt. Sutta Nipāta 2.12 (SNP 24) ✗
nigrodhattheragāthā

fem. Theragāthā 21 (TH21) ✗

Construction nigrodha + paribbājaka + vatthu
nigrodhaparimaṇḍala

adj. with round and well proportioned limbs; nineteenth of the thirty-two marks of a great man; lit. like the circumference of a banyan tree [nigrodha + parimaṇḍala] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with round and well proportioned limbs; nineteenth of the thirty-two marks of a great man; lit. like the circumference of a banyan tree

Compound kammadhāraya (nigrodha viya parimaṇḍala)
Commentary (MNa) nigrodhaparimaṇḍalo'ti nigrodho viya parimaṇḍalo.
Sanskrit nyagrodha + parimaṇḍala, nyagrodhaparimaṇḍala (bsk)

nigrodhaparimaṇḍalo kho pana so bhavaṃ gotamo, yāvatakv'assa kāyo tāvatakv'assa byāmo, yāvatakv'assa byāmo tāvatakv'assa kāyo, idam'pi tassa bhoto gotamassa mahāpurisassa mahāpurisalakkhaṇaṃ bhavati.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

ayañ'hi, deva, kumāro nigrodhaparimaṇḍalo yāvatakv'assa kāyo tāvatakv'assa byāmo, yāvatakv'assa byāmo, tāvatakv'assa kāyo

SN 55.21 paṭhamamahānāmasuttaṃ

atha kho bhagavā sāyanhasamayaṃ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito yena nigrodh'ārāmo ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.

nigha

tiṇṇaṃ vedānaṃ pāragū sanighaṇḍukeṭubhānaṃ s'ākkharappabhedānaṃ itihāsapañcamānaṃ, padako, veyyākaraṇo, lok'āyatamahāpurisalakkhaṇesu anavayo.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

yathā vā pana, mahārāja, brāhmaṇamāṇavakānaṃ iruvedaṃ yajuvedaṃ sāmavedaṃ athabbaṇavedaṃ lakkhaṇaṃ itihāsaṃ purāṇaṃ nighaṇḍu keṭubhaṃ ... sikkhā karaṇīyā

MIL 4.3.7 buddhapūjanapañho
nighāta

masc. striking down, destroying ✗
nighāti

fem. dejection; defeat; loss; lit. beat down [ni + √ghaṭ + *i] ✓

Grammar fem, from nigghāteti
Meaning dejection; defeat; loss; lit. beat down
Root Family ni √ghaṭ
Root √ghaṭ･8 *e (strike, kill)
Construction ni + √ghaṭ > ghāṭ + *i
Derivative kita (*i)
Phonetic Change a > ā
ṭ > t
Antonym ugghāti
Commentary (NIDD1) etesu ugghātinighāti hotī'ti. jayaparājayo hoti, lābh'ālābho hoti, yas'āyaso hoti, nind'āpasaṃsā hoti, sukhadukkhaṃ hoti, somanassadomanassaṃ hoti, iṭṭh'āniṭṭhaṃ hoti, anunayapaṭighaṃ hoti, ugghātitanigghātitaṃ hoti, anurodhavirodho hoti
Sanskrit nighātin
Sanskrit Root √han √ghaṭ 1, 2, 8 (smite)

ete vivādā samaṇesu jātā,
etesu ugghāti nighāti hoti,
etam'pi disvā virame kath'ojjaṃ,
na h'añña'd'atth'atthipasaṃsalābhā.

AN 7.59 kimilasuttaṃ
nicca

adj. permanent; lasting; continuous; ordered; stable; reliable; regular; immutable [ni + tya] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning permanent; lasting; continuous; ordered; stable; reliable; regular; immutable
Construction ni + tya
Derivative taddhita (tya)
Phonetic Change ty > cc
Antonym anicca
Commentary (MNa) nicco'ti uppādavayarahito.
Notes MW suggests from ni √jan
Sanskrit nitya

buddho ce me varaṃ dajjā,
so ca labbhetha me varo,
gaṇhe'haṃ sabbalokassa,
niccaṃ kāyagataṃ satiṃ.

TH 225 lakuṇḍaka bhaddiyattheragāthā

anicce, bhikkhave, niccan'ti saññāvipallāso cittavipallāso diṭṭhivipallāso. dukkhe, bhikkhave, sukhan'ti saññāvipallāso cittavipallāso diṭṭhivipallāso.

Sanskrit nitya + kalpam

evaṃ vutte, āyasmā mahācundo āyasmantaṃ channaṃ etadavoca, tasmā't'iha, āvuso channa, idam'pi tassa bhagavato sāsanaṃ niccakappaṃ sādhukaṃ manasi kātabbaṃ

SN 35.87 channasuttaṃ

so kho ahaṃ, aggivessana, tassā'y'eva kathāya pariyosāne, tasmiṃ'y'eva purimasmiṃ samādhinimitte ajjhattam'eva cittaṃ saṇṭhapemi sannisādemi ekodiṃ karomi samādahāmi, yena sudaṃ niccakappaṃ viharāmī'ti.

paravajj'ānupassissa,

kara'icc'etassa dhātussa sapaccayassa kāh'ādeso hoti vā bhavissantimhi vibhattimhi, ssassa ca niccaṃ lopo hoti. kāhati, kāhiti, kāhasi, kāhisi, kāhāmi, kāhāma. vā'ti kim'atthaṃ? karissati, karissanti.

ucc'āvacā niccharanti,
dāye aggisikh'ūpamā,
nāriyo muniṃ palobhenti,
tāsu taṃ mā palobhayuṃ.

mahāvaggo 11

c > ch (Kacc 20, 27)
Sanskrit niścarati
Sanskrit Root √car 1 (move)

aṭṭh'aṅgasamannāgato kho pan'assa bhoto gotamassa mukhato ghoso niccharati, vissaṭṭho ca, viññeyyo ca, mañju ca, savanīyo ca, bindu ca, avisārī ca, gambhīro ca, ninnādī ca.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

yathāparisaṃ kho pana so bhavaṃ gotamo sarena viññāpeti, na c'assa bahiddhā parisāya ghoso niccharati.

app'icchassa alolupo,

aniccho hoti nibbuto.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11

c > ch (Kacc 20, 27)
a > ā

Sanskrit Root √car 1 (move)

puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu kodhano hoti kodhasāmantā vācaṃ nicchāretā. yam'p'āvuso, bhikkhu kodhano hoti kodhasāmantā vācaṃ nicchāretā, ayam'pi dhammo dovacassakaraṇo.

c > ch (Kacc 20, 27)
a > ā
Sanskrit niścārayati
Sanskrit Root √car 1 (move)

so taṃ paṭiggaṇheyya, paṭiggahetvā pārupeyya, pārupetvā attamano attamanavācaṃ nicchāreyya, chekaṃ vata, bho, odātaṃ vatthaṃ abhirūpaṃ nimmalaṃ sucī'ti!

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ

tatr'āpi te, phagguna, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ, na c'eva me cittaṃ vipariṇataṃ bhavissati, na ca pāpikaṃ vācaṃ nicchāressāmi, hit'ānukampī ca viharissāmi mettacitto, na dos'antaro'ti.

Sanskrit niścar
Sanskrit Root √car 1 (move)

atha kho, āvuso, paṇḍuputto ājīvako purāṇayānakāraputto attamano attamanavācaṃ nicchāresi, hadayā hadayaṃ maññe aññāya tacchatī'ti.

MN 5 anaṅgaṇasuttaṃ

kiṃ, je, divātaraṃ uṭṭhāsī'ti? na khv'ayye, kiñcī'ti. no vata re kiñci, pāpi dāsi, divātaraṃ uṭṭhāsī'ti kupitā anattamanā anattamanavācaṃ nicchāresi.

MN 21 kakacūpamasuttaṃ
nicchuddha

pp. thrown out; expelled [nī + √chubh] ✗
niccheyya

ger. (+acc and +loc) evaluating; ascertaining; discriminating; distinguishing the difference (between); lit. picking away [nī + √ci + *ya] ✓

Grammar ger of nicchināti, intrans (+acc and +loc)
Meaning evaluating; ascertaining; discriminating; distinguishing the difference (between); lit. picking away
Root Family nī √ci
Root √ci･5 nā (gather, accumulate)
Construction nī + √ci > chay + *ya
Phonetic Change c > ch (Kacc 20, 27)
īch > icch
i > ay
Sanskrit niścitya
Sanskrit Root √ci 1, 2, 5 (gather)

na tena hoti dhammaṭṭho,
yen'atthaṃ sāhasā naye,
yo ca atthaṃ anatthañ'ca,
ubho niccheyya paṇḍito.

DHP 256 dhammaṭṭhavaggo

diṭṭhīnivesā na hi svātivattā,
dhammesu niccheyya samuggahītaṃ,
tasmā naro tesu nivesanesu,
nirassatī ādiyatī ca dhammaṃ.

SNP 41 duṭṭhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 3
nicchoṭeti

pr. (+acc) tramples; stomps; smashed; crushes [nī + √chuṭ + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning tramples; stomps; smashed; crushes
Root Family nī √chuṭ
Root √chuṭ･8 *e (cut off)
√ In Comps cchuṭ
Base √chuṭ + *e > choṭe
Construction nī + choṭe + ti
Phonetic Change u > o
īch > icch
Variant nipphoṭeti, nicchodeti, nicchadeti
Notes mismatch between root, on the one hand, and sanskrit and contextual meaning on the other. root meaning would be "cuts off".
Sanskrit nir + kṣodayati
Sanskrit Root √chuṭ 10 (cut)

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, pabbajalāyako pabbajaṃ lāyitvā agge gahetvā odhunāti niddhunāti nicchoṭeti

SN 22.102 aniccasaññāsuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi nāma balavā soṇḍikādhutto vālaṃ kaṇṇe gahetvā odhuneyya niddhuneyya nicchoṭeyya evam'ev'āhaṃ samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ vādena vādaṃ odhunissāmi niddhunissāmi nicchoṭessāmi.

MN 35 cūḷasaccakasuttaṃ
nijigiṃsāna

prp. (+acc) desiring; wanting to get; lit. wanting to conquer [ni + √ji + sa + āna] ✓

Grammar prp of nijigiṃsati, desid, trans (+acc)
Meaning desiring; wanting to get; lit. wanting to conquer
Root Family ni √ji
Root √ji･1 sa (conquer)
Base √ji + ji + sa > jigiṃsa (desid)
Construction ni + jigiṃsa + āna
Derivative kita (āna)
Sanskrit ni + jigīṣamāṇa
Sanskrit Root √ji 1, 2 (conquer)

asataṃ yo'dha pabrūti,
mohena paliguṇṭhito,
kiñcikkhaṃ nijigiṃsāno,
taṃ jaññā vasalo iti.

SNP 7 vasalasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 7
nijigiṃsitar

masc. who wishes to acquire; who covets [ni + √ji] ✗
nijigī

fem. desire; wish [ni + √ji] ✗
nijigīsanaka

adj. looking to gain; seeking (something for something) [ni + √ji] ✗
nijigīsanatā

fem. desiring; seeking; wanting to get; lit. wanting to conquer state [ni + √ji + sa + ana + tā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from nijigīsana, desid
Meaning desiring; seeking; wanting to get; lit. wanting to conquer state
Root Family ni √ji
Root √ji･1 sa (conquer)
Base √ji + ji + sa > jigīsa (desid)
Construction ni + jigīsa + ana + tā
nijigiṃsana + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Commentary (MNa) lābhena lābhaṃ nijigīsanti magganti pariyesantī'ti lābhena lābhaṃ nijigīsanā, tesaṃ bhāvo lābhena lābhaṃ nijigīsanatā.
Sanskrit ni + jigīṣamāṇa + tā
Sanskrit Root √ji 1, 2 (conquer)

katamo ca, bhikkhave, micchāājīvo? kuhanā, lapanā, nemittikatā, nippesikatā, lābhena lābhaṃ nijigīsanatā, ayaṃ, bhikkhave, micchāājīvo.

MN 117 mahācattārīsakasuttaṃ
nijigīsitar

masc. who desires; who seeks; who wishes to get [ni + √ji] ✗
nijigīṃsitar

masc. who desires; who seeks; who wishes to get [ni + √ji] ✗
nijjara 1

adj. free from old age or decay [√jar] ✗
nijjara 2

masc. deity [√jar] ✗
nijjaravatthu

nt. basis for wearing away; grounds for eradication [nijjarā + vatthu] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning basis for wearing away; grounds for eradication
Construction nijjarā + vatthu
nijjarasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.106 (AN10.106) ✗
nijjarā

fem. destruction; wearing away; decay [nī + √jar + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from nijjareti
Meaning destruction; wearing away; decay
Root Family nī √jar
Root √jar･1 a (age)
Construction nī + √jar + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Phonetic Change īj > ijj
Commentary (ANa) nijjarā'ti kilesajīraṇakapaṭipadā.
Notes Jain term for gradual destruction of all actions.
Sanskrit nirjara
Sanskrit Root √jṛ √jṝ 1, 4, 6, 9, 10 (waste away)

so navañ'ca kammaṃ na karoti, purāṇañ'ca kammaṃ phussa phussa byantīkaroti, sandiṭṭhikā nijjarā akālikā ehipassikā opaneyyikā paccattaṃ veditabbā viññūhi.

AN 4.195 vappasuttaṃ
nijjareti

pr. destroys, annihilates [nī + √jar] ✗
nijjiṇṇa

pp. depleted; exhausted; worn out; worn away [nī + √jīr + na] ✓

Grammar pp of nijjīrati
Meaning depleted; exhausted; worn out; worn away
Root Family nī √jīr
Root √jīr･1 a (grow old, decay)
Construction nī + √jīr + na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change īj > ijj
rn > ṇṇ
Notes Jain term for gradual destruction of all actions.
Sanskrit nirjīrṇa
Sanskrit Root √jṝ √jṛ 1, 4, 6, 9 (waste away)

sammādiṭṭhissa, bhikkhave, micchādiṭṭhi nijjiṇṇā hoti. ye ca micchādiṭṭhipaccayā aneke pāpakā akusalā dhammā sambhavanti te c'assa nijjiṇṇā honti.

MN 117 mahācattārīsakasuttaṃ

iti purāṇānaṃ kammānaṃ tapasā byantibhāvā, navānaṃ kammānaṃ akaraṇā, āyatiṃ anavassavo, āyatiṃ anavassavā kammakkhayo, kammakkhayā dukkhakkhayo, dukkhakkhayā vedanākkhayo, vedanākkhayā sabbaṃ dukkhaṃ nijjiṇṇaṃ bhavissatī'ti.

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ
nijjīrati

pr. (+acc) depletes; exhausts; wears out; wears away [nī + √jīr + a + ti] ✓

Meaning depletes; exhausts; wears out; wears away

Construction nī + jīra + ti

Variant nijjarati
Notes Jain term for gradual destruction of all actions.
Sanskrit nirjarati
Sanskrit Root √jṝ √jṛ 1, 4, 6, 9 (waste away)

so evam'āha, atthi kho vo, nigaṇṭhā, pubbe pāpakammaṃ kataṃ, taṃ imāya kaṭukāya dukkarakārikāya nijjīretha, yaṃ pan'ettha etarahi kāyena saṃvutā vācāya saṃvutā manasā saṃvutā taṃ āyatiṃ pāpassa kammassa akaraṇaṃ

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ

Notes Jain term for gradual destruction of all actions.
Sanskrit nirjarayitavya
Sanskrit Root √jṝ √jṛ 1, 4, 6, 9 (waste away)

kiṃ pana tumhe, āvuso nigaṇṭhā, jānātha, ettakaṃ vā dukkhaṃ nijjiṇṇaṃ, ettakaṃ vā dukkhaṃ nijjīretabbaṃ, ettakamhi vā dukkhe nijjiṇṇe sabbaṃ dukkhaṃ nijjiṇṇaṃ bhavissatī'ti? no h'idaṃ, āvuso.

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ
nijjhatti

fem. persuasion; convincing; lit. causing to consider [ni + √jhā + *āpe + ti] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from nijjhāpeti, caus
Meaning persuasion; convincing; lit. causing to consider
Root Family ni √jhā
Root √jhā･3 *āpe (think, meditate)
√ In Comps jjhā
Base √jhā + āpe > jhāpe (caus)
Construction ni + jhāpe + ti
Derivative kita (ti)
Phonetic Change āpe + ti > atti (contraction)
Commentary (MNa) te na c'eva aññam'aññaṃ saññāpenti na ca saññattiṃ upentī'ti te atthañ'ca kāraṇañ'ca dassetvā n'eva aññam'aññaṃ jānāpenti. sace'pi saññāpetuṃ ārabhanti, tath'āpi saññattiṃ na upenti, jānituṃ na icchantī'ti attho. nijjhattiyā'pi es'eva nayo.
Sanskrit nidhyapti
Sanskrit Root √dhyai √dhyā 2, 4 (think)

te na c'eva aññam'aññaṃ saññāpenti na ca saññattiṃ upenti, na ca aññam'aññaṃ nijjhāpenti, na ca nijjhattiṃ upenti.

MN 48 kosambiyasuttaṃ
nijjhattibala 1

nt. power of persuasion ✗
nijjhattibala 2

adj. with power to persuade; having the ability to convince [nijjhatti + bala] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with power to persuade; having the ability to convince
Construction nijjhatti + bala
Antonym anijjhattibala
Commentary (ANa) nijjhattibalā'ti na idaṃ evaṃ, evaṃ nām'etan'ti atth'ānatthanijjhāpanaṃ'y'eva balaṃ.
nijjhāna

nt. contemplating; reflecting; pondering; scrutinising [ni + √jhā + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, from nijjhāyati
Meaning contemplating; reflecting; pondering; scrutinising
Root Family ni √jhā
Root √jhā･3 ya (think, meditate)
√ In Comps jjhā
Construction ni + √jhā + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Commentary (SNa) mattaso nijjhānaṃ khamantī'ti pamāṇato olokanaṃ khamanti. (MNa) na nijjhānaṃ khamantī'ti na upaṭṭhahanti na āpāthaṃ āgacchanti, imasmiṃ ṭhāne sīlaṃ samādhi vipassanā maggo phalaṃ vaṭṭaṃ vivaṭṭaṃ kathitan'ti evaṃ jānituṃ na sakkā hontī'ti attho.
Sanskrit nidhyāna
Sanskrit Root √dhyai √dhyā 2, 4 (think)

yassa kho, bhikkhave, ime dhammā evaṃ paññāya mattaso nijjhānaṃ khamanti, ayaṃ vuccati dhamm'ānusārī, okkanto sammattaniyāmaṃ, sappurisabhūmiṃ okkanto, vītivatto puthujjanabhūmiṃ

SN 25.1 cakkhusuttaṃ

etha tumhe, kālāmā, mā anussavena, mā paramparāya, mā itikirāya, mā piṭakasampadānena, mā takkahetu, mā nayahetu, mā ākāraparivitakkena, mā diṭṭhinijjhānakkhantiyā, mā bhabbarūpatāya, mā samaṇo no garū'ti.

MN 48 kosambiyasuttaṃ
nijjhāpetuṃ

paṭibalo hoti ubho atthapaccatthike saññāpetuṃ paññāpetuṃ nijjhāpetuṃ pekkhetuṃ pasādetuṃ, adhikaraṇasamuppādavūpasamakusalo hoti

nijjhāma

SN 22.95 pheṇapiṇḍūpamasuttaṃ
nijjhāyi

aor. (+acc) meditated, reflected [ni + √jhā] ✗
niṭṭhaṅgata 1

pp. attained perfection; complete; finished; lit. gone to the end [niṭṭhaṃ + gata] ✓

Grammar pp of niṭṭhaṃ gacchati, comp vb
Meaning attained perfection; complete; finished; lit. gone to the end
Construction niṭṭhaṃ + gata
Phonetic Change ṃ > ṅ
Compound alutta dutiyā tappurisa (niṭṭhaṃ + gata)
Commentary (DHPa) tattha niṭṭhaṅgato'ti imasmiṃ sāsane pabbajitānaṃ arahattaṃ niṭṭhaṃ nāma, taṃ gato patto'ti attho.
Sanskrit niṣṭhāgata

niṭṭhaṅ'gato asantāsī,
vītataṇho anaṅgaṇo,
acchindi bhavasallāni,
antimo'yaṃ samussayo.

DHP 351 taṇhāvaggo
niṭṭhaṅgata 2

pp. (+loc) come to a conclusion (about); reached surety (about); not in doubt (about) [niṭṭhaṃ + gata] ✓

Grammar pp of niṭṭhaṃ gacchati, comp vb (+loc)
Meaning come to a conclusion (about); reached surety (about); not in doubt (about)
Construction niṭṭhaṃ + gata
Phonetic Change ṃ > ṅ
Compound alutta dutiyā tappurisa (niṭṭhaṃ + gata)
Antonym aniṭṭhaṅgata
Commentary (ANa) tathāgate niṭṭhaṅgato'ti buddhaguṇesu patiṭṭhitacitto pahīnakaṅkho.
Sanskrit niṣṭhāgata (attained perfection)

puna caparaṃ, brāhmaṇa, idh'ekacco akaṅkhī hoti avicikicchī niṭṭhaṅ'gato saddhamme. tam'enaṃ aññataro gāḷho rog'ātaṅko phusati. tassa aññatarena gāḷhena rog'ātaṅkena phuṭṭhassa evaṃ hoti, akaṅkhī vat'amhi avicikicchī niṭṭhaṅ'gato saddhamme'ti.

AN 4.184 abhayasuttaṃ
niṭṭhaṅgatasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.63 (AN10.63) ✗
niṭṭhamagami

aor. reached the conclusion; came to the realisation [niṭṭhaṃ + agami] ✓

Grammar aor, comp vb
Meaning reached the conclusion; came to the realisation
Construction niṭṭhaṃ + agami
Compound comp verb (niṭṭhaṃ + agami)
Sanskrit niṣṭhām + agan

evam'eva kho ahaṃ, bho, yato addasaṃ samaṇe gotame cattāri padāni ath'āhaṃ niṭṭham'agamaṃ, sammāsambuddho bhagavā, svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo, suppaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho'ti.

MN 27 cūḷahatthipadopamasuttaṃ

yathā yathā me, āvuso, bhagavā dhammaṃ deseti uttar'uttariṃ paṇītapaṇītaṃ kaṇhasukkasappaṭibhāgaṃ tathā tath'āhaṃ tasmiṃ dhamme abhiññāya idh'ekaccaṃ dhammaṃ dhammesu niṭṭham'agamaṃ, satthari pasīdiṃ

MN 47 vīmaṃsakasuttaṃ
niṭṭhā 1

fem. end; finish; conclusion; perfection; lit. stand down [ni + √ṭhā + ā] ✓

Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

niṭṭhaṅ'gato asantāsī,
vītataṇho anaṅgaṇo,
acchindi bhavasallāni,
antimo'yaṃ samussayo.

DHP 351 taṇhāvaggo

accantaniṭṭho accantayogakkhemī accantabrahmacārī accantapariyosāno seṭṭho devamanussānan'ti

AN 7.61 pacalāyamānasuttaṃ
niṭṭhā 2

fem. aim; goal; conclusion; lit. stand down [ni + √ṭhā + ā] ✓

Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

piyā su lokasmiṃ kutonidānā,
ye c'āpi lobhā vicaranti loke,
āsā ca niṭṭhā ca kutonidānā,
ye samparāyāya narassa honti.

SNP 49 kalahavivādasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 11

kiṃ pan'āvuso, ekā niṭṭhā, udāhu puthu niṭṭhā'ti? sammā byākaramānā, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyā paribbājakā evaṃ byākareyyuṃ, ek'āvuso, niṭṭhā, na puthu niṭṭhā'ti.

MN 11 cūḷasīhanādasuttaṃ
niṭṭhā 3

fem. conclusion; decision; verdict; lit. stand down [ni + √ṭhā + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from niṭṭhāti
Meaning conclusion; decision; verdict; lit. stand down
Root Family ni √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Construction ni + √ṭhā + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Sanskrit niṣṭhā
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

tañ'ca nāgaṃ passati rukkhamūlagataṃ vā abbhokāsagataṃ vā gacchantaṃ vā tiṭṭhantaṃ vā nisinnaṃ vā nipannaṃ vā. so niṭṭhaṃ gacchati, ayam'eva so mahānāgo'ti.

MN 27 cūḷahatthipadopamasuttaṃ
niṭṭhā 4

fem. (gram) final decision; verdict; conclusion; lit. stand down [ni + √ṭhā + ā] ~

Meaning (gram) final decision; verdict; conclusion; lit. stand down
Root Family ni √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Construction ni + √ṭhā + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Sanskrit niṣṭhā
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)
niṭṭhāti

pr. is prepared; is finished (being prepared); lit. stands down [ni + √ṭhā + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning is prepared; is finished (being prepared); lit. stands down
Root Family ni √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)

Base √ṭhā + a > ṭhā
Construction ni + ṭhā + ti
Sanskrit niṣṭhāti
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

paṭipadāya saṇṭhātī'ti gehe nisīdāpetvā yāgukhajjak'ādīni datvā yāva bhattaṃ niṭṭhāti, tasmiṃ antare nisinno pañhaṃ pucchati.

ANa 3.68 kathāvatthusuttavaṇṇanā

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
niṭṭhitakammantapariyosāna

adj. having completed work as ultimate goal; with finished business as ultimate purpose [niṭṭhita + kammanta + pariyosāna] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having completed work as ultimate goal; with finished business as ultimate purpose
Construction niṭṭhita + kammanta + pariyosāna
niṭṭhitacīvara 1

nt. completed robe-cloth; finished robe [niṭṭhita + cīvara] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning completed robe-cloth; finished robe
Construction niṭṭhita + cīvara
Compound kammadhāraya (niṭṭhita + cīvara)
Commentary (VIN 1.4.1.1) niṭṭhitacīvarasmin'ti bhikkhuno cīvaraṃ kataṃ vā hoti naṭṭhaṃ vā vinaṭṭhaṃ vā daḍḍhaṃ vā cīvar'āsā vā upacchinnā.
Sanskrit niṣṭhita + cīvara

niṭṭhitacīvarasmiṃ bhikkhunā ubbhatasmiṃ kathine das'āhaparamaṃ atirekacīvaraṃ dhāretabbaṃ, taṃ atikkāmayato nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT NP 1 kathinasikkhāpadaṃ

niṭṭhitacīvarasmiṃ bhikkhunā ubbhatasmiṃ kathine ekarattam'pi ce bhikkhu ticīvarena vippavaseyya, aññatra bhikkhusammutiyā nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT NP 2 udositasikkhāpadaṃ
niṭṭhitacīvara 2

adj. when the robe was completed ✗
niṭṭhitacīvarasmiṃ

nt. when the robe-cloth is complete; when the robe is finished [niṭṭhita + cīvara + smiṃ] ✓

Grammar nt, comp, loc sg of niṭṭhitacīvara, loc abs
Meaning when the robe-cloth is complete; when the robe is finished
Construction niṭṭhita + cīvara + smiṃ
niṭṭhitacīvara + smiṃ
Commentary (VIN 1.4.1.1) niṭṭhitacīvarasmin'ti bhikkhuno cīvaraṃ kataṃ vā hoti naṭṭhaṃ vā vinaṭṭhaṃ vā daḍḍhaṃ vā cīvar'āsā vā upacchinnā.
Sanskrit niṣṭhita + cīvara

niṭṭhitacīvarasmiṃ bhikkhunā ubbhatasmiṃ kathine das'āhaparamaṃ atirekacīvaraṃ dhāretabbaṃ, taṃ atikkāmayato nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT NP 1 kathinasikkhāpadaṃ

niṭṭhitacīvarasmiṃ bhikkhunā ubbhatasmiṃ kathine ekarattam'pi ce bhikkhu ticīvarena vippavaseyya, aññatra bhikkhusammutiyā nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

nittaṇha

adj. without desire; free from craving [√tas + ṇhā + a] ✓

Grammar adj, from taṇhā, neg
Meaning without desire; free from craving
Root Family √tas
Root √tas･6 ṇhā (thirst)
Base √tas + ṇhā > taṇhā
Construction nir + taṇhā + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change r > t
Compound kammadhāraya (nir + taṇha)
Sanskrit nistṛṣṇa
Sanskrit Root √tṛṣ 4 (be thirsty)

yassa papañcā ṭhiti ca n'atthi,
sandānaṃ palighañ'ca vītivatto,
taṃ nittaṇhaṃ muniṃ carantaṃ,
n'āvajānāti sadevako'pi loko'ti.

UD 67 papañcakhayasuttaṃ

nittharaṇa 1

nt. (+gen) crossing over (of); getting across; traversing [nī + √tar + aṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, act, from nittharati (+gen)
Meaning crossing over (of); getting across; traversing
Root Family nī √tar
Root √tar･1 a (cross)
Construction nī + √tar > thar + aṇa
Derivative kita (aṇa)
Phonetic Change īt > itt
t > th (Kacc 20, 27)
Sanskrit nistaraṇa
Sanskrit Root √tṝ √tṛ 1 (pass)

santi, bhante, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā dvayena oghassa nittharaṇaṃ paññapenti, sīlavisuddhihetu ca tapojigucchāhetu ca. idha, bhante, bhagavā kim'āhā'ti?

AN 4.196 sāḷhasuttaṃ

kull'ūpamaṃ vo, bhikkhave, dhammaṃ desessāmi nittharaṇa-atthāya, no gahaṇ'atthāya.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
nittharaṇa 2

nt. overcoming, finishing [nī + √tar] ✗

nanu te, bhikkhave, yāva'd'eva kantārassa nittharaṇ'atthāya āhāraṃ āhāreyyun'ti? evaṃ, bhante

SN 12.63 puttamaṃsūpamasuttaṃ

kull'ūpamaṃ vo, bhikkhave, dhammaṃ desessāmi nittharaṇ'atthāya, no gahaṇ'atthāya.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
nittharaṇatthāya

Sanskrit nistaraṇa + arthatas

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, kull'ūpamaṃ vo, bhikkhave, dhammaṃ desessāmi nittharaṇ'atthāya, no gahaṇ'atthāya.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ

imaṃ ce tumhe, bhikkhave, diṭṭhiṃ evaṃ parisuddhaṃ evaṃ pariyodātaṃ allīyetha kelāyetha dhanāyetha mamāyetha, api nu me tumhe, bhikkhave, kull'ūpamaṃ dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājāneyyātha nittharaṇ'atthāya no gahaṇ'atthāyā'ti?

MN 38 mahātaṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ

pr. (+abl) crosses (over) [nī + √tar + a + ti] ✓

Root Family nī √tar
Root √tar･1 a (cross)
Base √tar + a > tara > thara (irreg)
Construction nī + thara + ti
Phonetic Change īt > itth
t > th (Kacc 20, 27)
Sanskrit nistarati
Sanskrit Root √tṝ √tṛ 1 (pass)

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso sadhano sabhogo kantār'addhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjeyya. so aparena samayena tamhā kantārā nitthareyya sotthinā abbhayena, na c'assa kiñci bhogānaṃ vayo.

Grammar masc, abstr, comp (+gen)
Meaning primary cause (of); source of existence (of); lit. source and origin

Commentary (ANa) nidānasambhavo'ti kāme nideti uppādanasamatthatāya niyyādetī'ti nidānaṃ. sambhavati tato'ti sambhavo, nidānam'eva sambhavo nidānasambhavo.

AN 6.63 nibbedhikasuttaṃ

nidānaṃ

ind. due to; because of [ni + √dā + na + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, in comps, acc sg of nidāna
Meaning due to; because of
Root Family ni √dā
Root √dā･3 ya (tie, bind)
Construction ni + √dā + na + aṃ
nidāna + aṃ
Commentary (SNa) kāmahetū'ti kāmamūlakaṃ. kāmanidānan'ti kāmapaccayā. kām'ādhikaraṇan'ti kāmakāraṇā. sabbāni hetāni aññam'aññavevacanān'eva.
Sanskrit nidāna
Sanskrit Root √dā 4, 6 (bind)

idh'āhaṃ, bhante, aḍḍakaraṇe nisinno passāmi khattiyamahāsāle'pi brāhmaṇamahāsāle'pi gahapatimahāsāle'pi aḍḍhe mahaddhane mahābhoge pahūtajātarūparajate pahūtavitt'ūpakaraṇe pahūtadhanadhaññe kāmahetu kāmanidānaṃ kām'ādhikaraṇaṃ sampajānamusā bhāsante.

SN 3.7 aḍḍakaraṇasuttaṃ
niddara

adj. fearless; free from anguish; anxiety-free [nir + √dar + a] ✓

Grammar adj, from dara, neg
Meaning fearless; free from anguish; anxiety-free
Root Family √dar
Root √dar×1 a (fear)
Construction nir + √dar + a
Derivative kita (a)
Compound kammadhāraya (nir + dara)
Commentary (DHPa) niddaro hotī'ti tena ubhayarasapānena khīṇ'āsavo bhikkhu abbhantare rāgadarathādīnaṃ abhāvena niddaro c'eva nippāpo ca hoti.
Sanskrit nir + dara
Sanskrit Root √dṛbh √ḍṝ 10 (fear)

pavivekarasaṃ pitvā,
rasaṃ upasamassa ca,
niddaro hoti nippāpo,
dhammapītirasaṃ pivaṃ.

DHP 205 sukhavaggo
niddasa

adj. not (another) ten; not ten (again) [nir + dasa] ~

Grammar adj, from dasa, neg
Meaning not (another) ten; not ten (again)
Construction nir + dasa
Commentary (ANa) niddasavatthūnī'ti niddas'ādivatthūni, niddaso bhikkhu, nibbīso, nittiṃso, niccattālīso, nippaññāso'ti evaṃ vacanakāraṇāni. ayaṃ kira pañho titthiyasamaye uppanno. titthiyā hi dasavassakāle mataṃ nigaṇṭhaṃ niddaso'ti vadanti. so kira puna dasavasso na hoti.
niddasavatthu

nt. not (another) ten years; not ten years (again) [niddasa + vatthu] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning not (another) ten years; not ten years (again)
Construction niddasa + vatthu
Commentary (ANa) niddasavatthūnī'ti niddas'ādivatthūni, niddaso bhikkhu, nibbīso, nittiṃso, niccattālīso, nippaññāso'ti evaṃ vacanakāraṇāni. ayaṃ kira pañho titthiyasamaye uppanno. titthiyā hi dasavassakāle mataṃ nigaṇṭhaṃ niddaso'ti vadanti. so kira puna dasavasso na hoti.
niddasavatthusutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 7.20 (AN7.20) ✗
niddā

fem. sleep; (comm) sleeping too much [ni + √dā + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, from niddāyati
Meaning sleep; (comm) sleeping too much
Root Family ni √dā
Root √dā･3 ya (sleep)
√ In Comps ddā
Construction ni + √dā + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Commentary (SNa) niddā'ti soppabahulatā.
Sanskrit nidrā
Sanskrit Root √drā √drai 2, 4 (sleep)

uṭṭhahatha nisīdatha,
ko attho supitena vo,
āturānañ'hi kā niddā,
sallaviddhāna ruppataṃ.

SNP 22 uṭṭhānasuttaṃ
cūḷavaggo 10

niddaṃ na bahulīkareyya,
jāgariyaṃ bhajeyya ātāpī,
tandiṃ māyaṃ hassaṃ khiḍḍaṃ,
methunaṃ vippajahe savibhūsaṃ.

SNP 52 tuvaṭakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 14
niddākilamatha

Meaning sleepiness and fatigue
Construction niddā + kilamatha
niddākilamathapaṭivinodana

nt. getting rid of sleep and fatigue; removing sleepiness and tiredness [niddā + kilamatha + paṭivinodana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning getting rid of sleep and fatigue; removing sleepiness and tiredness
Construction niddā + kilamatha + paṭivinodana
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (niddākilamathassa + paṭivinodana)
Sanskrit nidrā + klānta + prativinodana

so kho ahaṃ, bhante, aññatr'eva asitapītakhāyitasāyitā aññatra uccārapassāvakammā aññatra niddākilamathapaṭivinodanā vassasat'āyuko vassasatajīvī vassasataṃ gantvā appatvā'va lokassa antaṃ antarā'y'eva kālaṅ'kato.

kāyagutto vacīgutto,
āhāre udare yato,
saccaṃ karomi niddānaṃ,
soraccaṃ me pamocanaṃ.

st > ṭṭh

dhātuniddiṭṭhehi paccayehi kh'ādikārit'antehi vibhattiyo honti. titikkhati, jigucchati, vīmaṃsati, samuddāyati, puttīyati, kāreti, pāceti.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 455

Phonetic Change īd > idd
Sanskrit nirdiśati
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)
niddisati 2

pr. (+acc) explains, defines [nī + √dis] ✗
niddisi 1

aor. (+acc) indicated; pointed out; designated; appointed [nī + √dis + i] ✓

Root √dis･1 a (point out, explain)
Construction nī + √dis + i
Phonetic Change īd > idd
Sanskrit niradikṣat
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)

so ce dūto taṃ veyyāvaccakaraṃ saññāpetvā taṃ bhikkhuṃ upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadeyya, yaṃ kho, bhante, āyasmā veyyāvaccakaraṃ niddisi, saññatto so mayā, upasaṅkamat'āyasmā kālena, cīvarena taṃ acchādessatī'ti.

VIN PAT NP 10 rājasikkhāpadaṃ
niddisi 2

aor. (+acc) explained, defined [nī + √dis] ✗
niddisitabba 1

ptp. (+instr) should be indicated (by); should be pointed out (by); should be designated (by); should be appointed (by); lit. to be pointed down [nī + √dis + itabba] ✓

Grammar ptp of niddisati (+instr)
Meaning should be indicated (by); should be pointed out (by); should be designated (by); should be appointed (by); lit. to be pointed down
Root Family nī √dis
Root √dis･1 a (point out, explain)
Construction nī + √dis + itabba
Derivative kicca (itabba)
Phonetic Change īd > idd
Sanskrit nirdiś
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)

so ce dūto taṃ bhikkhuṃ evaṃ vadeyya, atthi pan'āyasmato koci veyyāvaccakaro'ti. cīvar'atthikena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā veyyāvaccakaro niddisitabbo ārāmiko vā upāsako vā, eso kho, āvuso, bhikkhūnaṃ veyyāvaccakaro'ti.

niddhanta

pp. blown off; removed; purified; lit. blown away [nī + √dham + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of niddhamati
Meaning blown off; removed; purified; lit. blown away
Root Family nī √dham
Root √dham･1 a (blow, sound)

Phonetic Change īd > idd
Antonym aniddhanta
Variant ninnīta
Sanskrit nirdhānta
Sanskrit Root √dhmā √dham 1, 2 (blow)

so karohi dīpam'attano,
khippaṃ vāyama paṇḍito bhava,
niddhantamalo anaṅgaṇo,
dibbaṃ ariyabhūmiṃ upehisi.

DHP 236 malavaggo

taṃ hoti jātarūpaṃ dhantaṃ sandhantaṃ niddhantaṃ aniddhantaṃ anihitaṃ aninnītakasāvaṃ, na c'eva mudu hoti na ca kammaniyaṃ, na ca pabhassaraṃ pabhaṅgu ca, na ca sammā upeti kammāya.

adj. with impurity and delusion got rid of ✗

thokaṃ thokaṃ khaṇe khaṇe,
kammāro rajatass'eva,
niddhame malam'attano.

DHP 239 malavaggo

tam'enaṃ suvaṇṇakāro vā suvaṇṇakār'antevāsī vā jātarūpaṃ mūsāyaṃ pakkhipitvā dhamati sandhamati niddhamati.

nidhānakusala

kālavādī bhūtavādī atthavādī dhammavādī vinayavādī nidhānavatiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā hoti kālena sāpadesaṃ pariyantavatiṃ atthasaṃhitaṃ

AN 10.176 cundasuttaṃ
nidhāpeti

pr. causes to deposit [ni + √dhā] ✗

Root √dhā･1 a (place, support)
Construction ni + √dhā + ya
Commentary (DHPa) nidhāyā'ti nikkhipitvā oropetvā.
Sanskrit nidhāya
Sanskrit Root √dhā 1, 2, 3 (put)

alaṅ'kato ce'pi samaṃ careyya,
santo danto niyato brahmacārī,
sabbesu bhūtesu nidhāya daṇḍaṃ,
so brāhmaṇo so samaṇo sa bhikkhu.

DHP 142 daṇḍavaggo

nidhāya daṇḍaṃ bhūtesu,
tasesu thāvaresu ca,
yo na hanti na ghāteti,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

DHP 405 brāhmaṇavaggo
nidhi 1

masc. treasure; trove; hoard; lit. put down [ni + √dhā + i] ✓

Meaning treasure; trove; hoard; lit. put down

Root √dhā･1 a (place, support)

Sanskrit nidhi
Sanskrit Root √dhā 1, 2, 3 (put)

kadā iṇ'aṭṭo'va daliddako nidhiṃ,
ārādhayitvā dhanikehi pīḷito,
tuṭṭho bhavissaṃ adhigamma sāsanaṃ,
mah'esino taṃ nu kadā bhavissati.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

nidhīnaṃ'va pavattāraṃ,
yaṃ passe vajjadassinaṃ,
niggayhavādiṃ medhāviṃ,
t'ādisaṃ paṇḍitaṃ bhaje,
t'ādisaṃ bhajamānassa,
seyyo hoti na pāpiyo.

DHP 76 paṇḍitavaggo

Sanskrit nidhi + mukha

evaṃ vutte, dasamo gahapati aṭṭhakanāgaro āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ etadavoca, seyyathā'pi, bhante ānanda, puriso ekaṃ'va nidhimukhaṃ gavesanto saki'd'eva ekādasa nidhimukhāni adhigaccheyya.

Sanskrit Root √dhā 1, 2, 3 (put)

nidhiṃ nidheti puriso,
gambhīre odak'antike,
atthe kicce samuppanne,
atthāya me bhavissati.

KP 1.8 nidhikaṇḍasuttaṃ
nindati

pr. (+acc) blames; criticize; find fault [√nind + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning blames; criticize; find fault
Root Family √nind
Root √nind･1 a (blame, abuse)
Base √nind + a > ninda
Construction ninda + ti
Sanskrit nindati
Sanskrit Root √nind 1 (revile)

porāṇam'etaṃ atula,
n'etaṃ ajjatanām'iva,
nindanti tuṇhim'āsīnaṃ,
nindanti bahubhāṇinaṃ,
mitabhāṇim'pi nindanti,
n'atthi loke anindito.

DHP 227 kodhavaggo

yo nindiyaṃ pasaṃsati,
taṃ vā nindati yo pasaṃsiyo,
vicināti mukhena so kaliṃ,
kalinā tena sukhaṃ na vindati.

SN 6.9 turūbrahmasuttaṃ
nindanta

prp. blaming, disparaging, insulting [√nind] ✗
nindā

fem. blame; criticism; fault-finding; disgrace [√nind + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from nindati
Meaning blame; criticism; fault-finding; disgrace
Root Family √nind
Root √nind･1 a (blame, abuse)
Construction √nind + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Sanskrit nindā
Sanskrit Root √nind 1 (revile)

selo yathā ekaghano,
vātena na samīrati,
evaṃ nindāpasaṃsāsu,
na samiñjanti paṇḍitā.

DHP 81 paṇḍitavaggo

yutto kathāyaṃ parisāya majjhe,
pasaṃsam'icchaṃ vinighāti hoti,
apāhatasmiṃ pana maṅku hoti,
nindāya so kuppati randhamesī.

SNP 46 pasūrasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 8
nindāghaṭṭanabyārosaupārambhabhaya

nt. fear of blame, conflict, causing anger and condemnation; fear of criticism, insult, angering, and being faulted [nindā + ghaṭṭana + byārosa + upārambha + bhaya] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning fear of blame, conflict, causing anger and condemnation; fear of criticism, insult, angering, and being faulted
Construction nindā + ghaṭṭana + byārosa + upārambha + bhaya
Commentary (SNa) nindāghaṭṭanabyārosaupārambhabhayā'ti viññūnaṃ santikā nindābhayena ca ghaṭṭanabhayena ca dos'āropanabhayena ca upārambhabhayena ca.
nindāpasaṃsā

fem. blame and praise; criticism and approval [nindā + pasaṃsā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning blame and praise; criticism and approval
Construction nindā + pasaṃsā
Compound dvanda (nindā ca pasaṃsā ca)
Sanskrit nindā + praśaṃsā

selo yathā ekaghano,
vātena na samīrati,
evaṃ nindāpasaṃsāsu,
na samiñjanti paṇḍitā.

DHP 81 paṇḍitavaggo
nindābyārosaupārambhabhaya

nt. fear of blame, provoking anger and criticism [nindā + byārosa + upārambha + bhaya] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning fear of blame, provoking anger and criticism
Construction nindā + byārosa + upārambha + bhaya
Variant nindābyārosanaupārambhabhaya
Commentary (MNa) nindābyārosaupārambhabhayā'ti attano nindābhayena ghaṭṭanabhayena upavādabhayena cā'ti attho.
nindābyārosanaupārambhabhaya

nt. fear of blame, provoking anger and criticism [nindā + byārosanā + upārambha + bhaya] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning fear of blame, provoking anger and criticism
Construction nindā + byārosanā + upārambha + bhaya
Variant nindābyārosaupārambhabhaya
Commentary (ANa) nindābyārosanaupārambhabhayā'ti attano nindabhayena ghaṭṭanabhayena upavādabhayena cā'ti attho.
nindārosa

masc. fault-finding and offending; blaming and causing offence; (comm) blaming and attacking [nindā + rosa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning fault-finding and offending; blaming and causing offence; (comm) blaming and attacking
Construction nindā + rosa
Compound dvanda (nindā ca rosa ca)
Antonym anindārosa
Commentary (MNa) nindāroso'ti nindāghaṭṭanā.
Sanskrit nindā + roṣa

agiddhilobhaṃ nissāya giddhilobho pahātabbo. anindārosaṃ nissāya nindāroso pahātabbo. akkodh'ūpāyāsaṃ nissāya kodh'ūpāyāso pahātabbo. anatimānaṃ nissāya atimāno pahātabbo.

MN 54 potaliyasuttaṃ
nindārosapaccayā

ind. dependent on fault-finding and offending; due to blaming and causing offence [nindārosa + paccayā] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, abl sg of nindārosapaccaya
Meaning dependent on fault-finding and offending; due to blaming and causing offence
Construction nindārosa + paccayā
Sanskrit nindā + roṣa + pratyayāt

ahañ'c'eva kho pana nindārosī assaṃ, attā'pi maṃ upavadeyya nindārosapaccayā, anuviccā'pi maṃ viññū garaheyyuṃ nindārosapaccayā, kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā duggati pāṭikaṅkhā nindārosapaccayā.

MN 54 potaliyasuttaṃ
nindārosī

adj. who finds faults and offends; who blames and causes offence [nindā + rosa + ī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, from nindārosa
Meaning who finds faults and offends; who blames and causes offence
Construction nindā + rosa + ī
nindārosa + ī
Derivative taddhita (ī)
Antonym anindārosī
Sanskrit nindā + roṣin

ahañ'c'eva kho pana nindārosī assaṃ, attā'pi maṃ upavadeyya nindārosapaccayā, anuviccā'pi maṃ viññū garaheyyuṃ nindārosapaccayā, kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā duggati pāṭikaṅkhā nindārosapaccayā.

na c'eta'r'ahi vijjati,
ek'antaṃ nindito poso,
ek'antaṃ vā pasaṃsito.

DHP 228 kodhavaggo
ninditumarahati

pr. (+acc) is worthy to criticise; is fit to blame [nindituṃ + arahati] ✓

Grammar pr, comp vb, trans (+acc)
Meaning is worthy to criticise; is fit to blame
Construction nindituṃ + arahati
Compound comp verb (nindituṃ + arahati)
Sanskrit nind + arhati

yassa mūlaṃ chamā n'atthi,
paṇṇā n'atthi kuto latā,
taṃ dhīraṃ bandhanā muttaṃ,
ko taṃ ninditum'arahati.
devā'pi naṃ pasaṃsanti,
brahmunā'pi pasaṃsito'ti.

UD 66 taṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ

nikkhaṃ jambonadass'eva,
ko taṃ ninditum'arahati,
devā'pi naṃ pasaṃsanti,
brahmunā'pi pasaṃsito.

nipaka 1

adj. intelligent; wise; discerning; astute [nipa + ka] ✓

Meaning intelligent; wise; discerning; astute
Construction nipa + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Commentary (SNa) nipako'ti nepakkaṃ vuccati paññā, tāya samannāgato'ti attho. (SNa) nipakā'ti ... paññānepakkena ca samannāgatā. (SNa) nipako'ti paṇḍito.

santussako ca subharo ca,
appakicco ca sallahukavutti,
sant'indriyo ca nipako ca,
appagabbho kulesu ananugiddho.

es'ūpamā dāmali brāhmaṇassa,
khīṇ'āsavassa nipakassa jhāyino,
pappuyya jātimaraṇassa antaṃ,
n'āyūhatī pāragato hi so'ti.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
nipaccavādī

adj. speaking humbly; speaking hurtfully? ✗
nipajja

ger. laying down, leaving [ni + √pad] ✗

pr. lies down; rests [ni + √pad + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning lies down; rests
Root Family ni √pad
Root √pad･3 ya (go, step)
Base √pad + ya > pajja
Construction ni + pajja + ti
Phonetic Change dy > jj
Sanskrit nipadyate
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

atha puriso āgaccheyya ghamm'ābhitatto ghammapareto kilanto tasito pipāsito. so taṃ pokkharaṇiṃ ogāhetvā nhātvā ca pivitvā ca paccuttaritvā tatth'eva rukkhacchāyāya nisīdeyya vā nipajjeyya vā.

AN 5.162 dutiyaāghātapaṭivinayasuttaṃ

tassa evam'assa, kiṃ nu kho ahaṃ ṭhito? yaṃnūn'āhaṃ nisīdeyyan'ti. so nisīdeyya. tassa evam'assa, kiṃ nu kho ahaṃ nisinno? yaṃnūn'āhaṃ nipajjeyyan'ti. so nipajjeyya.

abhisatto'va nipatati,
vayo rūpaṃ aññam'iva tath'eva santaṃ,
tass'eva sato avippavasato,
aññass'eva sarāmi attānan'ti.

TH 118 kimilattheragāthā

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, gimhānaṃ pacchime māse māluvāsipāṭikā phaleyya. atha kho taṃ, bhikkhave, māluvābījaṃ aññatarasmiṃ sālamūle nipateyya. atha kho, bhikkhave, yā tasmiṃ sāle adhivatthā devatā sā bhītā saṃviggā santāsaṃ āpajjeyya.

MN 45 cūḷadhammasamādānasuttaṃ
nipatati 2

pr. (+acc) befalls; attacks; lit. falls down [ni + √pat + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning befalls; attacks; lit. falls down
Root Family ni √pat
Root √pat･1 a (fall)
Base √pat + a > pata
Construction ni + pata + ti
Sanskrit nipatati
Sanskrit Root √pat 1 (fly, fall)

seyyathāpi, ānanda, sampanne ucchukkhette mañjiṭṭhikā nāma rogajāti nipatati, evaṃ taṃ ucchukkhettaṃ na ciraṭṭhitikaṃ hoti, evam'evaṃ kho, ānanda, yasmiṃ dhammavinaye labhati mātugāmo agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjaṃ, na taṃ brahmacariyaṃ ciraṭṭhitikaṃ hoti.

AN 8.51 gotamīsuttaṃ
nipatanta

prp. falling down; descending; dropping [ni + √pat + a + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of nipatati, intrans
Meaning falling down; descending; dropping
Root Family ni √pat
Root √pat･1 a (fall)
Base √pat + a > pata
Construction ni + pata + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Commentary (SNa) nipatatan'ti nipatantānaṃ meghavuṭṭhi seṭṭhā. (SNt) nipatantānan'ti adhomukhaṃ pavattantānaṃ.
Sanskrit nipatat
Sanskrit Root √pat 1 (fly, fall)

bījaṃ uppatataṃ seṭṭhaṃ,
vuṭṭhi nipatataṃ varā,
gāvo pavajamānānaṃ,
putto pavadataṃ varoti.

SN 1.74 vuṭṭhisuttaṃ

vijjā uppatataṃ seṭṭhā,
avijjā nipatataṃ varā,
saṅgho pavajamānānaṃ,
buddho pavadataṃ varo'ti.

SN 1.74 vuṭṭhisuttaṃ
nipati

aor. fell down [ni + √pat] ✗
nipatitvā

abs. (+loc) having fallen down (at); having gone down (at) [ni + √pat + itvā] ✓

Grammar abs of nipatati, intrans (+loc)
Meaning having fallen down (at); having gone down (at)
Root Family ni √pat
Root √pat･1 a (fall)
Construction ni + √pat + itvā
Sanskrit nipat
Sanskrit Root √pat 1 (fly, fall)

upasaṅkamitvā bhagavato pāde sirasā nipatitvā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca, desetu me, bhante bhagavā, dhammaṃ, desetu, sugato, dhammaṃ, yaṃ mam'assa dīgharattaṃ hitāya sukhāyā'ti.

UD 10 bāhiyasuttaṃ

yaṃnūn'āhaṃ catukkuṇḍiko nipatitvā gopītakaṃ pivitvā pakkameyyan'ti. so catukkuṇḍiko nipatitvā gopītakaṃ pivitvā pakkameyya.

AN 5.162 dutiyaāghātapaṭivinayasuttaṃ
nipanna

pp. laid down; lying down [ni + √pad + na] ✓

Grammar pp of nipajjati
Meaning laid down; lying down
Root Family ni √pad
Root √pad･3 ya (go, step)
Construction ni + √pad + na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change d > n
Sanskrit nipanna (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, añño'va aññaṃ paccavekkheyya, ṭhito vā nisinnaṃ paccavekkheyya, nisinno vā nipannaṃ paccavekkheyya.

AN 5.28 paṭhamadhammavihārīsuttaṃ

nisajjaṃ kappeyyā'ti mātugāme nisinne bhikkhu upanisinno vā hoti upanipanno vā. bhikkhu nisinne mātugāmo upanisinno vā hoti upanipanno vā. ubho vā nisinnā honti ubho vā nipannā.

VIN 1.3.1 paṭhamāniyatasikkhāpadaṃ
nipannokāsa

masc. (+gen) sleeping place (of) [nipanna + okāsa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp (+gen)
Meaning sleeping place (of)
Construction nipanna + okāsa
Compound kammadhāraya (nipanna + okāsa)
Sanskrit nipanna (bsk) + avakāśa

sāsaṅkaṃ nāma ārāme ārām'ūpacāre corānaṃ niviṭṭh'okāso dissati, bhutt'okāso dissati, ṭhit'okāso dissati, nisinn'okāso dissati, nipann'okāso dissati.

VIN 1.4.3.9 sāsaṅkasikkhāpadaṃ

sāsaṅkaṃ nāma tasmiṃ magge corānaṃ niviṭṭh'okāso dissati, bhutt'okāso dissati, ṭhit'okāso dissati, nisinn'okāso dissati, nipann'okāso dissati.

m'āvamaññetha pāpassa,
na man'taṃ āgamissati,
udabindunipātena,
udakumbho'pi pūrati,
bālo pūrati pāpassa,
thokaṃ thokam'pi ācinaṃ.

DHP 121 pāpavaggo

dandho, ānanda, udakaphusitānaṃ nipāto, atha kho naṃ khippam'eva parikkhayaṃ pariyādānaṃ gaccheyya

319, 330. upasagganipātapubbako abyayībhāvo.

evaṃ liṅga, sabbanāma, pada, upasagga, nipāta, taddhita, ākhyāta, kammappavacanīy'ādisaññā ca.

DHP 36 cittavaggo
nipātī 2

Sanskrit nipātin
Sanskrit Root √pat 1 (fly, fall)

so taṃ gahapatiṃ vā gahapatiputtaṃ vā upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadeyya, upaṭṭhaheyyaṃ taṃ, bhante'ti. tam'enaṃ so gahapati vā gahapatiputto vā upaṭṭhāpeyya. so upaṭṭhaheyya pubb'uṭṭhāyī pacchānipātī kiṃkārapaṭissāvī manāpacārī piyavādī.

nipuṇa 1

adj. fine; subtle [ni + √puṇ + a] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning fine; subtle
Root Family ni √puṇ
Root √puṇ×1 a (be skilful, precise)
Construction ni + √puṇ + a
Derivative kita (a)
Commentary (ANa) nipuṇan'ti saṇhaṃ.
Sanskrit nipuṇa (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √puṇ 6 (act piously)

sabbhi'r'eva samāsetha,
paṇḍiteh'atthadassibhi,
atthaṃ mahantaṃ gambhīraṃ,
duddasaṃ nipuṇaṃ aṇuṃ,
dhīrā samadhigacchanti,
appamattā vicakkhaṇā'ti.

TH 4 puṇṇattheragāthā

anomanāmaṃ nipuṇ'atthadassiṃ,
paññādadaṃ kām'ālaye asattaṃ,
taṃ passatha sabbaviduṃ sumedhaṃ,
ariye pathe kamamānaṃ mahesin'ti.

SN 1.45 anomasuttaṃ
nipuṇa 2

adj. astute; skilled; shrewd; (comm) knowing how to do refined work [ni + √puṇ + a] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning astute; skilled; shrewd; (comm) knowing how to do refined work
Root Family ni √puṇ
Root √puṇ×1 a (be skilful, precise)
Construction ni + √puṇ + a
Derivative kita (a)
Commentary (MNa) nipuṇe'ti saṇhe sukhumabuddhino, sukhum'ātthantarapaṭivijjhanasamatthe. (ANa) nipuṇo'ti saṇho sukhumakāraṇaññū.
Sanskrit nipuṇa (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √puṇ 6 (act piously)

dullabho, bhikkhave, vuḍḍhapabbajito nipuṇo, dullabho ākappasampanno, dullabho bahussuto, dullabho dhammakathiko, dullabho vinayadharo.

AN 5.59 paṭhamavuḍḍhapabbajitasuttaṃ

katamāni cattāri? idh'āhaṃ, bho, passāmi ekacce khattiyapaṇḍite nipuṇe kataparappavāde vālavedhirūpe, te bhindantā maññe caranti paññāgatena diṭṭhigatāni.

nippapañca 1

Meaning not forming various opinions; without proliferating; epithet of Nibbāna

Antonym papañca

Sanskrit Root √pañc 1 (spread)

ākāse'va padaṃ n'atthi,
samaṇo n'atthi bāhire,
papañc'ābhiratā pajā,
nippapañcā tathāgatā.

DHP 254 malavaggo

nāgassa pantasenassa,
khīṇasaṃyojanassa muttassa,
paṭimantakassa dhonassa,
pannadhajassa vītarāgassa,
dantassa nippapañcassa,
bhagavato tassa sāvako'ham'asmi.

nippapañc'ārāmass'āyaṃ dhammo nippapañcaratino n'āyaṃ dhammo papañc'ārāmassa papañca-ratino'ti

AN 8.30 anuruddha mahāvitakkasuttaṃ

sammā byākaramānā, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyā paribbājakā evaṃ byākareyyuṃ, nippapañc'ārāmass'āvuso, sā niṭṭhā nippapañcaratino, na sā niṭṭhā papañc'ārāmassa papañcaratino'ti.

MN 11 cūḷasīhanādasuttaṃ
nippapañcagāmī

adj. leading to the unproliferated; going to the non-manifold [nippapañca + gāmī] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning leading to the unproliferated; going to the non-manifold
Construction nippapañca + gāmī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (nippapañcaṃ + gāmī)
Commentary (SNa) taṇhāmānadiṭṭhipapañcānaṃ abhāvena nippapañcaṃ.
nippapañcapada

nt. state of nonproliferation; state without conceptualization; (comm) state of Nibbāna [nippapañca + pada] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning state of nonproliferation; state without conceptualization; (comm) state of Nibbāna
Construction nippapañca + pada
Commentary (ANa) nippapañcapade'ti nibbānapade.
nippapañcarata

adj. who takes delight in not forming various opinions; taking pleasure in nonproliferation [nippapañca + rata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who takes delight in not forming various opinions; taking pleasure in nonproliferation
Construction nippapañca + rata
Compound sattamī tappurisa (nippapañce + rata)
Commentary (THa) taṃ pana desitaṃ dhammaṃ desento āha nippapañcarato buddho, nippapañcam'adesayī'ti. papañcā nāma rāg'ādayo kilesā, tesaṃ vūpasamatāya, tadabhāvato ca lok'uttaradhammā nippapañcā nāma. tasmiṃ nippapañce rato abhirato sammāsambuddho yathā taṃ pāpuṇāmi, tathā t'ādisaṃ dhammaṃ adesayi, sāmukkaṃsikaṃ catusaccadhammadesanaṃ pakāsayī'ti attho.
Sanskrit niṣprapañca + rata

yathā me ahu saṅkappo,
tato uttari desayi,
nippapañcarato buddho,
nippapañcaṃ adesayi.

AN 8.30 anuruddhamahāvitakkasuttaṃ
nippapañcarati

adj. taking pleasure in mental nonproliferation; not addicted to manifold ideas [nippapañca + rati] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning taking pleasure in mental nonproliferation; not addicted to manifold ideas
Construction nippapañca + rati
Compound sattamī tappurisa (nippapañce + rati)
Antonym papañcarati
Sanskrit niṣprapañca + rati

sā pan'āvuso, niṭṭhā papañc'ārāmassa papañcaratino udāhu nippapañc'ārāmassa nippapañcaratino'ti? sammā byākaramānā, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyā paribbājakā evaṃ byākareyyuṃ, nippapañc'ārāmass'āvuso, sā niṭṭhā nippapañcaratino, na sā niṭṭhā papañc'ārāmassa papañcaratino'ti.

MN 11 cūḷasīhanādasuttaṃ

nippapañc'ārāmass'āyaṃ dhammo nippapañcaratino n'āyaṃ dhammo papañc'ārāmassa papañcaratino'ti

MN 11 cūḷasīhanādasuttaṃ

Sanskrit niṣprapañca + ārāma +

na kamm'ārāmatā, na bhass'ārāmatā, na nidd'ārāmatā, na saṅgaṇik'ārāmatā, indriyesu guttadvāratā, bhojane mattaññutā, asaṃsagg'ārāmatā, nippapañc'ārāmatā.

AN 8.79 parihānasuttaṃ
nippariyāya 1

adj. literal; actual; real; lit. not going around [nir + pari + √i + *a] ~

Grammar adj, from pariyāya, neg
Meaning literal; actual; real; lit. not going around
Root Family pari √i
Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Construction nir + pari + [y] + √i > ay + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change +y
i > ay
Compound kammadhāraya (nir + pariyāya)
Antonym pariyāya
Sanskrit niṣparyāya
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)
nippariyāya 2

adj. non-metaphorical [pari + √i] ✗
nippariyāya 3

adj. without distinction or difference [pari + √i] ✗
nippariyāyena

ind. literally; not figuratively; lit. by not going around [nir + pari + √i + *a + ena] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, instr sg of nippariyāya, neg
Meaning literally; not figuratively; lit. by not going around
Root Family pari √i
Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Construction nir + pari + [y] + √i > ay + *a + ena
nippariyāya + ena
Phonetic Change +y
i > ay
Commentary (ANa) nippariyāyenā'ti yattakaṃ kāyena sacchikātabbaṃ, sabbassa katattā ayaṃ nippariyāyena kāyasakkhi nāma.
Sanskrit niṣparyāyena
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

yathā yathā ca tadāyatanaṃ tathā tathā naṃ kāyena phusitvā viharati. ettāvatā'pi kho, āvuso, kāyasakkhī vutto bhagavatā nippariyāyenā'ti.

Root Family nī √vatt
Root √vatt･1 *e (be, proceed)
Base √vatt + e > vatte > batte (caus, irreg)
Construction nī + batte + tvā
Phonetic Change īv > ibb
v > b
Sanskrit nirvṛtayitvā
Sanskrit Root √vṛt 1 (turn)
nibbana 1.1

adj. desireless; without craving [nir + √van + a] ✓

Grammar adj, from vana, neg
Meaning desireless; without craving
Root Family √van
Root √van×7 o (like, desire)
Construction nir + √van + a > bana
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change v > b
Compound kammadhāraya (nir + vana)
Commentary (THa) vanā nibbanam'āgatan'ti kilesavanato tabbirahitaṃ nibbanaṃ upagataṃ. (ANa) nibbanam'āgatan'ti kilesavanato nibbanaṃ kilesavanarahitaṃ nibbānaṃ āgataṃ sampattaṃ.
Notes see nibbana 1
Sanskrit nis + vana
Sanskrit Root √van 1, 6, 8 (win)

sabbasaṃyojan'ātītaṃ,
vanā nibbanam'āgataṃ,
kāmehi nekkhammarataṃ,
muttaṃ selā'va kañcanaṃ.

TH 247 udāyittheragāthā

vanaṃ chindatha mā rukkhaṃ,
vanato jāyate bhayaṃ,
chetvā vanañ'ca vanathañ'ca,
nibbanā hotha bhikkhavo.

DHP 283 maggavaggo
nibbana 2.1

adj. forestless; without forest; clear (land) [nir + vana] ✓

Grammar adj, from vana, neg
Meaning forestless; without forest; clear (land)
Construction nir + vana > bana
Phonetic Change r > b
v > b
Compound kammadhāraya (nir + vana)
Commentary (THa) vanā nibbanam'āgatan'ti kilesavanato tabbirahitaṃ nibbanaṃ upagataṃ. (ANa) nibbanam'āgatan'ti kilesavanato nibbanaṃ kilesavanarahitaṃ nibbānaṃ āgataṃ sampattaṃ.

Sanskrit nirvana

sabbasaṃyojan'ātītaṃ,
vanā nibbanam'āgataṃ,
kāmehi nekkhammarataṃ,
muttaṃ selā'va kañcanaṃ.

TH 247 udāyittheragāthā

vanaṃ chindatha mā rukkhaṃ,
vanato jāyate bhayaṃ,
chetvā vanañ'ca vanathañ'ca,
nibbanā hotha bhikkhavo.

DHP 283 maggavaggo
nibbanatha

adj. free from desire; free from craving [nir + √van + a + tha] ✓

Grammar adj, from vanatha, neg
Meaning free from desire; free from craving
Root Family √van
Root √van×7 o (like, desire)
Construction nir + √van + a + tha
nibbana + tha
Derivative taddhita (tha)
Phonetic Change v > b
Compound kammadhāraya (nir + vanatha)
Sanskrit nir + vanatha (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √van 1, 6, 8 (win)

yo nibbanatho van'ādhimutto,
vanamutto vanam'eva dhāvati,
taṃ puggalam'etha passatha,
mutto bandhanam'eva dhāvati.

DHP 344 taṇhāvaggo
nibbasana

nt. cast-off cloth [√vas] ✗
nibbahati

pr. carries out; carries along; flows out [nī + √vah] ✗
nibbāti 1

pr. (of mental defilement) is completely quenched; is entirely emancipated; is completely cooled; lit. blows away [nī + √vā + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning (of mental defilement) is completely quenched; is entirely emancipated; is completely cooled; lit. blows away
Root Family nī √vā
Root √vā･1 a (blow, emit odour)
Base √vā + a > vā > bā (irreg)
Construction nī + bā + ti
Phonetic Change īv > ibb
v > b
Sanskrit nirvāti
Sanskrit Root √vā 2 (blow)

khīṇaṃ purāṇaṃ nava n'atthi sambhavaṃ,
virattacitt'āyatike bhavasmiṃ,
te khīṇabījā avirūḷhichandā,
nibbanti dhīrā yath'āyaṃ padīpo,
idam'pi saṅghe ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ,
etena saccena suvatthi hotu.

SNP 13 ratanasuttaṃ,
cūḷavaggo 1

pucchāmi taṃ ādiccabandhu,
vivekaṃ santipadañ'ca mahesi,
kathaṃ disvā nibbāti bhikkhu,
anupādiyāno lokasmiṃ kiñci.

SNP 52 tuvaṭakasuttaṃ

SNP 13 ratanasuttaṃ,
cūḷavaggo 1
nibbāna 1

viññāṇassa nirodhena,
taṇhākkhayavimuttino,
pajjotass'eva nibbānaṃ,
vimokkho hoti cetaso'ti.

AN 3.91 dutiya sikkhattayasuttaṃ
nibbāna 2

nt. (of mental defilement) complete quenching; total emancipation; complete cooling; lit. blowing away [nī + √vā + ana] ✓

Sanskrit Root √vā 2 (blow)

ārogyaparamā lābhā,
nibbānaṃ paramaṃ sukhaṃ,
aṭṭh'aṅgiko ca maggānaṃ,
khemaṃ amatagāminan'ti.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ

katamā ca, bhikkhave, ariyā pariyesanā? idha, bhikkhave, ekacco ... attanā byādhidhammo samāno byādhidhamme ādīnavaṃ viditvā abyādhiṃ anuttaraṃ yogakkhemaṃ nibbānaṃ pariyesati

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ
nibbānagama

adj. going, leading to nibbāna ✗
nibbānagamana

adj. leading to putting out the fire; conducive to Nibbāna; going to Nibbāna [nibbāna + gamana] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning leading to putting out the fire; conducive to Nibbāna; going to Nibbāna
Construction nibbāna + gamana
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (nibbānaṃ + gamana)
Sanskrit nirvāna + gamana

etam'atthavasaṃ ñatvā,
paṇḍito sīlasaṃvuto,
nibbānagamanaṃ maggaṃ,
khippam'eva visodhaye.

DHP 289 maggavaggo
nibbānagāmī

adj. leading to putting out the fire; conducive to Nibbāna [nibbāna + gāmī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning leading to putting out the fire; conducive to Nibbāna
Construction nibbāna + gāmī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (nibbānaṃ + gāmī)
Commentary (SNa) vānaabhāvena nibbānaṃ.
Sanskrit nirvāṇa + gāmin

vanappagumbe yatha phussit'agge,
gimhānamāse paṭhamasmiṃ gimhe,
tath'ūpamaṃ dhammavaraṃ adesayi,
nibbānagāmiṃ paramaṃ hitāya,
idam'pi buddhe ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ,
etena saccena suvatthi hotu.

SNP 13 ratanasuttaṃ,
cūḷavaggo 1

aññā hi lābh'ūpanisā,
aññā nibbānagāminī,
evam'etaṃ abhiññāya,
bhikkhu buddhassa sāvako,
sakkāraṃ n'ābhinandeyya,
vivekam'anubrūhaye.

nibbānadhātu

Sanskrit nirvāna + dhātu

dve'mā, bhikkhave, nibbānadhātuyo. katame dve? saupādisesā ca nibbānadhātu, anupādisesā ca nibbānadhātu.

ITI 44 nibbānadhātusuttaṃ

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, bahū ce'pi bhikkhū anupādisesāya nibbānadhātuyā parinibbāyanti, na tena nibbānadhātuyā ūnattaṃ vā pūrattaṃ vā paññāyati

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ
nibbānadhātusutta

nt. Itivuttaka 44 (ITI 44) ✗

na āvaṭṭaggāho gahessati, na antopūtī bhavissatha, evaṃ tumhe, bhikkhave, nibbānaninnā bhavissatha nibbānapoṇā nibbānapabbhārā.

SN 35.241 paṭhamadārukkhandhopamasuttaṃ
nibbānapañhāsutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 38.1 (SN38.1) ✗
nibbānapaṭisaṃyutta
