Sanskrit nirvāṇa + prāpti

sambādhe v'āpi vindanti,
dhammaṃ nibbānapattiyā,
ye satiṃ paccalatthaṃsu,
sammā te susamāhitā'ti.

das'uttaraṃ pavakkhāmi,
dhammaṃ nibbānapattiyā,
dukkhass'antakiriyāya,
sabbaganthappamocanaṃ.

nibbānapada

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning state of Nibbāna
Construction nibbāna + pada

te pabbajitvā sugatassa sāsane,
bhāvetva bojjh'aṅgabalāni paṇḍitā,
udaggacittā sumanā kat'indriyā,
phusiṃsu nibbānapadaṃ asaṅkhatan'ti.

idha diṭṭhasutamutaviññātesu,
piyarūpesu hemaka,
chandarāgavinodanaṃ,
nibbānapadam'accutaṃ.

SNP 63 hemaka māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 8
nibbānapabbhāra

na āvaṭṭaggāho gahessati, na antopūtī bhavissatha, evaṃ tumhe, bhikkhave, nibbānaninnā bhavissatha nibbānapoṇā nibbānapabbhārā.

SN 35.241 paṭhamadārukkhandhopamasuttaṃ
nibbānaparāyaṇa

adj. culminating in Nibbāna; destined for Nibbāna [nibbāna + parāyaṇa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning culminating in Nibbāna; destined for Nibbāna
Construction nibbāna + parāyaṇa
Compound sattamī tappurisa (nibbānaṃ + parāyaṇa)
Sanskrit nirvāṇa + parāyaṇa

accayāsi, brāhmaṇa, pañhaṃ, n'āsakkhi pañhassa pariyantaṃ gahetuṃ. nibbān'ogadhañ'hi, brāhmaṇa, brahmacariyaṃ vussati nibbānaparāyaṇaṃ nibbānapariyosānan'ti.

SN 48.42 uṇṇābhabrāhmaṇasuttaṃ
nibbānaparāyana

adj. culminating in Nibbāna; destined for Nibbāna [nibbāna + parāyana] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning culminating in Nibbāna; destined for Nibbāna
Construction nibbāna + parāyana
Compound sattamī tappurisa (nibbānaṃ + parāyana)
Commentary (MNa) nibbānaparāyanan'ti nibbānaṃ paraṃ ayanam'assa parā gati, na tato paraṃ gacchatī'ti attho.
Sanskrit nirvāṇa + parāyaṇa

nibbānassa pan'āyye, kiṃ paṭibhāgo'ti? accayāsi, āvuso visākha, pañhaṃ, n'āsakkhi pañhānaṃ pariyantaṃ gahetuṃ. nibbān'ogadhañ'hi, āvuso visākha, brahmacariyaṃ, nibbānaparāyanaṃ nibbānapariyosānaṃ.

MN 44 cūḷavedallasuttaṃ
nibbānapariyosāna

adj. culminating in Nibbāna; finishing with extinguishing; (or) having Nibbāna as conclusion [nibbāna + pariyosāna] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning culminating in Nibbāna; finishing with extinguishing; (or) having Nibbāna as conclusion
Construction nibbāna + pariyosāna
Compound sattamī tappurisa (nibbāne + pariyosāna)
Commentary (MNa) nibbānaṃ pariyosānaṃ avasānaṃ assā'ti nibbānapariyosānaṃ. (ANa) nibbānapariyosānā'ti ettha anupādisesā. anupādisesaṃ pattassa hi sabbe dhammā pariyosānappattā nāma honti
Sanskrit nirvāṇa + paryavasāna

samādhippamukhā sabbe dhammā, sat'ādhipateyyā sabbe dhammā, paññ'uttarā sabbe dhammā, vimuttisārā sabbe dhammā, amat'ogadhā sabbe dhammā, nibbānapariyosānā sabbe dhammā'ti.

AN 10.58 mūlakasuttaṃ

accayāsi, brāhmaṇa, pañhaṃ, n'āsakkhi pañhassa pariyantaṃ gahetuṃ. nibbān'ogadhañ'hi, brāhmaṇa, brahmacariyaṃ vussati nibbānaparāyaṇaṃ nibbānapariyosānan'ti.

SN 48.42 uṇṇābhabrāhmaṇasuttaṃ
nibbānapoṇa

adj. sloping to Nibbāna; inclining to Nibbāna; leading to Nibbāna [nibbāna + poṇa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning sloping to Nibbāna; inclining to Nibbāna; leading to Nibbāna
Construction nibbāna + poṇa
Compound catutthī tappurisa (nibbānassa + poṇa)
Sanskrit nirvāṇa + pravaṇa

nibbānapoṇañ'ca me mānasaṃ bhavissati, saṃyojanā ca me pahānaṃ gacchissanti, paramena ca sāmaññena samannāgato bhavissāmī'ti.

AN 6.102 anavatthitasuttaṃ

na āvaṭṭaggāho gahessati, na antopūtī bhavissatha, evaṃ tumhe, bhikkhave, nibbānaninnā bhavissatha nibbānapoṇā nibbānapabbhārā.

SN 35.241 paṭhamadārukkhandhopamasuttaṃ
nibbānamattano

sandhi. one’s own quenching; one’s own going out; lit. extinguishing of one’s self [nibbānaṃ + attano] ✓

Grammar sandhi, nt + masc
Meaning one’s own quenching; one’s own going out; lit. extinguishing of one’s self
Construction nibbānaṃ + attano
Sanskrit nirvāṇa + ātmane

sati kāyagatā upaṭṭhitā,
chasu phass'āyatanesu saṃvuto,
satataṃ bhikkhu samāhito,
jaññā nibbānam'attano'ti.

UD 25 mahāmoggallānasuttaṃ
nibbānameti

pr. goes to Nibbāna [nibbānaṃ + eti] ✓

Grammar pr, comp vb
Meaning goes to Nibbāna
Construction nibbānaṃ + eti
Compound comp verb (nibbānaṃ + eti)
Commentary (DHPa) sittā te lahum'essatī'ti yathā hi mahāsamudde udakass'eva bharitā nāvā chiddāni pidahitvā udakassa sittatāya sittā sallahukā hutvā mahāsamudde anosīditvā sīghaṃ supaṭṭanaṃ gacchati, evaṃ tavā'pi ayaṃ micchāvitakkodakabharitā attabhāvanā'vā cakkhudvār'ādichiddāni saṃvarena pidahitvā uppannassa micchāvitakkodakassa sittatāya sittā sallahukā saṃsāravaṭṭe anosīditvā sīghaṃ nibbānaṃ gamissati.
Sanskrit nirvāṇam + eti

siñca bhikkhu imaṃ nāvaṃ,
sittā te lahum'essati,
chetvā rāgañ'ca dosañ'ca,
tato nibbānam'ehisi.

DHP25 bhikkhuvaggo
nibbānasacchikiriyā

tapo ca brahmacariyañ'ca,
ariyasaccāna dassanaṃ,
nibbānasacchikiriyā ca,
etaṃ maṅgalam'uttamaṃ.

KHP 5 maṅgalasuttaṃ
nibbānasantike

n'atthi jhānaṃ apaññassa,
paññā n'atthi ajhāyato,
yamhi jhānañ'ca paññā ca,
sa ve nibbānasantike.

DHP 372 bhikkhuvaggo

vivekaññ'eva sikkhetha,
etadariyānam'uttamaṃ,
na tena seṭṭho maññetha,
sa ve nibbānasantike.

nibbānasampatti

AN 8.34 khettasuttaṃ
nibbānasaṃvattanika

adj. leading to putting out the fire; conducive to Nibbāna [nibbāna + saṃvattanika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning leading to putting out the fire; conducive to Nibbāna
Construction nibbāna + saṃvattanika
Compound catutthī tappurisa (nibbānāya + saṃvattanika)
Antonym anibbānasaṃvattanika
Commentary (MNa) nibbānadhātusacchikiriyāya saṃvattatī'ti nibbānasaṃvattaniko.
Sanskrit nirvāṇa + saṃvartanīya

nekkhammavitakko, bhikkhave, anandhakaraṇo cakkhukaraṇo ñāṇakaraṇo paññāvuddhiko avighātapakkhiko nibbānasaṃvattaniko.

ITI 87 andhakaraṇasuttaṃ

so ca kho nevattabyābādhāya saṃvattati, na parabyābādhāya saṃvattati, na ubhayabyābādhāya saṃvattati, paññāvuddhiko avighātapakkhiko nibbānasaṃvattaniko.

Compound dutiyā tappurisa (nibbānaṃ + adhimutta)
Sanskrit nirvāṇa + adhimukta

seyyathā'pi, sunakkhatta, tālo matthakacchinno abhabbo puna viruḷhiyā. evam'eva kho, sunakkhatta, sammā nibbān'ādhimuttassa purisapuggalassa ye n'evasaññān'āsaññ'āyatanasaṃyojane se ucchinnamūle tāl'āvatthukate anabhāvaṃkate āyatiṃ anuppādadhamme.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ
nibbānābhirata

adj. taking delight in extinguishing; indulging in going out [nibbāna + abhirata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning taking delight in extinguishing; indulging in going out
Construction nibbāna + abhirata
Compound sattamī tappurisa (nibbāne + abhirata)
Antonym sakkāyābhirata
Sanskrit nirvāna + abhirata

ayaṃ vuccat'āvuso, bhikkhu nibbān'ābhirato pajahāsi sakkāyaṃ sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāyā'ti.

AN 6.14 bhaddakasuttaṃ

saddhā dutiyā purisassa hoti,
paññā c'enaṃ pasāsati,
nibbān'ābhirato macco,
sabbadukkhā pamuccatī'ti.

SN 1.59 dutiyasuttaṃ
nibbānogadha

adj. immersed in Nibbāna [nibbāna + ogadha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning immersed in Nibbāna
Construction nibbāna + ogadha
Compound sattamī tappurisa (nibbānasmiṃ + ogadha)
Commentary (MNa) nibbān'ogadhan'ti nibbān'abbhantaraṃ nibbānaṃ anupaviṭṭhaṃ.
Sanskrit nirvāṇa + avagāḍha

accayāsi, brāhmaṇa, pañhaṃ, n'āsakkhi pañhassa pariyantaṃ gahetuṃ. nibbān'ogadhañ'hi, brāhmaṇa, brahmacariyaṃ vussati nibbānaparāyaṇaṃ nibbānapariyosānan'ti.

SN 48.42 uṇṇābhabrāhmaṇasuttaṃ
nibbānogadhagāmī

adj. leading to a immersion in Nibbāna [nibbāna + ogadha + gāmī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning leading to a immersion in Nibbāna
Construction nibbāna + ogadha + gāmī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (nibbānogadhaṃ + gāmī)
Commentary (ANa) nibbān'ogadhagāminan'ti nibbānassa antogāminaṃ. maggabrahmacariyañ'hi nibbānaṃ ārammaṇaṃ karitvā nibbānassa anto'y'eva vattati pavattati.
Sanskrit nirvāṇa + avagāḍha + gāmin

saṃvar'atthaṃ pahān'atthaṃ,
brahmacariyaṃ anītihaṃ,
adesayi so bhagavā,
nibbān'ogadhagāminaṃ,
esa maggo mahantehi,
anuyāto mah'esibhi.

AN 4.25 brahmacariyasuttaṃ
nibbāpana 1

nt. (of fire) extinguishing; quenching; putting out; lit. causing to blow away [nī + √vā + *āpe + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, from nibbāpeti, caus
Meaning (of fire) extinguishing; quenching; putting out; lit. causing to blow away
Root Family nī √vā
Root √vā･1 *āpe (blow, emit odour)
Base √vā + āpe > vāpe > bāpe (caus, irreg)
Construction nī + bāpe + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Phonetic Change īv > ibb
v > b
Sanskrit nirvāpaṇa
Sanskrit Root √vā 2 (blow)

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, ādittacelo vā ādittasīso vā, tass'eva celassa vā sīsassa vā nibbāpanāya adhimattaṃ chandañ'ca vāyāmañ'ca ussāhañ'ca ussoḷhiñ'ca appaṭivāniñ'ca satiñ'ca sampajaññañ'ca kareyya.

AN 10.51 sacittasuttaṃ
nibbāpana 2

nt. cooling [nī + √vā] ✗
nibbāpetabba

ptp. should be put out; should be extinguished; lit. to be caused to blow away [nī + √vā + *āpe + tabba] ✓

Grammar ptp of nibbāpeti, caus
Meaning should be put out; should be extinguished; lit. to be caused to blow away
Root Family nī √vā
Root √vā･1 *āpe (blow, emit odour)
Base √vā + āpe > vāpe (caus)
Construction nī + vāpe + tabba
Derivative kicca (tabba)
Sanskrit nirvāpayitavya
Sanskrit Root √vā 2 (blow)

ayaṃ kho pana, brāhmaṇa, kaṭṭh'aggi kālena kālaṃ ujjaletabbo, kālena kālaṃ ajjhupekkhitabbo, kālena kālaṃ nibbāpetabbo, kālena kālaṃ nikkhipitabbo'ti.

AN 7.47 dutiyaaggisuttaṃ
nibbāpeti 1

pr. (+acc) (of fire) grows cold; lit. causes to blow away [nī + √vā + *āpe + ti] ✓

Meaning (of fire) grows cold; lit. causes to blow away
Root Family nī √vā
Root √vā･1 *āpe (blow, emit odour)
Base √vā + āpe > vāpe > bāpe (caus, irreg)
Construction nī + bāpe + ti
Phonetic Change īv > ibb
v > b
Variant nibbāyati
Sanskrit nirvāpayati
Sanskrit Root √vā 2 (blow)

sace, bhikkhave, suvaṇṇakāro vā suvaṇṇakār'antevāsī vā taṃ jātarūpaṃ ek'antaṃ udakena paripphoseyya, ṭhānaṃ taṃ jātarūpaṃ nibbāpeyya

AN 3.103 nimittasuttaṃ
nibbāpeti 2

pr. (+acc) puts out, extinguishes [nī + √vā] ✗
nibbāpetukāma

Grammar adj, comp

Construction nibbāpetuṃ + kāma
Compound tuṃpaccaya tappurisa (nibbāpetuṃ + kāma)
Sanskrit nirvāpayitum + kāma

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso mahantaṃ aggikkhandhaṃ nibbāpetu'kāmo assa. so tattha sukkhāni c'eva tiṇāni pakkhipeyya, sukkhāni ca gomayāni pakkhipeyya

SN 46.53 aggisuttaṃ

v > b
Sanskrit nirvāpayitum
Sanskrit Root √vā 2 (blow)

bhabbo nu kho so puriso mahantaṃ aggikkhandhaṃ nibbāpetun'ti? no h'etaṃ, bhante

SN 46.53 aggisuttaṃ

v > b
Sanskrit nirvāti
Sanskrit Root √vā 2 (blow)

sā harit'antaṃ vā panth'antaṃ vā sel'antaṃ vā udak'antaṃ vā ramaṇīyaṃ vā bhūmibhāgaṃ āgamma anāhārā nibbāyati. hoti kho so, āvuso, samayo yaṃ kukkuṭapattena'pi nhārudaddulena'pi aggiṃ gavesanti.

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, telañ'ca paṭicca vaṭṭiñ'ca paṭicca telappadīpo jhāyeyya, tass'eva telassa ca vaṭṭiyā ca pariyādānā anāhāro nibbāyeyya

nibbāyamāna

prp. cooling down; getting cold [nī + √vā] ✗

v > b

kappāyano kacci'ssa taṃ amoghaṃ,
nibbāyi so ādu saupādiseso,
yathā vimutto ahu taṃ suṇoma.

icchām'ahaṃ, tāta, janapadaṃ gantuṃ, aggiṃ, tāta, paricareyyāsi. mā ca te aggi nibbāyi.

Meaning doubtless; certain
Root Family vi √cit
Root √cit･8 cha (think, intend)
Base √cit + cit + sa > cikiccha (desid)
Construction nir + vi + cikiccha + ā + a
nibbicikicchā + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Phonetic Change r > b
v > b
c > k
Compound kammadhāraya (nir + vicikiccha)
Sanskrit nirvicikitsa
Sanskrit Root √cit √cint 1, 2, 3 (perceive, know, appear)

yesañ'ca kho etaṃ bhante ñātaṃ diṭṭhaṃ viditaṃ sacchikataṃ phassitaṃ paññāya, nikkaṅkhā te tattha nibbicikicchā

nibbicikicchā

Root √cit･8 cha (think, intend)

v > b
c > k
Compound kammadhāraya (nir + vicikicchā)
Sanskrit nir + vicikitsā
Sanskrit Root √cit √cint 1, 2, 3 (perceive, know, appear)

bhūtam'idan'ti, bhikkhave, iti'pi vo ettha nibbicikicchā'ti? evaṃ, bhante. tadāhārasambhavan'ti, bhikkhave, iti'pi vo ettha nibbicikicchā'ti? evaṃ, bhante.

MN 38 mahātaṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ
nibbijja

ger. (+abl) losing interest (in); becoming disenchanted (with); becoming disillusioned (with); being fed up (with) [nī + √vid + ya] ✓

Grammar ger of nibbindati, intrans (+abl)
Meaning losing interest (in); becoming disenchanted (with); becoming disillusioned (with); being fed up (with)
Root Family nī √vid
Root √vid･2 ṃa (feel, like)
Construction nī + √vid > bid + ya
Phonetic Change īv > ibb
dy > jj
Commentary (MNa) nibbijjā'ti nibbinditvā.
Sanskrit nirvidya
Sanskrit Root √vid 2, 6 (find)

yadā kho, bhikkhave, kummo kacchapo soṇḍipañcamānaṃ aṅgānaṃ aññataraṃ vā aññataraṃ vā aṅgaṃ na abhininnāmi, atha siṅgālo kummamhā nibbijja pakkāmi, otāraṃ alabhamāno.

SN 35.240 kummopamasuttaṃ

so kho ahaṃ, aggivessana, taṃ dhammaṃ analaṅkaritvā tasmā dhammā nibbijja apakkamiṃ.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
nibbijjati

nibbijji

aor. was disheartened or disgusted [nī + √vid] ✗

dhy > jjh

yass'indriyāni bhāvitāni,
ajjhattaṃ bahiddhā ca sabbaloke,
nibbijjha imaṃ parañ'ca lokaṃ,
kālaṃ kaṅkhati bhāvito sa danto.

yāni loke gadhitāni,
na tesu pasuto siyā,
nibbijjha sabbaso kāme,
sikkhe nibbānam'attano.

nibbiṭṭharājabhaṭa

nibbidattha

iti kho, bhikkhave, virāgo vimuttiñāṇadassan'attho vimuttiñāṇadassan'ānisaṃso, nibbidā virāg'atthā virāg'ānisaṃsā, yathābhūtañāṇadassanaṃ nibbid'atthaṃ nibbid'ānisaṃsaṃ

AN 11.2 cetanākaraṇīyasuttaṃ

sabbasaṅkhāresu ca me nibbidasaññā paccupaṭṭhitā bhavissati, seyyathā'pi ukkhitt'āsike vadhake. sabbalokā ca me mano vuṭṭhahissati, nibbāne ca santadassāvī bhavissāmi

AN 6.103 ukkhittāsikasuttaṃ
nibbidā

fem. (+dat) dis-enchantment (towards); de-illusionment (with); disinterest (in); dispassion (towards) [nī + √vid + ā] ✓

Root √vid･2 ṃa (feel, like)

Derivative kita (ā)
Phonetic Change īv > ibb
Sanskrit nirvid, nirvidā (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √vid 2, 6 (find)

so iti paṭisaṅkhāya atītasmiṃ rūpasmiṃ anapekkho hoti, anāgataṃ rūpaṃ n'ābhinandati, paccuppannassa rūpassa nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya paṭipanno hoti

SN 22.79 khajjanīyasuttaṃ

evaṃ passaṃ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako ... viññāṇasmiṃ nibbindati, nibbidā virajjati, virāgā vimuccati, vimuttasmiṃ vimuttam'iti ñāṇaṃ hoti.

Meaning seeing (something) as dis-enchanting; observing (something) with disinterest

nibbidābahulasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 22.146 (SN22.146) ✗
nibbidāvipanna

adj. who has failed to become disenchanted; without disinterest [nibbidā + vipanna] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has failed to become disenchanted; without disinterest
Construction nibbidā + vipanna
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (nibbidāya + vipanna)
Sanskrit nirvid, nirvidā (bsk) + vipanna

yathābhūtañāṇadassane asati yathābhūtañāṇadassanavipannassa hat'ūpanisā hoti nibbidā. nibbidāya asati nibbidāvipannassa hat'ūpaniso hoti virāgo. virāge asati virāgavipannassa hat'ūpanisaṃ hoti vimuttiñāṇadassanaṃ.

AN 11.3 paṭhamaupanisāsuttaṃ
nibbidāvirāga

masc. dis-enchantment and detachment; disinterest and dispassion [nibbidā + virāga] ✓

Meaning dis-enchantment and detachment; disinterest and dispassion
Construction nibbidā + virāga
Compound dvanda (nibbidā ca virāga ca)
Sanskrit nirvid + virāga

iti kho, bhikkhave, nibbidāvirāgo vimuttiñāṇadassan'attho vimuttiñāṇadassan'ānisaṃso, yathābhūtañāṇadassanaṃ nibbidāvirāg'atthaṃ nibbidāvirāg'ānisaṃsaṃ

AN 10.2 cetanākaraṇīyasuttaṃ

iti kho, bhikkhave, nibbidāvirāgo vimuttiñāṇadassan'attho vimuttiñāṇadassan'ānisaṃso, yathābhūtañāṇadassanaṃ nibbidāvirāg'atthaṃ nibbidāvirāg'ānisaṃsaṃ

AN 10.2 cetanākaraṇīyasuttaṃ
nibbidāvirāgavipanna

Antonym nibbidāvirāgasampanna
nibbidāvirāgasampanna

adj. who has successfully achieved dis-enchantment and detachment; with disinterest and dispassion [nibbidāvirāga + sampanna] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has successfully achieved dis-enchantment and detachment; with disinterest and dispassion
Construction nibbidāvirāga + sampanna
Antonym nibbidāvirāgavipanna
nibbidāvirāgānisaṃsa

adj. for the benefit of dis-enchantment and detachment; for the advantage of disinterest and dispassion [nibbidā + virāga + ānisaṃsa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning for the benefit of dis-enchantment and detachment; for the advantage of disinterest and dispassion
Construction nibbidā + virāga + ānisaṃsa
Compound sattamī tappurisa (nibbidāvirāge + ānisaṃsa)
Sanskrit nirvid + virāga + anuśaṃsa (bsk)

iti kho, bhikkhave, nibbidāvirāgo vimuttiñāṇadassan'attho vimuttiñāṇadassan'ānisaṃso, yathābhūtañāṇadassanaṃ nibbidāvirāg'atthaṃ nibbidāvirāg'ānisaṃsaṃ

AN 10.2 cetanākaraṇīyasuttaṃ
nibbidāsampanna

adj. who has successfully achieved disenchantment; who is disinterested; lit. succeeded with disinterest [nibbidā + sampanna] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has successfully achieved disenchantment; who is disinterested; lit. succeeded with disinterest
Construction nibbidā + sampanna
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (nibbidāya + sampanna)
Sanskrit nirvid, nirvidā (bsk) + sampanna

yathābhūtañāṇadassane sati yathābhūtañāṇadassanasampannassa upanisasampannā hoti nibbidā, nibbidāya sati nibbidāsampannassa upanisasampanno hoti virāgo, virāge sati virāgasampannassa upanisasampannaṃ hoti vimuttiñāṇadassanaṃ.

nibbinda 1

masc. dissatisfaction; disgust; turning away [nī + √vid] ✗

nibbindati 1

pr. (+loc) is dis-enchanted (with); is disinterested (in); is disillusioned (by); loses interest (in); is dispassionate (towards) [nī + √vid + ṃa + ti] ✓

Root √vid･2 ṃa (feel, like)
Base √vid + ṃa > vinda > binda (irreg)
Construction nī + binda + ti
Phonetic Change īv > ibb
v > b
Antonym sārajjati
Sanskrit nirvidyate
Sanskrit Root √vid 2, 6 (find)

yaṃ kiñci pasavati, asuci'y'eva pasavati, duggandhaṃ'y'eva pasavati, jegucchiyaṃ'y'eva pasavati. tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, imasmiṃ kāye nibbindathā'ti.

AN 9.15 gaṇḍasuttaṃ

sabbe saṅkhārā aniccā'ti,
yadā paññāya passati,
atha nibbindati dukkhe,
esa maggo visuddhiyā.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
nibbindamāna

Phonetic Change īv > ibb
v > b
Commentary (ANa) sammā nibbindamāno'tiādīsu pana sammā hetunā nayena nibbid'ānupassanāya nibbindanto ukkaṇṭhanto, virāg'ānupassanāya virajjanto, paṭisaṅkh'ānupassanāya muccanassa upāyaṃ katvā vimuccamāno, adhimokkhavasena vā vimuccamāno sanniṭṭhānaṃ kurumāno'ti attho.
Sanskrit nirvidyamāna
Sanskrit Root √vid 2, 6 (find)

sabbe sattā āhāraṭṭhitikā, imasmiṃ kho, bhikkhave, ekadhamme bhikkhu sammā nibbindamāno sammā virajjamāno sammā vimuccamāno sammā pariyantadassāvī samma'd'atthaṃ abhisamecca diṭṭh'eva dhamme dukkhass'antakaro hoti.

Sanskrit Root √veṣṭ 1 (wrap)

seyyathā'pi nāma suttaguḷe khitte nibbeṭhiyamānam'eva paleti, evam'eva bāle ca paṇḍite ca sandhāvitvā saṃsaritvā dukkhass'antaṃ karissantī'ti.

micchāpaṭipanno tvam'asi, aham'asmi sammāpaṭipanno. sahitaṃ me, asahitaṃ te. purevacanīyaṃ pacchā avaca, pacchāvacanīyaṃ pure avaca. adhiciṇṇaṃ te viparāvattaṃ. āropito te vādo, cara vādappamokkhāya. niggahito'si, nibbeṭhehi vā sace pahosī'ti.

SN 56.9 viggāhikakathāsuttaṃ

katame ca, bhikkhave, aṭṭha purisakhaḷuṅkā aṭṭha ca purisadosā? idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bhikkhuṃ āpattiyā codenti. so bhikkhu bhikkhūhi āpattiyā codiyamāno, na sarāmī'ti asatiyā nibbeṭheti.

Sanskrit Root √vyadh 4 (pierce)

nibbedhikapariyāyaṃ vo, bhikkhave, dhammapariyāyaṃ desessāmi. taṃ suṇātha, sādhukaṃ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī'ti. evaṃ, bhante'ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ. bhagavā etadavoca.

AN 6.63 nibbedhikasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako paññavā hoti uday'atthagāminiyā paññāya samannāgato ariyāya nibbedhikāya, sammā dukkhakkhayagāminiyā. idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, paññ'indriyaṃ

SN 48.9 paṭhamavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
nibbedhikapañña

adj. with penetrative understanding; with incisive intelligence; with discriminative wisdom [nibbedhika + pañña] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with penetrative understanding; with incisive intelligence; with discriminative wisdom
Construction nibbedhika + pañña
Compound kammadhāraya (nibbedhika + pañña)
Commentary (SNa) katamā nibbedhikapaññā? idh'ekacco sabbasaṅkhāresu ubbegabahulo hoti uttāsabahulo ukkaṇṭhanabahulo aratibahulo anabhiratibahulo bahimukho na ramati sabbasaṅkhāresu, anibbiddhapubbaṃ appadālitapubbaṃ lobhakkhandhaṃ nibbijjhati padāletī'ti nibbedhikapaññā.
Sanskrit nirvedha + ka + prajña

sutavā nibbedhikapañño, sutavā nibbedhikapañño'ti, bhante, vuccati. kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, sutavā nibbedhikapañño hotī'ti

AN 4.186 ummaggasuttaṃ

nibbedhikapañño, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. app'iccho, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. santuṭṭho, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. pavivitto, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. asaṃsaṭṭho, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto.

SN 2.29 susimasuttaṃ
nibbedhikapaññatā

fem. state of penetrating wisdom; fact of having incisive understanding [nibbedhika + paññatā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning state of penetrating wisdom; fact of having incisive understanding
Construction nibbedhika + paññatā
Commentary (PM) nibbedhikapaññatāya saṃvattantī'ti katamā nibbedhikapaññā? idh'ekacco sabbasaṅkhāresu ubbegabahulo hoti uttāsabahulo ukkaṇṭhanabahulo aratibahulo anabhiratibahulo. bahimukho na ramati sabbasaṅkhāresu. anibbiddhapubbaṃ appadālitapubbaṃ lobhakkhandhaṃ nibbijjhati padāletī'ti, nibbedhikapaññā. anibbiddhapubbaṃ appadālitapubbaṃ dosakkhandhaṃ nibbijjhati padāletī'ti, nibbedhikapaññā.
nibbedhikapaññāsutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 55.74 (SN55.74) ✗
nibbedhikapariyāya

masc. penetrating discourse; discriminative instruction [nibbedhika + pariyāya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning penetrating discourse; discriminative instruction
Construction nibbedhika + pariyāya
Compound kammadhāraya (nibbedhika + pariyāya)
Commentary (ANa) anibbiddhapubbe appadālitapubbe lobhakkhandh'ādayo nibbijjhati padāletī'ti nibbedhikapariyāyo, nibbijjhanakāraṇan'ti attho.
Sanskrit nirvedha + paryāya

nibbedhikapariyāyaṃ vo, bhikkhave, dhammapariyāyaṃ desessāmi. taṃ suṇātha, sādhukaṃ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī'ti. evaṃ, bhante'ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ. bhagavā etadavoca

nibbhogo bhavaṃ gotamo'ti

par'āgāresu bhikkhati.

Root √mant･8 *e (counsel, invite)

Derivative kita (ana)
Commentary (DNa) na nimantanan'ti asukaṃ nāma kulaṃ vā vīthiṃ vā gāmaṃ vā paviseyyāthā'ti evaṃ nimantitabhikkham'pi na sādiyati, na gaṇhāti.

seyyath'idaṃ, nando vaccho, kiso saṃkicco, makkhali gosālo, etehi, bho gotama, acelakā mutt'ācārā hatth'āpalekhanā naehibhaddantikā natiṭṭhabhaddantikā na abhihaṭaṃ na uddissakataṃ na nimantanaṃ sādiyanti

SN 12.67 naḷakalāpīsuttaṃ

gaṇabhojanaṃ nāma yattha cattāro bhikkhū pañcannaṃ bhojanānaṃ aññatarena bhojanena nimantitā bhuñjanti. etaṃ gaṇabhojanaṃ nāma.

rūpaṃ disvā sati muṭṭhā,
piyaṃ nimittaṃ manasi karoto,
sārattacitto vedeti,
tañ'ca ajjhosa tiṭṭhati.

adhicittam'anuyuttena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā tīṇi nimittāni kālena kālaṃ manasi kātabbāni, kālena kālaṃ samādhinimittaṃ manasi kātabbaṃ, kālena kālaṃ paggahanimittaṃ manasi kātabbaṃ, kālena kālaṃ upekkhānimittaṃ manasi kātabbaṃ.

VIN 1.1.1 paṭhamapārājikaṃ, santhatabhāṇavāro
nimitta 8

nt. hint; suggestion; clue [ni + √mā] ✗
nimittakamma

nt. making a sign; giving a signal [nimitta + kamma] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning making a sign; giving a signal
Construction nimitta + kamma
Commentary (VINa) nimittakamman'ti saññ'uppādan'atthaṃ kassaci nimittassa karaṇaṃ, taṃ, akkhiṃ vā nikhaṇissāmī'tiādinā nayena tidhā vuttaṃ. aññam'pi pan'ettha hatthalaṅghana-pāṇippahāra-aṅguliphoṭana-gīvunnāmana-ukkāsan'ādi-anekappakāraṃ saṅgahetabbaṃ. sesam'ettha saṅketakamme vuttanayamevā'ti.
Sanskrit nimitta + karman

nimittakammaṃ nāma nimittaṃ karoti, akkhiṃ vā nikhaṇissāmi bhamukaṃ vā ukkhipissāmi sīsaṃ vā ukkhipissāmi, tena nimittena taṃ jīvitā voropehī'ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.

MN 43 mahāvedallasuttaṃ
nimittakovida

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning skilled in signs; expert in markings
Construction nimitta + kovida
nimittaggāha

masc. enticed by appearances; focusing on prominent features; lit. grasping signs [nimitta + gāha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning enticed by appearances; focusing on prominent features; lit. grasping signs
Construction nimitta + gāha
Commentary (SNa) anubyañjanaso nimittaggāho'ti hatthā sobhanā pādā sobhanā'ti evaṃ anubyañjanavasena nimittaggāho. nimittaggāho'ti hi saṃsandetvā gahaṇaṃ, anubyañjanaggāho'ti vibhattigahaṇaṃ. nimittaggāho kumbhīlasadiso sabbam'eva gaṇhāti, anubyañjanaggāho rattapāsadiso vibhajitvā hatthapād'ādīsu taṃ taṃ koṭṭhāsaṃ. ime pana dve gāhā ekajavanavāre'pi labbhanti, nānājavanavāre vattabbam'eva n'atthi.
Sanskrit nimitta + gṛhāya

varaṃ, bhikkhave, tattāya ayosalākāya ādittāya sampajjalitāya sajotibhūtāya cakkhu'ndriyaṃ sampalimaṭṭhaṃ, na tv'eva cakkhuviññeyyesu rūpesu anubyañjanaso nimittaggāho.

SN 35.235 ādittapariyāyasuttaṃ
nimittaggāhī

adj. enticed by appearances; focusing on prominent features; lit. grasping signs [nimitta + gāhī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning enticed by appearances; focusing on prominent features; lit. grasping signs
Construction nimitta + gāhī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (nimittaṃ + gāhī)
Commentary (NIDD1a) nimittaggāhī'ti itthipurisanimittaṃ vā subhanimitt'ādikaṃ vā kilesavatthubhūtaṃ nimittaṃ chandarāgavasena gaṇhāti, diṭṭhamatte'y'eva na saṇṭhāti.
Sanskrit nimitta + gṛhāya

kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu indriyesu guttadvāro hoti? idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā na nimittaggāhī hoti n'ānubyañjanaggāhī.

AN 4.37 aparihāniyasuttaṃ

cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā na nimittaggāhī n'ānubyañjanaggāhī

nimittasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 3.103 (AN3.103) ✗

SN 35.235 ādittapariyāyasuttaṃ
nimittānusārī

adj. following signs; following after mental representations [nimitta + anusārī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning following signs; following after mental representations
Construction nimitta + anusārī

Commentary (ANa) nimitt'ānusārī'ti vuttappabhedaṃ nimittaṃ anusaraṇasabhāvaṃ.
Sanskrit nimitta + anusārin

idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ vadeyya, animittā hi kho me cetovimutti bhāvitā bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā, atha ca pana me nimitt'ānusāri viññāṇaṃ hotī'ti.

AN 6.13 nissāraṇīyasuttaṃ
nimittobhāsakathā

fem. discussion about dropping a hint ✗
nimināti

pr. exchanges for, barters [ni + √mi] ✗
nimissati

pr. will bring; will take ✗
nimīleti

pr. (of eyes) closes; shuts [ni + √mīl + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning (of eyes) closes; shuts
Root Family ni √mīl
Root √mīl･8 *e (close eyes)
Base √mīl + e > mīle
Construction ni + mīle + ti
Antonym ummīleti
Sanskrit nimīlayati
Sanskrit Root √mīl 1 (wink)

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, cakkhumā puriso āpāthagatānaṃ rūpānaṃ adassanakāmo assa, so nimīleyya vā aññena vā apalokeyya.

MN 20 vitakkasaṇṭhānasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, ānanda, cakkhumā puriso ummīletvā vā nimīleyya, nimīletvā vā ummīleyya

MN 152 indriyabhāvanāsuttaṃ
nimīletvā

abs. (of eyes) having closed; having shut [ni + √mīl + *e + tvā] ✓

Grammar abs of nimīleti, intrans
Meaning (of eyes) having closed; having shut
Root Family ni √mīl
Root √mīl･8 *e (close eyes)
Base √mīl + e > mīle
Construction ni + mīle + tvā
Antonym ummīletvā
Sanskrit nimīl
Sanskrit Root √mīl 1 (wink)

seyyathā'pi, ānanda, cakkhumā puriso ummīletvā vā nimīleyya, nimīletvā vā ummīleyya

MN 152 indriyabhāvanāsuttaṃ
nimugga

pp. immersed; sunk down (in) [ni + √mujj + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of nimujjati
Meaning immersed; sunk down (in)
Root Family ni √mujj
Root √mujj･1 a (dive, sink, submerge)
Construction ni + √mujj + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change jt > gg
Sanskrit nimagna
Sanskrit Root √majj 1, 6 (sink)

udake jātāni udake saṃvaḍḍhāni udak'ānuggatāni antonimuggaposīni

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
nimuggaposī

adj. immersed and nourished ✗
nimujjati

pr. (+loc) (of water) dives (into); plunges (into); submerges (in) [ni + √mujj + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans (+loc)
Meaning (of water) dives (into); plunges (into); submerges (in)
Root Family ni √mujj
Root √mujj･1 a (dive, sink, submerge)
Base √mujj + a > mujja
Construction ni + mujja + ti
Antonym ummujjati
Commentary (VINa) nimujjati vā'tiādīsu nimujjan'atthāya orohantassa padavāre padavāre dukkaṭaṃ.
Sanskrit nimajjati
Sanskrit Root √majj 1, 6 (sink)

udake hasadhammo nāma uparigopphake udake has'ādhippāyo nimujjati vā ummujjati vā palavati vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.

nimokkha

masc. (+gen) release (of); freedom (of); emancipation (of); salvation (of); (comm) path (of) [ni + √mokkh + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from mokkha (+gen)
Meaning release (of); freedom (of); emancipation (of); salvation (of); (comm) path (of)
Root Family ni √mokkh
Root √mokkh･1 a (be freed)
Construction ni + √mokkh + a
Derivative kita (a)
Commentary (SNa) nimokkhan'tiādīni magg'ādīnaṃ nāmāni. maggena hi sattā kilesabandhanato nimuccanti, tasmā maggo sattānaṃ nimokkho'ti vutto.
Sanskrit nirmokṣa
Sanskrit Root √mokṣ 1, 10 (release)

jānāsi no tvaṃ, mārisa, sattānaṃ nimokkhaṃ pamokkhaṃ vivekan'ti? jānāmi khv'āhaṃ, āvuso, sattānaṃ nimokkhaṃ pamokkhaṃ vivekan'ti.

nimokkhasutta

nimmajjati

Grammar pp of nimmanthati (+instr)

Root Family nī √math
Root √math･1 a (churn, stir)
Construction ni + √math + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Phonetic Change īm > imm
Sanskrit nirmathita
Sanskrit Root √math √manth 1, 9 (shake)

evam'eva kho, mahārāja, yaṃ taṃ tejaṃ vīriyā nimmathitaṃ padhān'ābhinibbattaṃ, n'āhaṃ tattha kiñci nānākaraṇaṃ vadāmi, yadidaṃ vimuttiyā vimuttin'ti.

nimmala

adj. spotless; stainless; shining [nir + √mal + a] ✓

Grammar adj, from mala, neg
Meaning spotless; stainless; shining
Root Family √mal
Root √mal×1 a (dirty, stain)
Construction nir + √mal + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change r > m
Compound kammadhāraya (nir + mala)
Antonym mala
Sanskrit nirmala
Sanskrit Root √mlai √mlā 1, 2, 4 (relax)

tato malā malataraṃ,
avijjā paramaṃ malaṃ,
etaṃ malaṃ pahantvāna,
nimmalā hotha bhikkhavo.

DHP 243 malavaggo

so suṇeyya cakkhumato bhāsamānassa, chekaṃ vata, bho, odātaṃ vatthaṃ abhirūpaṃ nimmalaṃ sucī'ti! so odātapariyesanaṃ careyya.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
nimmaṃsa

adj. without meat; fleshless [nir + maṃsa] ✓

Grammar adj, from maṃsa, neg
Meaning without meat; fleshless
Construction nir + maṃsa
Phonetic Change r > m
Compound kammadhāraya (nir + maṃsa)
Sanskrit nirmāṃsa

tam'enaṃ dakkho goghātako vā goghātak'antevāsī vā aṭṭhikaṅkalaṃ sunikkantaṃ nikkantaṃ nimmaṃsaṃ lohitamakkhitaṃ upasumbheyya.

MN 54.2 potaliyasuttaṃ
nimmaṃsalohitamakkhita

adj. without meat but smeared with blood; fleshless and bloodstained [nimmaṃsa + lohitamakkhita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning without meat but smeared with blood; fleshless and bloodstained
Construction nimmaṃsa + lohitamakkhita
Compound dvanda (nimmaṃsa ca lohitamakkhita ca)
Commentary (DNa) nimaṃsalohitamakkhitan'ti maṃse khīṇe'pi lohitaṃ na sussati, taṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ nimaṃsalohitamakkhitan'ti.
Sanskrit nirmāṃsa + lohita + mrakṣita

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu seyyathā'pi passeyya sarīraṃ sivathikāya chaḍḍitaṃ aṭṭhikasaṅkhalikaṃ nimmaṃsalohitamakkhitaṃ nhārusambandhaṃ.

MN 119 kāyagatāsatisuttaṃ
nimmāta

pp. created [nī + √mā] ✗
nimmātar

masc. creator; designer; maker [nī + √mā + tar] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from nimmiṇāti
Meaning creator; designer; maker
Root Family nī √mā
Root √mā･5 nā (measure)
Construction nī + √mā + tar
Derivative kita (tar)
Phonetic Change īm > imm
Commentary (MNa) kattā nimmātā'ti lokassa kattā ca nimmātā ca, pathavī-himavanta-sineru-cakkavāḷa-mahāsamudda-candima-sūriyā ca iminā nimmitā'ti dīpeti.
Sanskrit nirmātṛ
Sanskrit Root √mā 2, 3, 4 (measure)

eso hi, bhikkhu, brahmā mahābrahmā abhibhū anabhibhūto aññadatthudaso vasavattī issaro kattā nimmātā seṭṭho sajitā vasī pitā bhūtabhabyānaṃ.

nimmānaratino

masc. name of a group of devas ✗
nimmānaratī 1

adj. who delight in creation; who enjoy their creations [nimmāna + ratī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who delight in creation; who enjoy their creations
Construction nimmāna + ratī
Compound sattamī tappurisa (nimmānasmiṃ + ratī)
Commentary (DNa) nimmānaratī'ti evaṃ sayaṃ nimmite nimmite nimmāne rati etesan'ti nimmānaratī.
Sanskrit nimāna + ratī

tusitānaṃ devānaṃ saddaṃ sutvā nimmānaratī devā saddam'anussāvesuṃ, lābhā vata bho vajjīnaṃ, suladdhalābhā vajjipajāya, yattha tathāgato viharati arahaṃ sammāsambuddho

MN 31 cūḷagosiṅgasuttaṃ
nimmānaratī 2

masc. realm of the gods who delight in creation [nimmāna + ratī] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning realm of the gods who delight in creation
Construction nimmāna + ratī
Compound sattamī tappurisa (nimmānasmiṃ + ratī)
Commentary (DNa) nimmānaratī'ti evaṃ sayaṃ nimmite nimmite nimmāne rati etesan'ti nimmānaratī.
Sanskrit nimāna + ratī

sahassaṃ cātumahārājikānaṃ sahassaṃ tāvatiṃsānaṃ sahassaṃ yāmānaṃ sahassaṃ tusitānaṃ sahassaṃ nimmānaratīnaṃ sahassaṃ paranimmitavasavattīnaṃ sahassaṃ brahmalokānaṃ.

AN 10.29 paṭhamakosalasuttaṃ
nimmānaratīdevā

masc. gods who delight in creation [nimmānaratī + deva + ā] ✓

Grammar masc pl, comp
Meaning gods who delight in creation
Construction nimmānaratī + deva + ā
nimmānaratīdeva + ā
Compound kammadhāraya (nimmānaratī + devā)
Commentary (DNa) nimmānaratī'ti evaṃ sayaṃ nimmite nimmite nimmāne rati etesan'ti nimmānaratī.
Sanskrit nimāna + rati + deva

so kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā nimmānaratīnaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjati. tatra, bhikkhave, sunimmito devaputto dānamayaṃ puññakiriyavatthuṃ atirekaṃ karitvā, sīlamayaṃ puññakiriyavatthuṃ atirekaṃ karitvā, nimmānaratīdeve dasahi ṭhānehi adhigaṇhāti, dibbena āyunā ... dibbehi phoṭṭhabbehi.

Root √mā･5 nā (measure)

Phonetic Change īm > imm
ā > i (Kacc 502, 493)
Antonym animmita
Sanskrit nimitta
Sanskrit Root √mā 2, 3, 4 (measure)

tassa me tumhe puttā orasā mukhato jātā dhammajā dhammanimmitā dhammadāy'ādā, no āmisadāy'ādā.

nimminitvāna panthako,
nisīd'ambavane ramme,
yāva kālappavedanā'ti.

DHPa 25 cūḷapanthakatthera vatthu
niya

Root √jan･3 ya (be born, produce)

Derivative kita (ya)
Phonetic Change j > y
Sanskrit nija
Sanskrit Root √jan 4 (give birth, be born)

mātā yathā niyaṃ puttaṃ,
āyusā ekaputtam'anurakkhe,
evam'pi sabbabhūtesu,
mānasaṃ bhāvaye aparimāṇaṃ.

KHP 9 karaṇīya mettasuttaṃ
niyaka

adj. one's own ✗
niyata 1

adj. controlled; restrained [ni + √yam + ta] ✓

Grammar adj, pp of niyameti
Meaning controlled; restrained
Root Family ni √yam
Root √yam･1 a (control, strive, end)
Construction ni + √yam + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change mt > t
Sanskrit niyata
Sanskrit Root √yam 1 (reach)

alaṅ'kato ce'pi samaṃ careyya,
santo danto niyato brahmacārī,
sabbesu bhūtesu nidhāya daṇḍaṃ,
so brāhmaṇo so samaṇo sa bhikkhu.

DHP 142 daṇḍavaggo
niyata 2

adj. certain; decided; invariable; unavoidable; of fixed destiny; lit. controlled down [ni + √yam + ta] ✓

Grammar adj, pp of niyameti
Meaning certain; decided; invariable; unavoidable; of fixed destiny; lit. controlled down

Construction ni + √yam + ta

Phonetic Change mt > t
Antonym aniyata
Sanskrit niyata
Sanskrit Root √yam 1 (reach)

so ākaṅkhamāno attanāva attānaṃ byākareyya khīṇanirayo'mhi khīṇatiracchānayoni khīṇapettivisayo khīṇ'āpāyaduggativinipāto sot'āpanno'ham'asmi avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyaṇo'ti

AN 5.179 gihisuttaṃ

aniyato'ti na niyato, pārājikaṃ vā saṅghādiseso vā pācittiyaṃ vā.

VIN 1.3.1 paṭhamāniyatasikkhāpadaṃ
niyatāyuka

adj. whose lifetime is fixed ✗
niyatisaṅgatibhāvapariṇata

adj. altered by fate, chance and nature; moulded by destiny, serendipity and inherent nature ✗
niyatisaṃgatibhāvapariṇata

adj. altered by fate, chance and nature; moulded by destiny, serendipity and inherent nature [niyati + saṃgati + bhāva + pariṇata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning altered by fate, chance and nature; moulded by destiny, serendipity and inherent nature
Construction niyati + saṃgati + bhāva + pariṇata
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (niyatisaṃgatibhāvena + pariṇata)
Commentary (MNa) niyatisaṅgatibhāvapariṇatā'ti ettha niyatī'ti niyatatā. saṅgatī'ti channaṃ abhijātīnaṃ tattha tattha gamanaṃ. bhāvo'ti sabhāvo'y'eva. evaṃ niyatiyā ca saṅgatiyā ca bhāvena ca pariṇatā nānappakārataṃ pattā. yena hi yathā bhavitabbaṃ, so tath'eva bhavati. yena no bhavitabbaṃ, so na bhavatī'ti dassenti.
Sanskrit niyati + saṃgati + bhāva + pariṇata

n'atthi balaṃ, n'atthi vīriyaṃ, n'atthi purisathāmo, n'atthi purisaparakkamo, sabbe sattā sabbe pāṇā sabbe bhūtā sabbe jīvā avasā abalā avīriyā niyatisaṃgatibhāvapariṇatā chasv'ev'ābhijātīsu sukhadukkhaṃ paṭisaṃvedentī'ti.

MN 60 apaṇṇakasuttaṃ
niyassa

adj. (a formal act of the saṅgha) conferring disgrace, loss of status; (or requiring effort) ✗
niyassaka

nt. formal niyassa act ✗
niyassakamma

nt. formal act of the saṅgha conferring loss of status; disgracing, reprimanding ✗
niyassakammakata

adj. dealt with by a formal act of the saṅgha conferring loss of status ✗
niyāma 1

masc. orderliness; certainty; inevitability; fixed order; lit. controlling down [ni + √yam + *a] ✓

Meaning orderliness; certainty; inevitability; fixed order; lit. controlling down
Root Family ni √yam
Root √yam･1 a (control, strive, end)
Construction ni + √yam > yām + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit niyama
Sanskrit Root √yam 1 (reach)

yo, bhikkhave, ime dhamme evaṃ saddahati adhimuccati, ayaṃ vuccati saddh'ānusārī, okkanto sammattaniyāmaṃ, sappurisabhūmiṃ okkanto, vītivatto puthujjanabhūmiṃ.

SN 25.1 cakkhusuttaṃ
niyāma 2

masc. right way; correct method; lit. controlling down [ni + √yam + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, abstr, from niyamati
Meaning right way; correct method; lit. controlling down
Root Family ni √yam
Root √yam･1 a (control, strive, end)

Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Commentary (ANa) niyāmaṃ kusalesu dhammesu sammattan'ti kusalesu dhammesu magganiyāmasaṅkhātaṃ sammattaṃ.
Sanskrit niyama
Sanskrit Root √yam 1 (reach)

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo labhanto vā tathāgataṃ dassanāya alabhanto vā tathāgataṃ dassanāya, labhanto vā tathāgatappaveditaṃ dhammavinayaṃ savanāya alabhanto vā tathāgatappaveditaṃ dhammavinayaṃ savanāya n'eva okkamati niyāmaṃ kusalesu dhammesu sammattaṃ.

itaro pucchitabbaniyāmen'eva pañhaṃ pucchitvā'pi tassa kathāya, apañhaṃ nu kho pucchitan'ti vimatiṃ karoti.

niyāma + tā

Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit niyama + tā
Sanskrit Root √yam 1 (reach)

api ca samaṇo gotamo bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ tathaṃ paṭipadaṃ paññapeti dhammaṭṭhitataṃ dhammaniyāmataṃ.

DN 9.4 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, saññāattakathā
niyāmita

pp. fixed; defined; determined; set [ni + √yam + *e + ita] ~

Grammar pp of niyameti, caus
Meaning fixed; defined; determined; set
Root Family ni √yam
Root √yam･1 *e (control, strive, end)

Construction ni + yāme + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit niyamita
Sanskrit Root √yam 1 (reach)
niyuñjati

pr. (+acc) urges; impels; instigates; encourages; lit. yokes down [ni + √yuj + ṃa + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning urges; impels; instigates; encourages; lit. yokes down
Root Family ni √yuj
Root √yuj･2 ṃa (yoke, join)
Base √yuj + ṃa > yuñja
Construction ni + yuñja + ti
Commentary (THa) itissu maṃ, citta, pure niyuñjasī'ti evañ'hi tvaṃ, citta, maṃ pabbajjato pubbe sammāpaṭipattiyaṃ uyyojesī'ti attho.
Sanskrit niyunakti
Sanskrit Root √yuj 2, 7 (join)

mayūrakoñc'ābhirutamhi kānane,
dīpīhi byagghehi purakkhato vasaṃ,
kāye apekkhaṃ jaha mā virādhaya,
itissu maṃ citta pure niyuñjasi.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

app'icchatā sappurisehi vaṇṇitā,
makkhappahānaṃ vūpasamo dukhassa,
iti'ssu maṃ citta tadā niyuñjasi,
idāni tvaṃ gacchasi pubbaciṇṇaṃ.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
niyojaka

masc. (+loc) instigator; urger; who impels; who encourages (one to do); lit. who yokes down [ni + √yuj + *e + aka] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from niyojeti, caus (+loc)
Meaning instigator; urger; who impels; who encourages (one to do); lit. who yokes down
Root Family ni √yuj
Root √yuj･2 *e (yoke, join)
Base √yuj + *e > yoje (caus)
Construction ni + yoje + aka
Derivative kita (aka)
Phonetic Change u > o
Commentary (NPa) na c'aṭṭhāne niyojako'ti dhammavinay'ādiṃ adhamm'āvinay'ādivasena avatvā dhammavinay'ādivasen'eva dīpanato na ca aṭṭhāne niyojako.
Sanskrit niyojaka
Sanskrit Root √yuj 2, 7 (join)

piyo garu bhāvanīyo,
vattā ca vacanakkhamo,
gambhīrañc'a kathaṃ kattā,
no c'aṭṭhāne niyojako.

AN 7.37 dutiyamittasuttaṃ
niyojayati

pr. (+acc) urges; impels; instigates; encourages; lit. yokes down [ni + √yuj + *aya + ti] ~

Grammar pr, caus of niyuñjati, trans (+acc)
Meaning urges; impels; instigates; encourages; lit. yokes down
Root Family ni √yuj
Root √yuj･2 *aya (yoke, join)
Base √yuj + *aya > yojaya (caus)
Construction ni + yojaya + ti
Phonetic Change u > o
Sanskrit niyojayati
Sanskrit Root √yuj 2, 7 (join)
niyojeti

pr. (+acc) urges, incites, commits [ni + √yuj] ✗
niyojesi

aor. urged, incited, committed [ni + √yuj] ✗
niyyati 1.1

pr. (+acc) is lead (to); is carried (to) [√nī + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass of neti, intrans (+acc)
Meaning is lead (to); is carried (to)
Root Family √nī
Root √nī･1 ya (lead, carry)
Base √nī + ya > nīya > niyya (pass, irreg)
Construction niyya + ti
Phonetic Change īy > iyy
Variant nīyati
Sanskrit nīyati
Sanskrit Root √nī 1, 2 (lead)

so bajjhataṃ pāsasatehi chabbhi,
rammā vanā niyyatu rājadhāniṃ,
tuttehi so haññatu pācanehi,
bhisāni te brāhmaṇa yo ahāsi.

JA 488 bhisa jātakaṃ

nirāsatti anāgate,
atītaṃ n'ānusocati,
vivekadassī phassesu,
diṭṭhīsu ca na niyyati.

SNP 48 purābhedasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 10

Variant nīyamāna

Sanskrit Root √nī 1, 2 (lead)

atha kho vassakāro brāhmaṇo magadhamahāmatto dārugahe gaṇakaṃ bandhaṃ āṇāpesi. addasa kho āyasmā dhaniyo kumbhakāraputto dārugahe gaṇakaṃ bandhaṃ niyyamānaṃ.

idha me, bho gotama, yaṃ ahosi dhanaṃ vā dhaññaṃ vā rajataṃ vā jātarūpaṃ vā sabbaṃ taṃ puttānaṃ dāyajjaṃ niyyātaṃ, tatth'āhaṃ anovādī anupavādī ghāsacchādanaparamo viharāmi.

AN 2.40 samacittavaggo
niyyātetabba

ptp. should be given; (comm) should be finished; should be concluded; lit. to be handed over [nī + √yat + *e + tabba] ~

Grammar ptp of niyyāteti
Meaning should be given; (comm) should be finished; should be concluded; lit. to be handed over
Root Family nī √yat
Root √yat･8 *e (arrange, hand over)
Base √yat + *e > yāte
Construction nī + yāte + tabba
Derivative kicca (tabba)
Phonetic Change īy > iyy
a > ā
Variant niyyādetabba
Commentary (VINa) niyyādetabbo'ti appetabbo.
Sanskrit niryatayitavya
Sanskrit Root √yat 1, 10 (stretch)
niyyāteti 1

pr. (+acc and +dat) hands over (to); delivers (to); returns (to) [nī + √yat + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc and +dat)
Meaning hands over (to); delivers (to); returns (to)
Root Family nī √yat
Root √yat･8 *e (arrange, hand over)
Base √yat + *e > yāte
Construction nī + yāte + ti
Phonetic Change īy > iyy
a > ā
Variant nīyyādeti, niyyādeti
Commentary (SNa) niyyāteh'evā'ti niyyātehi'y'eva. gāvīsu hi aniyyātitāsu gosāmikā āgantvā, ekā gāvī na dissati, eko goṇo, eko vacchako na dissatī'ti tuyhaṃ piṭṭhito piṭṭhito vicarissanti, iti te aphāsukaṃ bhavissati. pabbajjā ca nām'esā saiṇassa na ruhati, aṇaṇā pabbajjā ca buddh'ādīhi saṃvaṇṇitā'ti dassan'atthaṃ evam'āha.
Sanskrit niryātayati
Sanskrit Root √yat 1, 10 (stretch)

tena hi tvaṃ, nanda, sāmikānaṃ gāvo niyyātehī'ti. gamissanti, bhante, gāvo vacchagiddhiniyo'ti. niyyāteh'eva tvaṃ, nanda, sāmikānaṃ gāvo'ti.

pabbaji dāni brāhmaṇo,
sujāto tīhi rattīhi,
tisso vijjā aphassayi.

Sanskrit niryūha, nirvyūha
Sanskrit Root √ūh 1 (remove)

vejayantassa kho, mārisa moggallāna, pāsādassa ekasataṃ niyyūhaṃ. ek'ekasmiṃ niyyūhe satta satta kūṭ'āgārasatāni. ekam'ekasmiṃ kūṭ'āgāre satta satta accharāyo. ekam'ekissā accharāya satta satta paricārikāyo.

MN 37 cūḷataṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ
niragamā

imperf. went out; left; came out, emerged, appeared [nī + √gam] ✗
niraggaḷa

adj. unobstructed; unimpeded; free; lit. unbarred [nir + aggaḷā + a] ✓

Grammar adj, from aggaḷa, neg
Meaning unobstructed; unimpeded; free; lit. unbarred

Derivative taddhita (a)

Antonym aggaḷa
Variant niraggala
Sanskrit nirargala

ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ukkhittapaligho iti'pi, saṃkiṇṇaparikkho iti'pi, abbūḷh'esiko iti'pi, niraggaḷo iti'pi, ariyo pannaddhajo pannabhāro visaṃyutto iti'pi.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
niraggaḷha

masc. type of sacrifice; lit. unbarred [nir + aggaḷha] ✓

Grammar masc, from aggaḷha, neg
Meaning type of sacrifice; lit. unbarred
Construction nir + aggaḷha
Compound kammadhāraya (nir + aggaḷha)
Antonym aggaḷha
Variant niraggaḷa
Commentary (SNa) ekena pariyaññena sattarasahi pasūhi yajitabbassa beluvayūpassa sattarasakadakkhiṇassa yaññass'etaṃ adhivacanaṃ. n'atthi ettha aggaḷā'ti niraggaḷo.
Sanskrit nirargala, nirargaḍa (bsk)

assamedhaṃ purisamedhaṃ,
sammāpāsaṃ vājapeyyaṃ niraggaḷhaṃ,
mahāyaññā mah'ārambhā,
na te honti mahapphalā.

SN 3.9 yaññasuttaṃ
niraṅkatvā

abs. having repudiated, having disregarded [nī + ā + √kar] ✗
nirata

adj. fond of, attached to ✗
niratta 1

masc. no self; soullessness [nir + atta] ✓

Grammar masc, atta group, from atta, neg
Meaning no self; soullessness
Construction nir + atta
Compound kammadhāraya (nir + atta)
Antonym atta
Commentary (SNPa) attā nirattā na hi tassa atthī'ti tassa hi attadiṭṭhi vā ucchedadiṭṭhi vā n'atthi, gahaṇaṃ muñcanaṃ v'āpi attanirattasaññitaṃ n'atthi.
Notes see niratta 2
Sanskrit nirātman

upayo hi dhammesu upeti vādaṃ,
anūpayaṃ kena kathaṃ vadeyya,
attā nirattā na hi tassa atthi,
adhosi so diṭṭhim'idh'eva sabbanti.

SNP 41 duṭṭhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 3

na tassa puttā pasavo,
khettaṃ vatthuñ'ca vijjati,
attā v'āpi nirattā vā,
na tasmiṃ upalabbhati.

SNP 48 purābhedasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 10
niratta 2

nt. rejecting; throwing away; casting aside; lit. threw down [nī + √as + ta] ✓

Grammar nt, pp of nirassati
Meaning rejecting; throwing away; casting aside; lit. threw down
Root Family nī √as
Root √as･3 ya (throw, hurl)
Construction nī + [r] + √as + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change +r
Antonym atta, uggahīta
Commentary (SNPa) attā nirattā na hi tassa atthī'ti tassa hi attadiṭṭhi vā ucchedadiṭṭhi vā n'atthi, gahaṇaṃ muñcanaṃ v'āpi attanirattasaññitaṃ n'atthi.
Notes see niratta 1
Sanskrit nirasta
Sanskrit Root √as 4 (throw)

kāmesu vinaya gedhaṃ,
nekkhammaṃ daṭṭhu khemato,
uggahītaṃ nirattaṃ vā,
mā te vijjittha kiñcanaṃ.

SNP 66 jatukaṇṇi māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 11

upayo hi dhammesu upeti vādaṃ,
anūpayaṃ kena kathaṃ vadeyya,
attaṃ nirattaṃ na hi tassa atthi,
adhosi so diṭṭhim'idh'eva sabbanti.

SNP 41 duṭṭhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 3

Root √ar･1 a (move, attain)

Sanskrit nirartha

aciraṃ vat'ayaṃ kāyo,
pathaviṃ adhisessati,
chuddho apetaviññāṇo,
niratthaṃ'va kaliṅgaraṃ.

DHP 41 cittavaggo
niratthaka

adj. useless; worthless; pointless; meaningless; nonsensical [nir + √ar + tha + ka] ✓

Meaning useless; worthless; pointless; meaningless; nonsensical

nirattha + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Phonetic Change r > t
Sanskrit nirarthaka
Sanskrit Root √ṛ 1 (go, send)

yathā haritālena makkhitaṃ,
addasa cittikaṃ bhittiyā kataṃ,
tamhi te viparītadassanaṃ,
saññā mānusikā niratthikā.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
niratthakaṃ

ind. in vain ✗
niranusaya

adj. without underlying tendencies; free from inherent inclinations; without dormant dispositions; lit. no sleeping alongside [nir + anu + √sī + *a] ✓

Grammar adj, from anusaya, neg
Meaning without underlying tendencies; free from inherent inclinations; without dormant dispositions; lit. no sleeping alongside
Root Family anu √sī
Root √sī･1 a (lie, sleep)
Construction nir + anu + √sī > say + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change ī > ay
Compound kammadhāraya (nir + anusaya)
Antonym anusaya
Sanskrit niranuśaya
Sanskrit Root √śī 1, 2 (lie)

ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu niranusayo sammaddaso acchecchi taṇhaṃ, vivattayi saṃyojanaṃ, sammā mān'ābhisamayā antam'akāsi dukkhassā'ti.

SN 36.3 pahānasuttaṃ
nirabbuda 1

card. 10⁶³ ✓

Grammar card, nt sg
Meaning 10⁶³
Notes 20 abbuda = 1 nirabbuda
Sanskrit nirarbuda

yo sugatesu manaṃ padosaye,
sataṃ sahassānaṃ nirabbudānaṃ,
chattiṃsatī pañca ca abbudāni,
yam'ariyagarahī nirayaṃ upeti,
vācaṃ manañ'ca paṇidhāya pāpakan'ti.

AN 4.3 paṭhamakhatasuttaṃ
nirabbuda 2

adj. free from trouble or tumours [abbuda] ✗
nirabbuda 3

masc. name of a hell [abbuda] ✗
nirabbudaniraya

masc. (comm) part of the Avīci hell where one must stay an nirabbuda-count in duration [nirabbuda + niraya] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning (comm) part of the Avīci hell where one must stay an nirabbuda-count in duration
Construction nirabbuda + niraya
Notes see abbuda 5
niraya

masc. hell; hell realm; lit. no good fortune [nir + √i + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from aya, neg
Meaning hell; hell realm; lit. no good fortune
Root Family √i
Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Construction nir + √i > ay + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > ay
Compound kammadhāraya (nir + aya)
Synonym apāya
Notes MW also suggests nī + √i
Sanskrit niraya
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

yāya devā manussā ca,
sitā tiṭṭhanti atthikā,
tarath'etaṃ visattikaṃ,
khaṇo vo mā upaccagā,
khaṇ'ātītā hi socanti,
nirayamhi samappitā.

SNP 22 uṭṭhānasuttaṃ
cūḷavaggo 10

abhabbo taṃ kammaṃ kātuṃ, yaṃ kammaṃ katvā nirayaṃ vā tiracchānayoniṃ vā pettivisayaṃ vā upapajjeyya, abhabbo'va tāva kālaṃ kātuṃ yāva na sot'āpattiphalaṃ sacchikaroti.

Sanskrit niraya + gamanīya

katamā ca, bhikkhave, āsavānaṃ vemattatā? atthi, bhikkhave, āsavā nirayagamanīyā, atthi āsavā tiracchānayonigamanīyā, atthi āsavā pettivisayagamanīyā, atthi āsavā manussalokagamanīyā, atthi āsavā devalokagamanīyā.

nirayañ'c'āhaṃ, sāriputta, pajānāmi, nirayagāmiñ'ca maggaṃ, nirayagāminiñ'ca paṭipadaṃ, yathā paṭipanno ca kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjati tañ'ca pajānāmi.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ

nirayadukkhaṃ aticca vīriyavā so,
so vīriyavā padhānavā,
dhīro tādi pavuccate tathattā.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ
nirayadevanirayādisutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 56.117-119 (SN56.117-119) ✗
nirayapāla

masc. hell warden; guardian in hell [niraya + pāla] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning hell warden; guardian in hell
Construction niraya + pāla
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (nirayassa + pāla)
Commentary (MNa) tattha ekacce therā, nirayapālā nāma n'atthi, yantarūpaṃ viya kammam'eva kāraṇaṃ kāretī'ti vadanti. tesaṃ taṃ, atthi niraye nirayapālā'ti, āmantā, atthi ca kāraṇikā'tiādinā nayena abhidhamme (kathā. 866) paṭisedhitam'eva. yathā hi manussaloke kammakāraṇakārakā atthi, evam'eva niraye nirayapālā atthī'ti.
Sanskrit niraya + pāla

atha kho maṃ, pāpima, nirayapālā upasaṅkamitvā etadavocuṃ, yadā kho te, mārisa, saṅkunā saṅku hadaye samāgaccheyya, atha naṃ tvaṃ jāneyyāsi, vassasahassaṃ me niraye paccamānassā'ti.

SN 2.8 tāyanasuttaṃ
nirassajati

pr. (+acc) lets go (of); releases; drops; rejects [ni + ā + √saj + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning lets go (of); releases; drops; rejects
Root Family ni ā √saj
Root √saj･1 a (relinquish, let loose)
√ In Comps ssaj
Base √saj + a > saja
Construction ni + [r] + ā + saja + ti
Phonetic Change +r
ās > ass
Antonym uggahāyati
Sanskrit niḥsṛjati
Sanskrit Root √sṛj 1, 6 (send forth)

purimaṃ pahāya aparaṃ sitāse,
ej'ānugā te na taranti saṅgaṃ,
te uggahāyanti nirassajanti,
kapī'va sākhaṃ pamuñcaṃ gahāyaṃ.

SNP 42 suddhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 4
nirassati

pr. (+acc) rejects; discards; lit. throws away [nī + √as + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning rejects; discards; lit. throws away
Root Family nī √as
Root √as･3 ya (throw, hurl)
Base √as + ya > assa
Construction nī + [r] + assa + ti
Phonetic Change +r
y > s
nirassatī with metrically lengthened ī
Antonym ādiyati, ādeti
Sanskrit nirasyati
Sanskrit Root √as 4 (throw)

diṭṭhīnivesā na hi svātivattā,
dhammesu niccheyya samuggahītaṃ,
tasmā naro tesu nivesanesu,
nirassatī ādiyatī ca dhammaṃ.

aṭṭhakavaggo 3

na samesu na omesu,
na ussesu vadate muni,
santo so vītamaccharo,
n'ādeti na nirassatī'ti.

visaṃ pitvā'va chaḍḍitaṃ.

Sanskrit nirāmiṣa

vīriyasambojjh'aṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchati. āraddhavīriyassa uppajjati pīti nirāmisā.

SN 46.3 sīlasuttaṃ

s'āmisaṃ vā sukhaṃ vedanaṃ vedayamāno s'āmisaṃ sukhaṃ vedanaṃ vedayāmī'ti pajānāti, nirāmisaṃ vā sukhaṃ vedanaṃ vedayamāno nirāmisaṃ sukhaṃ vedanaṃ vedayāmī'ti pajānāti.

brahmacārī nirāmiso,

ahuvā te pure sakhā.

AN 8.61 icchāsuttaṃ
nirārambha 1.1

adj. free from violence; not harmful; not injurious (to living creatures) [ā + √rabh + a + a] ✓

Meaning free from violence; not harmful; not injurious (to living creatures)

Compound kammadhāraya (nir + ārambha)
Notes see nirārambha 2
Sanskrit nirārambha (not working)
Sanskrit Root √rabh 1 (take hold)

ye ca yaññā nirārambhā,
yajanti anukulaṃ sadā,
ajeḷakā ca gāvo ca,
vividhā n'ettha haññare,
etaṃ sammaggatā yaññaṃ,
upayanti mah'esino.

mun'īdha nanda kusalā vadanti,
visenikatvā anīghā nirāsā,
caranti ye te munayoti brūmi.

DHP 410 brāhmaṇavaggo
nirāsasa

adj. desireless; without wish; without expectation [nir + ā + √sas + a] ✓

nirāsaso so na ca āsasāno,
paññāṇavā so na ca paññakappī,
evam'pi todeyya muniṃ vijāna,
akiñcanaṃ kāmabhave asattan'ti.

SNP 64 todeyya māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 9

āsā yassa na vijjanti,
asmiṃ loke paramhi ca,
nirāsāsaṃ visaṃyuttaṃ,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

DHP 410 brāhmaṇavaggo
nirāsāsa

adj. desireless; without wish; without expectation [nir + ā + √is + ā + sa] ✓

Grammar adj, from āsā, neg
Meaning desireless; without wish; without expectation
Root Family ā √is
Root √is･1 a (wish for)
Construction nir + ā + √is + ā + sa
nirāsā + sa
Derivative taddhita (sa)
Variant nirāsaya
Commentary (DHPa) nirāsāsan'ti nittaṇhaṃ.
Sanskrit nirāśā
Sanskrit Root √iṣ 1, 4, 6, 9 (seek, desire)

āsā yassa na vijjanti,
asmiṃ loke paramhi ca,
nirāsāsaṃ visaṃyuttaṃ,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

DHP 410 brāhmaṇavaggo
nirujjhati

pr. dissolves; finishes; stops; ceases; vanishes [ni + √rudh + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass of nirundhati, intrans
Meaning dissolves; finishes; stops; ceases; vanishes
Root Family ni √rudh
Root √rudh･2 ya (obstruct)
Base √rudh + ya > rujjha (pass)
Construction ni + rujjha + ti
Phonetic Change dhy > jjh
Antonym uppajjati
Sanskrit nirodhyate
Sanskrit Root √rudh 2, 7 (obstruct)

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, saradasamaye thullaphusitake deve vassante udake udakabubbuḷaṃ uppajjati c'eva nirujjhati ca.

SN 22.95 pheṇapiṇḍūpamasuttaṃ

tañ'ca cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti, yatth'assa te uppannā pāpakā akusalā dhammā aparisesā nirujjhanti.

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ
nirujjhamāna

prp. dissolving; stopping; ending; ceasing; disappearing; vanishing [ni + √rudh + ya + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of nirujjhati, pass, intrans
Meaning dissolving; stopping; ending; ceasing; disappearing; vanishing
Root Family ni √rudh
Root √rudh･2 ya (obstruct)
Base √rudh + ya > rujjha (pass)
Construction ni + rujjha + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Phonetic Change dhy > jjh
Antonym uppajjamāna
Sanskrit nirudhyamāna
Sanskrit Root √rudh 2, 7 (obstruct)

dukkham'eva uppajjamānaṃ uppajjati, dukkhaṃ nirujjhamānaṃ nirujjhatī'ti na kaṅkhati na vicikicchati aparapaccayā ñāṇam'ev'assa ettha hoti. ettāvatā kho, kaccāna, sammādiṭṭhi hoti.

SN 12.15 kaccānagottasuttaṃ

sā kho pan'esā, bhikkhave, taṇhā kattha pahīyamānā pahīyati, kattha nirujjhamānā nirujjhati? yaṃ loke piyarūpaṃ sātarūpaṃ, etth'esā taṇhā pahīyamānā pahīyati, ettha nirujjhamānā nirujjhati.

MN 10 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
nirutti 1

fem. language; speech [nī + √vac + ti] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr
Meaning language; speech
Root Family nī √vac
Root √vac･1 a (say, speak)
Construction nī + [r] + √vac > vak > uk + ti
Derivative kita (ti)
Phonetic Change +r
va > u
v > b
Sanskrit nirukti
Sanskrit Root √vac 2, 3 (speak)

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu atthapaṭisambhidāpatto hoti, dhammapaṭisambhidāpatto hoti, niruttipaṭisambhidāpatto hoti, paṭibhānapaṭisambhidāpatto hoti, yathāvimuttaṃ cittaṃ paccavekkhati.

AN 5.95 akuppasuttaṃ

janapadaniruttiṃ n'ābhiniveseyya, samaññaṃ n'ātidhāveyyā'ti, iti kho pan'etaṃ vuttaṃ. kiñ'c'etaṃ paṭicca vuttaṃ? kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, janapadaniruttiyā ca abhiniveso hoti samaññāya ca atisāro?

MN 139 araṇavibhaṅgasuttaṃ

dhammaṃ vimuttisukhadaṃ vihat'āghasaṃghaṃ,
saṃghaṃ ca niccam'abhivandiya dakkhiṇeyyaṃ.

bālāvatāra paṇāma

tayo'me, bhikkhave, niruttipathā adhivacanapathā paññattipathā asaṅkiṇṇā asaṅkiṇṇapubbā, na saṅkīyanti, na saṅkīyissanti, appaṭikuṭṭhā samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi viññūhi. katame tayo?

SN 22.62 niruttipathasuttaṃ

sabbaṃ niruttipathapāragataṃ sabuddhaṃ,
buddhaṃ tilokatilakaṃ hatapāpadhammaṃ,
dhammaṃ vimuttisukhadaṃ vihat'āghasaṃghaṃ,

bālāvatāra paṇāma
niruttipathasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 22.62 (SN22.62) ✗
niruttipadakovida

Meaning skilled in language; (comm) accomplished in the grammar and the verse

Sanskrit nirukti + pada + kovida

vītataṇho anādāno,
niruttipadakovido,
akkharānaṃ sannipātaṃ,
jaññā pubb'āparāni ca,
sa ve antimasārīro mahāpañño,
mahāpuriso'ti vuccati.

DHP 352 taṇhāvaggo

yaṃ, bhikkhave, rūpaṃ atītaṃ niruddhaṃ vipariṇataṃ ahosī'ti tassa saṅkhā, ahosī'ti tassa samaññā, ahosī'ti tassa paññatti, na tassa saṅkhā atthī'ti, na tassa saṅkhā bhavissatī'ti.

SN 22.62 niruttipathasuttaṃ

yv'āyaṃ, āvuso, mato kālaṅ'kato tassa kāyasaṅkhārā niruddhā paṭippassaddhā, vacīsaṅkhārā niruddhā paṭippassaddhā, cittasaṅkhārā niruddhā paṭippassaddhā, āyu parikkhīṇo, usmā vūpasantā, indriyāni paribhinnāni.

MN 43 mahāvedallasuttaṃ
nirupatāpa

adj. without pain, without trouble ✗

Root √dhā･1 a (place, support)

Compound kammadhāraya (nir + upadhi)
Antonym upadhi
Variant nirūpadhi
Sanskrit nirupādhi
Sanskrit Root √dhā 1, 2, 3 (put)

upadhi dukkhassa mūlan'ti, iti viditvā nirupadhi upadhisaṅkhaye vimutto upadhismiṃ vā kāyaṃ upasaṃharissati cittaṃ vā uppādessatī'ti, n'etaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.

nirūpadhi 1

adj. free from attachment; free from grasping; not taking as mine; not appropriating; lit. no foundation [nir + upa + √dhā + i] ✓

Grammar adj, from upadahati, neg
Meaning free from attachment; free from grasping; not taking as mine; not appropriating; lit. no foundation
Root Family upa √dhā
Root √dhā･1 a (place, support)
Construction nir + upa + √dhā + i
Derivative kita (i)
Compound kammadhāraya (nir + upadhi)
Antonym upadhi
Variant nirupadhi
Notes only found in verse
Sanskrit nirupādhi
Sanskrit Root √dhā 1, 2, 3 (put)

hitvā ratiñ'ca aratiñ'ca,
sītibhūtaṃ nirūpadhiṃ,
sabbalok'ābhibhuṃ vīraṃ,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

DHP 418 brāhmaṇavaggo

so'haṃ evaṃ viharanto,
ñatvā dhammaṃ nirūpadhiṃ,
ārogye yobbanasmiñ'ca,
jīvitasmiñ'ca ye madā.

AN 5.57 abhiṇhapaccavekkhitabbaṭhānasuttaṃ
nirūpadhi 2

adj. without possessions; without acquisitions; without assets; lit. no foundation [nir + upa + √dhā + i] ✓

Meaning without possessions; without acquisitions; without assets; lit. no foundation

Derivative kita (i)

Antonym upadhi
Variant nirupadhi
Commentary (SNa) na hi so nandati yo nirūpadhī'ti yo kāmaguṇasampattirahito daliddo dullabhaghās'acchādano, na hi so nandati. evarūpo manussapeto ca manussanerayiko ca kiṃ nandissati bhagavā'ti āha.
Notes only found in verse
Sanskrit nirupādhi
Sanskrit Root √dhā 1, 2, 3 (put)

nandati puttehi puttimā,
gomā gohi tath'eva nandati,
upadhīhi narassa nandanā,
na hi so nandati yo nirūpadhī'ti.

nirodha

masc. (+gen) ending (of); cessation (of); termination (of); finishing (of) [ni + √rudh + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from nirundhati (+gen)
Meaning ending (of); cessation (of); termination (of); finishing (of)
Root Family ni √rudh
Root √rudh･2 ṃa (obstruct)
Construction ni + √rudh > rodh + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change u > o
Commentary (MW) confinement, locking up, imprisonment
Sanskrit nirodha
Sanskrit Root √rudh 2, 7 (obstruct)

viññāṇassa nirodhena,
taṇhākkhayavimuttino,
pajjotass'eva nibbānaṃ,
vimokkho hoti cetaso'ti.

AN 3.91 dutiya sikkhattayasuttaṃ

ye hi keci, bhikkhave, samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā evaṃ rūpaṃ abhiññāya ... rūpassa nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya paṭipannā, te suppaṭipannā.

Sanskrit nirodha + artham

AN 4.25 brahmacariyasuttaṃ
nirodhadhamma

adj. having the nature to end; subject to cessation; ending naturally [nirodha + dhamma] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having the nature to end; subject to cessation; ending naturally
Construction nirodha + dhamma
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (nirodhassa + dhamma)
Sanskrit nirodha + dharma

seyyathā'pi nāma suddhaṃ vatthaṃ apagatakāḷakaṃ samma'd'eva rajanaṃ paṭiggaṇheyya, evam'eva yasassa kulaputtassa tasmiṃ'y'eva āsane virajaṃ vītamalaṃ dhammacakkhuṃ udapādi, yaṃ kiñci samudayadhammaṃ, sabbaṃ taṃ nirodhadhamman'ti.

VIN 4.1.7 pabbajjākathā

tadāhāranirodhā yaṃ bhūtaṃ taṃ nirodhadhamman'ti yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya disvā nirodhadhammassa nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya paṭipanno hoti. evaṃ kho, bhante, sekkho hoti.

kathaṃ bhāvitā ca, bhikkhave, satta bojjh'aṅgā kathaṃ bahulīkatā vijjāvimuttiṃ paripūrenti ? idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu satisambojjh'aṅgaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ.

MN 118 ānāpānassatisuttaṃ
nirodhavagga

masc. Chapter 8 of the Bojjhaṅgasaṃyuttaṃ, Book 5 of the Saṃyutta Nikāya ✗

nirodhasaññā

fem. perception of ending; recognition of cessation [nirodha + saññā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning perception of ending; recognition of cessation
Construction nirodha + saññā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (nirodhassa + saññā)
Notes ten peceptions 1. aniccasaññā, 2. anattasaññā, 3. asubhasaññā, 4. ādīnavasaññā, 5. pahānasaññā, 6. virāgasaññā, 7. nirodhasaññā, 8. sabbaloke anabhiratasaññā, 9. sabbasaṅkhāresu anicchāsaññā, 10. ānāpānassati.
Sanskrit nirodha + saṃjñā

katamā c'ānanda, nirodhasaññā? idh'ānanda, bhikkhu araññagato vā rukkhamūlagato vā suññ'āgāragato vā iti paṭisañcikkhati, etaṃ santaṃ etaṃ paṇītaṃ yadidaṃ sabbasaṅkhārasamatho sabb'ūpadhippaṭinissaggo taṇhākkhayo nirodho nibbānan'ti.

AN 10.60 girimānandasuttaṃ
nirodhasaññāparicita

Sanskrit nirodha + saṃjñā + paricita

pahānasaññāparicitañ'ca no cittaṃ bhavissati, virāgasaññāparicitañ'ca no cittaṃ bhavissati, nirodhasaññāparicitañ'ca no cittaṃ bhavissatī'ti, evañ'hi vo, bhikkhave, sikkhitabbaṃ.

tatiyassa jhānassa pīti kaṇṭako, catutthassa jhānassa assāsapassāso kaṇṭako, saññāvedayitanirodhasamāpattiyā saññā ca vedanā ca kaṇṭako, rāgo kaṇṭako doso kaṇṭako moho kaṇṭako.

AN 10.72 kaṇṭakasuttaṃ

nirodhasamāpattito vuṭṭhahitvā viya nisinnaṃ bhagavantaṃ, arahantaṃ, sammā sambuddhaṃ iminā pupphena pūjemi, pūjemi, pūjemi.

buddhavandana pūjāgāthā
nirodhasamāpattisutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 28.9 (SN28.9) ✗

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 46.76 (SN46.76) ✗

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 9.60 (AN9.60) ✗
nirodhānupassī

nirodh'ānupassī assasissāmī'ti sikkhati, nirodh'ānupassī passasissāmī'ti sikkhati.

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ

so kāye ca sukhāya ca vedanāya anicc'ānupassī viharati, vay'ānupassī viharati, virāg'ānupassī viharati, nirodh'ānupassī viharati, paṭinissagg'ānupassī viharati.

SN 36.7 paṭhamagelaññasuttaṃ
nirodhetabba

ptp. to be destroyed; should be dissolved; should be annihilated [ni + √rudh] ✗
nirodheti

pr. destroys, dissolves, annihilates [ni + √rudh] ✗
nirodhetvā

Root √rudh･2 *e (obstruct)
Base √rudh + *e > rodhe (caus)
Construction ni + rodhe + tvā
Phonetic Change u > o
Sanskrit nirudh
Sanskrit Root √rudh 2, 7 (obstruct)

yattha kāmā nirujjhanti, ye ca kāme nirodhetvā nirodhetvā viharanti, addhā te āyasmanto nicchātā nibbutā tiṇṇā pāraṅ'gatā tadaṅgenā'ti vadāmi

Commentary (VINa) nilīno'ti paṭicchanno hutvā.
Sanskrit nilīna
Sanskrit Root √lī 1, 4, 9 (cling)

tena kho pana samayena, rañño ambo dhuvaphalo hoti. atha kho, bhikkhave, so chapako yena so ambo ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā taṃ ambaṃ abhiruhitvā nilīno acchi.

VIN 2.7.7 pādukavaggo
nilīyi

aor. hid, lurked, kept oneself hidden [ni + √lī] ✗

Phonetic Change r > l
Compound kammadhāraya (nir + lapa)
Antonym lapa
Sanskrit nirlapaka (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √lap 1 (prate)

ye ca kho te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū nikkuhā nillapā dhīrā atthaddhā susamāhitā, te kho me, bhikkhave, bhikkhū māmakā. anapagatā ca te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū imasmā dhammavinayā. te ca imasmiṃ dhammavinaye vuddhiṃ viruḷhiṃ vepullaṃ āpajjantī'ti.

nikkuhā nillapā dhīrā,
atthaddhā susamāhitā,
te ve dhamme virūhanti,
sammāsambuddhadesite'ti.

AN 3.51 mahācorasuttaṃ

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, kāmahetu kāmanidānaṃ kām'ādhikaraṇaṃ kāmānam'eva hetu sandhim'pi chindanti, nillopam'pi haranti, ek'āgārikam'pi karonti, paripanthe'pi tiṭṭhanti, paradāram'pi gacchanti.

tvam'pi samma catuppado,
ehi samma nivattassu,
kiṃ nu bhīto palāyasi.

Sanskrit nivṛt
Sanskrit Root √vṛ 1, 5, 9 (cover)

seyyathā'pi, bhante, rañño paccantimaṃ nagaraṃ daḷh'uddāpaṃ daḷhapākāratoraṇaṃ ekadvāraṃ, tatr'assa dovāriko paṇḍito viyatto medhāvī aññātānaṃ nivāretā ñātānaṃ pavesetā

DN 16.5 mahāparinibbānasuttaṃ
nivāreti

pr. (+acc and +abl) prevents (from); blocks (from); obstructs (from); reins in (from) [ni + √var + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of ni √var, trans (+acc and +abl)
Meaning prevents (from); blocks (from); obstructs (from); reins in (from)
Root Family ni √var
Root √var･1 *e (cover, dress, restrain)
Base √var + *e > vāre (caus)
Construction ni + vāre + ti
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit nivārayati
Sanskrit Root √vṛ 1, 5, 9 (cover)

yassa kassaci, bhikkhave, bhikkhussa vā bhikkhuniyā vā cakkhuviññeyyesu rūpesu uppajjeyya chando vā rāgo vā doso vā moho vā paṭighaṃ v'āpi cetaso, tato cittaṃ nivāreyya.

SN 35.246 vīṇopamasuttaṃ

ovadeyy'ānusāseyya,
asabbhā ca nivāraye,
satañ'hi so piyo hoti,
asataṃ hoti appiyo.

DHP 77 paṇḍitavaggo
nivāresi

Meaning prevented (from); obstructed (from); blocked (from)

Root √var･1 *e (cover, dress, restrain)

Construction ni + vāre + si
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit nivṛ
Sanskrit Root √vṛ 1, 5, 9 (cover)

devayānaṃ abhiruyha,
virajaṃ so mahāpathaṃ,
kāmarāgaṃ virājetvā,
brahmalok'ūpago ahu,
na naṃ jāti nivāresi,
brahmalok'ūpapattiyā.

paṇidhī me na vijjati.

aṭṭhakavaggo 13

na chandagū no'pi nivissavādī,
sa vippamutto diṭṭhigatehi dhīro,
na lippati loke anattagarahī.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

te ve narā oghatiṇṇā'ti brūmi.

SNP 41 duṭṭhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 3

yaṃ kiñci sampajānāsi,
uddhaṃ adho tiriyañ'c'āpi majjhe,
etesu nandiñ'ca nivesanañ'ca,
panujja viññāṇaṃ bhave na tiṭṭhe.

SNP 59 mettagū māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 4
nivesanadvāra

nt. front door; lit. entrance door [nivesana + dvāra] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning front door; lit. entrance door
Construction nivesana + dvāra
Commentary (VINa) nivesanadvāre'ti nivesanassa mahādvāre.
nivesanā

fem. attaching; clinging; fixing; lit. entering down [ni + √vis + *anā] ✓

Grammar fem, act, from nivesati
Meaning attaching; clinging; fixing; lit. entering down
Root Family ni √vis
Root √vis･1 a (enter)
Construction ni + √vis > ves + *anā
Derivative kita (*anā)
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit niveśana
Sanskrit Root √viś 6 (enter)

yass'ūbhay'ante paṇidh'īdha n'atthi,
bhav'ābhavāya idha vā huraṃ vā,
nivesanā tassa na santi keci,
dhammesu niccheyya samuggahītaṃ.

SNP 43 paramaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 5
nivesayati

pr. (+acc and +loc) establishes (in); settles (in); makes oneself at home (in); lit. causes to enter down [ni + √vis + *aya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of nivisati, trans (+acc and +loc)
Meaning establishes (in); settles (in); makes oneself at home (in); lit. causes to enter down
Root Family ni √vis
Root √vis･1 *aya (enter)
Base √vis + *aya > vesaya (caus)
Construction ni + vesaya + ti
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit niveśayati
Sanskrit Root √viś 6 (enter)

attānam'eva paṭhamaṃ,
patirūpe nivesaye,
ath'aññam'anusāseyya,
na kilisseyya paṇḍito.

DHP 158 attavaggo

tamh'uddhaṭe tantikhīlake,
vissaṭṭhe vikale parikrite,
na vindeyya khaṇḍaso kate,
kimhi tattha manaṃ nivesaye.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
nivesayi

aor. (+acc) settled (in); established (in); lit. caused to enter [ni + √vis + *aya + i] ~

Meaning settled (in); established (in); lit. caused to enter

Root √vis･1 *aya (enter)
Base √vis + *aya > vesaya (caus)
Construction ni + vesaya + i
Commentary (SNa) sacce nivesayī'ti paramatthasacce nibbāne nivesesi.
Sanskrit Root √viś 6 (enter)
nivesiya

ger. (+loc) establishing (in); settling (in); lit. entering down [ni + √vis + *e + iya] ✓

Grammar ger of niveseti, caus, trans (+loc)
Meaning establishing (in); settling (in); lit. entering down
Root Family ni √vis
Root √vis･1 *e (enter)
Base √vis + *e > vese (caus)
Construction ni + vese + iya
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit niviś
Sanskrit Root √viś 6 (enter)

paññāya chetvā vipath'ānusārinaṃ,
yogena niggayha pathe nivesiya,
disvā samudayaṃ vibhavañ'ca sambhavaṃ,
dāy'ādako hehisi aggavādino.

Sanskrit Root √viś 6 (enter)

niveseti

yogā ve jāyatī bhūri,
ayogā bhūrisaṅkhayo,
etaṃ dvedhāpathaṃ ñatvā,
bhavāya vibhavāya ca,
tath'āttānaṃ niveseyya,
yathā bhūri pavaḍḍhati.

nivesesi

nisaṅkhati

fem. fabrication; fiction; invention; (comm) accumulation of merit and demerit [ni + saṃ + √kar + ti] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from nisaṅkharoti
Meaning fabrication; fiction; invention; (comm) accumulation of merit and demerit
Root Family ni saṃ √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Construction ni + saṃ + √kar > khar + ti
Derivative kita (ti)
Phonetic Change ṃ > ṅ
k > kh (Kacc 20, 27)
rt > t
Variant nisaṅkhiti
Commentary (NIDD1) nisaṅkhatī'ti vuccanti puññ'ābhisaṅkhāro apuññ'ābhisaṅkhāro āneñj'ābhisaṅkhāro.
Notes see nisaṅkhiti
Sanskrit ni + saṃskṛti
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

anejassa vijānato,
n'atthi kāci nisaṅkhati,
virato so viyārabbhā,
khemaṃ passati sabbadhi.

Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)

nisajja kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi

nisīdi bhagavā paññatte āsane. nisajja pāde pakkhālesi.

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning frequently when sitting down

Sanskrit nyāsadya + bahala

evañ'hi so, bhikkhave, goṇo kiṭṭh'ādo gāmagato vā araññagato vā, ṭhānabahulo vā assa nisajjabahulo vā na taṃ kiṭṭhaṃ puna otareyya, tam'eva purimaṃ daṇḍasamphassaṃ samanussaranto.

Commentary (MNa) nisabhassā'ti usabhavasabhanisabhesu sabbattha appaṭisamaṭṭhena nisabhassa. (SNa) gavasatajeṭṭhako hi usabho, gavasahassajeṭṭhako vasabho, gavasatasahassajeṭṭhako nisabho'ti vuccati.

cūḷavaggo 10

anādā ce bhikkhu purāṇasantha tassa sāmantā sugatavidatthiṃ, navaṃ nisīdanasanthataṃ kārāpeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

nt. rule about sitting cloths; Pācittiya 89 [nisīdana + sikkhāpada] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning rule about sitting cloths; Pācittiya 89
Construction nisīdana + sikkhāpada
nisīdanta

prp. siting down [ni + √sad] ✗
nisīdāpita

pp. caused to sit down [ni + √sad] ✗
nisīdāpīyati

pr. (+acc) causes to be seated; makes (someone) be seated [ni + √sad + *āpe + īya + ti] ~

Grammar pr, pass of nisīdāpeti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning causes to be seated; makes (someone) be seated
Root Family ni √sad
Root √sad･1 *āpe + īya (sink, sit, settle)
Base √sad + āpe + īya > sādāpīya > sīdāpīya (caus, pass, irreg)
Construction ni + sīdāpīya + ti
Phonetic Change a > ī
Sanskrit niṣadyate
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)
nisīdāpeti

pr. (+acc) causes to sit down; makes (someone) take a seat [ni + √sad + *āpe + ti] ✓

Root √sad･1 *āpe (sink, sit, settle)

Phonetic Change a > ī
Sanskrit niṣadayati
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)

atha kho upāli gahapati, yaṃ sudaṃ pubbe yato passati nigaṇṭhaṃ nāṭaputtaṃ dūrato'va āgacchantaṃ disvāna tato paccuggantvā yaṃ tattha āsanaṃ aggañ'ca seṭṭhañ'ca uttamañ'ca paṇītañ'ca taṃ uttar'āsaṅgena sammajjitvā pariggahetvā nisīdāpeti

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
nisīdāpetvā

Meaning having caused to sit down
Root Family ni √sad
Root √sad･1 *āpe (sink, sit, settle)
Base √sad + āpe > sadāpe > sīdāpe (caus, irreg)

Phonetic Change a > ī
English Cognate sit, seat, sedentary, sedate
Sanskrit niṣadayitvā
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)

rājā te sabbe gāhāpetvā rāj'aṅgaṇe nābhippamāṇe āvāṭe khaṇāpetvā te tattha nisīdāpetvā paṃsūhi pūretvā upari palāle vikirāpetvā aggiṃ dāpesi.

DHPa 1.2.1 sāmāvatīvatthu

te upakaṭṭhāya vass'ūpanāyikāya pañcasatatāpase himavantato āgantvā nagare bhikkhāya carante disvā pasīditvā nisīdāpetvā bhojetvā paṭiññaṃ gahetvā cattāro māse attano santike vasāpetvā puna vass'āratte āgaman'atthāya paṭijānāpetvā uyyojesuṃ.

upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi

atha kho therā bhikkhū yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu. upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdiṃsu.

Sanskrit niṣad
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)

suppaṭicchannena antaraghare nisīditabbaṃ. yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca kāyaṃ vivaritvā antaraghare nisīdati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.

VIN 2.7.1 parimaṇḍalavaggo

susaṃvutena antaraghare nisīditabbaṃ. yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca hatthaṃ vā pādaṃ vā kīḷāpento antaraghare nisīdati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.

nisumbhati

pr. knocks down; treads down [ni + √sumbh] ✗
nisedha 1

Sanskrit Root √sidh 1 (repel)

yadā nisedho manaso piyehi,
yato yato hiṃsamano nivattati,
tato tato sammati'm'eva dukkhaṃ.

asso bhadro kasām'iva.

TH 257 pārāpariyattheragāthā

seyyathā'pi nāma suddhaṃ vatthaṃ apagatakāḷakaṃ samma'd'eva rajanaṃ paṭiggaṇheyya, evam'eva yasassa kulaputtassa tasmiṃ'y'eva āsane virajaṃ vītamalaṃ dhammacakkhuṃ udapādi, yaṃ kiñci samudayadhammaṃ, sabbaṃ taṃ nirodhadhamman'ti.

jj > gg
Commentary (VIN 6.8.5) nissaggiyan'ti yaṃ vuttaṃ, taṃ suṇohi yathātathaṃ, saṅghamajjhe gaṇamajjhe, ekass'eva ca ekato, nissajjitvāna deseti, ten'etaṃ iti vuccati.
Sanskrit niḥsargika (bsk), naiḥsargika (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √sṛj 6 (send forth)

ime kho pan'āyasmanto tiṃsa nissaggiyā pācittiyā dhammā uddesaṃ āgacchanti.

VIN PAT NP nissaggiyapācittiyā

niṭṭhitacīvarasmiṃ bhikkhunā ubbhatasmiṃ kathine das'āhaparamaṃ atirekacīvaraṃ dhāretabbaṃ, taṃ atikkāmayato nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN 2.5.4.10 dantaponasikkhāpadaṃ

asīlatā abbatā no'pi tena,

santo anissāya bhavaṃ na jappe.

Phonetic Change īs > iss
jjt > ṭṭh
Antonym anissaṭṭha
Sanskrit nisṛṣṭa
Sanskrit Root √sṛj 6 (send forth)

Root Family nī √sand
Root √sand･1 a (flow)
√ In Comps sand or ssand
Construction nī + √sand + a

Phonetic Change īs > iss
Commentary (ANa) eso tassa nissando'ti esā piyabhāvassa nipphatti.
Sanskrit nisyanda
Sanskrit Root √syand 1 (move on)

asitapītakhāyitasāyitassa kho, nāgita, uccārapassāvo, eso tassa nissando.

AN 5.30 nāgitasuttaṃ

satthena vā visena vā,
vihesam'pi na kubbate,
antarāmaraṇaṃ n'atthi,
tesaṃ nissandato mama.

nissaya 1

Sanskrit niśraya
Sanskrit Root √śri √śṛ 1 (resort)

ñāṇe'pi so nissayaṃ no karoti,
sa ve viyuttesu na vaggasārī,
diṭṭhim'pi so na pacceti kiñci.

SNP 43 paramaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 5

ete ca ñatvā upanissitā'ti,
ñatvā munī nissaye so vimaṃsī,
ñatvā vimutto na vivādam'eti,
bhav'ābhavāya na sameti dhīro'ti.

aṭṭhakavaggo 11

yaṃ nissito passati hīnam'aññaṃ,
tasmā hi diṭṭhaṃ va sutaṃ mutaṃ vā,
sīlabbataṃ bhikkhu na nissayeyya.

nissitassa calitaṃ, anissitassa calitaṃ n'atthi. calite asati passaddhi, passaddhiyā sati nati na hoti. natiyā asati āgatigati na hoti. āgatigatiyā asati cut'ūpapāto na hoti. cut'ūpapāte asati n'ev'idha na huraṃ na ubhayam'antarena. es'ev'anto dukkhassā'ti.

sabbesu kāmesu yo vītarāgo,
ākiñcaññaṃ nissito hitvā m'aññaṃ,
saññāvimokkhe parame'dhimutto,
tiṭṭheyya so tattha anānuyāyī.

Derivative kita (*ṇī)
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit niḥśreṇikā
Sanskrit Root √śri √śṛ 1 (resort)

tam'enaṃ evaṃ vadeyyuṃ, ambho purisa, yassa tvaṃ pāsādassa ārohaṇāya nisseṇiṃ karosi, jānāsi taṃ pāsādaṃ puratthimāya vā disāya dakkhiṇāya vā disāya pacchimāya vā disāya uttarāya vā disāya ucco vā nīco vā majjhimo vā'ti?

DN 9.6 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, ekaṃsikadhammo
nisseṇī 2

fem. ladder; lit. leaning against [ni + √si + *ṇī] ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning ladder; lit. leaning against
Root Family ni √si
Root √si･1 a (depend on, associate with)
√ In Comps si or ssi
Construction ni + √si > se + *ṇī
Derivative kita (*ṇī)
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit niḥśreṇikā
Sanskrit Root √śri √śṛ 1 (resort)

aparikkamanaṃ nāma na sakkā hoti yathāyuttena sakaṭena anuparigantuṃ samantā nisseṇiyā anuparigantuṃ. etaṃ aparikkamanaṃ nāma.

VIN 1.2.6 kuṭikārasikkhāpadaṃ
nisseṇīupamā

fem. simile of the ladder ✗

sabbattha vihatā nandī,
tamokhandho padālito,
evaṃ jānāhi pāpima,
nihato tvam'asi antaka.

THI 59 cālātherīgāthā

nivāto nāma nīcamanatā nivātavuttitā, yāya samannāgato puggalo nihatamāno nihatadappo pādapuñchanakacoḷasadiso chinnavisāṇausabhasamo uddhaṭadāṭhasappasamo ca hutvā saṇho sakhilo sukhasambhāso hoti, ayaṃ nivāto.

atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo uṭṭhāy'āsanā ek'aṃsaṃ uttar'āsaṅgaṃ karitvā dakkhiṇajāṇumaṇḍalaṃ pathaviyaṃ nihantvā yena te satta ca jaṭilā satta ca nigaṇṭhā satta ca acelakā satta ca ekasāṭakā satta ca paribbājakā ten'añjaliṃ paṇāmetvā tikkhattuṃ nāmaṃ sāvesi

nihini

diṭṭhe sute sīlavate mute vā,

nihīnato passati sabbamaññaṃ.

SNP 43 paramaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 5

samo visesī uda vā nihīno,
yo maññatī so vivadetha tena,
tīsu vidhāsu avikampamāno,
samo visesī'ti na tassa hoti.

tasmā attano uttariṃ bhajethā'ti.

AN 3.27 jigucchitabbasuttaṃ
nihuṃhuṅka

adj. not humphy; not huffy; not disgruntled; not disapproving; lit. not humph-ing [nir + huṃhuṅka] ✓

Grammar adj, from huṃhuṅka, neg
Meaning not humphy; not huffy; not disgruntled; not disapproving; lit. not humph-ing
Construction nir + huṃhuṅka
Compound kammadhāraya (nir + huṃhuṅka)
Commentary (UDa) huṃhuṅkārappahānena nihuṃhuṅko (PYt) huṃhuṅkārapahānenā'ti iminā n'atthi huṃhuṅkāro imassā'ti nihuṃhuṅko'ti vacan'atthaṃ dasseti.
Sanskrit nis, niṣ, nir, niḥ, nī + huhuṃ (bsk)

yo brāhmaṇo bāhitapāpadhammo,
nihuṃhuṅko nikkasāvo yat'atto,
vedantagū vūsitabrahmacariyo,
dhammena so brahmavādaṃ vadeyya,
yass'ussadā n'atthi kuhiñ'ci loke'ti.

UD4 huṃhuṅkasuttaṃ
nīka

Grammar masc
Meaning name of a deity

Notes follower of Nigaṇṭha Nāṭaputta

atha kho sambahulā nānātitthiyasāvakā devaputtā asamo ca sahali ca nīko ca ākoṭako ca vegabbhari ca māṇavagāmiyo ca abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇā kevalakappaṃ veḷuvanaṃ obhāsetvā yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu

SN 2.30 nānātitthiyasāvakasuttaṃ
nīgha

masc. trouble, misery, confusion ✗
nīghasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 45.168 (SN45.168) ✗
nīca 1

adj. low; short ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning low; short
Antonym ucca
Sanskrit nīca

etu nisīdi bhagavā paññatte āsane. poṭṭhapādo'pi kho paribbājako aññataraṃ nīcaṃ āsanaṃ gahetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdi. ekam'antaṃ nisinnaṃ kho poṭṭhapādaṃ paribbājakaṃ bhagavā etadavoca

tam'enaṃ evaṃ vadeyyuṃ, ambho purisa, yassa tvaṃ pāsādassa ārohaṇāya nisseṇiṃ karosi, jānāsi taṃ pāsādaṃ puratthimāya vā disāya dakkhiṇāya vā disāya pacchimāya vā disāya uttarāya vā disāya ucco vā nīco vā majjhimo vā'ti?

nīca 2

Meaning poor; inferior; humble; lit. low
Antonym ucca
Sanskrit nīca

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo nīce kule paccājāto hoti, caṇḍālakule vā venakule vā nesādakule vā rathakārakule vā pukkusakule vā dalidde app'annapānabhojane kasiravuttike, yattha kasirena ghāsacchādo labbhati.

nivāto nāma nīcamanatā nivātavuttitā, yāya samannāgato puggalo nihatamāno nihatadappo pādapuñchanakacoḷasadiso chinnavisāṇausabhasamo uddhaṭadāṭhasappasamo ca hutvā saṇho sakhilo sukhasambhāso hoti, ayaṃ nivāto.

nīceyya

adj. (+instr) lower (than); more inferior (than); worse (than) [nīca + eyya] ✓

Grammar adj, compar of nīca (+instr)
Meaning lower (than); more inferior (than); worse (than)
Construction nīca + eyya
Derivative taddhita (eyya)
Antonym bhiyyo
Synonym hīna, oma
Sanskrit nīcya

evam'pi kho ahaṃ, brahme, n'eva te samasamo abhiññāya, kuto nīceyyaṃ? atha kho aham'eva tayā bhiyyo.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ

seyyo na tena maññeyya,
nīceyyo athavā'pi sarikkho,
phuṭṭho anekarūpehi,
n'ātumānaṃ vikappayaṃ tiṭṭhe.

SNP 52 tuvaṭakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 14
nīta 1

pp. (+instr) carried (by); led (by); guided (by) [√nī + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of neti (+instr)
Meaning carried (by); led (by); guided (by)
Root Family √nī
Root √nī･1 a (lead, carry)
Construction √nī + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Sanskrit nīta
Sanskrit Root √nī 1, 2 (lead)

kāmā hi citrā madhurā manoramā,
aviddasū yattha sitā puthujjanā,
te dukkham'icchanti punabbhav'esino,
cittena nītā niraye nirākatā.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
nīta 2

adj. (of meaning) clear; plain; straightforward; explicit; obvious; lit. led [√nī + ta] ✓

Grammar adj, pp of neti
Meaning (of meaning) clear; plain; straightforward; explicit; obvious; lit. led
Root Family √nī
Root √nī･1 a (lead, carry)
Construction √nī + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Antonym neyya
Sanskrit nīta
Sanskrit Root √nī 1, 2 (lead)

dve'me, bhikkhave, tathāgataṃ abbhācikkhanti. katame dve? yo ca neyy'atthaṃ suttantaṃ nīt'attho suttanto'ti dīpeti, yo ca nīt'atthaṃ suttantaṃ neyy'attho suttanto'ti dīpeti. ime kho, bhikkhave, dve tathāgataṃ abbhācikkhantī'ti.

dve'me, bhikkhave, tathāgataṃ abbhācikkhanti. katame dve? yo ca neyy'atthaṃ suttantaṃ nīt'attho suttanto'ti dīpeti, yo ca nīt'atthaṃ suttantaṃ neyy'attho suttanto'ti dīpeti. ime kho, bhikkhave, dve tathāgataṃ abbhācikkhantī'ti.

mosavajje na nīyetha,
rūpe snehaṃ na kubbaye,
mānañ'ca parijāneyya,
sāhasā virato care.

nīyyādeti

Grammar pr, trans (+acc and +dat)
Meaning hands over (to); delivers (to); returns (to)

Root √yat･8 *e (arrange, hand over)
Base √yat + *e > yāte > yāde (irreg)
Construction nī + yāde + ti
Phonetic Change a > ā
Variant nīyyāteti, niyyādeti
Commentary (SNa) niyyāteh'evā'ti niyyātehi'y'eva. gāvīsu hi aniyyātitāsu gosāmikā āgantvā, ekā gāvī na dissati, eko goṇo, eko vacchako na dissatī'ti tuyhaṃ piṭṭhito piṭṭhito vicarissanti, iti te aphāsukaṃ bhavissati. pabbajjā ca nām'esā saiṇassa na ruhati, aṇaṇā pabbajjā ca buddh'ādīhi saṃvaṇṇitā'ti dassan'atthaṃ evam'āha.
Sanskrit niryātayati
Sanskrit Root √yat 1, 10 (stretch)
