yo nīvaraṇe pahāya pañca,
anigho tiṇṇakathaṃkatho visallo,
so bhikkhu jahāti orapāraṃ,
urago jiṇṇam'iva tacaṃ purāṇaṃ.

so sākabhakkho'pi hoti sāmākabhakkho'pi hoti nīvārabhakkho'pi hoti daddulabhakkho'pi hoti haṭabhakkho'pi hoti kaṇabhakkho'pi hoti ācāmabhakkho'pi hoti piññākabhakkho'pi hoti tiṇabhakkho'pi hoti gomayabhakkho'pi hoti, vanamūlaphal'āhāro'pi yāpeti pavattaphalabhojī.

AN 4.198 attantapasuttaṃ

te tattha sākabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, sāmākabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, nīvārabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, daddulabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, haṭabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, kaṇabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, ācāmabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, piññākabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, tiṇabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, gomayabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, vanamūlaphal'āhārā yāpesuṃ pavattaphalabhojī.

Phonetic Change rt > ṭ

taṃ hoti jātarūpaṃ sudhantaṃ niddhantaṃ nīhaṭaṃ ninnītakasāvaṃ mudu ca kammaññañ'ca pabhassarañ'ca

ādittasmiṃ agārasmiṃ,

taṃ tassa hoti atthāya,
no ca yaṃ tattha ḍayhati.

evaṃ ādittako loko,
jarāya maraṇena ca,
nīhareth'eva dānena,
dinnaṃ hoti sunīhataṃ.

Sanskrit nirhṛtvā
Sanskrit Root √hṛ 1 (take)

disvāna bhikkhū āmantesi, gaṇhatha, bhikkhave, bāhiyassa dārucīriyassa sarīrakaṃ, mañcakaṃ āropetvā nīharitvā jhāpetha, thūpañ'c'assa karotha. sabrahmacārī vo, bhikkhave, kālaṅ'kato'ti.

UD 10 bāhiyasuttaṃ

atha kho jīvako komārabhacco seṭṭhiṃ gahapatiṃ mañcake nipātetvā sambandhitvā sīsacchaviṃ uppāṭetvā sibbiniṃ vināmetvā dve pāṇake nīharitvā mahājanassa dassesi.

Sanskrit Root √hṛ 1 (take)

tato ce uttari paṭiggaṇheyya, pācittiyaṃ. dvattipattapūre paṭiggahetvā tato nīharitvā bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ saṃvibhajitabbaṃ, ayaṃ tattha sāmīci.

gandhatelappadittena,

pūjayāmi tamonudaṃ.

pabbataṭṭho'va bhūmaṭṭhe,
dhīro bāle avekkhati.

sucigandhaṃ manoramaṃ.

tath'eva loke sujāto,
buddho loke viharati,
n'upalippati lokena,
toyena padumaṃ yathā.

AN 6.43 nāgasuttaṃ

tassa n'atthi purakkhataṃ.

tassa rūpavipariṇām'aññathābhāvā n'uppajjanti sokaparidevadukkhadomanass'upāyāsā.

SN 22.54 bījasuttaṃ
nuhaṃ

sandhi. I? [nu + ahaṃ] ✓

Meaning I?
Construction nu + ahaṃ
Sanskrit nu + aham

kadā nu'haṃ pabbatakandarāsu,
ekākiyo addutiyo vihassaṃ,
aniccato sabbabhavaṃ vipassaṃ,
taṃ me idaṃ taṃ nu kadā bhavissati.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

kadā nu'haṃ dubbacanena vutto,
tatonimittaṃ vimano na hessaṃ,
atho pasattho'pi tatonimittaṃ,
tuṭṭho na hessaṃ tadidaṃ kadā me.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
nūna 1

ind. indeed; surely; surely not; truly ✓

Grammar ind, emph
Meaning indeed; surely; surely not; truly
Sanskrit nūnam

te c'āpi nūnappajaheyyu dukkhaṃ,
ye tvaṃ muni aṭṭhitaṃ ovadeyya,
taṃ taṃ namassāmi samecca nāga,
app'eva maṃ bhagavā aṭṭhitaṃ ovadeyya.

SNP 59 mettagū māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 4

s'āhaṃ nūna ito gantvā,
yoniṃ laddhāna mānusiṃ,
vadaññū sīlasampannā,
kāhāmi kusalaṃ bahuṃ.

VV 52 revatī vimānavatthu
nūna 2

Grammar ind, interr
Meaning could it be?; what if?; shall?; let’s?; perhaps?

siyā kho pana, bhante, idh'ekaccassa āyasmato evam'assa, kevalaṃ saddhāmattakaṃ nūna ayam'āyasmā nissāya nekkhamm'ādhimutto'ti.

AN 6.55 soṇasuttaṃ

atha kho tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ etadahosi, atippago kho tāva sāvatthiyaṃ piṇḍāya carituṃ, yaṃ nūna mayaṃ yena aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ ārāmo ten'upasaṅkameyyāmā'ti

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron
Meaning perhaps I; maybe I

Sanskrit nūnam + aham

yā nūn'āhaṃ bhante, aññaṃ jātiṃ kodhanā ahosiṃ upāyāsabahulā, appam'pi vuttā samānā abhisajjiṃ kuppiṃ byāpajjiṃ patitthīyiṃ kopañ'ca dosañ'ca appaccayañ'ca pātvākāsiṃ, s'āhaṃ, bhante, etarahi dubbaṇṇā durūpā supāpikā dassanāya.

yaṃ kiñci diṭṭhaṃ va sutaṃ mutaṃ vā,
sa pannabhāro muni vippamutto,
na kappiyo n'ūparato na patthiyo'ti.

Construction na + upa + vada + ti
na + upavadati

Commentary (SNa) n'ūpavadeyya kañcī'ti yaṃkiñci puggalaṃ ācāravipatti'ādīsu yāya kāyaci maṅkuṃ kātu'kāmo hutvā na vadeyya, kālena vakkhāmi no akālenā'tiādayo pana pañca dhamme ajjhattaṃ upaṭṭhapetvā ullumpana-sabhāva-saṇṭhitena cittena kāruññataṃ paṭicca vadeyyā'ti.

kummo aṅgāni sake kapāle,
samodahaṃ bhikkhu manovitakke,
anissito aññam'aheṭhayāno,
parinibbuto n'ūpavadeyya kañcī'ti.

SN 35.240 kummopamasuttaṃ
nūpura

nt. anklet ✗
ne 1

pron. they; those [ta] ✗
ne 2

pron. them; those ✓

Grammar pron, masc acc pl of ta
Meaning them; those
Variant te
Sanskrit te

tasmā hi ne namasseyya,
sakkareyya ca paṇḍito,
annena atha pānena,
vatthena sayanena ca.

AN 4.63 brahmasuttaṃ

sutvā rusito bahuṃ vācaṃ,
samaṇānaṃ vā puthujanānaṃ,
pharusena ne na paṭivajjā,
na hi santo paṭisenikaronti.

SNP 52 tuvaṭakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 14
neka

adj. many; several; lit. not one [na + eka] ✓

Grammar adj, from na eka, neg
Meaning many; several; lit. not one
Construction na + eka
Compound kammadhāraya (na + eka)
Antonym eka
Variant aneka
Sanskrit naika

ev'āhaṃ cintayitvāna,
n'ekakoṭisataṃ dhanaṃ,
nāth'ānāthānaṃ datvāna,
himavantam'upāgamiṃ.

BV 2 sumedha patthanā kathā
nekatika 1

masc. cheat [ni + √kar] ✗
nekatika 2

adj. deceitful, fraudulent [ni + √kar] ✗
nekattamupapajjati

sandhi. deep concentration in meditation does not arise; one does not attain mental unification [na + ekattaṃ + upapajjati] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + nt + pr, neg
Meaning deep concentration in meditation does not arise; one does not attain mental unification
Construction na + ekattaṃ + upapajjati
Commentary (SNa) ekattan'ti jhānaṃ. idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti, kāme ajahitvā muni jhānaṃ na upapajjati, na paṭilabhatī'ti attho.
Sanskrit na + ekatvam + udpadyate

chinda sotaṃ parakkamma,
kāme panuda brāhmaṇa,
nappahāya munī kāme,
n'ekattam'upapajjati.

SN 2.8 tāyanasuttaṃ
nekadhā 1

Construction na + eka + dhā

Antonym ekadhā
Commentary (THa) nekadhā hī'ti oṭṭhagoṇagadrabh'ādivasena c'eva kākabalākakulal'ādivasena ca anekappakāraṃ anekavārañ'ca
Sanskrit anekadhā

saṃsaraṃ hi nirayaṃ agacchissaṃ,
petalokam'agamaṃ punappunaṃ,
dukkhamamhi'pi tiracchānayoniyaṃ,
n'ekadhā hi vusitaṃ ciraṃ mayā.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
nekkha

nt. big gold coin ✗
nekkhamma

√ In Comps kkam

k > kh (Kacc 20, 27)
Antonym kāma
Variant nikkhama
Sanskrit naiṣkramya

tatra bhikkhu vivekaninnena cittena vivekapoṇena vivekapabbhārena vivek'aṭṭhena nekkhamma-abhiratena añña'd'atthu uyyojanikapaṭisaṃyuttaṃ'y'eva kathaṃ kattā hoti

AN 8.30 anuruddha mahāvitakkasuttaṃ

kāmesu vinaya gedhaṃ,
nekkhammaṃ daṭṭhu khemato,
uggahītaṃ nirattaṃ vā,
mā te vijjittha kiñcanaṃ.

Sanskrit naiṣkramya + sita

chattiṃsa sattapadā veditabbā'ti, iti kho pan'etaṃ vuttaṃ. kiñ'c'etaṃ paṭicca vuttaṃ? cha gehasitāni somanassāni, cha nekkhammasitāni somanassāni, cha gehasitāni domanassāni, cha nekkhammasitāni domanassāni, cha gehasitā upekkhā, cha nekkhammasitā upekkhā.

MN 137 saḷāyatanavibhaṅgasuttaṃ

papañcasaññā itarītarā narā,
papañcayantā upayanti saññino,
manomayaṃ gehasitañ'ca sabbaṃ,
panujja nekkhammasitaṃ irīyati.

SN 35.94 adantāguttasuttaṃ

Commentary (MNa) nekkhammasukhan'ti kāmato nikkhantasukhaṃ.
Sanskrit naiṣkramya + sukha

idaṃ vuccati nekkhammasukhaṃ pavivekasukhaṃ upasamasukhaṃ sambodhisukhaṃ. āsevitabbaṃ, bhāvetabbaṃ, bahulīkātabbaṃ, na bhāyitabbaṃ etassa sukhassā'ti, vadāmi.

MN 139 araṇavibhaṅgasuttaṃ

yo kho, nāgita, na'y'imassa nekkhammasukhassa pavivekasukhassa upasamasukhassa sambodhasukhassa nikāmalābhī assa akicchalābhī akasiralābhī ... so taṃ mīḷhasukhaṃ middhasukhaṃ lābhasakkārasilokasukhaṃ sādiyeyyā'ti.

Sanskrit naiṣkramya + adhimukta

so cha ṭhānāni adhimutto hoti, nekkhamm'ādhimutto hoti, pavivek'ādhimutto hoti, abyāpajj'ādhimutto hoti, taṇhākkhay'ādhimutto hoti, upādānakkhay'ādhimutto hoti, asammoh'ādhimutto hoti.

ye jhānapasutā dhīrā,
nekkhamm'ūpasame ratā,
devā'pi tesaṃ pihayanti,
sambuddhānaṃ satīmataṃ.

vītagedho amaccharī,

SNP 48 purābhedasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 10

Meaning these are not; not these

Antonym ete
Sanskrit na + etāḥ, etāni

kāyaviññeyyā phoṭṭhabbā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kām'ūpasaṃhitā rajanīyā. api ca kho, bhikkhave, n'ete kāmā kāmaguṇā nām'ete ariyassa vinaye vuccanti. saṅkapparāgo purisassa kāmo.

AN 6.63 nibbedhikasuttaṃ

n'ete kāmā yāni citrāni loke,
saṅkapparāgo purisassa kāmo,
tiṭṭhanti citrāni tath'eva loke.
ath'ettha dhīrā vinayanti chandan'ti.

gunnaṃ ce taramānānaṃ,

nette jimhaṃ gate sati.

MN 92 selasuttaṃ

jiṇṇo'ham'asmi abalo vītavaṇṇo,
nettā na suddhā savanaṃ na phāsu,
m'āhaṃ nassaṃ momuho antarāva,
ācikkha dhammaṃ yam'ahaṃ vijaññaṃ,

SNP 71 piṅgiya māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 16
netta 3

Meaning rein; lit. guide
Root Family √nī
Root √nī･1 a (lead, carry)
Construction √nī > ne + *tta
Derivative kita (*tta)
Phonetic Change ī > e
Commentary (SNa) sārathī'va nettāni gahetvā'ti yathā samappavattesu sindhavesu odhastapatodo sārathī sabbayottāni gahetvā acodento avārento tiṭṭhati
Sanskrit netra
Sanskrit Root √nī 1, 2 (lead)

tatra bhikkhavo samādahaṃsu,
cittam'attano ujukaṃ akaṃsu,
sārathī'va nettāni gahetvā,
indriyāni rakkhanti paṇḍitā'ti.

n'ālaṃ tadabhinandituṃ,
tassa nissaraṇaṃ santaṃ,
atakk'āvacaraṃ dhuvaṃ.

ITI 43 ajātasuttaṃ

pariciṇṇo mayā satthā,
kataṃ buddhassa sāsanaṃ,
ohito garuko bhāro,
bhavanetti samūhatā.

dakkhiṇāya ce'pi disāya āgaccheyya bhusā vātavuṭṭhi, n'eva saṅkampeyya na sampakampeyya na sampacāleyya. taṃ kissa hetu? gambhīrattā, bhikkhave, nemassa sunikhātattā silāyūpassa.

seyyathā'pi, āvuso sāriputta, cakkhumā puriso uparipāsādavaragato sahassaṃ nemimaṇḍalānaṃ volokeyya. evam'eva kho, āvuso sāriputta, bhikkhu dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena sahassaṃ lokānaṃ voloketi.

dhammā'pi tesaṃ na paṭicchitāse,
na brāhmaṇo sīlavatena neyyo,
pāraṅ'gato na pacceti tādī'ti.

SNP 43 paramaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 5

na vedagū diṭṭhiyā na mutiyā,
sa mānam'eti na hi tammayo so,
na kammunā no'pi sutena neyyo,
anūpanīto sa nivesanesu.

SNP 47 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 9

Commentary (ANa) yassa puggalassa uddesato paripucchato yonisomanasikaroto kalyāṇamitte sevato bhajato payirupāsato anupubbena dhamm'ābhisamayo hoti, ayaṃ vuccati puggalo neyyo.

ajjhattañ'ca bahiddhā ca,
n'atthi kiñcī'ti passato,
ñāṇaṃ sakk'ānupucchāmi,
kathaṃ neyyo tathāvidho.

SNP 69 posāla māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 14

cattāro'me, bhikkhave, puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ. katame cattāro? ugghaṭitaññū, vipañcitaññū, neyyo, padaparamo, ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin'ti.

Antonym nīta

Sanskrit neya
Sanskrit Root √nī 1, 2 (lead)

dve'me, bhikkhave, tathāgataṃ abbhācikkhanti. katame dve? yo ca neyy'atthaṃ suttantaṃ nīt'attho suttanto'ti dīpeti, yo ca nīt'atthaṃ suttantaṃ neyy'attho suttanto'ti dīpeti. ime kho, bhikkhave, dve tathāgataṃ abbhācikkhantī'ti.

petattanaṃ v'āpi tav'eva vāhasā.

DHP 134 daṇḍavaggo

Commentary (ANa) n'elā'ti elaṃ vuccati doso, n'āssa elan'ti nelā, niddosā'ti attho. n'elaṅgo setapacchādo'ti. ettha vuttanelaṃ viya.
Sanskrit anenas

yā sā vācā n'elā kaṇṇasukhā pemanīyā hadayaṅ'gamā porī bahujanakantā bahujanamanāpā tathārūpiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā hoti.

Meaning neither; not
Construction na + eva
Antonym eva
Sanskrit naiva

tato tvaṃ bāhiya na tena. yato tvaṃ bāhiya na tena tato tvaṃ bāhiya na tattha. yato tvaṃ bāhiya na tattha tato tvaṃ bāhiya n'eva-idha na huraṃ na ubhayam'antarena

UD 10 bāhiyasuttaṃ

atha kho te bhikkhū tesaṃ aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ bhāsitaṃ n'eva abhinandiṃsu nappaṭikkosiṃsu, anabhinanditvā appaṭikkositvā uṭṭhāy'āsanā pakkamiṃsu, bhagavato santike etassa bhāsitassa atthaṃ ājānissāmā'ti.

neva 2

Antonym eva
Sanskrit naiva

sace'pi me ayyaputtā vesāliṃ s'āhāraṃ dajjeyyātha n'eva dajjāhaṃ taṃ bhattan'ti

VIN 4.6.177 licchavī vatthu

n'eva kho asakkhi vāseṭṭho māṇavo bhāradvājaṃ māṇavaṃ saññāpetuṃ, na pana asakkhi bhāradvājo māṇavo'pi vāseṭṭhaṃ māṇavaṃ saññāpetuṃ.

DN 13 tevijjasuttaṃ
nevajjhagā

sandhi. (+acc) one never found; one cannot find; (comm) one does not get [na + eva + ajjhagā] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + ind + imperf, neg (+acc)
Meaning one never found; one cannot find; (comm) one does not get
Construction na + eva + ajjhagā
Commentary (SNa) n'ev'ajjhagā'ti n'ādhigacchati. (SNt) n'ev'ajjhagā'ti vattamān'atthe atītavacanan'ti āha n'ādhigacchatī'ti.
Sanskrit na + eva + ādhigamat

sabbā disā anuparigamma cetasā,
n'ev'ajjhagā piyataram'attanā kvaci,
evaṃ piyo puthu attā paresaṃ,
tasmā na hiṃse param'attakāmo'ti.

SN 3.8 mallikāsuttaṃ
nevatta

masc. neither oneself [na + eva + atta] ~

Grammar masc, comp, atta group, neg
Meaning neither oneself
Construction na + eva + atta
Antonym atta
nevattato

sandhi. neither as oneself; not as yours [na + eva + attato] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + ind + adv, neg
Meaning neither as oneself; not as yours
Construction na + eva + attato
Sanskrit naiva + ātmanaḥ

gāme araññe sukhadukkhaphuṭṭho,
n'ev'attato no parato dahetha,
phusanti phassā upadhiṃ paṭicca,
nirūpadhiṃ kena phuseyyu phassā'ti.

UD 14 sakkārasuttaṃ
nevattantapo

sandhi. neither harming oneself; neither self-torturing; neither self-mortifying [na + eva + attantapo] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + ind + adj, neg
Meaning neither harming oneself; neither self-torturing; neither self-mortifying
Construction na + eva + attantapo
Sanskrit na + eva + ātmānam + tapa

kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, puggalo n'ev'attan'tapo hoti n'āttaparitāpan'ānuyogam'anuyutto na paran'tapo na paraparitāpan'ānuyogam'anuyutto?

AN 4.198 attantapasuttaṃ

yo ca kho ayaṃ, bhante, puggalo n'ev'attan'tapo n'āttaparitāpan'ānuyogam'anuyutto na parantapo na paraparitāpan'ānuyogam'anuyutto ... ayam'eva me puggalo cittaṃ ārādhetī'ti.

MN 51 kandarakasuttaṃ
nevattasañcetanā

sandhi. neither one's own intention; neither one's own volition [na + eva + atta + sañcetanā] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + ind + masc + fem, neg
Meaning neither one's own intention; neither one's own volition
Construction na + eva + atta + sañcetanā
Sanskrit naiva + ātman + saṃcetanā (bsk)

atthi, bhikkhave, attabhāvapaṭilābho, yasmiṃ attabhāvapaṭilābhe n'evattasañcetanā kamati, no parasañcetanā. ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro attabhāvapaṭilābhā'ti.

AN 4.171 cetanāsuttaṃ
nevattahitāya

nt. neither for one's own benefit; neither for one's own good [na + eva + atta + hita + āya] ~

Grammar nt dat sg of nevattahita, comp, neg
Meaning neither for one's own benefit; neither for one's own good
Construction na + eva + atta + hita + āya
nevattahita + āya
Antonym attahitāya, parhitāya
nevattānaṃ

sandhi. neither oneself (object), not as a self ✗
nevattānukkaṃseti

sandhi. (+instr) one neither praises oneself (because of); one neither exalts oneself (due to) [na + eva + attānaṃ + ukkaṃseti] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + masc + pr, neg (+instr)
Meaning one neither praises oneself (because of); one neither exalts oneself (due to)
Construction na + eva + attānaṃ + ukkaṃseti
Antonym na paraṃ vambheti
Sanskrit naiva + ātmānam + utkarṣayati

so paṭipadaṃ'y'eva antaraṃ karitvā tāya uccākulīnatāya n'ev'attān'ukkaṃseti na paraṃ vambheti. ayaṃ, bhikkhave, sappurisadhammo.

MN 113 sappurisasuttaṃ

n'ev'attān'ukkaṃsissāma na paraṃ vambhissāmā'ti

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
nevatthato

ind. neither with regard to meaningful content (nor) [na + eva + atthato] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp, neg
Meaning neither with regard to meaningful content (nor)
Construction na + eva + atthato
Antonym atthato
nevatthi 1

sandhi. there is neither (nor); neither exists (nor) [na + eva + atthi] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + ind + pr, neg
Meaning there is neither (nor); neither exists (nor)
Construction na + eva + atthi
Sanskrit naiva + asti

channaṃ, āvuso, phass'āyatanānaṃ asesavirāganirodhā n'ev'atthi no n'atth'aññaṃ kiñcī'ti? mā h'evaṃ, āvuso.

AN 4.173 mahākoṭṭhikasuttaṃ
nevatthi 2

sandhi. there would not be [na + eva + atthi] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + ind + pr, neg
Meaning there would not be
Construction na + eva + atthi
Sanskrit naiva + asti

mañcakena ce'pi maṃ, sāriputta, pariharissatha, n'ev'atthi tathāgatassa paññāveyyattiyassa aññathattaṃ.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
nevarūpī

adj. neither with form; neither material [na + eva + rūpī] ~

Grammar adj, comp, neg
Meaning neither with form; neither material
Construction na + eva + rūpī
nevarūpīnārūpī

adj. neither material nor formless [na + eva + rūpī + na + arūpī] ~

Grammar adj, comp, neg x2
Meaning neither material nor formless
Construction na + eva + rūpī + na + arūpī
Antonym rūpārūpī
nevarūpīnārūpīattāsutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 24.40 (SN24.40) ✗
nevasaññānāsaññā

fem. neither perception nor non-perception; neither recognition nor non-recognition [na + eva + saññā + na + asaññā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp, neg x2
Meaning neither perception nor non-perception; neither recognition nor non-recognition
Construction na + eva + saññā + na + asaññā
nevasaññānāsaññāyatana

nt. dimension of neither perception nor non-perception [na + eva + saññā + na + asaññā + āyatana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp, neg x2
Meaning dimension of neither perception nor non-perception
Construction na + eva + saññā + na + asaññā + āyatana
Compound kammadhāraya (nevasaññānāsaññā + āyatana)
Sanskrit naivasaṃjñānāsaṃjñānāyatana

idha mayaṃ, bhante, yāva'd'eva ākaṅkhāma sabbaso ākiñcaññ'āyatanaṃ samatikkamma n'evasaññān'āsaññ'āyatanaṃ upasampajja viharāma

MN 31 cūḷagosiṅgasuttaṃ

evam'eva kho, sunakkhatta, sammā nibbān'ādhimuttassa purisapuggalassa ye n'evasaññān'āsaññ'āyatanasaṃyojane se ucchinnamūle tāl'āvatthukate anabhāvaṃkate āyatiṃ anuppādadhamme.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ
nevasaññānāsaññāyatanadhātu

fem. state of the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception; element of the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception [nevasaññānāsaññāyatana + dhātu] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning state of the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception; element of the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception
Construction nevasaññānāsaññāyatana + dhātu
nevasaññānāsaññāyatananissita

adj. dependent on the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception; based on the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception [nevasaññānāsaññāyatana + nissita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, neg x2
Meaning dependent on the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception; based on the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception
Construction nevasaññānāsaññāyatana + nissita
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṃ + nissita)
Sanskrit naivasaṃjñānāsaṃjñānāyatana + niśrita

atthi, bhikkhave, upekkhā ākāsānañc'āyatananissitā, atthi viññāṇañc'āyatananissitā, atthi ākiñcaññ'āyatananissitā, atthi n'evasaññān'āsaññ'āyatananissitā, ayaṃ, bhikkhave, upekkhā ekattā ekattasitā.

MN 137 saḷāyatanavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
nevasaññānāsaññāyatanapañhāsutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 40.8 (SN40.8) ✗
nevasaññānāsaññāyatanapaṭisaṃyutta

adj. connected with the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception [nevasaññānāsaññāyatana + paṭisaṃyutta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning connected with the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception
Construction nevasaññānāsaññāyatana + paṭisaṃyutta
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (nevasaññānāsaññāyatanena + paṭisaṃyutta)
nevasaññānāsaññāyatanasaññā

fem. (+loc) recognition of dimension of neither perception nor non-perception (in); perception of dimension of neither perception nor non-perception (in) [nevasaññānāsaññāyatana + saññā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp, neg x2 (+loc)
Meaning recognition of dimension of neither perception nor non-perception (in); perception of dimension of neither perception nor non-perception (in)
Construction nevasaññānāsaññāyatana + saññā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (nevasaññānāsaññāyatanassa + saññā)
Sanskrit naivasaṃjñānāsaṃjñānāyatana + saṃjñā

idha, sandha, bhadrassa puris'ājānīyassa ... ākiñcaññ'āyatane ākiñcaññ'āyatanasaññā vibhūtā hoti, n'evasaññān'āsaññ'āyatane n'evasaññān'āsaññ'āyatanasaññā vibhūtā hoti

AN 11.9 saddhasuttaṃ
nevasaññānāsaññāyatanasaññī

adj. (+loc) aware of dimension of neither perception nor non-perception (in); percipient of dimension of neither perception nor non-perception (in) [nevasaññānāsaññāyatana + saññī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, neg x2 (+loc)
Meaning aware of dimension of neither perception nor non-perception (in); percipient of dimension of neither perception nor non-perception (in)
Construction nevasaññānāsaññāyatana + saññī
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (nevasaññānāsaññāyatanassa + saññī)
Sanskrit naivasaṃjñānāsaṃjñānāyatana + saṃjñin

siyā nu kho, bhante, bhikkhuno tathārūpo samādhipaṭil ... na n'evasaññān'āsaññ'āyatane n'evasaññān'āsaññ'āyatanasaññī assa, na idhaloke idhalokasaññī assa, na paraloke paralokasaññī assa, saññī ca pana assā'ti?

AN 10.6 samādhisuttaṃ
nevasaññānāsaññāyatanasappāya

adj. beneficial for the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception; supportive for the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception [nevasaññānāsaññāyatana + sappāya] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning beneficial for the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception; supportive for the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception
Construction nevasaññānāsaññāyatana + sappāya
nevasaññānāsaññāyatanasamāpatti

fem. attainment of the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception [nevasaññānāsaññāyatana + samāpatti] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp, neg x2
Meaning attainment of the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception
Construction nevasaññānāsaññāyatana + samāpatti
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (nevasaññānāsaññāyatanassa + samāpatti)
Sanskrit naivasaṃjñānāsaṃjñānāyatana + samāpatti

so iti paṭisañcikkhati, ahaṃ kho'mhi n'evasaññān'āsaññ'āyatanasamāpattiyā lābhī, ime pan'aññe bhikkhū n'evasaññān'āsaññ'āyatanasamāpattiyā na lābhino'ti. so tāya n'evasaññān'āsaññ'āyatanasamāpattiyā attān'ukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti.

MN 113 sappurisasuttaṃ
nevasaññānāsaññāyatanasaṃyojana

nt. bond with the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception; connection to the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception [nevasaññānāsaññāyatana + saṃyojana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp, neg x2
Meaning bond with the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception; connection to the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception
Construction nevasaññānāsaññāyatana + saṃyojana
Notes see SCPN §10 (Eastern Forms)
Sanskrit naivasaṃjñānāsaṃjñānāyatana + saṃyojana

seyyathā'pi, sunakkhatta, tālo matthakacchinno abhabbo puna viruḷhiyā. evam'eva kho, sunakkhatta, sammā nibbān'ādhimuttassa purisapuggalassa ye n'evasaññān'āsaññ'āyatanasaṃyojane se ucchinnamūle tāl'āvatthukate anabhāvaṃkate āyatiṃ anuppādadhamme.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ
nevasaññānāsaññāyatanasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 28.8 (SN28.8) ✗
nevasaññānāsaññāyatanādhimutta

adj. intent on the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception [nevasaññānāsaññāyatana + adhimutta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning intent on the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception
Construction nevasaññānāsaññāyatana + adhimutta
nevasaññānāsaññāyatanūpaga

adj. gone to the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception [na + eva + saññā + na + asaññā + āyatana + upaga] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, neg x2
Meaning gone to the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception
Construction na + eva + saññā + na + asaññā + āyatana + upaga
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṃ + upaga)
Sanskrit naivasaṃjñānāsaṃjñānāyatana + upaga

tatra, bhante, y'āyaṃ attabhāvapaṭilābho yasmiṃ attabhāvapaṭilābhe n'eva attasañcetanā kamati no parasañcetanā, katame tena devā daṭṭhabbā'ti? n'evasaññānāsaññāyatan'ūpagā, sāriputta, devā tena daṭṭhabbā'ti.

AN 4.171 cetanāsuttaṃ

ākaṅkheyya ce, gahapatayo, dhammacārī samacārī, aho vat'āhaṃ kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā n'evasaññānāsaññāyatan'ūpagānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjeyyan'ti, ṭhānaṃ kho pan'etaṃ vijjati, yaṃ so kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā n'evasaññānāsaññāyatan'ūpagānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjeyya.

MN 41 sāleyyakasuttaṃ
nevasaññānāsaññāyatanūpapatti

fem. rebirth into the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception; reappearance in the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception [nevasaññānāsaññāyatana + upapatti] ✓

Grammar fem, comp, neg x2
Meaning rebirth into the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception; reappearance in the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception
Construction nevasaññānāsaññāyatana + upapatti
Compound sattamī tappurisa (nevasaññānāsaññāyatane + upapatti)
Sanskrit naivasaṃjñānāsaṃjñānāyatana + upapatti

tassa mayhaṃ, aggivessana, etadahosi, n'āyaṃ dhammo nibbidāya na virāgāya na nirodhāya na upasamāya na abhiññāya na sambodhāya na nibbānāya saṃvattati, yāva'd'eva n'evasaññān'āsaññ'āyatan'ūpapattiyā'ti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
nevasaññināsaññī

adj. neither percipient nor non-percipient; neither conscious nor unconscious; neither aware nor unaware [na + eva + saññī + na + asaññī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, neg x2
Meaning neither percipient nor non-percipient; neither conscious nor unconscious; neither aware nor unaware
Construction na + eva + saññī + na + asaññī
Compound dvanda (nevasaññī ca nāsaññī ca)
Variant nevasaññīnāsaññī
Sanskrit naivasaṃjñinaivāsaṃjñin

yāvatā, bhikkhave, sattā apadā vā dvipadā vā catuppadā vā bahuppadā vā rūpino vā arūpino vā saññino vā asaññino vā n'evasaññin'āsaññino vā, tathāgato tesaṃ aggam'akkhāyati arahaṃ sammāsambuddho.

AN 10.15 appamādasuttaṃ
nevasaññī

adj. neither impercipient; neither unconscious; neither unaware [na + eva + saññī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, neg
Meaning neither impercipient; neither unconscious; neither unaware
Construction na + eva + saññī
Antonym asaññī
Commentary (THa) n'evasaññisu asaññisuṭṭhitan'ti rūp'ārūpadhātūsu ca na kevalaṃ saññīsu eva, atha kho n'evasaññīn'āsaññīsu asaññīsu ca upapajja ṭhitaṃ mayā'ti ānetvā yojetabbaṃ. n'evasaññiggahaṇena hettha n'evasaññīn'āsaññībhavo gahito.
Sanskrit na + eva + saṃjñin

mānuso'pi ca bhavo'bhirādhito,
saggakāyam'agamaṃ sakiṃ sakiṃ,
rūpadhātusu arūpadhātusu,
n'evasaññisu asaññisuṭṭhitaṃ.

TH 183 gotamattheragāthā
nevasaññīnāsaññī

adj. neither percipient nor non-percipient; neither conscious nor unconscious; neither aware nor unaware [na + eva + saññī + na + asaññī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, neg x2
Meaning neither percipient nor non-percipient; neither conscious nor unconscious; neither aware nor unaware
Construction na + eva + saññī + na + asaññī
Compound dvanda (nevasaññī ca nāsaññī ca)
Variant nevasaññināsaññī
Sanskrit naivasaṃjñinaivāsaṃjñin

n'evasaññīn'āsaññī bhavissan'ti maññitam'etaṃ. maññitaṃ, bhikkhave, rogo, maññitaṃ gaṇḍo, maññitaṃ sallaṃ. tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, amaññamānena cetasā viharissāmā'ti, evañ'hi vo, bhikkhave, sikkhitabbaṃ.

SN 35.248 yavakalāpisuttaṃ
nevasaññīnāsaññīvāda 1

masc. (proponent of the) doctrine of neither percipient nor impercipient (post-mortem existence) ✗
nevasaññīnāsaññīvāda 2

adj. holding the doctrine of neither percipient nor impercipient (post-mortem existence) ✗
nevasāta

adj. neither pleasant; neither nice; neither agreeable; neither appealing [na + eva + sāta] ~

Grammar adj, comp, neg
Meaning neither pleasant; neither nice; neither agreeable; neither appealing
Construction na + eva + sāta
Antonym nāsāta
Sanskrit na + eva + śāta
nevasekkhānāsekkha

adj. of neither a trainee nor one beyond training [na + eva + sekkha + na + asekkha] ~

Grammar adj, comp, neg x2
Meaning of neither a trainee nor one beyond training
Construction na + eva + sekkha + na + asekkha
Antonym sekkhāsekkha
nevasekkhonāsekkha

adj. who is neither a trainee nor is beyond training; i.e. who does not train [na + eva + sekkho + na + asekkha] ~

Grammar adj, comp, neg
Meaning who is neither a trainee nor is beyond training; i.e. who does not train
Construction na + eva + sekkho + na + asekkha
nevassa

sandhi. not even for him; not even his; neither his [na + eva + assa] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + ind + pron, neg
Meaning not even for him; not even his; neither his
Construction na + eva + assa
Sanskrit naiva + asmai

sa kho so, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃsīlo evaṃdhammo evaṃpañño sālīnaṃ ce'pi piṇḍapātaṃ bhuñjati vicitakāḷakaṃ anekasūpaṃ anekabyañjanaṃ, n'ev'assa taṃ hoti antarāyāya.

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ

yasmiṃ, mahānāma, samaye ariyasāvako sīlaṃ anussarati n'ev'assa tasmiṃ samaye rāgapariyuṭṭhitaṃ cittaṃ hoti, na dosapariyuṭṭhitaṃ cittaṃ hoti, na mohapariyuṭṭhitaṃ cittaṃ hoti.

AN 6.10 mahānāmasuttaṃ
nevassu

sandhi. certainly not; definitely not [na + eva + ssu] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + ind + ind, neg
Meaning certainly not; definitely not
Construction na + eva + ssu
Antonym evassu
Sanskrit naiva + sma

atha kho, bhikkhave, bako brahmā antaradhāyissāmi samaṇassa gotamassa, antaradhāyissāmi samaṇassa gotamassā'ti n'eva'ssu me sakkoti antaradhāyituṃ

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
nevahotinanahotitathāgatosutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 24.18 (SN24.18) ✗
nevahotinanahotisutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 24.36 (SN24.36) ✗
nevāgatavisa

adj. neither with fast acting poison (nor) [na + eva + āgata + visa] ~

Grammar adj, comp, neg
Meaning neither with fast acting poison (nor)
Construction na + eva + āgata + visa
Antonym āgatavisa
Commentary (ANa) āgataviso na ghoraviso'ti yassa visaṃ āgacchati, ghoraṃ pana na hoti, cirakālaṃ na pīḷeti.
Sanskrit naiva + āgata + viṣa
nevāpika

masc. baiter; catcher; trapper; lit. who throws down [ni + √vap + * a + *ika] ✓

Grammar masc, from nivāpa
Meaning baiter; catcher; trapper; lit. who throws down
Root Family ni √vap
Root √vap･1 a (sow, shave)
Construction ni > e + √vap > vāp + * a + *ika
nivāpa + *ika
Derivative taddhita (*ika)
Phonetic Change i > e
a > ā
Commentary (MNa) nevāpiko'ti yo migānaṃ gahaṇ'atthāya araññe tiṇabījāni vapati, idaṃ tiṇaṃ khādituṃ āgate mige sukhaṃ gaṇhissāmī'ti.
Sanskrit nivāpaka
Sanskrit Root √vap 1 (strew)

na, bhikkhave, nevāpiko nivāpaṃ nivapati migajātānaṃ, imaṃ me nivāpaṃ nivuttaṃ migajātā paribhuñjantā dīgh'āyukā vaṇṇavanto ciraṃ dīgham'addhānaṃ yāpentū'ti.

MN 25 nivāpasuttaṃ
nevāpikaparisā

fem. followers of the baiter; trapper's gang [nevāpika + parisā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning followers of the baiter; trapper's gang
Construction nevāpika + parisā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (nevāpikassa + parisā)
Sanskrit nivāpaka + pariṣad

tatra, bhikkhave, nevāpikassa ca nevāpikaparisāya ca etadahosi, saṭhāssunām'ime tatiyā migajātā ketabino, iddhimantāssunām'ime tatiyā migajātā parajanā, imañ'ca nāma nivāpaṃ nivuttaṃ paribhuñjanti, na ca nesaṃ jānāma āgatiṃ vā gatiṃ vā.

MN 25 nivāpasuttaṃ
nevāsika 1

masc. resident; inhabitant [ni + √vas + *a + *ika] ~

Grammar masc, from nivāsa
Meaning resident; inhabitant
Root Family ni √vas
Root √vas･1 a (live)
Construction ni > ne + √vas > vās + *a + *ika
nivāsa + *ika
Derivative taddhita (*ika)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit naivāsika
Sanskrit Root √vas 1 (dwell)
nevāsika 2

masc. inmate [ni + √vas] ✗
nevāhaṃ

sandhi. I did not [na + eva + ahaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + ind + pron, neg
Meaning I did not
Construction na + eva + ahaṃ
Antonym evāhaṃ
Sanskrit naiva + aham

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bhikkhuṃ āpattiyā codenti. so bhikkhu bhikkhūhi āpattiyā codiyamāno, n'ev'āhaṃ āpanno'mhi, na pan'āhaṃ āpanno'mhī'ti so tuṇhībhāvena saṅghaṃ viheṭheti.

AN 8.14 assakhaḷuṅkasuttaṃ
nevidha

sandhi. neither here; lit. not even here [na + eva + idha] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + ind + adv, neg
Meaning neither here; lit. not even here
Construction na + eva + idha
Sanskrit naiva + iha

nissitassa calitaṃ, anissitassa calitaṃ n'atthi. calite asati passaddhi, passaddhiyā sati nati na hoti. natiyā asati āgatigati na hoti. āgatigatiyā asati cut'ūpapāto na hoti. cut'ūpapāte asati n'ev'idha na huraṃ na ubhayam'antarena. es'ev'anto dukkhassā'ti.

UD 74 catutthanibbānapaṭisaṃyuttasuttaṃ

tato tvaṃ bāhiya na tena. yato tvaṃ bāhiya na tena tato tvaṃ bāhiya na tattha. yato tvaṃ bāhiya na tattha tato tvaṃ bāhiya n'ev'idha na huraṃ na ubhayam'antarena

UD 10 bāhiyasuttaṃ
nesa

sandhi. this is not [na + esa] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron, neg
Meaning this is not
Construction na + esa
Antonym esa
Sanskrit na + eṣaḥ

gāth'ābhigītaṃ me abhojaneyyaṃ,
sampassataṃ brāhmaṇa n'esa dhammo,
gāth'ābhigītaṃ panudanti buddhā,
dhamme satī brāhmaṇa vutti'r'esā.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4
nesajja

masc. ascetic who remains in a sitting position; upright sitter [ni + √sad + yā + *a] ~

Grammar masc, from nisajjā
Meaning ascetic who remains in a sitting position; upright sitter
Root Family ni √sad
Root √sad･1 a (sink, sit, settle)
Construction ni > ne + √sad + yā + *a
nisajjā + *a
Derivative taddhita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > e
dy > jj
Sanskrit naiṣadyika
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)
nesajjika

masc. ascetic who remains in a sitting position; upright sitter [ni + √sad + yā + *ika] ✓

Grammar masc, from nisajjā
Meaning ascetic who remains in a sitting position; upright sitter
Root Family ni √sad
Root √sad･1 a (sink, sit, settle)
Construction ni > ne + √sad + yā + *ika
nisajjā + *ika
Derivative taddhita (*ika)
Phonetic Change i > e
dy > jj
Sanskrit naiṣadyika
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)

āraññiko hohi ca piṇḍapātiko,
sosāniko hohi ca paṃsukūliko,
nesajjiko hohi sadā dhute rato,
itissu maṃ citta pure niyuñjasi.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

ahaṃ kho'mhi nesajjiko, ime pan'aññe bhikkhū na nesajjikā'ti. so tena nesajjikattena attān'ukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti. ayam'pi, bhikkhave, asappurisadhammo.

MN 113 sappurisasuttaṃ
nesajjikasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.186 (AN5.186) ✗
nesaṃ 1

pron. for them; to them [[n] + esa + ānaṃ] ✓

Grammar pron, masc and nt dat pl of ta
Meaning for them; to them
Construction [n] + esa + ānaṃ > aṃ
Phonetic Change +n
Variant tesaṃ
Sanskrit etebhyaḥ

siyā ca nesaṃ kantār'āvaseso anatiṇṇo

SN 12.63 puttamaṃsūpamasuttaṃ

ye pana te bhikkhū adhimānena aññaṃ byākaṃsu tatra, sunakkhatta, tathāgatassa evaṃ hoti, dhammaṃ nesaṃ desessan'ti.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ
nesaṃ 2

pron. of them; of those; their [[n] + esa + ānaṃ] ✓

Grammar pron, masc and nt gen pl of ta
Meaning of them; of those; their
Construction [n] + esa + ānaṃ > aṃ
Phonetic Change +n
Sanskrit etānām

yadā kho te, bhikkhave, chappāṇakā jhattā assu kilantā, atha kho yo nesaṃ pāṇakānaṃ balavataro assa tassa te anuvatteyyuṃ, anuvidhāyeyyuṃ vasaṃ gaccheyyuṃ.

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ

saddhammapūjā'pi nesaṃ tath'eva,
yathā pasaṃsanti sak'āyanāni,
sabb'eva vādā tathiyā bhaveyyuṃ,
suddhī hi nesaṃ paccattam'eva.

SNP 51 mahābyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 13
nesā

sandhi. this is not [na + esā] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron, neg
Meaning this is not
Construction na + esā
Antonym esā
Sanskrit na + eṣā

evaṃ vutte poṭṭhapādo paribbājako bhagavantaṃ etadavoca, tiṭṭhat'esā, bhante, kathā, yāya mayaṃ eta'r'ahi kathāya sannisinnā. n'esā, bhante, kathā bhagavato dullabhā bhavissati pacchā'pi savanāya.

DN 9.2 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, abhisaññānirodhakathā

taṃ kissa hetu? n'esā, bhikkhave, kathā atthasaṃhitā n'ādibrahmacariyakā na nibbidāya na virāgāya na nirodhāya na upasamāya na abhiññāya na sambodhāya na nibbānāya saṃvattati.

SN 56.9 viggāhikakathāsuttaṃ
nesāda

masc. hunter; fisherman ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning hunter; fisherman
Sanskrit niṣāda, naiṣāda

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo nīce kule paccājāto hoti, caṇḍālakule vā venakule vā nesādakule vā rathakārakule vā pukkusakule vā dalidde app'annapānabhojane kasiravuttike, yattha kasirena ghāsacchādo labbhati.

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo nīce kule paccājāto hoti, caṇḍālakule vā venakule vā nesādakule vā rathakārakule vā pukkusakule vā dalidde app'annapānabhojane kasiravuttike, yattha kasirena ghāsacchādo labbhati.

AN 8.53 saṃkhittasuttaṃ
nesohamasmi

Meaning this is not me; I am not this

tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, yaṃ kiñci rūpaṃ atīt'ānāgatapaccuppannaṃ ajjhattaṃ vā bahiddhā vā oḷārikaṃ vā sukhumaṃ vā hīnaṃ vā paṇītaṃ vā yaṃ dūre santike vā, sabbaṃ rūpaṃ, n'etaṃ mama, n'eso'ham'asmi, na m'eso attā'ti evam'etaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya daṭṭhabbaṃ

SN 22.79 khajjanīyasuttaṃ

sutavā ca kho, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako ... rūpaṃ n'etaṃ mama, n'eso'ham'asmi, na m'eso attā'ti samanupassati.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ

Sanskrit neṣyati

yassa jitaṃ n'āvajīyati,
jitaṃ yassa no yāti koci loke,
taṃ buddham'anantagocaraṃ,
apadaṃ kena padena nessatha.

Sanskrit no

ādittasmiṃ agārasmiṃ,
yaṃ nīharati bhājanaṃ,
taṃ tassa hoti atthāya,
no ca yaṃ tattha ḍayhati.

janā vadanti ta'y'idaṃ kathaṃsu,
ñāṇ'ūpapannaṃ no muniṃ vadanti,
udāhu ve jīviten'ūpapannaṃ.

pārāyanavaggo 7
no 2.1

Meaning us (object)
Variant amhe, amhākaṃ
Sanskrit asmān, naḥ

kiṃ nu kho mayaṃ āyasmato anuruddhassa evam'ārocimha, imāsañ'ca imāsañ'ca vihārasamāpattīnaṃ mayaṃ lābhino'ti yaṃ no āyasmā anuruddho bhagavato sammukhā yāva āsavānaṃ khayā pakāsetī'ti?

MN 31 cūḷagosiṅgasuttaṃ

āyām'āvuso, yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkamissāma. upasaṅkamitvā bhagavato etam'atthaṃ ārocessāma. yathā no bhagavā byākarissati tathā naṃ dhāressāmā'ti.

ko sujjhati muccati bajjhatī ca,
ken'attanā gacchati brahmalokaṃ,
ajānato me muni brūhi puṭṭho,
bhagavā hi me sakkhi brahmajjadiṭṭho,
tuvañ'hi no brahmasamo'si saccaṃ,
kathaṃ upapajjati brahmalokaṃ jutima.

yath'āssa passato rūpaṃ,

khīyati n'opacīyati,
evaṃ so caratī sato,
evaṃ apacinato dukkhaṃ,
santike nibbānam'uccati.

nopariyesanānānattasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 14.8 (SN14.8) ✗
nopalitta

Sanskrit Root √lip 6 (smear)

saññaṃ pariññā vitareyya oghaṃ,
pariggahesu muni n'opalitto,
abbūḷhasallo caram'appamatto,
n'āsīsatī lokam'imaṃ parañ'cā'ti.

SNP 40 guhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 2

Sanskrit Root √lip 6 (smear)

yathā'pi udake jātaṃ,
puṇḍarīkaṃ pavaḍḍhati,
nopalippati toyena,
sucigandhaṃ manoramaṃ.

TH 247 udāyittheragāthā

tath'eva ca loke jāto,
buddho loke viharati,
nopalippati lokena,
toyena padumaṃ yathā.

TH 247 udāyittheragāthā
nopi

sandhi. nor; nor even [no + api] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + ind
Meaning nor; nor even
Construction no + api
Sanskrit no + api

na piyaṃ kubbati no'pi appiyaṃ,
tasmiṃ paridevamaccharaṃ,
paṇṇe vāri yathā na limpati.

SNP 44 jarāsuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 6

na diṭṭhiyā na sutiyā na ñāṇena,
sīlabbaten'āpi na suddhim'āha,
adiṭṭhiyā assutiyā añāṇā,
asīlatā abbatā no'pi tena,
ete ca nissajja anuggahāya,
santo anissāya bhavaṃ na jappe.

SNP 47 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 9
nopeti

pr. (+acc) does not approach [na + upa + √i + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, from na upeti, neg, trans (+acc)
Meaning does not approach
Root Family upa √i
Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Base √i + a > e
Construction na + upa + e + ti
na + upeti
Phonetic Change u > o
i > e
Antonym upeti
Sanskrit na + upeti
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

ārogyaṃ samma'd'aññāya,
āsavānaṃ parikkhayā,
saṅkhāya sevī dhammaṭṭho,
saṅkhyaṃ n'opeti vedagū'ti.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

so vedanā pariññāya,
diṭṭhe dhamme anāsavo,
kāyassa bhedā dhammaṭṭho,
saṅkhyaṃ n'opeti vedagū'ti.

SN 36.3 pahānasuttaṃ
nophassanānattasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 14.3 (SN14.3) ✗
nossu

ind. not sure [no + ssu] ✓

Grammar ind, comp, in comps, neg
Meaning not sure
Construction no + ssu
Antonym ssu
Commentary (MNa) nossū'ti taṃ bhūtaṃ khandhapañcakaṃ paccayasambhavaṃ nu kho, na nu kho'ti.
Sanskrit nu + sma, svid

tadāhārasambhavaṃ nossū'ti, bhikkhave, kaṅkhato uppajjati vicikicchā'ti? evaṃ, bhante. tadāhāranirodhā yaṃ bhūtaṃ, taṃ nirodhadhammaṃ nossū'ti, bhikkhave, kaṅkhato uppajjati vicikicchā'ti? evaṃ, bhante.

MN 38 mahātaṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ
nvayaṃ

sandhi. (for who) this? [nu + ayaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron
Meaning (for who) this?
Construction nu > nv + ayaṃ
Phonetic Change u > v
Sanskrit nu + ayam

disvāna bhāradvājagottaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ etadavoca, kassa nv'ayaṃ bhoto bhāradvājassa agy'āgāre tiṇasanthārako paññatto, samaṇaseyy'ānurūpaṃ maññe'ti?

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ

idh'ānanda, rañño mahāsudassanassa tadah'uposathe pannarase sīsaṃ nhātassa uposathikassa uparipāsādavaragatassa dibbaṃ cakkaratanaṃ pāturahosi sahass'āraṃ sanemikaṃ sanābhikaṃ sabbākāraparipūraṃ.

DN 17.3 mahāsudassanasuttaṃ
nhātaka 1

adj. perfected; purified; lit. who has bathed [√nhā + ta + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, from nhāta
Meaning perfected; purified; lit. who has bathed
Root Family √nhā
Root √nhā･3 ya (bathe)
Construction √nhā + ta + ka
nhāta + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Variant nahātaka
Commentary (MNa) nhātakilesattā nhātako hoti, dhotakilesattā'ti attho. (MNa) nhātakassā'ti nhātakilesassa.
Notes (MW) m. one who has bathed or performed ablutions (i.e. a Brahman who, after performing the ceremonial lustrations required on his finishing his studentship as a brahma-cārin under a religious teacher, returns home and begins the second period of his life as a gṛha-stha
Sanskrit snātaka
Sanskrit Root √snā 2, 4 (bathe)

usabhaṃ pavaraṃ vīraṃ,
mah'esiṃ vijitāvinaṃ,
anejaṃ nhātakaṃ buddhaṃ,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

DHP 422 brāhmaṇavaggo

ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu samaṇo iti'pi brāhmaṇo iti'pi nhātako iti'pi vedagū iti'pi sottiyo iti'pi ariyo iti'pi arahaṃ iti'pi

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ

sattame divase pāto'va uṭṭhāya gandh'odakena nhāyitvā cattāri satasahassāni vissajjetvā mahādānaṃ datvā sabb'ālaṅkāravibhūsitā varabhojanaṃ bhuñjitvā

JAa 1.N.2 avidūre nidānakathā
nhāru 1

masc. tendon; sinew ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning tendon; sinew
Variant nahāru
Sanskrit snāyu

atthi imasmiṃ kāye kesā lomā nakhā dantā taco, maṃsaṃ nhāru aṭṭhi aṭṭhimiñjaṃ vakkaṃ, hadayaṃ yakanaṃ kilomakaṃ pihakaṃ papphāsaṃ

DN 22.5 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

āraddhavīriyo viharati, kāmaṃ taco ca nhāru ca aṭṭhi ca avasissatu, sarīre upasussatu maṃsalohitaṃ, yaṃ taṃ purisathāmena purisavīriyena purisaparakkamena pattabbaṃ, na taṃ apāpuṇitvā vīriyassa saṇṭhānaṃ bhavissatī'ti.

nt. broken bits of tendon; tendon parings [nhāru + daddula] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning broken bits of tendon; tendon parings
Construction nhāru + daddula
Compound kammadhāraya (nhāru + daddula)
Commentary (MNa) nhārudaddulenā'ti cammanillekhanena. (ANa) nhārudaddulan'ti nhārukhaṇḍaṃ nhāruvilekhanaṃ vā.
Sanskrit snāyu + ??

sā harit'antaṃ vā panth'antaṃ vā sel'antaṃ vā udak'antaṃ vā ramaṇīyaṃ vā bhūmibhāgaṃ āgamma anāhārā nibbāyati. hoti kho so, āvuso, samayo yaṃ kukkuṭapattena'pi nhārudaddulena'pi aggiṃ gavesanti.

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, kukkuṭapattaṃ vā nhārudaddulaṃ vā aggimhi pakkhittaṃ patilīyati patikuṭati pativattati, na sampasāriyati.
